Reviews.Title: “a disgrace to be called a hotel”
Reviews.Author: shardamark
Reviews.Content: whatever you do , take your own shampoo, soap as they dont even supply that! £98.00 for a night. pillows as about flat as a pancake. bed uncomfortabe and small and a tv that works sometimes. breakfast, rubber scrammbles eggs with cold sausages , cold tomatoes and barely warm beans. bar prices are ridiculous,. only one thing in this joke of a hotels favour, its position. other than that. NOTHING

Reviews.Title: “Not what I bargained for!”
Reviews.Author: Bethany S
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last weekend. Admittedly, the room and reception were very nice and clean however it was apparent that the staff did not enjoy their work or care for their guests satisfaction whatsoever; they were very unhelpful. When checking out, I realised there was nowhere to leave my luggage and since check out was 12 noon and my train was not til 8pm, I had to fork out £18 to leave my cases somewhere! Definitely would not cost a lot for them to invest in a luggage room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: shmirlCumbria
Reviews.Content: For two 60+ ladies, this was a brilliant hotel due to its location. We didn't want to use the underground and it was great as many attractions were just a short walk away. It only took 30 mins to walk to Oxford St and we window shopped all the way there so you could do it in 20mins. The bedroom was clean, comfortable and quiet. We did arrive too early for the check in (which is 3pm) but were offered an early check in for just £10. It was worth every penny to dump our suitcases. Check out was 12noon which was good for us as we could leave our cases in the room as there is no luggage room. Breakfast was adequate but we noticed a few cafes serving breakfast close by for a lot cheaper than we paid. All in all it was basic but we didn't expect 5 star. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: CEWEngland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night whilst on business a couple of weeks ago, and was impressed with this Travelodge. The location is ideal for the West End, and just a 5 minute walk from Covent Garden or Holborn tube station. Check in was quick and easy, and the hotel was spotlessly clean with a 'new' feel to it. It is a big of a tower block by design and whilst it may not look great from the outside, it offers some impressive views of London from the highers floors (I was on level 6). My room was warm and comfortable and I was not disturbed in the night at all, despite reception and the bar area being busy. Breakfast the following morning was also very busy but I was seated immediately and the food on the hot buffet was freshly cooked and very nice. I would be very happy to stay here again for business or leisure. I paid £95 for the room - which is very reasonable for central London - and could not fault it.

Reviews.Title: “So much potential: so much indifference”
Reviews.Author: Worthingwanderers
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is superb: in the middle of Drury Lane, convenient for West End theatres, the British Museum and other central London sites. However, the location doesn't compensate for the hotel's shortcomings. No-one books a Travelodge expecting the best service ever, but even at very competitive room rates, basics shouldn't be the exception. Though we booked a double room, clearly stating two-person occupancy (in spite of a misleading website defaulting to single occupancy, then having to pay extra to change the booking), there was only one towel in the bathroom and no bath mat. A second towel still didn't appear after three requests, so we collected one from reception. It appeared several other guests had the same problem, as the pre-breakfast towel queue at reception the next morning demonstrated. We arrived an hour early for check-in at 2pm, but were told there was no left-luggage facility for suitcases. We had either the choice of carrying suitcases around central London for an hour, or paying Â£10 extra to check-in early. So, the room was actually vacant and cleaned, it's just that they wanted to get a further tenner from us for the pleasure of renting it for an extra hour. Staff were completely indifferent to any requests. It's clearly a case of 'get 'em in and get 'em out quickly': it's almost as if guests are an inconvenience. Rooms are very basic and painted in a less-than0-welcoming corpse-white, but in fairness ours was clean and quiet with a comfortable bed. Energy-saving bulbs mean you're moving in an eerie twilight for most of then time. Breakfast was acceptable, but no-one tells you to pay at reception for vouchers before you go into the breakfast room. It's a shame the hotel doesn't try a little harder: it has the potential to be so much better with very little extra effort.

Reviews.Title: “Theater trip”
Reviews.Author: marbar15
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights during a theater trip. Same old Travelodge, clean and comfortable with no frills but no complaints and great location. Buffet breakfast was ok. If all you need is a comfortable and clean bed then this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good base”
Reviews.Author: AngelJude54
Reviews.Content: This is a good place to stay in London. Handy for lots of areas. The rooms are clean and functional. Staff are hit and miss, some were lovely some not. Would recommend especially if you can get it when on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Location brilliant, especially for theatres”
Reviews.Author: Kythe2
Reviews.Content: We often tend to stay in Travelodges because they are cheap and you (pretty much) know what you are getting. This was no exception. We were in Building 2 which is on Holborn, literally right next door to the Shaftesbury Theatre. The room was clean and spacious, the bathroom spotless. I had read reviews on here which said the rooms were disgusting but ours was fine. It was about 20 minute stroll from the Savoy Theatre on the Strand, about 5 minutes from the National Theatre and about 10 minutes form Covent Garden tube. The only thing that knocked this down from a 5 rating was that on the Saturday morning when we went down to breakfast even thought there was already a lot of people down there when I went to get some toast the bread had mould on it! When told the receptionist removed the whole lot straight away however about 10 minutes later she removed the entire basket again which was a bit suspicious. She just apologised, however when we checked out later the other receptionist made us fill in a complaint form, so I don't know if the first one was trying to hush it up or what. Anyway, at the end of the day we would definitely use this hotel again (but perhaps stick with cereal for breakfast!)

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dan H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in February with my girlfriend and i have to say it was a complete rip off. The hotel was shabby and the staff seemed like they couldnt care less, this being London they probably DIDN'T care less. I asked to use the toilet in recption and was greeted with a look of surprise and was given a rather strange key and told to follow a maze of corridors and then use the key to get through the locked door at the end. I was a little surprised and was expecting the bathroom to be akin to fort knox or made of pure gold, alas no... It was a smelly, disgusting bathroom that had the walls to the stalls completely smashed and hanging off so that if you wanted to use the stall everybody could see you in all your glory. I mentioned this to reception but as above, they seemed like they couldnt care less... The room was fine, it was a bit basic but it was functional and to their credit it was clean but a little scruffy from many guests using it i guess. When i next go to London i will spend a little extra and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sarah14387
Reviews.Content: There are two parts to this Travelodge, and both, I am told are now equally newly renovated. I stayed on the 9th floor in a spacious, quiet room. Beds were very soft, and sheets had a stain on, and these weren't changed during my 5 day stay. There is no storage space, but a small desk, and a few hangers. Shower was luke warm, at the highest temp possible. Breakfast was really nice - lots of choice, however, don't leave your drinks unattended - the staff will clean them away, and they don't understand English!! All minor problems though, and overall I would recommend this hotel to friends. The location is perfect - right in Covent garden, a 5 minute walk from the nearest underground train station, and within easy walkable distance to Oxford Street, River Thames, London eye, Buckingham palace, Theatres, Piccadilly, etc.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: downsouthDorset
Reviews.Content: We had stayed before and expected the basics for location which we think equals value for money, on this occasion we used self service checkin which you are encouraged to do. after a fruitless search for our room the reception staff belittled us for not asking them as they would have pointed out the room was in another block. why is that not on a notice or is flippancy from the staff part of the service. The room was clean but had a 'fiesty' smell in the bathroom, the only time i have smelt similar is wet trainers, not sweaty trainers just wet? The bed wasn't that comfy but if you pack a lot in during your stay you should be knackerd enough to sleep on a rope. However the hotel fire alarm sounded for about 20 seconds at about 4:30 am. We recieved no apology in the morning when we checked out, everyone I speak to says we should have asked for a refund. It remains a great location when we stayed on Sat march 10th the area around the seven dials had a rockin atmosphere. We have friends from Canada coming in August but we will try elsewhere as we are worried they wont understand the value for money location versus utility equation. If you are looking for a no frills basic bed and base in central London for a night or two go for it, any longer I think you might become tired of the general utilitarian feel of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You always know what you're getting with a Travelodge!”
Reviews.Author: ViewsFromNorwich
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel at the end of February as I was attending 4Designers at the Odeon in Leicester Square. The party I was traveling with all stayed at the hotel for two nights. The Covent Garden tube station was literally a few minutes walk away but Leicester Square was only 10 so it was really easy to get to our destination in the mornings by foot. We didn't pay for breakfast in the hotel and were pleased we didn't, as there were plenty of cafe's, patisseries and big chain brands such as Pret a Manger nearby where you could pick up a bite to eat in the mornings. As well as this there are many bars, pubs and restaurants within walking distance where you can eat in the evenings, with a wide range of cuisines. It stated under the check-in information when you pay for this hotel, that you cannot check-in until 2.30 or later. Even at 2.28 they still would not start the check-in procedure and a massive queue had begun to form. This was a little frustrating, but then I suppose this is company policy, and if you do decide on the day to drop off your bags a little earlier you can do so for a cost of Â£10. On the whole, the reception staff were really helpful and were happy to provide us with extra pillows and hairdryers to use for the duration of our stay and the rooms also provides plenty of teas, coffees and milk. My room was on the ground floor of the hotel and there was a really odd banging sound during the duration of each night. The other guest in my room is a very light sleeper and found this kept her awake, but I had no problems. If you are a light sleeper I would recommend that you request a high floor to avoid this. In terms of the room, it appears ours was recently refurbished as it was much more modern and up to date than some of our other friends'. Maybe they are in the process of updating the hotel? But it was spotlessly clean and the beds, as usual, were really comfortable. My only moan is that I do like a powerful shower and this one was far from it, but I can't complain! It was a bargain to stay so cheaply in central London for two nights and Travelogde made our stay very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: Debs&Mark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Covent Garden Travelodge at the beginning of Feb. We were on a trip with friends to go to the theatre (Aldephi on the Strand) and the British Museum. The hotel is in a great location if you want to go lots of places on foot. And as it snowed the weekend we were there, that was a massive bonus! If you want to get out on the town early, you need to pay for an early check in, otherwise itâ€™s 2.30pm. The room was pretty spartan and seemed very grey when we first entered it, but it was newly refurbished and spotless and had everything youâ€™d expect. Its real advantage is location. It is literally just up the road from the BM and it took us only 5 mins to walk. It was only 10-15 mins slow walk to the Strand via the Covent Garden Market. We ate and drank locally â€“ great Belgian beer pub just a few doors up. If you were going to see War Horse, this hotel is right opposite, so great location for that. We had a really good nightâ€™s sleep for London! It was actually really really quiet (we didnâ€™t overlook the main road) and the bed was comfy. Shower was good. Weâ€™d prepaid for brekkie, which was a bit of a scramble. OK for the price we paid, though. If we were staying again, weâ€™d probably have breakfast somewhere locally. Top tip: because the BM donâ€™t allow luggage, we paid Â£10 for late check out and left our bags in the room until after lunch, which made things lots easier.

Reviews.Title: “3 nights in March 2012”
Reviews.Author: Julie P
Reviews.Content: We have just had 3 nights in Travelodge Covent Garden (Room 141, ground floor) Very quiet room, good hot shower, polite staff, good breakfast, really excellent location for theatres. No frills as we expected but would definitely stay here again. Only annoying thing was having to get the key card re formulated a couple of times.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: datsuns
Reviews.Content: great location, booked early so really good price, clean and basic, exactly what you want for a night in the city. Did ask for a extra towel which did not arrive, but on the whole very good

Reviews.Title: “A room is just a room”
Reviews.Author: binnysays
Reviews.Content: if you are looking for a basic set up of four walls and a bed then you can't go wrong. The travelodge stable are all much of a muchness with basic accommodation for reasonable prices. This one however boasts a location that you would normally pay much more for. I stayed here on business while visiting my HQ on Old Street. The journey to and from the office couldn't have been easier with the 55 just round the corner. The location really is this hotel's selling point as you are minutes away from all the important central London venues. I didn't opt for the breakfast as it is rather disappointing as a veggie and there are nice little cafes nearby with a more interesting array of breakfast treats The only downside of all the travelodge hotels is the linen, it smells very strange ( of cardboard) and never makes the rooms pleasant to stay in for a long time, I wonder if they have thought about adding a little fabric conditioner to their wash? Having said that, great place to base yourself in central London if you don't want to fork out lots of cash.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for theatreland”
Reviews.Author: sunseekerLichfield
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay in this hotel.I was pleasantly surprised. It was obviously no frills which was what I expected, but it was clean and acceptable. We had breakfast in the hotel and it was fine and plentiful. The location was tremendous, so close to theatres, British Museum, etc. Would not hesitate to recommend and would certainly stay in here again for a short theatre break.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: holly1985
Reviews.Content: OK, I know Iâ€™ve said about good locations in other reviews but this one really is perfect. You literally are in the heart of Covent Garden. Lots of boutique shops and amazing little restaurants and not far from the Covent Garden tube either. The hotel itself is very basic and you have to ask at the reception for a hairdryer and the hotel do NOT store bags for you for the afternoon as many others do (free of charge may i add) and they also charge for an earlier check in. There was a view of a concrete wall from our room due to the structure of the building, we didnâ€™t mind so much as we were rarely in the room. There is quite a nice little bar downstairs though. If you want a no frills hotel in a great location on a budget then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great”
Reviews.Author: littlesisterWales
Reviews.Content: At Â£29 for a double room (booked in advance), you would be hard put to find better value in London. Location is great - a couple of minutes walk to Covent Garden & Tube. Easy walk into London central. No frills but perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Very small and needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Sw02jco
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny, there was a small flat screen tv though. Shower kept blocking and pillows were very dirty under the cases. Centrally located and decent price though if booked in advance. Will

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: ChildFreeTour
Reviews.Content: We were a bit worried about staying in this hotel after reading some of the reviews on here, but we shouldn't have been. We were very pleasantly surprised. Check-in was very smooth, despite the fact that the computer system was down and the staff had to do everything manually. They coped admirably and were polite and helpful. We have stayed in Travelodges before and were aware that the towels and pillows provided are at a minimum, so we requested extras when we checked in and this was no problem. We requested, and were given a refurbished room on the 8th floor of the Drury Lane building. Room was immaculate, as was the shower-room, and the facilities were perfectly adequate for our requirements (somewhere to sleep and have a shower). We did not experience any noise, either from inside or outside the hotel. Breakfast was busy, but well organised, with items restocked as they ran out. Saturday and Sunday morning, as expected were the busiest, but still plenty of everything, and enough staff to ensure that tables were cleared quickly for other guests to use. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a central location. Lots of restaurants etc within walking distance and very well situated for all the shows and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “great location but very variable rooms”
Reviews.Author: ecosse
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a couple of times through work. The first time I was given a room on a high floor in the building in High Holborn. I was really impressed as the room was basic the view was great. The second time I was allocated a room on the ground floor in Drury Lane and it was disgusting. A tiny dark dirty room with a tiny shower room. The carpet hadn't been cleaned and the bedsheets didn't look as if they had been changed. I went straight back to reception and managed to get a room in High Holborn. The breakfasts are hit and miss. On my second stay there was hardly anything on the buffet as a large party. This wasn't replenished until a guest had gone into the kitchen to find a member of staff. The bread sitting beside the toasting machine was mouldy. It's a great location but I won't be returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: B&PTynemouth
Reviews.Content: This Travelodge is in a characterful, central location with lots of traditional bars, cafes and restaurants close at hand. At check in, we asked for a quiet room and were given room (918) on the 9th floor at the end of a corridor. Although it was not completely noise free, it came very close to being so for a city centre location. The room was very clean and looked as though it had been recently decorated. The bathroom was spotless and appeared to have been newly renovated. We had clean, white sheets and towels. The bed was comfortable but a bit 'creaky'. No marks on the carpet. Rooms are basic, but that is what you expect at a Travelodge. All things considered, I think it is probably the best room we have had in a Travelodge so far, and we have stayed in quite a few. we booked 10 weeks in advance and paid Â£62 for the room. For central London, and at this price, I don't think anybody could have any cause for complaint.

Reviews.Title: “It all depends...”
Reviews.Author: Tom_Cobbley
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times, and the latest was a one night stay in February 2012. The hotel actually consists of two separate buildings. The main one's on Drury Lane. The second, with its own reception, bar etc. is around the corner on High Holborn, and although it can be pot luck where you are allocated on arrival, you can always ask for your preferred location. In former lives, I suspect both 'hotels' were a little swankier than they are now. Rooms are a good size, bathrooms too. But now they're Travelodges, the Travelodge standard applies, so little in the way of frills. Check in can now be done automatically, and if you have prepaid, it's all very simple. Is it good value? It all depends. It is if you book way in advance and pay upfront on the non-refundable deal. On this occasion, and thanks to one of their occasional online sales, I got the room for Â£15, which, by any standards, is an astounding deal. But if you're booking last minute and the rate's climbed up to Â£100 or more, look elsewhere first. There are some pretty decent hotels in the WC1 and WC2 area, and at Â£100+, the Travelodge starts to get uncompetitive. Personally, I like Travelodges when travelling alone on business. I don't like nasty surprises, and the easy-in, easy-out system with automated check in and key-drop check out suits me fine. They're basic, but we all know that by now. And of all their central London locations, this is easily the best one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: newbride4708
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a number of times. I would always stay again. I've stayed with my husband and I've also stayed as a group. There are two buildings to the travelodge. One being double rooms I think where I have stayed with my husband, and the other building where I have stayed when with groups. Both were fine, both have a bar and restaurant which are nice. All the times I've stayed the rooms have been fine, clean and large enough. A couple of times I have had to go back to reception to ask for extra towels/pillows etc as there wasn't enough for the number of people booked for some reason. Would have appreciated a phone in the room but don't think any travelodges do this which is a shame. I would just say, I think the windows could be a bit thicker as it can get quite noisy outside at night as there are a few clubs and pubs nearby. So just be aware it can be noisy, but then again it is in the middle of london! Very good location, two tube stations Holborn and Covent garden are within 5 minutes walk. And in general you can walk everywhere from this hotel, spot on. Shaftesbury theatre just literally round the corner too. All good, just a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location stops this being rated awful”
Reviews.Author: Lancs7
Reviews.Content: We have spent many a night at a travelodge but this one really is very poor.We arrived for check in 10 minutes early but were made to wait with a queue of others before we were allowed to check in. During that time the reception team stood and stared at us! Had they attempted to look busy we along with the rest of the queue would have accepted we were simply early. When we did finally get served the staff were unhelpful and quite frankly rude. Our room was clean when we arrived after but did not have enough towels or pillows for our party.It was never cleaned or replenished again during our 3 night stay. The hotel was full of tourists many from oversea and it saddens me that this is the impression they will return home with of English hospitality. Cheap yes value for money no!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: IanBoyd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night on 22/02/2012. It is a basic clean hotel with a bar and restaurant. The location is excellent - the hotel is on 2 sites, one on Drury Lane and one on High Holburn. We were allocated a room in High Holburn saying that the 2 sites are literally across the road from each other. The location is superb and so handy for all of London's attractions - the nearest tube station is a 3 minute walk at most. At Â£80 for 3 people for a night it was excellent value for money. Can happily recommend

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Daniella R
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid it was of a very good standard, I was really worried about my boyfriend and I staying there after reading lots of the reviews on here. We stayed in the refurbished part of the Travelodge. We had a bit of confusion when we went to check in because the kiosk machines where we were supposed to be checking in were not working and the member of staff could not find us on their computer either. But eventually they found us. The room was a good enough size. The only thing that was broken was our bin in the bathroom. Everything else was in working order. The bathroom was a bit like a cabin bathroom but perfectly fine. The only annoying points is that they give you just one large towel and a small towel when there was two of us staying in the room. The duvet is very thin as well and the mattress is not very comfortable. But all in all it was a nice room and I would definitely stay there again. I was on the 5th floor and heard no noise at night either. We did not have breakfast there because there were so many places to have breakfast just a couple minutes walk away that were far nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag!”
Reviews.Author: PrincessCP
Reviews.Content: I had read the mixture of good and bad reviews so didn't have high hopes. Upon arrival the welcome from reception was good. There were a few of us in the party and a couple of us opted to use the self check in machine. We were shown how to use it - very straightforward. Of the 6 in our party, 1 was allocated a refurbished room, the rest of us were in the older part. The room was fine - an okay size, with wardrobe, bedside cabinet, desk and double bed. The bathroom was small but looked okay on first glance. So the negative? Mattress was soft and bed squeaked everytime I moved, the divan was a bit grubby, the bath was chipped and stained where the shower hose was touching the bath, and the toilet seat was falling off. Also, we did not have any warm water in two of our rooms which was a pain as we were getting ready to go out at night. A cold shower was had! My colleague complained to reception and we were told that there had been a problem with the boiler, and that it had been fixed, but that if we experienced any problems the following day, we could move rooms. We did have hot water the next morning. Breakfast great - warm welcome, plenty of room to sit down and good choice of all you could eat. A bit canteen like but did the job. As I was staying with work colleagues, and work had paid for the hotel, I didn't want to complain. Had I paid for this myself, I would have asked for a different (newer) room. Would I stay again? Probably not. I would prefer to pay a bit more for a nicer stay. Yes it is Â£100 for London city centre, but it is still Â£100!!

Reviews.Title: “You know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: mosieboy
Reviews.Content: Travelodge do not go overboard on unnecessary luxury or the provision of toiletries that you either didn't know you needed or you leave and waste! What you do get is a plain (bland) clean room, adequately heated (rather than overbearingly hot) and in the case of Covent Garden; very well positioned. I enjoy luxurious rooms and have been fortunate enough to stay in some of the best hotels in the world but if the definition of a 'quality experience' is a supply that at least matches your expectation then Travelodge is a quality product! Going to see a couple of shows in Theatreland? Going in by Train? If your room is not going to be your evening and weekend focal point but merely a base for your excursions then this Hotel is all you really need.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Northern-traveller08
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in Feb 2012. Excellent location, nice clean rooms. I can recommend the breakfast, which is an all you can eat buffet, including hot food consisting of scrambled egg, sausage, bacon, beans etc. Good choice of cereals and pastries etc. Food and drinks are served throughout the day and free wifi is available throughout the bar and eating areas. If you want to use wifi in the bedrooms you have to pay for this, either by the hour or per day. Only negative comment I have is that in my bathroom there was a large handle on the side wall above the (narrow) bath which reduces the space between wall and shower curtain. It is difficult, when showering to avoid the handle and in trying to do so the user can be put off balance and is in danger of falling towards the shower curtain. Apart from that no other comments and I will endeavour to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and very welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: SB2_10
Reviews.Content: My room was very clean and the staff were very welcoming. The hotel was in a brilliant location as the theatre was only a few minutes walk away. I was also pleased with how quiet it was in the room due to the secondary glazing which made it very easy to have a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Lucylastic1
Reviews.Content: We were apprehensive about staying here, however we had booked 2 nights at Â£12 per night in the sale, we definitely got a bargain. Fortunately for us our room was in the refurbished building. The room was spotless with a reasonable sized bathroom. It's in a great location and despite the central location we experienced no noise at all. (5th floor) We didnt really have any experience of the staff as we booked in using the quick check in machine. The negatives were: Only one towel in the room for two of us - quickly remedied. The usual problem with insufficent pillows quick;y remedied. A new, but very soft, uncomfortable matress. All in all a great place to stay on a budget particularly if you book during one of the sales.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: amyeastyorks
Reviews.Content: We have just spent two nights at this hotel with two young children. The best thing about the hotel is the location. It is only a five minute walk to the tube station and the main area of covent garden and if you haven't visited covent garden before it is a really nice area to be in with plenty of shops and restaurants. The rooms were very basic and the kids bed was a sofa bed which you pull out. It was clean and for the amount of time we were in the room it was everything we needed. Breakfast was good and kids eat free - there is plenty of choice. Overall I was pleased with this hotel mainly because of the location but if you are planning on spending a lot of time in your hotel room I would stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: WindermereBoys
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive about staying here as I had read a number of negative reviews. However, I can recommend this busy hotel. There are two hotel buildings. I checked in at the newer building on Museum Street but was told my room was in the other building. The reception had recently been refurbished and looked great. The lift was a little wobbly but it was fine. My room was on the 5th floor at the rear of the building overlooking some low-rise residential flats. The room was clean, comfortable and best of all quiet. My only complaint about the room was it felt quite cold so my advice would be to take something or someone to keep you warm! All in all I would recommend the hotel and it is in a superb location. If you are planning to see "War Horse" the theatre is only 2 mins away. There is a restaurant but I would recommend that instead you visit one of the many restaurants in the area. I paid Â£19.50 for the room - amazing value. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a nights stay but not a week......”
Reviews.Author: gingertomsk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week over half term as daughter was attending Sylvia Youngs and this hotel was straight through on tube from Holborn to Marble Arch. Great central location but the noise outside was horrendous - even though we were on 11th floor, High Holborn site. Had to change rooms half way through the week as our window didnt appear to close properly but to be honest it didnt make much difference. It was constant every night of the week although Friday, Saturday and Sunday were markedly noisier. On arrival we had one pillow each and it took 2 days to find another for me. 1 lift out of order and other 2 randomly stopping before starting up again - hardly confidence inspiring. Breakfast ok although cafe nearby presented better value and better food. Slightly offputting to encounter staff swilling away vomit from front of building on a few mornings as we were leaving. Cheap hotel, great location but lack of sleep for a full week means we wont be returning at Easter - find somewhere out of city and travel in......worth it in the end.

Reviews.Title: “What you expect from a travelodge!”
Reviews.Author: fullybestever
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a sunday night for Â£12 so a bargain for london, room was clean but small (but we only needed to sleep/shower so wasnt a problem), fab location, Only gripes are that there is some building work going on, the banging started at 8.30am which was annoying, the bed was bizarre - the top was lower than the end so you were at a bit of a tilt when lying down! No luggage room meant we paid an extra Â£10 for late checkout just so we didnt have to lug our luggage around everywhere - however they deactivated our room card so had to queue for 20mins when trying to retrieve bags - the room had already been made up for next occupants when we finally got back in which would annoy me if i was to stay in the room next as i used the towels/made a brew because we'd paid for it!! If i paid more than Â£12 id prob expect more but it was a complete bargain, absolutely fine as a base to sightsee etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, slightly noisy but nothing major.”
Reviews.Author: Deanovibe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend starting 17th Feb. The location is brilliant for shops, theatres etc. Handy for Oxford street too. We stayed on the first floor and it was a bit noisy but I'm guessing this will not be a problem if you're are higher up. DONT ask at reception for a cab, they gave me a card and It was for a service which turned out to be 'prestige'. The cabs were great but hugely expensive. Charged at least double a black cab which you'll get outside at any time. Very clean and friendly. Great hotel for the price and location. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Robbo1965
Reviews.Content: Ok, lets start by saying we paid Â£29.50 for our one nights stay on a Sunday evening and that's fantastic value for money any where but this is in the center of London. Your 5 mins from Covent Garden and 5 seconds from Shaftesbury Ave. There are Pubs/bars & mini marts within a couple of minutes walk. Now to the room, it was spotless and so was the bathroom! looked like it had been refurbished recently, its was on the small side but by no means tiny. Flat screen tv, kettle and coffee/tea all available in the room. The only downsides (not complaints) to the room was the grey colour of the paint, when in the shower no where to store your shampoo/shower gel, no hair dryer and no view from our window! This place is perfect place to stay if your going to a show or just exploring London.

Reviews.Title: “good location - shame about the room!”
Reviews.Author: ginablackpool
Reviews.Content: super location just 10/15 yards from one end of Drury lane and just an Â£8 cab ride from london euston train station. the New london theatre just 2/3 mins walk! pubs and resturants are plentiful. However, the level of cleanliness was poor - sweet wrappers in the sofa bed dust all over, we didn't complain as we were too tired. water dripping through the ceiling in the 3rd floor lift lobby not good but if you can overlook these "minor" problems the location really makes up for it if you like the arts etc

Reviews.Title: “good weekend”
Reviews.Author: rik h
Reviews.Content: read the reviews about this hotel after i had booked it for myself and my wife to stay for two nights so i was a bit concerned about our room before we got there .On arrival i asked the receptionist if we could have one of the newly refurbished rooms to which she replied "no problem".the room was as you would expect from travelodge, very basic ,clean and seved it's purpose.the breakfast was not cold as some reviews have said and was replenished very quickly when it was low.the location was perfect and was not noisey at all . if you stay in this hotel ask for a newly refurbished room and you should have a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you would expect”
Reviews.Author: Rod P
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable and very good value for money. We asked for a quiet room and were given one on a higher floor and had no problem. Good location, just 5 min walk from Covent Garden. Cafes etc nearby. Only issue, there is no facility for holding luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: Livy1000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my sister to attend a show. We got a little lost finding the hotel as there are two in the same place! The staff in the other were very helpful in pointing us in the right direction though! We stayed at the one on Drury Lane and were suprised at how spacious it is. Check in was very fast although impersonal. Our room was really nice and spacious which we didn't expect to be honest. So often in London rooms are like shoe boxes but this was nice. It was very clean though, has nice high ceilings, it was very quiet and it had a good sized bathroom with a bath and a shower too. The bed was comfortable and we slept very well. Check out was abit of a nightmare and the queues were huge. The duty manager was so busy arguing with a guest about something that he forgot that there were many people around eavesdropping. It would have been far better if they had removed themselves from the desk. This commotion meant that the staff were stressed and not concentrating. I was rather abruptly told I had ï¿½60 dinner bill even though we hadn't even stepped foot in the restaurant! This was a simple room number mixup but there was no apology; just unnecessary attitude. Overall the hotel was good; a central location with nice rooms. Yes they are basic but you get what you pay for and it was more than enough for the time we actually spent there. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Rooster1979
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money. The rooms are basic but clean & for the cost and the little time spent in the room, it was more than adequate. Cannot fault the location, very central and within walking distance to the theatres and major attractions. Breakfast is busy & basic but nice enough, with a choice of cereal plus bacon, scrambled egg, sausage, croissants, toast & fruit juice. Staff seemed fairly friendly and helpful. We are just back and are booking this hotel again for July.

Reviews.Title: “Good value accomodation in central location”
Reviews.Author: AGoth
Reviews.Content: Excellent value accomodation. Family rooms are large and spacious and clean. However, dining room is quite small, so go down early for breakfast. Plenty of choice on breakfast buffet. Great location, 5 minute walk to British Museum and Covent Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuciaL809
Reviews.Content: I stayed for only one night but I thought it was a good hotel, very basic but clean, good size room and bathroom, comfortable bed and in a central location of London. It is a typical hotel that you go only to sleep but that's all you need when you are in a vibrant city like London. I would't mind to stay again in here, the room was really spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Please dont to it !!!!”
Reviews.Author: EM1Scotland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my elderly mother for 2 nights and I cant believe how bad it was. I wasnt expecting anyhting special - just clean. We booked because of the location & to see a show and after checking in at reception- we here lookiing forward to having a shower/ a meal etc. The main foyer area is fresh/bright and clean- but thats as good as it gets. Leaving reception we went through a security door into a grubby/tatty corridor where the lifts are situated. The lift area was really grotty looking and smelt of urine. We left the lift and followed the direction to our room - again along a couple of grotty/filthy corridors. There were bags cement/broken tiles etc lying in the corridor and the corridor was badly in need of redecoration. The room was even worse- the walls were filthy and badly marked,radiator was not attached to the wall, the lamp shades were fithy/stained and broken, the furniture was shabby and broken.The bed sheets has scorch marks and the carpet was vile. the bathroom was not any better - the vents were choked with grime/dust/muck etc. There were no bath towels and only 1 pillow in the room and when i went back down to reception i expalined that therer were only 2 very small hand towels etc - the very unfriendly receptionist grunted and told me I would have to come back later , when I insisted i wanted bath towels & pillows now she began to "rant" in polish to another member of staff / got towels/pillows from a back store room ,dumped them of the reception desk and walked away. The next day , after breakfast ( which was excellent) I twice asked to speak to a manager but was told no-one was available. We were out most of the day and got back late- again no-one available. We left the following morning. This was a special treat for my mum and the staying here really spoilt the trip. I e-mailed the manager a few days after I got back but didnt get a response- I have stayed a few T/lodges throught the UK but never again.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what it said on the tin - basic but functional”
Reviews.Author: travellinghappySY
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights to see a show and see London sights. I was initially concerned after reading some negative reviews on here but I took advice from them and phoned ahead to request on of the refurbished rooms on a high floor to avoid noise. This was a straightforward process and we arrived to be checked in to room 813 - check in incidentally was quick and smooth with polite staff. The room was very basic but clean and it was obvious that it - as well as the corridor has recently been refurbed. My only 2 complaints with the room: 1) is the same I have with many hotels is that they don't seem to put plug sockets anywhere near mirrors making hair drying and straightening a pain. 2) We were in a double room that only had 1 spare pillow(??!), Other than that all was good - shower was warm and relatively powerful whenever we used it, the room was always warm and we were never bothered with night time noise. Can't comment on the meals or the bar as we never used either. The early check in and late check out facilities are good - we used them both - but they are a bit of a rip off at Â£10 each but seeing as how they have no luggage store facility it allowed us a few hours extra to get out and about. All in all, I would use it again as location wise its brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “High Holbourn”
Reviews.Author: howard3857
Reviews.Content: Apparently there are 2 Travelodges in this area Druary Lane as well as High holbourn. 2 of us stayed in the High Holbourn site to take a few shows. Both hotles are very handy for any shows on drury Lane (WARHORSE) & Shaftsbury Ave/ Covent Garden. The hotel we were in (HH),was clean, quite, well sound proofed & very close to all theatres. The buffet breakfast was very nice with help youself to as much as you wish,however there was somtimes a wait to be seated and some people were dooing there best to queue jump. Also be warned there not always enough change in the till to change a Â£10 or Â£20 note, more so at shift change over. The staff were all very nice and nothing was to much. I would stay there again,. Howard3857

Reviews.Title: “Good Location,clean,tidy”
Reviews.Author: rockyontour
Reviews.Content: Great location,clean and tidy,great hotel for the westend,all shows in walking distance,good value for money if you get a saver deal, we stopped 2 nights,the room we had no615 had a view of the london eye, great at night ,the room was located at the back of the hotel and was very quiet ,the only moan i have is when we checked in at 12.00 it was bedlem and no organisation. very busy, all the staff wanted to do was send me to a machine to check in myself ????even though i did not want to use the machine, told them i did not know what to do but just left us to it! one nice touch was the fact security did the rounds during the day and night. this made us feel safe.i would recommend this hotel we have used it loads of times and will do in the future,we will just look for the deals when we want to go

Reviews.Title: “somewhere to sit down...”
Reviews.Author: modelbox
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before - its cheap and cheerful and local to where I was working. Lat time, no problems. This time we got to the room and there wasn't the usual sofa to sit on. All there was was a desk chair and the bed. I enquired at reception, and was told that if you book a family room you get the sofa, but if you book a double room you dont get it, althoiugh the price is the same. I pointed out that I had stayed at several Travelodges over the years, never booked a family room, but always got a sofa. The receptionist said that most Travelodges only have family rooms, but this one has both. Thank you Travelodge for making this obvious! No other real problems - breakfast was acceptable, rooms and corridors clean. One thing that did concern me was that late on Sat night there was a terrible commotion coming from the corridor - it sounded like someone was trying to kick the door of another room down. As there was no phones in hte room, and I couldnt see a telephone number for reception so I could ring on my mobile, there was nothing I could do. I certainly wasn't going to go into the corridor to investigate, as it sounded very violent.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews say it all........”
Reviews.Author: Jon B
Reviews.Content: Well this place has double the amount of terrible reviews than it does have excellent ones so I rest my case. I can understand why as stayed here on Saturday 11th Feb and had a shocker of a room. It was firstly freezing cold (which we thought would improve and not much you can do about it at 2am when you arrive back and the heater does not work!) and secondly the bed was so concave in the middle that it was impossible to sleep on! You could not even get a lather out of the bar of soap in the bathroom and overall the room looked dowdy and unkempt. We were disappointed to say the least and it did ruin our evening to some extent. It is not the first time I have stayed and the other experiences were also not fantastic but at the end of the day people will continue to book as its a cheap (although Â£100 for a room for one night is not that cheap!) room and so central to Covent and London in general. We never had the breakfast but it looked busy. The Internet access is a rip off at Â£1 for 20 minutes - we put Â£2 in before it would work and of course there was no one about to tell to get a refund! Despite the central location I wont be rushing back again. I did complain and was given a 50% discount on the room which was fair I thought but I expect someone else has already been put in the room again! The place it in need of a general overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, but great value!”
Reviews.Author: Felix491
Reviews.Content: A one night stop as part of a weekend theatre visit. This hotel has friendly staff and is clean and comfortable. The rooms are basic, but all that is needed for a short stay; the hotel is very well placed for the centre of London and its attractions. Drinks from the bar were a reasonable price and breakfast was good value. We were in a ground level room and were concerned that it may be noisy. However, it was very quiet and we slept very well. Overall, a great place to stay for a trip to the theatre or sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “compact, clean and cheap!”
Reviews.Author: helenwhitegate
Reviews.Content: I read through loads of the reviews on here for this hotel but as I was able to get a room for 2 for only 19.50 in the centre of London I felt it was worth a punt. That said I had my credit card ready to bail and find somwhere else if it was dirty! I am pleased to say it was better than alright. I asked for a room up high and refurbed, the very nice staff advised that the refurbed rooms are experiencing a heating problem due to the boiler and that I would be better off not going in one of them so I said it was up to them to recommend me a room and they gave me one on the 9th floor of the Drury lane site. The room was small but perfectly good, the bathroom was spotless and the room clean and very warm! The tv worked and my daughter and I enjoyed watching a film in bed whilst having naughty snacks from the lobby vending machine. The next day we went to breakfast - which was free for her - and again it was lovely. I cannot fault anything about our stay and the view out of our window was great, in fact we could see a huge building which we found was the British Museum and we headed up there when we booked out. A lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Theres basic and then theres a Travelodge!”
Reviews.Author: anneloo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Drury Lane end of the travelodge this weekend and was very dissapointed. The room was tiny and very basic. There is a very thin duvet and we only had one tiny pillow on the bed. There was a chair and a vanity area with no mirror. Plugs for hairdryers etc are no where near any of the mirrors and you need to put your make up on in the bathroom in both aday and night for decent light.The bathroom had a shower which did not have hot water (it was tepid and the shower did not drain very well wither) for the whole duration we were there and there was no soap or anything to wash with. We had lights that did not work so we were in a darkened room for most of the weekend. We only had one towel and one pillow for a double room. We returned to reception to report the lights and to request further towels and pillows to be asked why we needed them (there was one towel and two people in the room?!) and was told they had neither and to return later. We asked for at least some towels as we were going out for the evening and was grudgingly given one extra towel. After staying at the hotel for two nights and returning to reception to request pillows frequently we were never given any.The uninterested receptionists excuse? They only have a limited supply. How on earth does a hotel only have a limited supply of basic items? Whilst we were supposedly in a refurbished room (fittings did not work) I would have hated to see the old rooms. They were run down already. The staff hadnt bothered to clean the window or the TV and the room looked very jaded with scratches and marks on the wall. Although it is ideally located for covent garden and theatreland I would never stay there again.The staff are uncaring and uninterested in any problems you have and the rooms have been shabbily refurbished. Whilst at a Travelodge I am aware you cannot expect 5* facilities, I would however expect to have decent service and the correct facilities (ie towels/pillows in ratio to the number pf people staying in the room). The only decent thing about the place was breakfast. There was a good choice of hot and cold food and it was well cooked, top marks to the kitchen! I found the hotel very dissapointing and overpriced. Had it not been Baftas weekend and half term, I would have tried to move hotels.If you are happy with price over comfort and standards, go for it. Spend a little extra time looking for a hotel in the same price bracket instead of wasting your money here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Paul S
Reviews.Content: Just a few minutes walk to all the theatre's.We saw Lion King so just 5 min walk.The hotel has 2 buildings.The room was old and well worn,the windows had gaps so let in constant noise from taxi's.It was below zero outside so draughts were a pain.The heater on full warmed up room but we dont like it hot.We slept through but had walked a lot during day.Loads restraunts and fast food near by and a Sainsburys round the corner.Clean and comfortable,no view and easy check in although it was very busy.Very popular with weekend bookings.Would def go again.And all for Â£25!!!! Beat that!

Reviews.Title: “Old and in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: kievro
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Fr=ebruary and got a room in the sale for Â£20. So was very cheap. The hotel was split in 2 one side was refurbished the other our side looked like it had not been refurbished since 1980. Although it was clean the mold round the bath and the cracked tiles and mismatching tiles (where some had been replaced) made it seem filthy. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and although very cheap i dread to think of the people who pay full price of Â£80 plus to stay there. I will say that i will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Martin C
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Travelodge in February 2012. The hotel is centrally located in Covent Garden only 5-10 mins walk from the Underground station and close to the market. We booked a twin room and were given one on the 'refurbished' 4th floor.......recently refurbished apparently because there was an overpowering smell of wet paint! We asked for another room and were given one on the second floor which was not refurbished and it showed. The furniture and bathroom looked old and the sink drain was totally blocked! Once again we were given a different room on the second floor which was acceptable. There is no hair dryer in the room which is annoying. Breakfast was extra but good. Whatever, this is a budget hotel in an outstanding location so unless you usually stay at the Ritz, you should be comfortable enough here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LesleyGYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights early February. It was freezing outside but we had a heater in the room which kept us reasonably warm. Our room was on the 9th floor of the newer side of the Drury Lane site and with the help of secondary double glazing we had very little noise from outside. The room was basic but clean. This is a budget hotel which is in a brilliant location close to Covent Garden and the West End.

Reviews.Title: “Not great - but ok”
Reviews.Author: Fruity29
Reviews.Content: We wanted a cheap and cheerful hotel in Central London for two nights. This Travelodge ticked all the boxes. It is walkable to the shops and theatres and a stroll to Covent Garden Market. We booked in using the Express Check-In machines, which was fine. When we got to our room we discovered it was on the ground floor and was clearly a room for the disabled. Because of this it was large and the bathroom was actually a wet room which seemed to have all the aids someone in a wheelchair might need, such as all the bars to help them in the shower, to use the toilet etc. We didn't really want a ground floor room, and are able bodied, so went to reception to request a room on a higher floor. This wasn't a problem. We were given a room on the 9th floor (top floor). This room was, as expected, smaller with a regular shower room. The room was very clean, apart from the carpet which was stained and I was personally not happy to walk around on barefoot. The bed was comfortable and the tv was located at the end of the bed, which was good. It was a corner room and the small window was located in the corner of the building so the room was very dingy - not a big problem as we didn't intend to spend much time in the room. We did need another pillow and towel, which wasn't a problem when we went down to reception. There is no hairdryer in the room, but again available on request at reception. The lead is very short and there is no socket near the mirror, but not really an issue as far as I am concerned. We didn't eat breakfast there, but did find the cafe just outside the Travelodge did a very nice breakfast. This is a budget hotel and you do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “updated”
Reviews.Author: tomandbridie
Reviews.Content: having stayed here many times parts of the hotel have been updated giving a clean and comfortable but basic room. thee is no better location in london to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: ltullett
Reviews.Content: Book far enough in advance and you can get a room for under Â£40, which is a bargain. The hotel is split between two buildings around the corner from one another, they are both in an excellent location for visiting the west end with its theatres, shops and restaurants. The rooms are basic but of a very good size and the beds are comfy. The decor of the rooms and bathrooms is good, the hallways look a little tired but this isn't pretending to be a luxury hotel. Great value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: LovesTheMed
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I was dreading staying at this hotel thanks to the reviews on here. I paid Â£15 for the room and it was absolutely amazing value for what I got. I used the self check-in (so didn't get to request a high/refurbished room) but then had to use reception anyway because the machine had no keys left! That said check in at the reception was very easy and the staff just took my details and handed me the key card. Check out was even easier, just give in the key card and off you go! I was in the Drury Lane building and only on the second floor. The view out of my window was of the back of the hotel with the vans pulling up early the next morning. But I wasn't going to London to sit staring out the window anyway so it was hardly an issue. I was up early the next morning as well so the noise wasn't problematic (it's central London, if you want peace and quiet then go to the countryside). The room itself was refurbished just last month (01/12). It smelt brand new, looked brand new and was absolutely amazing. The bed was comfy, the heating was adequate (only a small heater but I was warmer during the night than I would've been at home). The storage space was good enough for one or two nights. The bathroom had a shower, the water wasn't red hot but was enough for a quick shower. I didn't have the breakfast the next morning but I did have a meal the night before, the resteraunt area is very nice and the meal itself was also very good. I would definitely eat there again. There was also the option to have it in the room. All in all it was a fantastic stay and as most of the rooms will eventually be refurbished it kind of makes a lot of reviews on here null and void, because the rooms will be refurbished to a high standard and are brand new. The problem isn't with the maintenance but with the people that stay in the hotels, the toilet roll holder had a used plaster shoved down the middle of it, so some dirty bugger has done that in a matter of weeks of that room being opened. It's just disgusting and if people don't respect the rooms and look after them then they'll end up like the old rooms pictured on here within a short while. I can't wait to stay in this hotel again, it's fantastic and if you can get a room in the sales, well the value for money in London is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good in parts”
Reviews.Author: SpicyButNice
Reviews.Content: The first thing that struck me as I arrived was that there was a huge flight of steps up to the hotel - this isn't mentioned on their website but could be a problem for some people. The reception area resembles a station waiting room, and the staff seem to work on the call centre principal - they can only work from a script and you'd better not ask anything that isn't on it. My room was OK - very basic but warm (this was during the snows) and the bed turned out to be very comfortable. The bathroom was also OK - no bath and the shower had a fixed shower head but acceptable. Breakfast was definitely poor and if I stay there again (and I might, just for the location) I would eat breakfast elsewhere. I also had dinner there one night (because of the bad weather) and it was OK - not bad value for the price. There is a rumour that it's being refurbished, and I hope they do something with the cafe bar, which resembles a school cafeteria at the moment. In contrast to to other reviews I have to say it was clean and I had no complaints on that score. The staff were friendly but not very knowledgeable. Where it does score though is the location - and the price was excellent for such a central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor stay”
Reviews.Author: deank
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights, ok it's a travelodge but it was a poor one. No hot water for two nights, kettle did not fit under tap flooded room. The shower tray so small it kept over flowing. No place for shampoos etc. No hair dryer, I took my own but no sockets nr a mirror to use. Noisy rooms. Breakfast cold, miserable staff, raw bacon, rubber scrambled eggs. All in all the worst travelodge I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: Mair61
Reviews.Content: I looked at the other reviews before I booked and made the mistake of deciding that previous complaints re cleanliness, were too fussy !!!! We have stayed at many Travelodge; previously and they have been excellent. This occasion and location, the furnishing in the room were truly filthy. The room itself was sort of cleaned, not my standards, but ok!!! However, the dirt was ground into the furnishings, the carpets were nothing short of disguisting, could not walk on them without shoes. We had a family room on the Holburn site. The bed sofa was revolting - my dog sleeps on cleaner bedding. I slept on the sofa bed, with a duvet underneath me to protect me from the filthy dirty furnishing Uuuuggggghhhhhh.....the bedding provided seemed clean. The location of this hotel, was excellent and should be a flagship for the Travelodge chain.. Instead It gives the wrong image of the British standards and culture. The room was really, really noisy at night. The nightclubs and sirens etc.. This would easily be solved with decent double glazing. COME ON TRAVELODGE! YOU ARE BETTER THAN THIS! BUCK YOUR IDEAS UP . My advise, if you are a bit of a stinker, standards won't worry you. If cleanliness, is important to you - stay somewherelse.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, don't expect to be able to store your bags there”
Reviews.Author: AnnaF1234
Reviews.Content: A standard Travelodge, fantastic location. Hair dryer available from reception. Staff were reluctant to take a second towel up to our room, even though we had booked a room for 2 people. Don't expect to be able to store your luggage here if you arrive early (unless you are prepared to pay Â£10 for early checkin). It's a shame they haven't thought to provide somewhere for you to leave your bags, even for a small fee.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for such a good location”
Reviews.Author: candyqueen
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner wanted a weekend away in London but couldn't really afford these top class five stars hotels so we just decided to stay at this Travelodge at Â£124 for two nights. I was already excited about staying in Covent Garden but we really just expected the hotel to be very basic and probably run down. We were massively surprised!! Its in a prime location, about a 5 minute walk from the tube station and the markets. Check in took about a minute. The staff were so friendly on all levels from the receptionist to the staff in the dining room to the cleaners. Our room didn't have a trace of dirt, everything was immaculate. We didn't book breakfast with the booking but we decided to pay for it there. It was brilliant! Juice, cappuccinos, tea in abdundance. Plenty of choice with kellogs cereals, jams, speads and marmelades for your toast. Full English, muffins, fruit and muller light yogurts. It was a fab selection for Â£7.50 each and kept us full all day! Nice comfy bed, tea and coffee and kettle in the room, really nice big towel! Hair dryers, extra towels and pillows are available on request. Very suited to us two British twenty-somethings. I'll recommend this Travelodge to anyone and will definitely stay here again the next time we stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: BGeeLeeds
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 14.00 and had to wait another hour for check in.We were aware of this but you would think there could be some flexibility if rooms were ready so by the time we had unpacked and freshened up alot of our first day had finished.Lifts in the hotel were a guessing game when they would arrive.Why a hotel this size dosnt have a hospitality room for checking out?On the good side room was the rooms were clean(apart from the windows)and warm.Prices were good for the Central location and Breakfast was ok.Would personally think twice before booking again.

Reviews.Title: “Its a Travelodge, get a grip.”
Reviews.Author: Parky04
Reviews.Content: Book early, get a good price. Location spot on. Its clean, has a bed and plenty of hot water. If you want turndown service and robes pay the going price otherwise stop moaning. Its a great location Travelodge....Jeez.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location !!!”
Reviews.Author: spireiteBob
Reviews.Content: Situated on two sites, approx.150mtrs apart, in an excellent location for central London attractions and Shows. N.C.P. car park 100mtrs away - Covent Garden tube 5mins walk. We stayed in the Drury Lane building. (15 steps up to Reception ).Check in is self service or reception desk. Bar and Restaurant well priced and open early till late. Usual Travelodge room spec : basic decor, kettle, tv, small bathroom, wall heater, comfortable bed, but all was very clean & fresh ( recently refurbished room - an ongoing project.) We stayed Sun till Wed at Â£40 per night, which is excellent value for money. Not too much room noise, but weekends may be a bit livelier. Newsagents,cafes & pubs are all on the doorstep. Brilliant location - we will return when in London later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: WRB_Kawakuchi
Reviews.Content: As regular theatre goers we look for good value hotels near Drury/Shaftesbury. The Covent Garden Travelodge is well located within a few minute walk from Holborn and Covent Garden tubes. Our preference is always their block on High Holborn, not Drury Lane. Especially a room on the top floors. We had a large room with great views of the London skyline from the 11th floor. By booking ahead we were able to get a doubke room for less than Â£60, together with a great coffee and porridge/friut at a nearby Pret a Manger ! They also offer a 50% off the next door NCP which is worth Â£18 on the normal Â£36 rate. Conclusion - great value clean hotel in a very good location

Reviews.Title: “Our room was poor.”
Reviews.Author: Jo D
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location but that was the best thing I could say! We stayed here for a night in December & I am sure we were put in one of the 'old' rooms. It was above the entrance & Ok I expected noise, but it didn't help that the window had a 3cm gap so we could hear everything outside plus it made the room rather chilly in December. There was an ironing board balanced against the window to hold the curtains closed. The room had a very old bed & furniture . Bedding & towels were clean . It was cold as there was 1 electric heater working,there were 2 radiators , neither worked.There was a leg missing on one piece of furniture & it was propped up. Staff seemed to be few & far between on Reception & when I commented on the room didn't seem to be 'bothered' by my comments.Not good customer service. Don t think i will be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Cold!”
Reviews.Author: SimonLSpa
Reviews.Content: It was very cold outside this week and this was echoed in my room. There obviously has been proper heating in my room at some point - the 2 completely dead radiators were testament to this. However, these defunct radiators have been replaced by 1 dimplex heater which was not up to the size of the room. There was no heating at all in the bathroom. The 1.5 walls worth of floor to ceiling (drafty old) windows didn't help with the cold either! The room was ok if I stayed in my outdoor clothes or got under the duvet. Although shaving while shivering was a challenge! Anyhow... This hotel is very dated, and has not worn well. It needs a hell if a lot of money spending on it to bring it up to date and standard. Travelodge Covent garden has 1 thing going for it. Location!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Ottleyhouse
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location for the theatre & shaftesbury avenue but had the most lumpy bed I have ever slept in. Also there was a lot of outside noise (sounded like a club downstairs) & we could here it from floor 12!! Would not advise staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Solid budget choice”
Reviews.Author: Terri K
Reviews.Content: We ended up with an unexpected night in London and this hotel (on High Holborn) was perfectly acceptable. The price for the room was affordable, we were on the 9th floor so we had no road noise and a surprisingly beautiful view of the city and the sunset. We love the location, close to the Tube, the excellent neighborhood of the Seven Dials, and directly across from the organic cafe at Aveda. Don't expect anything as far as atmosphere goes - this is dorm room decor at it's finest - but it was larger than most London hotels and there was good hot water. The bed was decent, which again isn't a guarantee in other hotels. Strangely, there's no phone in the room (ok if you've got a dependable cell), no clock or wakeup call service, and no hairdryer. Wireless access ok but expensive and you have to pay by the day.

Reviews.Title: “Best for Value and Location!”
Reviews.Author: Jana N
Reviews.Content: Fantastic budget hotel and great location! Very close to 3 different tube stations, West End, Trafalgar square, Oxford Street and some great restaurants and cafes! If travelling Solo or as a couple, book a family room as it is the same price and very spacious! Bed is comfy too! Service at reception was a bit off but I got clean towells and a cleaned room every day for my 6 night stay! But it is London so not much time is spent in hotel rooms!!! Definitely recommend for the budget traveller!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: GWEZAG
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights for my boyfriends birthday. We got to the hotel around 2:45 and were checked in immediately. We were on the 12th floor room 1261 which is right by the lift. I was concerned to begin with as I thought we would hear everyone coming and going but it was fine. We could hear traffic noise during the night which is mentioned in the website. But then it was to be expected as the hotel is in the middle of London!! The room was basic but clean I found the bed to be comfortable. The room had tea and coffee facilities that were replenished everyday. Breakfast was nice, however wouldn't recommend the fruit as it was tinned. The only downside I found was that the bar staff didn't really have a clue about drinks and it was quite expensive. However if I ever visit London again I will definitely stay at this hotel as the staff were helpful and the location is perfect for the shows and sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a price !!!”
Reviews.Author: veejayservices
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights mid January. Great location. Room was on the ground floor in the Drury Lane section. Had obviously had a recent upgrade as the condition was excellent. Very clean and comfortable bed. Extra pillows, coffee, milk etc freely available. Reception staff very helpful and informative. Bar very reasonably priced for a central london hotel. We did not eat in the hotel but there is a small cafe on Drury Lane directly under the Travel Lodge which is owned and run by a lovely Turkish family. Breakfast is freshly cooked when ordered and the selection of sandwiches and take away hot food is really extensive. The hotel is expensive for a Travel Lodge but the location is excellent which helps to balance out the high cost element. If you could get rooms at this location on their reduced rate promotions then that would be the icing on the cake, as they say

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Tonto40
Reviews.Content: Stopped for 3 nights and really enjoyed the stay. Never stayed at Travelodge before and was pleasantly suprised. Ok its not got all the comforts of more expensive Hotels but all the basics were their and all in working order and clean ( Breakfast was very good ). Not far to walk to a lot of top London attractions. Well done Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “Freezing!”
Reviews.Author: Triumph_Herald
Reviews.Content: I was so cold under the skimpy summer duvet that I ended up putting most of my day clothes back on for warmth. It was an unusually cold night in London, but even so, they need to consider some appropriate winter bedding options. Don't bank on a long lie-in either. The builders started hammering, sawing and drilling on the other side of my wall at 10 past 8 in the morning. There is extensive refurbishment work going on, not that there was any warning about this when I booked.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but TAKE EAR-PLUGS+not worth full rate.”
Reviews.Author: beachlover30
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a 4 night stay in late January 2012. I have stayed in some terrible dives in central London that you wouldn't put a dog in, so this was a real treat to have my own clean bathroom! Booked about 6 months before so got a really good rate. Had a family room as they were available but was on my own so had loads of space :-) Two buildings, check in in either. I was in the Holborn one. Great room, double bed, sofa, very clean and brilliant shower. Lifts worked well. Really nice bar and restaurant if you wanted it. I didn't use either. TV really good quality. Perfect location as you can walk to almost every theatre etc. Daily service changed towels and cleaned bathroom etc. Bed was OK, could feel some springs but used the spare duvets in the family room and pillows! However, the noise surrounding this hotel is EXTREMELY loud. On my first night ie Tuesday a nightclub was blaring out until at least 6am. Ofcourse, being in the centre of London you expect noise but this is LOUD! I was even on the 6th floor! I am a very light sleeper so fortunately had my industrial strenth ear plugs with me otherwise I wouldn't have got a minute. Even with the windows shut it was still SO loud. I would not say the full rate is fair at all. It seems to vary from Â£89.00 upwards. Personally I would say no more than Â£35.00 per night is fair. It is totally budget accomodation even though the location is so good. I notice they are charging Â£190.00+ per night while the Olympics are on, what an absolute rip off. I would use this place again but only at a very reduced rate.

Reviews.Title: “Worst bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: Stoids
Reviews.Content: I got booked into this hotel by my work to attend a conference the next day. First impressions weren't too bad: large room, nice view (9th floor), though a bit dated it was clean. It was when I went to bed I realised how bad it was! The matteress was so knackered and lumpy, that I had to roll myself up in the duvet for extra cushioning. The pillows were so naff I used all three. It was also cold because the duvet was about a centimeter thick. My room was number 961, right next to the hallway where the lifts are. Every time a lift was used, it banged and rattled, keeping me awake. This went on til around 2am and then started again at 5.30am. Not the best night's sleep I've ever had. Breakfast was ok, but if you like decent coffee, go elsewhere. I've stayed in a few budget hotels, which have been what you'd expect for the money but this was by far the worst, and because of the location it wasn't cheap either.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, Good location, FANTASTIC PRICE!”
Reviews.Author: XTheGeekFreakX
Reviews.Content: Location: Once we found it, it's about 8 or so minutes walk from Covent Garden tube station, which proved really handy. Value for money / Price: We got the room on an online deal a couple of months earlier...Which meant the room only cost Â£10 (Â£12.50 after VAT and stuff) Which is an unbelievable price for what was the best Travelodge I have ever stayed in! Room: Everything was pretty much new, the room was immaculate, not a speck of dirt, bathroom was really nice to, updated for once. Honestly couldn't fault it. Staff: The staff were very helpful and always cleaning by the looks of it! Would I stay again? Definitely.

Reviews.Title: “very good service”
Reviews.Author: cheekytee
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the high holborn from monday to wednesday and found the hotel to be clean and comfortable. we were on the second floor and had no trouble with noise from outside the breakfast was wonderful and great value for money and the bar food was very good and not expensive as we had expected it to be. the location is perfect for exploring london. i would stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “the big yin”
Reviews.Author: tony2911
Reviews.Content: stayed for 1 night to see billy connelly. payed Â£35.75 and at that price cant fault it .location fantastic covent garden 2 min walk, did not try the food,bar service a bit slow,room no veiw to tallk about but clean with plenty of space if a bit basic . but hey at under Â£40 in the centre london for a double its fab

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Jafe1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January and would never stay here again. There are two buildings and we got put into the older one. The rooms are 3rd world style with light fittings hanging off the wall, toilet roll holder hanging off the wall and burn marks on the wall paper.
