It also smelled terrible and after booking in for 2 we only got 1 towel and 1 spare pillow The shower was cold and the shower head was also not fixed to the wall. We complained and the reception staff didn't care. I went over to the new building and we managed to change our room to the new location. This room was better and had been refurbished but still not what you would expect from Travelodge. It seems to have been refurbished very cheaply and is extremely basic. Would recommend spending a bit more and staying somewhere else if you are in London.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby....”
Reviews.Author: D B
Reviews.Content: Having checked ourselves in we found our room to be shabby, stained and generally dirty. However the bed was clean and very comfortable. TV and lighting in the room did not work and staff were unable to grasp what our complaint was due to the language barrier when we enquired about it. Over priced for the age and condition but location was good. But wouldn't really stay longer than a night!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy rooms and rude arrogant management”
Reviews.Author: RA_UK_1
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault the location.However, badly let down by being very dirty, blood stained sheets, grubby stained carpet, filthy chair, bathroom fan that did not work, tv that picked up more static than a nylon jumper! Staff quite pleasant however the management are rude and ignorant, they seem to feel they are doing you a favour by providing accomodation. BEST AVOIDED, I would rather pay a little more than stay in that filthy badly managed dump again...

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paula&Dave
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just had 5 nights at this hotel, and were very satisfied with the overall experience. We were advised to book each night seperately on the Travelodge website, and although this takes a bit more time, we were able to get a lower price for the 5 nights by doing this. We obviously paid more for the midweek nights (Â£60 was the highest), but the Saturday and Sunday worked out at approx. Â£30 per night for the room! We booked a Family Room, which gave us a useful sofa to sit on, and gave us extra pillows and quilts, which was useful in January, although the small heater did well to keep up with our demands! The rooms are basic but adequate, and the bathroom was small, but big enough for its purpose! We had constant hot water at all times, and tea/coffee facilities were fine. We had an isssue with the keycard, but this was sorted quite quickly and turned out to be a low battery. We had breakfast each morning, and this was limited to cereals (a good seletion of Kellogs), grapefruit and orange segments, back bacon (the best I've tasted for a long time), Cumberland sausage, scrambled eggs and fresh tomatoes, plus toast etc. The selection didn't vary, but was good quality, and we saved Â£1 per day each by booking in advance. We never use the bar in these places as they tend to be expensive and soul-less, and we heard a few complaints about the service, mainly because the staff have other duties to perform. We went into the White Hart across the road, and this was very pleasant. The area is fairly busy with traffic, but we really only heard the noisiest (Police etc.) as we were on the 4th floor and around the back.This didn't give us a great view, but we didn't expect one anyway! The location is brilliant for the West End, 10 minutes walk to Chinatown, and only 15 minutes walk to Trafalgar square etc. We always shop around for best deals, and would certainly stay here again, but wouldn't pay the advertised rate of approx Â£90 per room! Having said that, we went on some websites and saw hotels with shared bathroom facilities for not much less money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jayay
Reviews.Content: This is a great Travelodge for staying in Central London. We checked ourselves in at the Drury Lane Lodge and was given a room there. It was clean and up to date. We were at the back of the building so didn't hear any external noise at all. We had booked breakfast and were very pleased with the cafe and the food on offer. The staff were very attentive and we would definitely stay there again.This lodge is only 5 mintues walk from the British Museum and many theatres. We also walked from there to Trafalgar Square to visit the National Gallery. It doesn't take long.. There were also quite a lot of places to eat around especially near the Britsh Museum..

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: zoestevens
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here on a few occasions all on pleasure and have to say perfectly located in the middle of the central hub close enough to everything you would require for an ideal base for day or night! Hotel staff friendly and the rooms are clean and presentable which is ideal when you only use the room as a base. Only thing i will point out is the towels are limited to one bath towel and one hand towel and you need to request more whilst at reception, the same goes for pillows if you require more than the one. Breakfast is more than adequate just make sure you got an appetite as you could happily eat your weight in cereal, yogurts, fresh fruit, croissants, pastries, toast and full english not a bad addition to fuel your busy day. Overall worth the Â£80 per night we paid for 2 adults and about Â£8 from Waterloo via taxi for those that like us could not walk back to the station after a night out in town.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Travelodges I have stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: PookieBear2011
Reviews.Content: A large group of us stayed here for a hen do and, although it was still a basic as expected Travelodge, it was one of the better ones I have stayed at. We needed a room early to put all our stuff in and get changed and, whilst we had to pay Â£10 for it, we were able to do so, which was handy. We got a decent night's sleep and it was a good location - about all you need from a Travelodge. We went to Cote restaurant, Comedy Club Picadilly Circus, Sway nightclub and Covent Garden - all easy to get to from here. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: macbunKent
Reviews.Content: I managed to book this hotel for one night for a good discount, (book in advance or during a room sale if you can), We stayed in the newish block in Drury lane. Its still having a refurb and you can expect some noise from around 8am in the morning. We choose the breakfast and it was just ok to be honest, Check in was mega quick, I would say 30 seconds. The room was fine, clean and what you would expect from travel lodge,,,,,,,but you will hardly be there if your site seeing etc. There is a bar open for residents, but they are very limited in choice, no whiskey, no ginger ale, (you get the idea) But the real bonus to this place is its location, you are within walking distance to the following Covent garden, three mins walk China Town, ten mins walk Leicester Square, ten mins walk Picadilly Circus, ten mins walk T square, ten / fifteen mins walk Downing Street, fifteen mins walk and the list can go on. If you can get a good rate, this hotel would be ideal

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Vfrphil
Reviews.Content: If you want a place to stay in central London, not far from Covent Garden, stay here. Short walk from Waterloo Station, opposite Warhorse and near a bicycle hire station. Room was everything you expect from a Travelodge. The mattress was soft and the bathroom small, no remote control for the TV. We had no issues with noise due to a double glazed window, leading to a double glazed window, useful for storing the OJ. If you don't want to pay for a Travelodge breakfast there are several cafes opposite. Overall, great location. Please note there is a Tescos Express in Covent Garden if you want some wine/beer......

Reviews.Title: “Great location but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Whistlerspa
Reviews.Content: Given that this is prime location London and around thereabouts most hotels are Â£200+ a night or more this represents value for money. However our stay was in the older building on High Holborn rather than the newer Drury Lane block. The age of the hotel showed with grubby stained carpet and a tatty sofa bed with pullout which was not vey inviting to sleep on as a family room option. The overall cleanliness was acceptable though the mattresses were a little too firm for our liking. Street noise is an issue so take your ear plugs (however no fault to the hotel for this). I think that the chain should consider introducing room safes and left luggage facilities also. We didn't take the Â£7.50 breakfast option finding a Â£4.50 cafe option some 50 meters away in Drury Lane.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price we paid....”
Reviews.Author: JoHalli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in December 2011 having booked it earlier in the year at a fantastic rate of only Â£32.50 per night for a Family Room. We also paid Â£6 each adult for breakfast and the kids ate free! We arrived with trepidation having read both good and bad reviews on here. We were pleasantly surpised to say the least. We were in the building on High Holborn which is literally just around the corner from the Drury Lane site. I would say it is worth calling beforehand to check which building you are in as when we arrived it was cold, wet and windy and if you have to go from one building to the other to check in, it can be slightly annoying. It is also worth calling beforehand to request a refurbished room - I noticed that someone else had commented this so did call and did get a refurbished room (no idea whether my phone call made a difference!!). The hotel could not be more conveniently located close to Covent Garden. When we arrived, it was extremely busy however there is a self serve check in machine in reception which we used and was very quick and efficient (not quite sure why others didnt seem to be using it....). Our room was basic but clean and tidy. There are no pictures or ornaments. There were sufficient towels and bedding for us all. There were tea/coffee making facilities. The only thing I could comment on the negative is that there was only one toilet roll and we had to ask for more! Overnight, I did hear sirens but expected this as you are in Central London. We were warned that breakfast the next day would be busy however when my husband and I went down at around 8.30 we didnt have to queue and got a table immediately. The buffet breakfast was excellent and the hot food was kept topped up and replenished at all times. Our girls didnt come down for breakfast as we had a late night the night before but the restaurant staff gave us two plates to take food up for them. When we got back to the room on the afternoon we were a little surprised to find that the room hadnt been cleaned - we had to ask for fresh towels and more toilet roll!! We then popped out for a coffee and when we returned it had actually been done.... To be honest for the price we paid we could not fault this hotel - parking at the NCP car park was at a reduced rate of Â£18 per day. I wouldnt like to think I was paying over Â£100 a night for a room but if you can get it cheap, would certainly stay there again and recommend it. At the end of the day you are in central London - we hardly spent any time in the room and for the price, thought it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “bad to worse....NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: IRBaboonLondon
Reviews.Content: the fact i checked out 4 days into a prepaid non refundable 8 day stay may provide you with a suitable executive summary of the stay, it was worth losing the money just to escape i stopped staying here a while ago due to the variability of rooms and the odds of getting a good one being stacked against, however family, a number of them being in the same hotel necessitated staying here, although we snapped and moved after the 4 days of 8 rooms were average as usual, stayed in three different ones, decor is just average, what you expect main issue is that the travelodge website being stupid its better to book each night separately than book 8 nights together, its about 40 - 60% cheaper, however either hotel staff or computer cannot cope with this situation of multiple booings as checkout is at 12 check in at 3, so every day we found people entering our rooms unannounced with keys because the computer had checked us out, and every day we had the same hassles, every day they promise d to fix it and every day it wasnt, that was quite wearing and stressful for the older members of the group being as we had to check in again each day we were then told to use the automatic machines, the guy would not listen to our situation and lo and behold despoite being already guests the machine allocated us a different room exactly as we expected and had tried to explain , in order to fix thhe problme we had to ask another staff member to move the room on the booking but by checking out of the wrong room (that we never entered) we then didnt have a booking to check in again becaus ethe computer closed it and so it went on and on and on most staff the younger ones were arrogant and lazy only one older lady could fix our problems and she was great but she want always on duty - hence carnage, even when we were out and about town i kept getting calls from family members who were having problems at reception with bookings and needed me to resolve them the noise was also terrible but by drunken chavs in the hotel and street noise outside, there is a nightclub on one side of the hotel, a cut through on another and a theatre entrance / exit on another , if u want to stay awake til 530 every morning with everything from drunken fights to thetare construction its perfect the day i left in the morning a drunken gang of guests were being racist to th ereceptionist, says it all about the quality of people who stay there....

Reviews.Title: “Grotty”
Reviews.Author: gincott
Reviews.Content: Won't be returning, the location is good but the rooms are cold, tired and uninviting , staff weary and uninterested

Reviews.Title: “Given a shabby room until you complain? Might explain the mixed reviews!”
Reviews.Author: dxb100
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the night of the 28th December for one night. Initially we were given a room on the 2nd floor in a section of the hotel which had clearly not been refurbished. I'm not someone who usually makes a fuss and I totally accept that you get what you pay for in a travelodge, but the entire corridor had a strange smell and when we opened the door of the room it smelled of raw sewage. There was urine in the toilet so it had obviously not been cleaned either. It was a twin room and we'd booked a double (the receptionist even confirmed 'double' as were checking in) so we immediately returned to ask for a double room (I didn't bother complaining about the smell). However, the manager was there (dealing with other complaints!) and he put us into a room on the 4th floor. This time, we were sent in the other direction (still in the Drury Lane building - not the other one across the road) and it was immediately obvious from the decor in the corridor that we were in a section of the hotel that had been 'done up'. Our room, although much smaller was much MUCH better and had a new bathroom and new double glazed windows. If the first room had been a double, as opposed to a twin, I probably wouldn't have complained and would have had a miserable night. If I stay here in future, I will ask for a refurbished room to begin with and I advise others to do the same. I find it unacceptable that the 2 rooms cost the same and am left wondering whether it is policy to put people in a horrible room and only move them if they bother to complain?

Reviews.Title: “Shocking customer service and a confusing two hotel approach.”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine_Mark
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend to catch a gig at the O2 and a spell of shopping and booked the Travelodge because we got a good rate of Â£89 per night for a Covent Garden hotel. We went to check-in at the reception on Drury Lane and got our keys. We were not given any directions to the room or helpful advice, after going to the lift block and not seeing our room number on the sign and very confused went back to the desk to be told â€œyou are in the other hotelâ€� which confused us even more. What other hotel?? Apparently the Travelodge has two hotels, one on Druryâ€™s Lane and a second building 1 block up the road on High Holbom. So after the brilliant and helpful service we received at check-in (being sarcastic there) we went for a wonder up the road and found the other building. Here the guys on reception were a lot better and directed us to the lift and apologised for the confusion. The room was quite large and clean looking, the bed was a little firm but not too bad. We had a kettle in the room with some coffee packets and a TV with some freeview channels. The wardrobe was huge and could fit enough clothes in there to last a month. The bathroom was ok, the basin and bath had some signs of mould around the edges and plug holes but were relatively clean. The worst thing about this hotel was the corridors to get to your rooms. They seem to like putting doors every 10m to annoy you when dragging caseâ€™s through also, as they are self close doors all you can hear all night are doors banging as people move through which kept me awake. The walls are thin enough to hear your neighbours talking or TVâ€™s blaring out. All in all, the hotel is in a good spot being 15 mins from the nearest tube station. That is the positives done with. The two building approach is confusing and the service on the desk at check-in was appalling, the noise in the rooms is not great so I would not recommend this hotel, however if you want a hotel in Covent Garden as a base for going out and will not be in your room much, then it would be good for that.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out - there's two Travelodges at Covent Garden!”
Reviews.Author: revdarthur
Reviews.Content: We ended up at the older of the two Travel Lodges. I phoned ahead seeking instructions for parking and ended up in a loop road in Soho for 30 minutes. Large but half-empty and very noisy room high up and looking across to "Soviet type" abandoned office. Busy street and night club nearby with XS noisy at 4.00am. Only one (small hard) chair. No hair dryer. Bath without anti-slip mat...

Reviews.Title: “Covent Garden Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: Vibach
Reviews.Content: Does what it says on the tin. I went there alone with my two little girls. We had a family room. Very long and thin and as another reviewer said, this mad the tv very far away. Not that this bothered us as we were only there to fall asleep in exhausted after a very exciting day. The carpet I must admit was a little nasty and the windows filthy, but the staff were kind and helpful and for an extra Â£10 they kept my luggage in our room until after 3pm, allowing me to have two hands free to hold onto two very eager girls!

Reviews.Title: “Central Location,cheap n cheerful”
Reviews.Author: rosemead1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family of 3, the reception staff were all friendly and efficient. The room was on the 4th floor and plenty large enough to accomodate our party.The room was clean and tidy, the bathroom was the same standard. Tea and coffee making facilities and flat screen TV were also included. The breakfast was not bad, typical travelodge fair but filled us up ready for sightseeing.You can easily walk into the city centre from here and Covent Garden is on your doorstep. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but for Â£20 in Covent Garden you can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: Skywalker3
Reviews.Content: Firstly - if you are expecting a full service, 4 or 5star hotel look elsewhere. Like all Travelodge hotels this is a basic offering but if you can get a sale room for Â£20 in the heart of the West End it has to be one of London's best hotel bargains. The hotel is busy - probably down to its pricing, and at times reception does seem to be more like a hostel than a hotel with large numbers of people sitting round piles of bags. Some seemed to be there all day and using the cafe area as a drop in centre so perhaps the hotel could use a bit of 'guest only' crowd control. Check in though is now fairly quick and easy with the addition of self check in terminals. All worked fine for me apart from it didn't give me a key card but soon sorted by friendly staff. The self service though means this is the only interaction with staff. The room itself is standard Travelodge issue - a white box, small bathroom with shower, TV on wall and small desk. Tea and Coffee making facilities though and though storage limited for a long trip a one night stay fine. Room clean and well maintained and despite the busy nature of hotel is nice and quiet. Do be aware though that building work in the area does start at 7.30am in the morning and can be heard, even through the double glazing. Also be aware that the hotel is split over two buildings on each side of High Holborn, this review relates to a room on 2nd floor in Drury Lane building. No luxury frills but for a place to get your head down in central London the price is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean and good value (in Drury Lane one)”
Reviews.Author: OspreyEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: We checked in at the Holborn one but had been pre-allocated a 1st Floor room in Drury Lane property. It was just a short walk across Holborn Road, down Drury Lane and up steps into hotel. Clearly this one has been refurbished very recently as it was verging on pristine. Room was small and basic with no "frills" - which if your out you probably wouldn't need anyway e.g. mini bar/fridge. Comfy bed (singles) and a good shower. Stayed two nights. Key card wouldn't operate inner GF security door on second day and had to be reset by reception (don't put it next to your credit cards apparently). Also just one set of towels supplied for two of us, but no problem getting another at reception. Didn't eat or drink in hotel as there are lots of eating places around about. Best avoid the White Hart pub in Drury Lane. It looks old and authentic but is pretty dire. Try to book The 10 Cases Bistro in Endell Street if you want a really nice dinner. Would definitely recommend as a basic, good value, suberbly located hotel. It was busy and unfortunately may not remain pristine clean for long.

Reviews.Title: “No smoking rip-off”
Reviews.Author: captdave5
Reviews.Content: Having spent a night at this Hotel in December I was confronted by a letter saying they were claiming Â£150 for cleaning and loss of business due to my smoking in the room. This was not so. I am a smoker but always keep to smoking designated areas. Of course the letter was through a third party company CRS, obviously to cover up Travelodge exposure to bad publicity.(I'm still fighting this). Internet research shows that this situation is not uncommon and is classed as a rip-off. (see consumer action groups on Google.) Hotel itself was OK, however no fridge or telephone. Sink was blocked and toilet cystern made a noise like the whistle on QEII when nearly full. Cold unwelcoming place as were the staff. .

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Genepy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 9th and 10th December 2011, the location is just fantastic. We arrived too early to check in, and no rooms available. Later we tried at the site on High Holborn and were successful. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and stark as expected, on the 3rd floor and quiet except for the water tap in shower/bath was EXTREMELY NOISY, felt sorry for the nieghbours every time I had a wash! My main problem was breakfast on both mornings,we queued up to 'report' for breakfast and were handed 2 cold plates and then told to find a seat. The plates were to use for the self service buffet. (watery orange juice, long time to wait for food to be replenished) When you stay in Central London for travelodge prices you should not expect silver service; however being handed cold plates by someone who has just been carrying out reception duties is not good. Felt more like a camping trip than anything I've experienced before. We visit London once a year so I would stay here again for a short break only because of the location, as I told travelodge when they asked me, only until Premier Inn open a site in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish”
Reviews.Author: chaz1055
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many travel lodges with work and with family I can honestly say without doubt this was the worst Iâ€™ve ever been in. I booked it for 2 nights as a base while we did the usual shopping, site seeing and west end show. Iâ€™m not fussy all I ask is the rooms clean and the services (if needed) are good but unfortunately this had neither. I could go on for ages but basically the room (529) was a disgrace you wouldnâ€™t have put a dog in it for the night, even the smoke detector had an old pair of socks covering it over. I asked to be moved and explained all the reasons why, the receptionist must of grunted 2 words in my direction and gave me another key for room 191. This room was clean but falling to pieces, if it wasnâ€™t for the fact we were only using the room to sleep in and I had already booked tickets for a show I would have turned round and come home. Roomâ€™s substandard and customer service non-existent I would definitely pay extra and stay somewhere else rather than go here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: jadesummers
Reviews.Content: I stayed here alone when I was in London for work. My room was freezing cold all night i could actually see my own breath. The room was smelly and not very clean ( although the bed was clean ) the bathroom did not have a plug so you could only shower. No phone in the room. The security of the hotel was poor as I was alone I did not feel safe as anyone could walk into the hotel. The hotel was very close to covent garden that was the only good point. I had the worse nights sleep ever because of being so cold and due to terrible noise

Reviews.Title: “It's All About What You Paid Folks !”
Reviews.Author: Whouzo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 22nd / 23rd of December for a pre Xmas city break. I booked in the summer and got the two nights for Â£61.50. I'm a hardened TL jockey so I've seen some duff rooms in my time, but I specified by e-mail that I didn't want to be in the older block and my preference was for the unit across Holborn. I found the staff attentive and helpful. The key card didn't initially work but it was a mere glitch. Our room (416) was immediately off the central lift lobby. The lift shaft intruded into the room making it an "L" shape but I can't remember being bothered by any lift noises. The room however was rather long and my wife found it difficult to see the TV from the bed, which was a good 5+ metres away. The venting fans on the flat roof outside the window seem to run all night, but we wear earplugs so it wasn't a major problem for us. The view was uninspiring although you could see Centrepoint and the Telecom tower. As previous reviewers have already said, the location was just great, with plenty of bars, restaurants, shops etc, and easy tube links within walking distance. Being a muso myself, I really enjoyed drooling at all the guitar shops in Tin Pan Alley - (Denmark Street) - which is virtually across the road from the Holborn hotel. What more can I say - If you paid more than Â£40 a night then please e-mail me with your bank account details and your PIN number as I have exciting news for you regarding the Nigerian Lottery !

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel exceptional value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mari-AnneBed
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights - 29th December and 30th December. After reading Trip Advisor comments we requested a refurbished room - room 634 in Drury Lane was assigned to us. The room faced inwards so no view but you can request a room facing outwards. Check in was quick and efficient - the only hiccup was that we were unaware that you can book in at the hotel in Drury Lane and dont have to go to Holborn to book in but as the two establishments are just around the corner from each other it was not a problem. It was basic, clean and quiet. Bathroom only had a shower but we knew this and it suited us. No toiletries are supplied. No cupboards, only shelves and hanging space on a rail with hangars supplied. Flat screen tv with selected channels. We were aware of all of the above so we were satisfied with the arrangements. The bed was exceptionally comfortable. Meals in the hotel are quite expensive as are the drinks. However there are pubs and restaurants within walking distance that are much more affordable and there are two eating establishments across the road from the Drury Lane Travelodge that offer affordable breakfasts and pizzas etc., There is also a Sainsbury's 2 blocks towards the Holborn station where sandwiches and drinks can be bought at reasonable prices. The Travelodge does not allow for baggage to be stored so we requested an early check in and late check out, which for 10 pounds was worth it. The hotel is superbly located for the West End shows and is within easy walking distance from Oxford Street and Hyde Park. The Holborn station is 5 minutes walk away. We were very impressed with this hotel - we only booked it a week before we left South Africa after having spent days looking for an affordable, reputable place to stay and will definitely stay here again. The hotel intends completing the refurbishment by the end of April 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: MJS1983
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. We stayed for one night in Room 147 and it was terrible. The room was so shabby you could find a nicer hostel to stay in! The light by the door was out so you could not see in the full length mirror, the sink in the bathroom would not drain, the taps on the sink were so loose that they could come off at any moment, the bed was tiny, the matress very uncomfortable, only one towel for a double room, no extra pillows.... I could go on and on. It was not what you would expect from a chain like Travelodge and very different to the pictures they show of this hotel on their website. The only thing this hotel has going for it is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For A New Year Break!”
Reviews.Author: CooperKinnon
Reviews.Content: I spent months researching a hotel in London for a surprise birthday present for my Mrs and originally booked another hotel. I then found this little beauty at a fraction of the price and also included breakfast + the location was perfect. We went on the 29th December and came back today (1/1/12) and stayed on the 7th floor of the Drury Lane site. On arrival, the staff were helpful and because we arrived about 12:30pm, I was prepared to pay the Â£10 to check in early so we could drop off our bags and head into London. The room had clearly been refurbished and it was big and spacious, simple but clean and overlooked the London Eye. You could also see Nelson's Column from our window too. The breakfast was average at best, functional and saved us having to faff around once out of the hotel so it set us up nicely. I think the best thing about this hotel is the location, which is fantastic. A short five minute walk down Drury Lane, along Long Acre (past the Covent Garden tube station) and you are in Leicester Square etc. It really is fantastic, and the price was sensational taking into account it included New Years Eve. London is expensive enough so to get three nights here for what I paid at this time of year I thought was fantastic. Of course I'd prefer to be in the Savoy or Waldorf, but for Â£250 you cannot go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “If you're willing to take pot luck, Covent Garden Travel Lodge is what you want.”
Reviews.Author: jamiea3
Reviews.Content: I find it very difficult to write reviews for Travelodge in the UK because of the way the rooms are priced. The earlier you book the cheaper the rooms are. In terms of Covent Garden this could be as cheap as Â£29 per room per night, but could be as much as Â£179, i believe, per room per night and as far as I am aware there is no difference in the rooms for the differing price. Having stayed here three times I have had three very different experiences. For this reason I will break down the review: Location - Situated on the outskirts of Covent Garden you will not find a better location for a budget type hotel. It is easily within walking distance of Covent Garden underground station, but is also very accessible from both Holborn and Tottenham Court Road underground stations as well. For this reason it is easy to get to from the Piccadilly, Central and Northern lines. This also makes it very accessible to Oxford Street, Tottenham Court Road end and also Soho as well as Shaftesbury Avenue and Theaterland. Basically very well located. Leaving the hotel you can be in Covent Garden in three to four minutes. There are lots of bars along the way making it idea for those who want to capitalise on not driving! Hotel Itself - For some strange reason Travelodge have decided to make two buildings the Covent Garden Travelodge. One building on one side of High Holborn which I believe used to be a Moat House Hotel and one on the other side of High Holborn. Apparently you can check in at either and then make you way to your room. The buildings are typical for Travelodge accommodation, however you are booking a Travelodge and not a hotel so expect it to be kind of cheap and cheerful. Rooms - This is the part that I have the biggest issue with. With Travelodge I expect clean, tidy and a good standard, not luxury, but a good standard where things work properly. On our first stay had a room in the ex Moat House side which was really good, room seemed newly refurbished was light and airy, bed was comfortable. Second visit the room, again in the ex Moat House side, was very small, the light fitting near the bed had the actual light broken off the wall leaving only the main light to light the room. In the bathroom the sink did not run clear, the waste pipes must have been blocked. The light above the bath was not working, which meant having a shower in the dark. Worst of all the duvet cover was ripped at the seams in places and the duvet did not fit properly in to the cover at the bottom. The third visit was in the other building. This time the bed was not fit to be slept in. The mattress was in urgent need of replacement. The shower worked, but only provided a trickle of water and there was not remote control for the TV. Parts of the hotel have an old wood type aroma both in the corridors and the rooms, again not expecting high standard, but the place should still clean and presentable Food - I have never eaten at this Travelodge so cannot comment. Staff - The new automated checkin system means that you rarely, if ever, come into contact with Travelodge staff making it very difficult to comment on. Overall - If you pay Â£29 for a hotel room here then you get great value for money if you can put up with the likelihood of getting a bed that is far too old and soft. If you're booking nearer to the date of your stay be aware that you may well be paying for the location.

Reviews.Title: “bloody awful”
Reviews.Author: Justine M
Reviews.Content: do not stay here unless your only other option is sleeping under a bridge. Unhelpful staff, pokey dark room, repeated trips to request things that should have been there any way..... good location but thats about all it has going for it

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean and so central”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the new block, no choice of where they put you. We overlooked the taxi officxe, open till late, didn't spoil it one bit - local colur! Automatic book in was OK, rooms clean, basic, but what do you want, you're not in London to stay in the room, it's just a bed for the night. Really close to Covent Garden and a reasonable walk to China Town, Soho, Leicester Square. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: joaosiriano
Reviews.Content: been there last august and the locantion is the best in london for those who likes party, clubs etc. very well located, close to tottenham subway, oxford street. It`s a bit noise because is right on the main street, plenty coffee shops around, restaurants, pubs. The british people likes to travel in groups and there were loads of these groups. Actualy was very funny some of them. As i was with a friend we asked for 2 separated beds and they couldnt provide it to us, for some reason i dont know , but in the end didnt bother us. also they dont provide enough soap. The floor from the toilet is a bit funny, i did not feel confortable put my feets there without flip flop. Nice breakfast, the way i like, bacon sausages...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: zeppo2
Reviews.Content: Wow--what a bargain for London. 29 pounds per night for a central London location can't be beat. If I'd paid full price I might feel different, but the room was clean, the girls at the front desk wonderful (they printed out my boarding pass on Xmas night!), and the room good enough. It was noisy, but you're right in the middle of everything. If you stay here, go to the Sainstbury grocery store right down the block by Holborn Underground stop for cheap food. We went around 9 each night and found that the ready made sandwiches would be marked down to next-to-nothing, which is a great deal in London where food is expensive and often not that good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean but simple, good stay”
Reviews.Author: Tras123
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! The building does not look great from the outside but looks clean and modern within. After reading other reviews we had requested a high level refurbished room, our request was granted with no hassle. Room 918 was very clean with a modern bathroom, very simple but perfect for a short break...couldn't fault the room. Would definitely return to stay here again. Staff at the hotel were ok, assistance from certain members was better than others. There is no left luggage point which is a downfall therefore we had to pay Â£8.50 at the station to secure our bags for the day. Overall an excellent stay, perfect location and would return to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for anything more.”
Reviews.Author: Katy C
Reviews.Content: Brilliant! Stayed for one night in the week leading up to Christmas. Room very clean, comfortable and quiet! In all honesty, we couldn't really ask for anything more!

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is!”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_addict2008
Reviews.Content: Its a Travelodge- no more, no less! The location is fantastic, lots of shops in surrounding areas, close to theatres. Breakfast was lovely, good quality sausage, plenyty of choice. Dinner was fine. Good comfy bed, tea and coffee making facilities. On 8th floor, great views at night, fast lifts, quiet, clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth more than the Â£25 we paid”
Reviews.Author: kimmy12CambridgeUK
Reviews.Content: OK so I paid Â£25 for a family room during Christmas week so I shouldn't be complaining. (room 674 in tower block) but if you want to hear the niggles here they are: Bad points: Noise - yes it does state there will be noise on the website but it honestly felt like the windows were open as they offered no soundproofing at all. The hotel is right by a taxi rank and all thorugh the night despite being on the 6th floor we were woken by various revellers and general car noise and buses. We honestly hardly slept a wink and it completely spoiled our next day. Breakfast - very disappointed - expected something similar to a Premier Inn breakfast given the price is similar but is much below that standard. My croissant was so dry I was about to toast it when the server took it away and microwaved it to freshen it up. Location - not as close as it could be but within walking distance of Covent garden tube. Plus points: Reception staff - in both hotels were very pleasant and informative. Parking - a discount card given by the hotel bought our 30 hour parking bill down from Â£60 to Â£25. TV - more channels available than the last time I stayed at a Travelodge. In short would I stay here again - No I'd pay the extra for a better hotel or travel home. But if you're a sound sleeper or are one of the late night revellers it will probably be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Functional”
Reviews.Author: Chimbonda
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just before Christmas, when we went to London to see a show. It's in a very handy position and we didn't need to use taxis during the weekend. Plenty of pubs and restaurants nearby, and all the theatres are within walking distance. The bar is a bit soulless but other than that, we have no complaints. If you want somewhere inexpensive, very clean and functional, this could be for you. We would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise.”
Reviews.Author: AuldJimmy
Reviews.Content: A pleasant surprise for me, my room on the fourth floor of the Drury Lane block was newly decorated and quieter than expected despite being at the front. Great value if you book in advance. Location is good, Pub opposite in Drury Lane, lots of Food outlets nearby so don't prepay for Breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Ivyrad
Reviews.Content: We had booked tickets to see several shows in the few days leading up to Christmas. Rather than travel back and forth to Ipswich we looked at booking a hotel and wanted something central but not expensive. I didn't think that it was possible to find both of those criteria. But we did with the Travelodge Covent Garden. It was ideally located for everything that we wanted to do which included War Horse, One Man, Two Govenors and Nutcracker Ballet which was all in walking distance from the hotel. Therefore we did not have to spend anything on travel costs. I was weary about the standard of the hotel. But I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was very tired and worn in places but our room was ok. The only thing about our room (211) was the very dated bathroom. But having said that it was clean. We also thought that being a central london hotel that it would be extremely noisey in the corridors from people being out late. We did not have any problems. Also we only paid Â£32 for the night for a day before Christmas. Certainly value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good for location”
Reviews.Author: katie66Uk
Reviews.Content: Typical travelodge standard in bed and pillows however rooms are a good standard and excellent location

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, serviceable and at Â£19 a night you can't really complain!”
Reviews.Author: UkRebecca28
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean room, comfy bed - not enough towels or pillows but asked for more and no problems providing them. Location is superb. Less than 15 minutes walk from Covent Garden, Trafalgar Square, Picadilly Circus, Oxford Street, Shaftesbury Avenue etc etc. About 20 minutes from the South Bank, Waterloo, St. Pauls and the CIty. We've stayed in London many times and this is by far the best location yet. Would have no problems staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - could be so much more!”
Reviews.Author: Tricky666
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice recently for work (taking Clients out) and whilst the location is good, not much else is. Usual Travelodge rooms, no frills. The bar was empty! Bar food was taking 45mins plus. The location IS GOOD and therefore this is probably one of the cheapest rooms in this area (if you book in advance) but not somewhere I would recommend or book again. I'd only stay here if someone else had booked it for me - and I did; twice!

Reviews.Title: “My old student digs were cleaner than this, absolutely grotty”
Reviews.Author: donnyladjr
Reviews.Content: I would have expected a bath plug at least for over 100 pounds or at least a bath towel free of feces, utterly the worst dive I have ever stayed in. Granted the staff were courteous but the rooms would make me stay well clear of this place again. Advice, bring some cleaning wipes with you before you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, grubby, poorly maintained”
Reviews.Author: Ron707
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Travelodge Covent Garden for one night in early December 2011. We are used to staying in budget hotels so we didn't expect the Waldorf Astoria, but the standard of cleanliness and basic maintenance in this place was a disgrace. Some highlights: - The hotel's corridors were littered with various items, including burst refuse sacks, used laundry and empty glasses - The carpets were filthy and clearly hadn't seen a vacuum for months - The room had not been fully made up upon our arrival, despite this being in the early evening - Bonus features in the bathroom included cracked tiles, a broken toliet roll holder and a rusty plughole - The room itself had peeling wallpaper and - worst of all - stains on the net curtains (we still don't know what they were) It's fair to say the room was generally very tired and in need of a major upgrade. But even then, it's possible to maintain basic standards of hygiene. Travelodge Covent Garden failed to do so on this occasion. As a result, it compares badly to its budget hotel competitors such as Premier Inn, Ibis and Holiday Inn Express, all of which we have stayed in several times. Travelodge has been well and truly scored off our list for the future.

Reviews.Title: “usual uninspiring Travelodge experience”
Reviews.Author: JimClose
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked for me by the office travel admin with about a week's notice, in the middle of Christmas party season. For an eye-watering Â£158 I got the usual Travelodge box: clean, simple, absolutely no frills, and the same as every other Travelodge. Front desk reception and checkout was OK - courteous and efficient. Breakfast in the morning is a self service buffet, with plenty of yoghurts, cereals, and cooked fare on display. The member of staff checking your room number as you arrive for breakfast does a great job of brightening the place up with an effervescent and enthusiastic welcome. There's a machine for coffee - brown and hot, and the most appalling diluted orange "juice" that I have ever tasted. All in all, not great value for money at this price.

Reviews.Title: “BASIC BUT CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: Kentravellers
Reviews.Content: Had 2 nights here - this is the third stay in total, the last one being over a year ago. Since our last trip the hotel has had some alterations/decorations. Having read some of the other previews, we took their advice and rang to check with the hotel that we were in the newly refurbished section, which we were.The room was clean, tidy and basic but nevertheless comfortable. We ALWAYS ask for an extra pillow and needed to ask for another bath and hand towel as there was only one set in the bathroom - all willingly handed over with no problem. On our previous stays, we had been in an unfurbished room which we had thought was adequate and okay, but it was nice to stay in a better room this time. Would recommend the little cafe straight across the road (think it's called Verona?) - good breakfasts and very reasonable. My only gripe about Travelodge rooms is I wish they would put a wall mounted hairdryer in the bathroom. Whenever you ask at Reception they never seem to have one. Suppose you could take your own but when you're on foot it's just something extra to have to carry!! All in all we would recommend this Hotel - perfect location for Covent Garden and the theatres, with lots of restaurants all very near by.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: pompey1001
Reviews.Content: Clean plesant stay , in central location. Great value for money and not too far to walk with all your Christamas shopping

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: william21Cheltenham
Reviews.Content: Where else can you stay in the centre of London for Â£19.50 a night? Excellent location within walking distance of everything central London has to offer. Clean quiet room,polite staff,easy check in. We have stayed here many times & never had a problem

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting bathroom, arctic bedroom”
Reviews.Author: DINKYBoyandGirl
Reviews.Content: For Â£137 for a twin room - we were greeted with an arctic bedroom, ineffective heater, thin duvets, wafer thin pillows (I offered the one spare to my friend), chipped toilet seat, broken washhand basin taps, overflowing shower curtain and black mould round the bath. The ONLY benefit of staying here is the location - I would never stay here again and would advise you to look elsewhere even if it's a little further afield. They should have paid me Â£137 to stay here!!! Grotesque!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in central London at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Glenn_C
Reviews.Content: A superbly placed hotel in central London just a few minutes walk from Covent Garden and Leicester Square, this Travelodge hotel is typical of that class, offering clean and comfortable accommodation at a reasonable price. While the breakfast represented good quality I was less impressed by the evening meal, which took ages to arrive and was only acceptable at best. This is the place to stay if you are visiting London's theatres or galleries and museums and you don't want to spend exorbitant amounts of money on a bed for the night. However, you may prefer to visit one of the many excellent restaurants and cafes in the area for your evening meal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, bargain price”
Reviews.Author: Josalsa
Reviews.Content: We booked a couple of months ago in the sale and got a room for Â£25 for a Friday night two weeks before Christmas! Location is wonderful walked to Covent Gardn, Oxford Street and Marble Arch. Travelodge is what you would expect, no frills, pretty basic, but clean with loads of hot water and you can walk to loads of attractions, for that price what is not to like.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel room ever!”
Reviews.Author: Paula B
Reviews.Content: I will keep this brief and to the point, this is why I won't stay here again - Towels were dirty, obviously not been laundered, one was covered in mascara stains. Washbasin tap broken, we had to hold the tap to keep it stable while using it. Bath tap broken, couldn't alter the temperature. Toilet broken, plumbing needed attention.. VERY, VERY noisy - we didn't sleep. We checked in, very tired at 11.30 pm otherwise we would have complained, but we were only staying one night and were too tired. The room was on the 8th floor. I listed the issues we had to tell the check out staff, but they were too busy on the telephone and just pointed at the drop box to leave the room 'key'!!! If you are considering this hotel, please don't waste your money, do yourself a favour and find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Paula321321
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights for our annual girls xmas weekend. Was really worried after reading the reviews but went with an open mind and the fact that it was not costing a lot for a room in central London. Well i was very suprised, we were over in the High Holburn building on the 10th floor and could not fault the rooms. Bedding and towels very clean and crisp, couldn't fault the cleaning in the room or the bathroom either. When we returned on the second day our beds had been made and fresh towels had been left and tea/coffee etc replenished. Reception staff really polite and helpful. Hotel about a 5 minute walk from either Holburn or Covent Garden Tube station. Will definitely stay here again, only dowside is slightly noisy with sirens but general street noise or corridor noise was very low.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location & Great Room”
Reviews.Author: claire7557
Reviews.Content: Couldnt fault our room was clean warm & quiet all you need for London staff are very friendly & helpful Some lovely sandwich shops or cafes nearby Fantastic location easy access for tube & covent garden Would deffinately recommend & wouldnt hesitate to book for our next stay in London

Reviews.Title: “All very average”
Reviews.Author: yellowfurbaby
Reviews.Content: Stayed in many many travelodges over the years. They are known for good comfy no frills approach. I am a fan of this! However..... Booked into a one night stay at this hotel and was a little disapointed. I do NOT expect luxury certainly not for Â£99 a night in central London, but it was tatty. It needs a serious lick of paint. Also not enough coffee in the room and the queues at the reception were not worth joining to get some more. The windows in the room seriously need some good double glazing. Soooooo noisy from drinkers passing by on the streets all through the night. We were on the 3 rd floor and could hear every word. Check in and out very convenient with touch screen do it yourself but did leave it all very impersonal. Location however cannot be topped and it was only Â£99. So I would be tempted to stay again at this most average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mouldy rooms, don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Sy_101
Reviews.Content: Good location very central. Hotel room was dirty, the bathroom was a disaster, four missing light bulbs, broken shower head and mouldy ceiling tiles

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very poor room”
Reviews.Author: Whittepk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night, fortunately! The hotel is in a very good central location, however don't expect to be able to leave your bag and explore London, you can but you need to pay Â£10 for early check-in. Our room (40) was tiny, dated, cobwebs on the 70's ceiling tiles, with a lovely view off the underground car park. The toilet didn't flush properly, no shampoo or shower gel in the shower. Whilst I appreciate Travelodge is a basic hotel, the room we had was very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Cabbagejon
Reviews.Content: Great location, only a few minutes walk from covent garden tube. We stayed in the Drury Lane site and had one of the refurbed rooms on the 1st floor. Clean and tidy, you know what you're getting with travelodge. Would defiantly stay here again if we got the same price

Reviews.Title: “Basic but more than adequate and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Nicola E
Reviews.Content: After reading some other reviews on here I was very apprehensive about staying here but was pleasantly surprised! I did however take another reviewer's advice and called up the hotel the day before I was due to check in and I requested a room in the refurbished part of the hotel and requested a high floor to avoid noise. My review may be very different if I didn't do my research but i was perfectly happy with the hotel and my room. OK so it's not the prettiest building in the world but the location is fantasic and great for Covent Garden and theatres etc. The bar area and breakfast are are bright and clean and the food is fine. If you do your research you will know that they do not provide soap or any other toiletries but I was prepared for that and also packed an extra towel as I read that you only get one towel and have to ask for more if needed. The room was very clean however and did not hear any noise from the street being on a high floor and having 2 sets of double glazed windows. The only negative I can think of is that they do not have anywhere to store your luggage when you check out. As I wasn't travelling home until 9.30pm I had to go to Euston and pay Â£8.50 to leave my bag there for the day. I don't understand why the hotel doesn't offer this facility but that is the only downside to my stay. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, great value”
Reviews.Author: SoulQuince
Reviews.Content: Excellent, central location. The room was perfect for a weekend break. It had all the basic facilities and a really comfy bed! The bathroom was clean, with a great shower. Our room was quiet, we heard no outside noise and were not disturbed by any other guests. We ate breakfast in the cafe opposite, which offered freshly cooked food, friendly service and was great value. This no frills hotel is ideal for short breaks, sightseeing and shopping, it offers great value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, good location for Theatreland.”
Reviews.Author: churchmouse33
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Museum Street site. It was close to the West End and the area had lots of good priced restaurants and bars...an area lively with a great atmosphere. The hotel was bright and clean, the corridors were spacious with good carpeting. The room was typical Travel Lodge, the furnshings basic but adequate. Small flat screen TV , tea making equipment and supplies. The bedding was clean and fresh. Had to ask for more pillows but they were delivered in time for bedtime. The mattress was TERRIBLE, the most uncomfortable nights attempt at sleep. Why do Travel Lodge no invest in better mattresses? There was adequate towels and of course we brought our own toiletry supplies, no problen with that.The net curtains in the bedroom were filthy and let the whole cleanliness of the room down as up till then were would have said the room was spotless. Our room overlooked the busy main road, we were on floor 2 and although there was some road and people noise it was nothing to be concerned about. A good breakfast - could have bought in the area for the same/less price - but it was convenient and very wholesome. Buffet style with plenty to choose from. Overall, great price for central London but would probably pay more for a confortable nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap london accompdation”
Reviews.Author: Gazpara
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a theatre package and was very pleasantly suprised. Nice accomodation within city centre location

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: LookItsJonno
Reviews.Content: Thank goodness this hotel is getting a refurb. We stayed at this hotel, and if we hadn't only paid Â£19 for the room i'd have been pretty upset. Our old fashioned room had Broken lights, a hole in ceiling, a TV that barely worked, broken tiles, no soap dispensors (rawl plugs evidence of existance), and little in terms of amenities (no soap etc). Having said that the reception area looked pleasant, and I expect the newly refurbished rooms will be quite nice. Location is excellent, staff seemed friendly. I would probably stay again, i'd just request a refurbished room !!

Reviews.Title: “Clean. Good location. Comfortable Room.”
Reviews.Author: ufojosh
Reviews.Content: Travelodges are always a pretty safe bet, your're almost guarenteed a good comfortable room that's clean and offers a good nights sleep. The onsite restaurant always serves an edible meal and whilst it isn't cheap it isn't massively overpriced. I got exactly what I was expecting in this hotel which is exactly why I end up being put in them. The one dissapointment was the staff who didn't quite seem all there. They weren't necessarily rude, just didn't think. The hotel is split across two sites, I checked in and had to cross the road to the other site to get to my room (not a problem, I knew about this and so was expecting it), when I got to my room the key didn't work so I returned to reception only to be told that the room I had been allocated had a faulty lock and someone would have to let me into my room whenever I wanted to enter. I was shocked that the first receptionist checked me into a faulty room and even more shocked that he didn't tell me about it! I asked to be changed into a different room and was allocated one in the basement. I had to visit reception again later in the evening to ask for some change for the vending machine but apparently they didn't have any and nor did the bar (which I find a little hard to believe) and saw a couple check into the hotel being given a room on the first floor, leading me to assume this hotel checks people into the bad rooms first which seems the wrong way round. Anyway, moan over. The hotel is good, in a great location and if you don't mind dealing with slightly odd processes then it is a great place to stay if you want to be close to Covent Garden etc.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, unfashionable, faded - but friendly, and good location!”
Reviews.Author: AdrianCollins
Reviews.Content: Apparently some parts of this hotel have been updated but our room was not. The corridors were dark and faded, well in need of a refurb. I had to kick the door each time to get into our room, as it was stuck. Some of the lights did not work and the room was very cold. The beds were bouncy and the pillows were dreadful. TV remote did not work, and the TV channels barely worked. Saying that, the room was quiet and the hotel was a good location. I paid Â£60 for a twin room which isnt bad for central London. We had breakfast across the road in a cafe for under Â£3 The room was also clean. The cafe and bar area was pretty good really - I thought it was due to close at midnight, but we were there until 2.30 am and it showed no sign of closing. The staff here were all very nice, helpful and smiley. I kinda liked the place. Odd I know.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge covent garden”
Reviews.Author: hackthorn
Reviews.Content: very good location for theatre land and centre of London. Draughty room,tired furnishings/dirty carpet. Broken/tatty bathroom. No hot water on final morning of stay.Noisy work in progress-not informed this would take place in adjacent room. E-mail sent prior asking for info not replied to.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: shinafoot
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Travelodges before and they are generally good value for money when you want to economise, but this one was a BIG disappointment, as it was run down, shoddy, room was pokey and bathroom looked well worn and dirty. Flimsy bedding and not even a hand control for the tv...now that IS skimping!

Reviews.Title: “I am a cheapskate!.........”
Reviews.Author: jaaaateeee
Reviews.Content: ....which is why it never ceases to amaze me that Trip Advisor reviewers seem to want a Savoy standard of hotel at a fifth of the Savoy nightly price and continue to moan about it!!. I paid a cheap price for a central London hotel. It's in a great location, easy walking to Theatreland. It was clean, quiet, had a comfotable bed and a nice shower. It did not have luxury wardrobes, safety deposit boxes, toiletries, turn down or room service!! If you want luxury and are willing to pay for it Claridges should have vacancies, if you are a cheapskate like me and want a basic clean room to rest your head then this Travelodge is perfectly acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: magpiepaul
Reviews.Content: Great location right in the heart of theaterland rooms are clean great English breakfast

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel of 3 Halves!!”
Reviews.Author: Cape-UK
Reviews.Content: This hotel has 3 sections to it. Two separate buildings on High Holborn, and across the road on Drury Lane. We stayed in the Drury Lane building, which in itself has 2 very distinct halves - 2 towers joined by the main reception, restaurant & bar. When we checked in we were put in the left tower of the hotel (left as you face it from outside). The corridors were very tired and tatty as was the room. We were going to put up with it as we didn't have high expectations for a budget hotel in central London. However 2 of the bulbs in the bathroom were broken, which made the room too dark to use the mirror to shave etc. So we went to report it to reception. The receptionist was a very friendly helpful girl, who told us that maintenance weren't in over the weekend, but she could move us to a different room on the other side of the hotel. She didn't say the rooms there were better, but we realised as soon as we saw them, that she moved us there for that reason. It was like a different hotel in the right tower of the hotel. Clearly recently refurbished. Can't really say anything bad about the room - considering it is a budget, no-frills hotel. Clean, new, good bed, good lighting, modern bathroom with walk-in shower. We were delighted! Could do with a safe though. The windows were triple glazed so kept noise out brilliantly. (This wasn't so on the old side of the hotel) Location is excellent, in the heart of the West End. Its a short walk from Covent Garden & Leicester Square. We give the right side of the Drury lane building 4 stars. If we'd only stayed in the left side, we would have given it 1-2 star, thats how different the buildings are! We didn't get to see the rooms in the Holborn building so we can't comment on that. We would definitely stay there again, only we would specify exactly which part of the hotel we want to be in!! We recommend you do too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pleasant staff, but the rooms need attention”
Reviews.Author: Ph1leasFogg
Reviews.Content: To be honest, I used the Travelodge at Covent Garden as a base to get around the centre of London. Firstly, the positives. You can tell that the reception area has been freshened up which has included a new restaurant and bar area. This area also includes free wi-fi, which is helpful when looking to keep up with your e-mails. The breakfasts have improved since my last visit and the selection is very good. The staff were very helpful throughout our stay - including moving myself and the person I went with when the original room was found to be of a poor standard and resolving an issue with a person in a neighbouring room who was making a lot of noise at 1 am on one of the days of our trip. The location is perfect for central London with good bus and tube networks nearby and being within easy walking distance of Theatreland. Now for the downside. Although the reception area has been renovated, the room I stayed in lacked attention to detail. Some of the ceiling tiles were broken, spotlights weren't working and there was evidence of mould in the bathrooms - both in our originally allocated room and following our room change. Additional to this, the lift and lobby areas on the floor where we stayed (Floor 2) smelled of damp, which wasn't pleasant to be greeted with. This lack of attention to detail has, unfortunately, affected my marking, but it can be an issue where improvements can be made.

Reviews.Title: “By far the best thing about this place is the location”
Reviews.Author: Beaverman33
Reviews.Content: Firstly the bad - Our room was about 20ft long, and only had 1 tiny window at the one end. The only two lights in the room were the bedside lights. This made the room very dark and difficult to see in â€“ even in broad daylight. In order to be able to see down the one end of the room we had to leave the bathroom door open and the bathroom light on! I think this hotel has been made out of converting an old office building which tends to give some unusually shaped rooms. The interior of the room was very tired and in need of a serious refurbishment (and additional lighting). The furniture all looked very old and worn. The double bed was incredibly lumpy and the pillows were thin â€“ it was akin to placing your head on an After Eight mint. I asked at reception for another pillow but was told there were none. This I find highly unbelievable and generally equates to â€œI canâ€™t be botheredâ€�. This was particularly annoying as the website says â€œAsk at reception if you need . . . any extra pillowsâ€� The walls of the room were paper thin meaning that you could hear your neighbours and their TVs all the while. The bathroom was really old with discoloured ceiling tiles and no plug for the sink. We stayed for two nights. When the room was serviced after the first night they only left one towel and took away one the cups for the tea and coffee making. Although the room was old and tired it did sort of look clean (although it was difficult to confirm this due to the darkness of our room!). We didnâ€™t have breakfast in the hotel as we thought it was overpriced, instead we can thoroughly recommend CafÃ© Verona just over the road. So what were the good points about this hotel? As Kirsty and Phil say on their Channel 4 property programme . . . location, location, location! The hotel is right in the heart of central London, only a stones throw from the 7 dials, Covent Garden Market, Theatre Land and the West End. The other big plus is the price â€“ it is very reasonable for a central London hotel (I think we paid Â£89.99 a night). So would I go back? Maybe! Despite the dire state of our room and the slightly ropey staff I would consider staying here again just because of that fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Should do a lot better”
Reviews.Author: E C
Reviews.Content: No secure storage place in the bedroom, not even cupboards and drawers. Bathroom was grubby with watermarks over the ceiling and some mould on the tiling, no plug for the bath nor the washbasin. Reception staff seemed unconcerned when approached.Even though it is a good central location it should be a lot better than this for the money.Or does Travelodge think this is OK for a hundred pounds a night in a part of the hotel that has not been re-furbished? In future I'll pay a bit more if necessary and go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “been said before”
Reviews.Author: bertiebelfast
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel ,stayed for two nights .Our friends luck was in when they got room 155-just refurbished and very nice . Our room 405 was worn and dull and the corridor stank ( possibly the carpet needs cleaned or renewed ) this seems to be a problem on other floors but the room was fine , clean and adequate for the time spent there. We are in London after all!! As others say the staff are friendly and are let down by the building. I would stay again but now know to ask for a 'new' room and also extra pillows and towels. Other than these points if you get a good rate when booking the hotel realy is excellent value for London . I hope Travelodge continue with their refurb programme. Also worth noting there is a great selection of pubs ( good food) and tea/coffee shops all around and also a great corner shop across the street. It is very small but stocks anything you might need including beer / wine and the guys there are very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JoanneG29
Reviews.Content: Had been a bit worried before I stayed at this hotel after reading some of the reviews. Was actually pleasantly surprised. Rooms are small and basic but clean. Room was cleaned and we were given fresh towels every day. I asked for an iron on the first night and was able to keep this for the remainder of our 5 night stay. Could not fault the location ideal for covent garden and theatres. Oxford Street, Trafalgar Square all in walking distance. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor standard, booked 2 rooms, 2 different buildings !!”
Reviews.Author: NCarlton
Reviews.Content: I Booked 2 rooms on line at exactly the same time for a business trip. When we checked in one was in Drury Lane 3rd floor- and the other on the 9th floor in their second seperate building 150 yards away where you have to walk outside, across a very very busy road !!! at 5.00pm good job it was not raining heavy. This would have certainly been an real big serious problem and a major worry if it was a family booking and had booked a seperate room for children or family, or just needed to be close proximity to the kids for safety reasons. Uninterested staff, the TV only worked when it felt like it (on only a few channels), toilet seat hanging off, carpets stained, and smelt, curtains hooks hanging off, when they were open It overlooked a derilict building with broken windows, felt a bit like Beirut. The noise all night outside was dreadful so not worth the Â£80+ for the room. The directors of Travel Lodge should book in occasionally as a mystery guest to see what they actually subject there customers too.... No I bet they book into the Raddison around the corner. and just poke their heads around the door..... It was the most bland room I have stopped in for a very very long time. Luckily I was only there for one night. I will be voting with my feet (and wallet) next time and always give this one a miss in the future. It is worth paying the extra to stop somewhere else. I am really glad I had not booked in for a nice weekend break, I would have been hopping mad & really browned off..... Really poor standard, something you don't need after a stressfull day !!!! I am usually quite easy going and much prefer to give an honest positive review, as can be seen by previous reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Seen better days.”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleLad
Reviews.Content: On the ground floor everything looks fine but when leaving the lift for the rooms you are hit with a damp fusty smell and shabby paintwork. The corridor to the room was in partial darkness and had a mattress propped against the wall (which stay there for 3 days). Inside the bedroom the bedding and towels were clean but the room had seen better days and was in desperate need of a vacuum. The bathroom was little better, no plug in the sink and mould round the bath sealant. Woken at 6 every morning with the sound of empty bottles being picked up by the bin man, the inability to close the window meant you got the full sound effects. Possibly the poorest hotel in the Travelodge chain.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: ann108
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a disapointment from the moment I stepped out the lift. The smell! It smelt of wee and beer along the hall to my room on 4th floor. Room was clean so decided to stopped. After a night went back to room to find T.V didn't work the window let a draft in. The wind rattled through the window all night. Window was closed but it didn't stop noise or wind so not much sleep to be had here. Told staff when booked out hotel. They offered me a free breakfast and told me next time to ask for a room on the other side of hotel as that had been done up. Great just what I needed to hear after spending Â£99.90 for a room only. So save your money and book another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ok...but!”
Reviews.Author: ilovetravel552011
Reviews.Content: good enough price, great location, basic clean, wee hospitality tray with tea/coffee only, ok for price, hot ample shower, towels could have been whiter, stain free?, pillows good, duvet good with extra, so bedding ok & clean, but actual double bed soooo lumpy, uncomfortable, also my son said the pull out bed was useless, he'd rather have slept in the bath. we stayed for one night so it was ok, but dont think would have managed two. also too much noise from street below, night clubs or pubs even at 5am on a monday (yawn). i would maybe use it again for 1 night if it was cheap & i was desperate as its so near everything. but please Travelodge upgrade your beds as necessarry, thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Good & Basic”
Reviews.Author: Thehappybrummie
Reviews.Content: My partner & i stopped here for the one night this weekend (19/11/2011),for my birthday, we had booked to go to The Prince of Wales Theatre to see "Mamma Mia". We found the staff very helpful & the room although basic & like previous reviews only 1 bath towel & 1 small towel it was very clean and adequate for an overnight stay. Breakfast in the morning was really good, all that you can eat for Â£7.50 each, well worth it, plus being in the middle of theatre land it was easy to find our theatre. Iwould recommend this for anybody who just wants to stay for either a night or two, plus the view from our window on the ninth floor was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good location for theatre district and cheap!”
Reviews.Author: Newton_Tony
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights here while we were 'doing London'. Given the short time we actually spent in the hotel, it was great value and had everything we needed. Of note: Positive - the hotel reception staff were very friendly and helpful. Negative - I would say I am a green supporter, but only 1 towel in our room was a little too far!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Oswestrian720
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the previous reviews, I was really concerned about booking this hotel, particularly as I was also booking for 4 other people. I have to say that I was very pleasantly surprised. The location is fantastic & as we were seeing various shows during our stay, it meant that we could walk to all of them. The rooms are basic - if you want 4 star luxury, then pay 4 star prices! The whole hotel was spotlessly clean. The bed was extremely comfortable. We were all on the 5th Floor facing down to the river & every one of the group commented on how quiet the rooms were. I'm a very light sleeper & the slightest noise will wake me, but I have to say that I have never slept so well in any hotel I've ever visited. The service at reception was very good - we had a problem with the automated check-in system, but a very helpful young lady took me to reception & sorted everything out for me. Breakfast was good value, if a little busy at times, but the self service system worked well. I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a decent hotel at a decent price in a great location. I will be more than happy to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Linda J
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the negative reviews. Having booked prior to reading these I was clearly worried but I needn't have been. It was basic but after that is what travel lodge offers so no surprises there. The accommodation was very clean and comfortable with plenty of room. The bedding,bathroom, towels and decor were immaculate. Breakfast was also very good and plenty of it! If I needed to find one flaw it would be that we would have liked more pillows!

Reviews.Title: “very shoddy and dirty”
Reviews.Author: junkospud
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with work one night due the week. I was staying at the building along High Holborn in a family room. The room seemed cleaned when I entered but when entering the bathroom, there was mould on the tiles, hair in the plughole when I removed the plug and the shower was intermittent. The duvet was not on the double bed and therefore had to be made up with a sheet; the duvet itself was dirty and had some very dodgy stains on it which makes me think the people that stay in this hotel do not use the sheet to put over the duvet. Reception was ok, generally friendly. I wasnâ€™t expecting luxury but I was expecting cleanliness, I feel that is worth the Â£70+ that was paid for the room. I am now looking at hotels in London for weekend trips and will be definitely be more wary about Travelodge in the future. Iâ€™m sure some of their hotels are very nice but not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: mr-mrs123
Reviews.Content: Reception very nice, modern and clean not a reflection on our room what so ever! Holes in door, ceiling and window. Stains on ceiling and mould around bath. I would not reccomend anybody stays in this room again, really bad value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fab price”
Reviews.Author: reeree81
