Reviews.Content: Very pleasantly surprised with this hotel as we thought it might be a bit shabby because of the cheap price, we couldn't be more wrong.The location is great, very close to 2 tube stations, we walked to and from Leicester Square and Covent Garden.There is a dominoes take away next door and the hotel was very, very clean. The room was huge!! Will be booking again for next year

Reviews.Title: “Very centralk”
Reviews.Author: Lambchopski
Reviews.Content: The usual Travelodge,very very basic,but spotlessly clean.Below average breakfast,but beautifully situated for all the sights of Loindon.

Reviews.Title: “More like a prison”
Reviews.Author: Jafar60
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic. Everything else is dire. Outside London or Albania this would be a prison. Never pay more than Â£100.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute rubbish”
Reviews.Author: QQQ876
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in the Drury Lane half of the hotel. Unbelievably shabby, dirty, noisy and cold. Given the choice I would have left and gone elsewhere but didn't have time.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep tight? More like sleep light”
Reviews.Author: hisroyalgingerness
Reviews.Content: Very sad to say an awful visit to this property. I chose because of location and proximity to our offices, but I won't be staying again. The room had a boiler/water tank which made a loud noise every time you used anything in the bathroom, and would continue for some moments after. This piece of equipment also emitted a sewage smell and when I returned to the room in the evening the smell was still in the room. Awful. Had interrupted sleeps both nights at the property. My room was on an internal ground floor, near (I believe) a smokers pen and this attracted many late night conversations and laughs which disturbed. On one occasion someone on a floor above asked the noisy people to be quiet and was met with 20 mins worth of abuse, the like of which I've never really come across. Vile.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Bad nights sleep.”
Reviews.Author: deak75
Reviews.Content: Stayed in London for 2 nights on a budget so picked Travelodge as we've stayed in them before and it did the job previously. In this Travelodge though we found it impossible to get any rest during the night due to the seriously uncomfortable beds that were also extremely noisy if you changed sleeping position, which in a bed that's digging in your ribs constantly is alot. The pillows that resembled omelettes also didn't help with recharging the batteries after a full day of walking around London. I also didn't understand why you only get 1 towel for a double room, so you have to get another one from reception. Next time we will spend an extra Â£60 a night to stay in a better quality hotel because although we wanted to stay on a budget the Travelodge is only Â£50-Â£60 cheaper per night (we paid Â£100 p/n) than a 4* hotel situated 100 metres away. On the plus side the location is good and the room and hotel were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy_James_Sale
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to this hotel. Stayed Nov 11-14. We stayed on the 12th floor in the taller Holborn building. Its location, as many other reviewers have noted is ideal. Room was a very good size for a central London hotel but It lacked furniture, an armchair wouldn't go a miss. Room seemed clean, I didn't undertake the thorough inspection some feel is necessary but it seemed perfectly acceptable. Room was very warm and even on one of the higher floors it was still very noisy outside. It took me 3 attempts to get an extra pillow. After no joy with house keeping I spoke to reception. Response wasn't great, they suggested I return at 7pm, but then again this was probably to be expected in a budget hotel. I didn't take breakfast in the hotel, this is extra. We found many cafes a short walk away. Silvas does a very good cooked breakfast, just round the corner from the Shaftesbury Theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, noisy & cheap for London but beware no left luggage facility.”
Reviews.Author: Staffsmartin
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Drury Lane part which is a very noisy location but ideally situated for Covent Garden. The room was ok but basic and what you expect from a Travelodge. Ok for one night. Please be aware there is no left luggage facility which is unbelievable for a central London hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location - expect nothing else”
Reviews.Author: JoolsCI
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights based on the fact that we got a really fantastic rate for well located accommodation within 5 mins walking distance from Covent Garden and Holburn. Great location - you couldn't be more central if you tried. Room was apparently clean and very basic, as you would expect and as is advertised. We were lucky and had a room allocated in the new building, those that stayed in the old part (family and triple rooms beware) as these get far worse reviews. The downside is the sort of guests that the hotel seems to attract: First night there was a massive commotion in the bar area as a pair of guests who had had an unfortunate room experience made a huge (and West End-worthy) drunken scene. The screaming and shouting went on for a good twenty minutes or so in the reception and in the bar area until they found some security people to eject them. Most unpleasant. Each morning were were woken in the wee hours by loud, drunken guests looking for their rooms and two out of three mornings were woken early by guests thinking it perfectly appropriate to host mobile phone arguments outside others' bedroom doors. The staff on the other hand were as helpful as could be in what, I would lay odds, is a thankless and stressful job. Take this for what it is: Cheap, well located, and basic. If you want anything more then go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: luvfoodantravel
Reviews.Content: Cheap and cheerful in a fabulous location. We were lucky enough to have a quiet, clean room. No problems at all. Breakfast was adequate. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Much better value to be found elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: CFTG
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business account so payed around Â£90 for the room. I'm afraid to say that I would have been disappointed to pay anymore than Â£30 for the room. Whilst the central area is perfectly adequate for a budget, London hotel, the very fact that it was a "budget, London hotel" did not excuse the state of the annexe building my room was in. The annexe itself smacks of being the "overflow accommodation" with incredibly tired and dated decor, black scorch marks up all the walls above the electric heaters, ceiling tiles missing, revealed electrical wiring and a heavily stained carpet. The room itself was freezing, tired, very noisy, stank of stale smoke and had not been cleaned properly. There were red liquid stains on the surfaces, mugs and the bedding. The bed was clearly old, the mattress was similar to a hammack and the bathroom had seen better days. As I checked in rather late and was due to be up in a few hours time, I did not complain to the staff. Therefore it is unfair of me to comment on how they would have reacted. But quite simply, the room should not have been in that state in the first place. Travelodge has a long way to go before in can compete with Premier Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Janet W
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for three nights 11th to 13th November 2011. The reception area - a new addition since we had last stayed there is fine, but beyond that we were met with a disgusting smell of damp whch we had to walk through several times a day to get to our room. The paintwork is shabby and the carpets heavily stained. In our room on the front of the building, the windows don't seem to fit properly and the noise is dreadful. It felt like the windows were wide open to all the noise. We had two slim pillows and one towel for two adults. Also the remote for the tv was missing and there were two tea bags and two little tubs of milk. Several trips to reception rectified these problems.The staff, I have to say, were pleasant and obliging, but the overall experience was one we would not like to repeat. We will never again stay at a Travelodge and in future will explore other hotel chains. Definitely nothing like the tv advert.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: KATHLEEN D
Reviews.Content: My |Colleague and I stayed here for 5 nights (07/11/11 to 11/11/11) during and intense training course for our company, no cold water in the bathroom, ceilings stained and bowing, stayed on second floor and the smell was disgusting. Service incredibly bad and staff seemed so miserable and unhelpful. our Organisation must spend so much money using this hotel but there is no way I or my colleague would stay there again and I certainly wouldn't take my family there. One positive thing is that the gentleman greeting you for breakfast put a smile on your face and there was a very nice young man working behind the bar in the cafe who made you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Bev H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Covent Garden travelodge for one night only and never again. The reception and ground floor facilities are comfortable and lull you into a false sense of security with regard to what lies behind closed doors. Our room was on the second floor and as soon as we exited from the lift the smell of damp was evident. This became even more overwhelming when we opened the door to our room. There was black mould around the bath and the wall near the sink had been badly 'repaired' with filler where a tile has obviously fallen off. There were cups in the room to make a hot drink but unfortunately no kettle. After requesting a kettle it took staff 3 hours to find one and it arrived just as we were about to check out. I would never stay in this travelodge again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but average service”
Reviews.Author: Archie24
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in last two years as the location is fantastic. This time around, the service was not as great as on the previous visit. We didn't have towels in the bathroom on arrival, the room stank of smoke despite it being a on smoking hotel. There was no left luggage facility (we should have checked this before staying but it does make it difficult with an 11.30 check out and 3pm check in.) overall, ok for the price but we will probably pay more to stay somewhere nicer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, good value, very quiet, bit frayed at the edges”
Reviews.Author: MattBatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night in mid November. I rang in advance to request a quiet room. Despite the somewhat irksome system of having to go through a phone number with a list of options to contact the hotel only to find the hotel was engaged (numerous times) I finally spoke to someone who was very helpful and told me what room he would allocate for us and indeed that was the case. The room was very quiet for Central London. In fact we hardly heard a noise inside nor out. Check in was easily done via the self service machines and the late (12o'clock check out) was very handy. The room itself was large and clean, there was a bathroom with bath. All in all the hotel looks a bit shabby. The interior corridors in particular could do with a paint and make over but for less than Â£100 at short notice this was certainly a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: L_Fenton
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and comfortable, ideal for a short stay in London. Easy self service check in. Worth booking a breakfast as the food was very good at a sensible London price. If you're going to see a show this hotel is in the right place with all the west end theatres within walking distance. There's a car park right next to the hotel with reduced rates for guests. Have now stayed at this hotel 3 times which I wouldn't do if there were any issues.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Yeslin
Reviews.Content: Tired, ugly converted office block in great location. Not much else to add - bathroom old and dated, room pretty bad too, but paid Â£29 for a room in heart of Covent Garden so can't complain! Recommended if you know what you are letting yourself in fo - want somewhere to crash on the cheap in expensive central location then it's fine. If you want nice decor, home comforts etc then avoid. Simple really.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location !”
Reviews.Author: hanzdatdodishes
Reviews.Content: When you stay at a Travelodge you know what your getting , basic room that's seen a lot of traffic , which is the case here the hotel and rooms are a little tired and the bed coul have been used by an Olympic trampolinist to practice on . However I liked the self check in facility which was quick and easy and the location was unbeatable , 5 minute walk to covent garden and Leicester and if you don't mind a half hour walk you can pretty much get to any of the main tourist areas .

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location for the Lion King / Shrek etc”
Reviews.Author: abjem
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family during the half term break. The family room was on the 11th floor of the second building and was pretty much what we were expecting, there were tea and coffee facilities in the room along with a double bed & a sofa that became two singles when pulled apart. The sofa itself was quite tired and could do with replacing soon. The bathroom was clean, however it too looked like a face lift is overdue, lastly the curtains in the room could not be pulled together fully because they were falling apart. This was because the curtain rail needs lubricating and they have been pulled hard to try and close them. Check in was easy and quick (on the automated system) and check out was no more difficult or time consuming. Breakfast was a self serve full English and continental affair and was great value compared to the mean meals available for extrordianary ammounts everywhere else (it seemed) in London. I must admitt am not really a fan of the Travelodge brand but when I could book this for 3 adults & 1 child including breakfasts for all for a weekday night during the half term AND get change from Â£75 I couldn't resist! I booked this back in March and paid then, so for all of us to stay here and see the Lion King was well less than Â£200. We enjoyed our stay and if I got the same deal on another show we all wanted to see could be tempted to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “weekend away”
Reviews.Author: happy_to_be_on_hol
Reviews.Content: My husband and daughter joined me on a weekend to see Alan Carr at the O2 and had booked the Travelodge in Covent Garden as my daughter had stayed here herself, we booked into the one further down from the concrete block on Drury Lane. The checkin was quick and pleasant and we were given room 567 with an extra bed as our daughter is not bothered about her own room when we stay over for a couple of nights. The extra bed was a pull out bed from the sofa and additional bed linen was left in the shelving althoug we did have to ask for additional towels as they had only left enough for two whilst doing this my husband asked for additional pillow and teabags which were given without any fuss. The room was clean and had tea/coffee facility and a television. The bathroom although a little tired looking was clean with shower over bath. We had booked breakfast on both mornings and although the first day a sunday went smoothly the monday left me having to wait 15minutes for replenishment of the hot buffet breakfast another critacism was that you were handed cold plates with your cutlery, I always like to warm places when you are putting hot food on, there was plenty of choice. The staff were all very nice and when asked anything seemed more than happy to assist. Checking out was again very easy and the hotel is in a good location with about a ten minute walk to Covent Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad.....”
Reviews.Author: nicos
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on business. Its a typical Travelodge-type place. For the location it is really good value. Maybe I was just lucky and got a refurbished room in the right part of the hotel but it was clean, quiet and comfortable and I had no complaints. The hotel is split over two locations and I would say the Drury Lane section (where I stayed) appeared to be the quieter of the two sites. A colleague who was with me stayed here for a longer period which spanned a weekend, and he said it was quite busy and noisy on Frid and Sat nights but he still had a fairly restful stay. The breakfast was surprisingly good for a buffet type arrangement. Food was well topped up and the cooked beakfast stayed hot. Overall I would have to rate this as avearge to good for the price and the location. Only 5-10 minutes walk to Covent Garden anf Holborn tube.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldnt let my dog sleep here”
Reviews.Author: dm1313
Reviews.Content: Where do i start - location great... but thats where it ends - 1) Room stank of damp and .. something? 2) 1 towel left for 2 guests - if you wanted another towel you had to go to reception. But only after 6pm as thats when the night porter brings the towels.. so if you need out before then its shared towels only 3) Stained carpet - burn marks 4) Walls where so dirty someone had tried to wash them only smearing more dirt 5) Bathroom tap broken 6) Some sort of mould growing in the bathroom - would have needed Kim and Aggie round to send it away for samples 7) Tv remote - broken 8) Bedside lamp - smashed and broken 9) Window - broken.. didnt shut right. Gale force wind came through and street noise awful 10) Bed... springs coming through it... when i pulled back the sheets to inspect it... bed covered in urine, vomit stains and brown stains.. ill leave those to your imagination While if i got this hotel at a Â£19 saver rate i might have been ok with it - but given i forked out Â£100 a night... disgraceful. Pictures are attached - i was phycially sick when i pulled back the sheet of the bed. Enter at your own risk to this hotel! I have just written a large letter to travelodge customer service with all the photos i took. Will keep you posted on their response

Reviews.Title: “budget hotel and 5 star prices”
Reviews.Author: camster66
Reviews.Content: Review based on cost versus amenties and location. I have stayed in many,many hotels in london, including many 5 star and 4 star hotels, along with a lot of 3 star rated establishments. Whilst it has to be said dthat this place is RELATIVELY clean room wise, the lack of basic amenties such as an iron belie its pricing. Seemingly if you book in davance you may get a good deal but I paid over Â£150 for my room for 2 days. In comparison, you can get a much better hotel for the price. The bathroom was dirty and did not have any soap or shower lotions. the towels had holes in them. Location wise-excellent- but then again so its the waldorf and that could have been had for only Â£10 more. Restaurant- basic food, cooked ok at reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for weekend in London”
Reviews.Author: Paul106
Reviews.Content: Booked into the Travelodge for a weekend sightseeing trip to London. Prepaid for Breakfast and Evening meal when booking for ease. Found self-in machine easy to use, helpful staff were there if required. Our room was in a newly refurbished part of the hotel. The room was clean and equiped as you would expect for a travelodge, TV, Kettle, good size bed and a showeroom. Breakfast was an all you can eat buffet with a good selection of cereals, bread and cooked food. Evening meal was better than expected - only downside was very slow service. I think they only had one person in the kitchen who was cooking one meal at a time. Car parking is in a NCP car park down the road, people staying a travelode get 50% discount if you get your ticket stamped when checking out.(Â£18 for 24hrs) Overall an ideal place to stay if you are looking for a base while sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “not that bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: freeflung
Reviews.Content: Room was basic, but clean. Bed base was a bit stained but the actual matress was brand new and the sheets were clean and fresh. No sink plug or toiletries in the bathroom, but shower was nice and warm and towels of a decent size, not the tiny things you sometimes get in cheaper hotels. Breakfast was adequate and you can eat as much as you want. I'm quite fussy and prefer a Marriott - but this cost a quarter of the price, so what do you expect? It is fine if you just want a place to put your head after a night at the theatre - not so good if you want to spend any time in your room, but in the centre of London, why would you?

Reviews.Title: “Typical Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: Stevepj35
Reviews.Content: Booked for one night on business. Excellent location, basic room, over priced but clean and tidy. Bar service was very slow. I did eat in the hotel because it was convenient to do so however I wish I had gone out to eat because the food, although edible, is not good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: socy50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with my daughters (adults) had read some negative reviews and so was a little concerned, but had no need to be, we stayed on the Holburn site. Check in was smooth and quick, we arrived early and were immediately able to check in. We had arranged to meet a friend at the last minute and asked if she could stay in the room, they were very helpful, and asked if we had enough bedding in the room. The room itself was clean, average size, bathroom also clean and a decnet size. Plenty of tea and coffee in the room. When we arrived back late Saturday night we asked if we could have more pillows as there was only enough for one each in the room, these were brought to our room about 10 minutes later. Breakfast was good, the usual Travelodge selection, we had to wait a little while for the hot selection to be restocked but this was not a problem and not having a lot out at a time meant it was fresh and hot. The only slight hiccup was we had to clear a table as all empty ones had dirtly plates etc on, but there seemed to be only one girl clearing so don't know if they were short staffed and anyway it was not an issue for us. If i were to be really picky, there was no hairdryer in the room, but i am sure had i gone and asked for one, it would have been provided. Overall good hotel, great location for Covent Garden and the West End and at the end of the day it is a budget hotel so expectations cannot be too high, if you want a 4/5 star hotel and service then book one and pay 4/5 star prices. This does the job at an affordable price, would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great value for money - would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: cheeseontoast21
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend (two nights) at the Covent Garden Travelodge on Drury Lane and really could not fault it. First and foremost, the location is perfect. If you haven't been to Covent Garden before you most certainly should (it is my favourite place on earth!), and this hotel is just a side street away from the centre and Covent Garden market hall and the heart of theatreland. Check-in was easy (no queues whatsoever, despite the fact that we turned up just as check-in began at 3pm), alot of staff members around and always eager to help. The room was spotless, although basic, and the bathroom was small and very clean. We were on the fifth floor and did hear quite alot of sirens at night but it wasn't particularly noisy...what else can you expect from a capital city? Breakfast is an all-you-can-eat buffet and really sets you up for the day. Families will feel safe here and everything is catered for. Cannot rave about it enough. Book now! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the tight-fisted...”
Reviews.Author: groggery1
Reviews.Content: Yes, there is no doubt this is a grim, impersonal sort of hotel, from the automatic check-in to the industrial level carpeting, powdered eggs passing for scrambled at the breakfast table, or the weird arrangements of the doors to my room (more like the office block that I suspect it once was). But, given the location and the price, none of this surprised me. It is in a fantastic position if you want the West End, for the price of a decent meal there. I also found I had a spectacular view, on the 10th floor, and the room, whilst bereft of comforts, was reassuringly large. If you are planning anything romantic, forget it! This would kill the passions of all but the most ardent, and show you up as a cheapskate to the woman of your dreams. You won't spend any time at all in these rooms, except to sleep, so you tight-fisted miser, what on earth have you got to complain about?

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Very Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZanteDJ
Reviews.Content: OK let's be realistic, I know Travelodge is a budget brand of hotels but i do believe there are certain standards that should exist across the board no matter what 'star' rating a hotel has. I can't fault the location of the hotel for access to Covent Garden and the West End. Most of the staff i encountered were very helpful within the bounds of the authority they had, so if your looking for refunds or compensation regarding your stay like i am you will get told to deal with head office. All of the above considered there are some key points i feel i should make people aware of: 1. Mattresses are to thin and soft, no support. 2. Beds / Mattresses need to be secured in order to prevent them sliding away from the wall the bed is against. 3. Duvets have all the thickness of a piece of tissue paper and do not fill the duvet covers. 4. Pillows (of which there were only 3 in the room) have no support or thickness. The have all the comfort value of a 3 day old pancake. 5. Anyone checking in to Covent Garden and being assigned rooms 60 - 75 on the ground floor should be warned about the possible noise level that is frankly unacceptable. Both mornings i was woken by traffic / street noise and delivery lorries at 7am and things did not quieten down till the rush hours ended and for those that are wondering i am not a light sleeper. On the plus side the Lounge area quite comfortable and good to see free wifi at last rather that being forced to pay spectrum's Â£10 pounds daily charge as this is a rip off. In this day and age wifi is no longer a luxury! If your looking for a cheap way to stay in the centre of London then go for it, but with economy there is often a price to pay and on this occasion it with 2 bad nights sleep for me and i will be asking for a refund.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!!”
Reviews.Author: melanie s
Reviews.Content: We've just had an overnight stay at the Travelodge in Covent Garden, and what a horrible, dirty, disgusting place it is! Everything was broken, dirty, stained and hairy. Errr hair! The T.V had no signal, the lamps were broken , tiles in the bathroom cracked,stains on the ceiling and carpets,the sink was blocked. The worst hotel we've ever stayed in, it wasn't cheap at Â£110 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs! Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: ad-iff
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a 2 night shopping trip. I wanted to write a review as I can away from the hotel having been continually bitten throughout the night by "bed bugs!". My abdomen, back and legs were covered in bite marks, and the bed sheets were covered in blood spots from where I had been bitten throughout the night. I have never had this in a hotel, but despite complaining, nothing was done or offered to me, except to complain when I got home! I even received an email when I got home saying that there were no sign of any problems with the room, and that I must have been bitten on the train journey to London (there was blood on the bed sheet!). I would not stay here again and would not recommend it, particularly as the customer service afterwards was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Ros16
Reviews.Content: This isnt the best travelodge Ive stayed in, however the location is brilliant and it was fairly cheap. If you can afford it, I would look for something a little better. Our room was on first floor above the entrance and consequently all the smokers stood around near the metal ashtrays talking throughout the night. A castor was missing off the double bed so my head was lower than my feet!! On arrival the toilet bowl had someone else's urine around the top. The toilet was not cleaned during our stay of 2 nights. In general it was all a bit scruffy and grubby. Our friends' room was fine. If you want a brilliant location for reasonable price and dont much care about anything else this is the place to stay. I wouldnt say it was terrible or anything, just a bit disappointing. It was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but very clean”
Reviews.Author: bradley62
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are basic but very, very clean and we found the staff helpful and polite. Great location and if we have reason for a few days stay in London, we will def book in here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: adam186402
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for Theatre, pubs, bars, shops and tube. Hotel room was clean, bathroom was very clean, Bathroom was small but adequate. Quite noisy on a weekend night, lots of drunks seemed to be staying at the hotel over the weekend. Would recommend this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: abandrus
Reviews.Content: You know what to expect with a travelodge - its not the largest rooms but its a bed and bath. We arrived from Australia at 7am, we had booked an early check in of 12 noon but we decided to ask if they could do anything for us earlier - within 10 mins of arriving they had given us a room. We appreciated this as a shower and clean clothes are essential after 24 hrs flying! We didn't have breakfast here as we just went to a cafe over the road, meant we didn't have to keep to any particular time. There is a great Thai restaurant just over the road from the hotel too - well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: vicki_lomax
Reviews.Content: The main reason we booked here was for it's proximity to Covent Garden and the hotel didn't disappoint on that front. It's literally a 3 min walk from the Covent Garden underground station or 6 mins from leicester square station. Check in staff were polite and efficient. The room was small with minimal decoration and slightly shabby furnishings. It's definitely looking a little tired, but it was fine as a place to sleep for one night. The bar was busy and very reasonably priced (not bad considering it's in central London!), serving a range of "pub" food and all the usual drinks. If I'd paid the same amount to stay anywhere but central London, I'd be looking for a hell of a lot more for my money. But, when in the capital, you pay the premium.

Reviews.Title: “Will be considering other hotels next time”
Reviews.Author: Lyne64
Reviews.Content: Me and 2 friends stayed in a family room at Travelodge in Covent Garden, the Reception staff were lovely, but the room had only been set up for 2 people so we had to ask for an extra cup and towels. The plug in the sink got stuck so we had to brush our teeth in the bath, the quilts were shabby, there was no phone in the room, which when the window outside our room seemed to be community central about 5am in the morning seemed a bit unsafe... I slept on the sofa bed which was actually a sofa, it didn't pull out it was just remove the back cushion and hunker down - it was very comfortable though. We had to ask 2 or 3 times for an extra cup and coffee. Bit of a let down really as my friends got about 2 hours sleep due to the loud conversations outside the room window. Think I will be considering a different hotel next time - which is disappointing as I have stayed here before and it was lovely...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: ade1982
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Drury Lane Travelodge after looking for a well-placed hotel on a miserly budget. We easily achieved this, paying around Â£250 for 6 nights on the last week of August/first week of September bank holiday week. Having paid an extra Â£10 to arrive for early check-in, we were greeted with a large queue of people checking in, with relatively few staff to do so. There were also newly checked in people complaining about the quality of their room in the lower floors (which was like a basement, I believe) The reason why there seemed to be a lack of staff was because the keycard scanner had stopped working, and so required staff having to take people to their rooms and manually check them in. We are happy-go-lucky enough people and weren't particularly bothered by the fact that the room was tiny, and smelled damp, bearing in mind that the people checking out could have been there just 30 mins earlier. The room was freshly laundered, but was missing a kettle and tea making facilities, and we found the much discussed one towel for two people -easily rectified, but it meant the long queues and escort by a member of staff because of the keycard situation. We left the hotel to explore around 3pm and encountered a huge number of people trying to check-in. Very glad we paid the extra to get in early. Over the course of the week, we can only say that it served its purpose as somewhere to lay our head, as we were out as much as possible. Location is amazing - right on the corner of Covent Garden, 5 minute walk from either Covent Garden or Holborn Tube station, mini-Sainsburys around the corner (which also served ready-to-eat hot currys), and you could be in the hustle and bustle of the Piazza of Covent Garden in around 2-3 mins. The British Museum was also a short walk away to the North. We didn't sample the breakfast or the evening meal, as we preferred to do our own thing (like another reviewer, we can heartily recommend The Ideal Sandwich Bar on Parker Street), and there are a load of chain restaurants on the Kingsway where Holborn Tube is (such as Ask, Cafe Rouge, etc), but again were very popular and if the literature was to be believed, would set you up nicely for the day. What we would say is that there was a sound of breaking glass to wake us up every morning as the refuse lorries did their job, but everything was just fine ... clean and basic. Only towards the end of the week did the cleaning staff replenish the tea and coffee and TWO towels every morning. We also had to report a blown bulb on the final day as we were packing to leave - although someone came to see that there was indeed a problem and that a glass bulb had blown, leaving us (and the entire floor) in darkness, because someone reset the fuse in the meantime, no effort was made to clear the broken glass through the bathroom, and the chemicals in the halogen lights are also toxic. Not great when there are no extractors in the room (which also probably accounted for the dampness on our arrival) On the whole, budget alue for a good location, however if we were to stop for more than a night in London in future, we would choose ANYWHERE else and pay for the associated luxuries.

Reviews.Title: “So glad i didn't cancel!”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui P
Reviews.Content: As i had booked a theatre show for my boyfriends birthday i thought it would be nice to stay nearby overnight and make the most of our time in London and so i chose the Covent Garden Travelodge. It was only after i had booked this hotel that i read the reviews on tripadvisor, and i was absolutely mortified to read such bad reviews! I came very close to cancelling my booking but decided to take a chance and hope for the best. We arrived just after 3pm and were immediately approached by a lovely lady asking if she could help us, i gave her my booking reference number and asked her if we could have a newly refurbished room. She booked us in on the self service booking machine and it had allocated us an old room, so she went straight to the reception desk and told them we would like to change our room. The lady on reception checked but there were no rooms available in the other building so she made a telephone call then told us Room 911 was available in the Drury Lane Building and that it was a refurbished room... we were a little apprehensive when told the room number..911..but thought oh well, we can only but try.. so we got the lift to the 9th floor, the corridors and lift were bright and clean, and when we got to the room we were very pleasantly suprised and SO relieved! Ok it wasn't a huge room, but the double bed was ample, the sheets were clean, 6 coathangers, a little dressing table, mirror on wall next to TV, and the carpet wasn't stained or dirty as i had feared and no light fittings hanging off the wall anywhere! The bathroom was small but adequate, the toilet, sink and shower were lovely and clean almost like new with no mould in sight anywhere! Shower worked fine, although only one spotlight above sink was working out of the 2 but this was quite bright enough! We knew the windows wouldn't fully open due to safety reasons but it was enough to cool the room down which did get quite warm on this particular sunny October day! You could just see the London Eye in the distance if you looked to the left but the view didn't really bother us. As expected after reading reviews there was only 1 bath towel and 1 hand towel but we were lucky enough to see the cleaners in the hallway and so took an extra couple of towels from the trolley! I was a little dubious about the towel already in the bathroom as it had a dirty mark on it, i think this may have been overlooked as there is a sign telling guests to leave dirty towels in shower and i can only presume this may have been left on the handrail..? Anyway, we slept soundly, no noise from outside whatsoever, and no other noisy guests in the corridor, not even the sound of banging doors usually heard when other guests go down for breakfast! Talking of breakfast, we went down to a lovely clean restaurant and although it was 10.40am (it closed at 11) there was plenty of food available, croissants, muffins, cereal, fruit, the cooked breakfast was lovely and hot, and at no point were we rushed out, in fact it was 11.15am when we left the restaurant and there were still people in there eating! I would definitely stay at this Travelodge again and cannot believe there are so many bad reviews about it. The staff were all really lovely and friendly, we had a laugh and a joke with the girls on reception and even the cleaners we met in the corridors greeted us with a polite and friendly hello! Right in the heart of Theatreland and plenty of pubs, bars and restaurants nearby. Do not be put off of this hotel! Many thanks to the staff for making us so welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DevonPoppies
Reviews.Content: Having been regular Travelodge users over the years, we were disappointed with the standard of our room this time. We were in the old building on Drury Lane. The new building is better. The decor was shabby and tired, light fittings were broken, furniture was old and mismatched. The shower was broken and wouldn't stay in the fitting. There was no plug for the bath. It wasn't even good value for money. I think we have outgrown Travelodge - won't be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Just What you Need”
Reviews.Author: VisitorEastYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Just what you need if you want to be centrally located. No problems whatsoever,the room was clean and spacious, and the hotel itself was quiet considering how many people were staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: debbie G
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay in a travel lodge as I thought like Premier Inn they were consistant. You know what you are getting - basic but clean. Which is perfect for a busy city break. But upon my arrival I was given a room no bigger than a prison cell with one very dim spot light, broken furniture and wall light just hanging off the wall. I did get a different room with no hassle. This was bigger but very shabby and worn. The window did'nt close properly so was very noisy. Plug sockets hanging off the wall. Basin in bathroon so old it had brown stains on it. Broken fittings in bathroom just left. Cracked tiles and grouting non existant in places. Very poor reception on TV. Basically there had been no maintenance on rooms for years. But, I will say the bedding was clean and the location was good. But as a woman staying on her own the hotel has a very seedy feel about it and would not recommend it. Great for stag partys!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: suze_victoria
Reviews.Content: The location of this place is great, and it's even better when you think how cheap you can get it for if booked in advance. People who give this place bad reviews must have stayed at a different place! Yes it's not 5 star service and rooms, but you get what you pay for. Room nice size, clean, bathroom clean, had no problems. Fast check in even though it was busy. Breakfast was lovely! Great selection on and I found it to be as good if not better than other hotels' breakfasts that I paid a lot more for. Don't really have any complaints. If you're looking for a basic, no frills room, but in a fantastic location (close to stations, restaurants, theatres, nice shops) then this place is ideal!

Reviews.Title: “Very basic accommodation.....”
Reviews.Author: LynneHartlepool
Reviews.Content: First impressions of this hotel were not good. Glue sniffers on the steps as we arrived, then a very miserable receptionist who failed to look us in the eye, not a good start to our break in London! We were then advised that there was no facility to store our case, (we had arrived earlier than the 3p.m check-in) we could however pay Â£10 and check into our room - so it was ready!! We had to pay another Â£10 to keep the room after 12 on the day of leaving, which we had to do unless we wanted to trail our luggage around London. I have never known a hotel without a room to store luggage and this was not advertised. The room was very basic, which is obviously what we expected for the money we paid. We are certainly not hard to please but there were only two towels between us, the toilet roll holder was broken and the bed was dreadful, very soft with a dip in the middle - it had definitely been well used!! I did ask for an extra pillow but this never arrived. We were on the 6th floor and waited ages for the lift to arrive to take us down to reception, we would have been there all day had a member of staff not walked past and told us that the button to go down was not working and you had to press the up button!!!! I can't comment on the food because we didn't eat there however plenty of people were having breakfast and it looked fine. I am aware that we didn't pay much for this hotel but I still would have expected a better service. The whole place is in need of a serious make-over. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Last resort”
Reviews.Author: SimonLSpa
Reviews.Content: If you just need somewhere to sleep this travelodge is just about adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge hotel covent garden”
Reviews.Author: jill o
Reviews.Content: The advert on the television is very very misleading the rooms were tiny smelled of musty and damp the curtains wre ripped and we had no main lights. We were given 3 rooms in two days TO SAY THAT IT WAS CLEAN WOULD BE AN UNDER STATEMENT the bathroom was dirty had no plugs the taps were faulty and the shower did not work properly I would NOT recomend this hotel to anybody if staying in London.

Reviews.Title: “nothing like the TV advert!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bob60_11
Reviews.Content: Room 221 - keep out! Just awful, dirty, horrible, smelly corridors, filthy net curtains, windows dirty, cold even with the heater on, no shower gells, shampoos etc. Suggest you book a Premier Travel Inn / Holiday Inn Express instead, much, much nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Terrible Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Annie A
Reviews.Content: The room was small, smelled of must and had a big damp patch on the floor. Leak in the bathroom that smelled of Sewerage. Staff were not helpful and would not allow for a room change. We asked for late check out to 3pm and cleaning staff walked into room without knocking bang on 2pm. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “OMG”
Reviews.Author: JayneS24
Reviews.Content: Room was tatty, holes in the carpet, bathroom pop up plug was broken, hairdryer broken so two trips to reception with wet hair. The receptionist placed the faulty dryer for someone else to have. Breakfast was ok but there were no glasses for the juice, cutlery was not the cleanest and the crockery felt as if it wasn't washed properly, There was a line of people in reception all making complaints and I actually felt sorry for the staff. Good location though but really not worth the money they ask for it.

Reviews.Title: “We had a 'normal' Travelodge room but can see where others have problems”
Reviews.Author: Been_Aroond
Reviews.Content: We took a gamble on this Traveldoge after reading other reviews, but the cheap deal we got pushed us to stay. Basically our room was fine - on Drury Lane, third floor, facing towards the back. One side of the other block on Museum St is adjacent to a nightclub and taxi rank which I am sure would be noisy as mentioned elsewhere. Our block also overlooked Holburn High Road, and again I suspect this is noisy. There is no A/C in the rooms so you need to open the windows if it's hot, so noise would be an issue on these sides of the hotels. So to sum it up - it's a Travelodge on 2 sites, with good and bad rooms. Reception is busy at check in time, and when coach groups turn up - again pretty normal. The location is amazingly central to Covent Garden with loads of good bars, restaurants nearby. Walking around Covent Garden in the evening is great, and has plenty of civilised atmosphere. We'd go back as long as we didn't get the 2 'bad sides', not sure if I would want to stay more than a couple of nights, but as i have already said it's a Travelodge!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: nikki044044
Reviews.Content: Clean modern room , well equipped although no air con or phone. A fabulous location on Drury Lane, perfect for theatres and Covent Garden, Leicester Square, Trafalgar Square. For the price, in London, very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: irmaSA
Reviews.Content: Our room was nice and clean. We didn't have much of a view and the bathroom is tiny but the location makes up for all of that. Do not bargain on getting a hairdryer since you have to ask for it at reception and they were out both days I wanted one... But that is not something that will ruin your day since it's London and will probably rain when you walk outside :) London is an amazing city with so much to see, do and buy that you don't need anything more than a clean, comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Worry About The Bad Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Jadey678
Reviews.Content: After many hours of searching for a hotel, I recently booked the travelodge in Covent Garden as part of my boyfriend's birthday present to the theatre. After researching the 'theatrebreak' type packages, I decided to save money and worry and book with the Travelodge - it being a chain I could rely on (i hoped!) After reading reviews on this website I was very apprehensive about booking. However, I took the advice of many reviewers and phoned the hotel to ensure I could have a room on the Drury Lane side (i've read it has recently been refurbished). The staff were very helpful over the phone - although getting the phone number was a bit difficult, as on the website it only gives the customer service/booking line number and not the direct number for this particular hotel. Upon arrival, the hotel looked much better than i'd anticipated - it's a white building block, not the prettiest sight but it's resided alongside lovely London streets with shops and little cafes (great for breakfast if you like to have a lie in!) The hotel was perfect. Very clean, with a little bar. Our room was a double room and obviously very basic, with the essentials. We had a little window so it was quite hot, but all in all we were pleased. I had no issues with broken furniture or dirty bathrooms. Despite reading others experiences of sleepless nights and lots of noise, we slept soundly and comfortably. Only issue I could say I had was that one of the staff members (perhaps he was new) told me that the bar closed at 4am... when in actual fact, it closes at 1. I do feel sorry for the bar staff however, the poor people, who had to deal with many many drunken people that particular night! Overall i'd really recommend this hotel. I cannot comment on the Holborn sight, but Drury Lane was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Value Hotel in the heart of Theatreland”
Reviews.Author: Trooper37
Reviews.Content: Having used Travelodge hotels outside the Capital and been impressed with the standards, I thought I would give the Covent Garden Travelodge a go as I had a nightâ€™s stopover prior to using the â€œEurostarâ€�, but had been a little concerned by some of the very negative reviews. I was pleasantly surprised however, be aware the exterior steps might be difficult for some older travellers Check in for online bookings are automated and so easy and quick, just have your booking confirmation number to hand and follow the screen instructions and it prints out everything you need and your key card. The room was in the older un-refurbished part of the hotel it was a good size clean and the en-suite was spotless, a request for an additional pillow was dealt with promptly, Yes, the corridors are a little worn and tired but given the volume of guests this hotel has its hardly surprising, my room was fine. For me the bed was far too soft and a bit of a wallow and was not the best nights sleep which marked it down for me, but for some people Iâ€™m sure its fine. Breakfast was a little frantic but had a good choice and quality. I stayed there again within five days on my way back through London this time in the newly refurbished part which was less tired as might be expected, equally clean room and bathroom, bed was better and firmer I also ate at the downstairs bar which was good value and good food. This is idea for a single nightâ€™s stopover or a couple of days short break. Overall, good value, clean with pleasant staff, centrally located for theatre land and the attractions near Covent Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, but good location and price if you get advance deals”
Reviews.Author: DJ_Billy
Reviews.Content: The location is great, close to Covent Garden, theatres and Russell Square. Although the room was an unusual shape the amenities were typical Traveldoge: basic but clean. The price I paid seemed very steep for such basic facilities, even in Central London, but much better deals are available for certain dates if you book far enough in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Rooms - no interest in customer service”
Reviews.Author: DevonCustomer
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. First in room 666(!), only ventilation a window on a short chain. Not a hot day - room unbelievably hot overnight. Changed room for second night - temperature OK. Both nights / rooms not enough towels or mugs etc. Childrens beds not made. Complained to hotel & head office - explanation as we had booked in early (and paid extra) we had not been given scheduled room. Nothing in compensation. Will never stay in Travelodge again !

Reviews.Title: “superb position”
Reviews.Author: myederts2
Reviews.Content: We were amazingly lucky to get 2 consectutive saver rooms and what excellent value it was. The hotel is in a superb place to get to everything especially theatres. We were given a room on the 6th floor with 3 huge picture windows so you could look over the 'roof' of London. We got on-the-day tickets for good shows at a fraction of the price. OK. so the corridors were a bit drab and a lick of paint might help, but everything worked. It was noisy outside but what do you expect in the middle of a capital city? We were delighted with the room and if we wanted an extra towel or pillow we only had to ask and the staff were very obliging. For what we paid it was outstanding value and I will be booking again.

Reviews.Title: “Soul Crew on Tour!”
Reviews.Author: MissDolly1266
Reviews.Content: We booked the Travelodge due to the location. Six adults going to see Jeresy Boys and then onto the 100 club in Oxford Street. It was situated between both events so didn't need a taxis to either venue. I do find Travelodges very standard and the beds are quite hard, but normally the cost reflect this. We had one large and one small towel in the bathroom, so we had share. No hairdryer. There was a kettle and tea and coffee so that was a bonus. We were situated by the main door to the block so the door slammed everytime someone came through it. So we have some broken sleep - so check your room when checking in. There was a full lenght mirror in the bedroom, but this must be broken in the past as there was just a piece of wood stuck to the wall. Not very good when you are trying to getting ready for a night out. We didn't have breakfast and had late check out instead, which is ideal if you are having a late night. I do think we could found something better for the price we paid, but we could not fault the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonnty
Reviews.Content: This has an amazing location however due to the location it is extremely noisy. Despite the windows being firmly shut and being on the 10th floor any external noise could be heard. This was reported however nothing was done. I stayed at this hotel the previous week and the keycard system also failed therefore creating long queues in reception as nobody could get into their room.

Reviews.Title: “Â£40 in Central London? Yes please!”
Reviews.Author: cheesemason
Reviews.Content: You dont get better value in central London than this. Hotel is well situated within walking distance of the West End and many tourist attractions, as well as a couple of Tube stations. Our room looked as if it had been refurbished within the last few years and was clean and functional. Only loses a mark as it was pretty noisy with the window open, but then this is central London so you can get that in most places. But getting a hotel room less than Â£100 a night in London is very tricky, so a decent hotel for half that amount is a real bargain

Reviews.Title: “Very good - In the new part!”
Reviews.Author: DollyGill
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before and stayed in the old part of the hotel, but only paid Â£10 so couldn't really complain. Just stayed again and managed to get the newer building - these are the "usual" Travelodge rooms. Again, we only paid Â£30 for the room, so was what we paid for. The location is excellent. Short walk onto Covent Garden and so close to tube. Â£10 extra for early check in. Cannot store bags on day of departure, so had to take to St Pancras and pay Â£8.50 for luggage storage. With the price we paid for the hotel, still worked out chepaer for us to do this. You get what you pay for, stayed in some really nice hotels hotels in London, but paid for them! Will def stay here again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Peak District National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Central and Clean!!”
Reviews.Author: vjcc80
Reviews.Content: The girls and I have an annual trip to London with the girls, we go to the theatre and go shopping. In the past we stay 4* but we found a bargin at the travelodge and due to Location we decided to book this. No regrets, main perk is the location, literally 2 mins walk from Covent Garden. The room is a double bed and a sofa bed. Clean and comfortable. En suite with a hot power shower. Towels are provided and a bar of soap. There is a kettle and some tea/coffee/milk/sugar. Mugs are provided. Check in is 2pm but you can pay Â£10 to check in early. You book as room only but you can buy breakfast at The Travelodge. We didnt and went to a fancy restaurant for a full english breakfast with drinks less than Â£10. The only down side is that when you checkout they dont let you store luggage there. This wasnt a problem as we already knew and we took it to St Pancras left luggage. Â£8.50 per bag. Great time, good nights sleep. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “poor room but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: footbalkid
Reviews.Content: We chose this travelodge for it's excellent location, 5 minute walk to 2 tube stations. We were put in a room in the Drury Lane part of hotel, very disappointed. The room was a floor below ground level, a tiny window in the room and all we could see were what looked like ventilation pipes. Couldnt see what kind of day it was so had to go upstairs before deciding what clothes to wear. Room was cleaned every day but bedding wasn't changed the whole 5 days we were there. Light in bathroom didn't work, reported it on the Tuesday, still wasn;t fixed by the time we left on the Friday. Staff was all very helpful, which was a good thing considering everyday our room key card was wiped due to being in pocket next to mobile or chip and pin bank card, which can desensitive the card.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price for london”
Reviews.Author: princessbadger
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the refurbished block across the road from reception. Room was basic but clean. Great location. All staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “sneaky Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: scotsmember
Reviews.Content: first impression - disgusting, old, smelly, poorly maintained rooms! next day i asked if all rooms were of same standard so they offered to move us. Seemed like totally different hotel! everything brand new and experience was good. remember to ask for refurbed rooms. I feel sorry for people who just accept the old rooms and don't realise what they can get!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: stapley
Reviews.Content: Perfect as long as you are in the new part. Excellent location. Very clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for location and keeping overheads low, but little else”
Reviews.Author: glevum777
Reviews.Content: I first stayed in this hotel in April 2010. I returned in October 2011 to stay for two nights, and was surprised to see that the place had been given a complete overhaul, only on this occasion I do not think for the better. Rather than the subdued lighting of before, now the main lobby is one large open space, with lighting that is garrulous and too bright, no sense of intimacy or privacy, and a roaring television drowning everything out. Food is not served until 5 pm but they will sell you overpriced beer from noon. Worst of all, they still enforce the 3pm check-in policy and attempt to charge a Â£10 fee to anybody who wishes to check in earlier, irrespective of whether the room is already made up or not. To add to that, WIFI is only free downstairs where there are few powerpoints to plug in, and a charge of Â£5 for 1 hour and Â£10 for all day is levied if you want to use WIFI in your room. This is increasingly an anomaly in the twenty-first century of hotel service. The staff are friendly but slow and clumsy, and it takes three of them to book us a taxi on the morning of departure. Furthermore, no tourist maps of London are available: this is the first time I have encountered the lack of such a service in a hotel anywhere. The rooms are now clinical and minimalist in decor but not design. There is little storage space for clothes, no air conditioning, and the brick effect in the bathroom is truly garrulous. The lifts are slow too - there are only two of them, and they are congested by staff using them as a service lift. On 50% of the occasions when I called a lift, it was clogged up with iron cages full of bedding and apologetic but uncompromising staff determined to make it down to the laundry as soon as possible. So far this review sounds very negative, which it is. However, there are some good points to this hotel. Its location is excellent for tourism, business and/or leisure in central London, it's a great place from which to explore Covent Garden, Soho and Theatreland, and it's hard to beat the price. It's the kind of place to stay in when you are going to be out all day and simply need a functional place to sleep for the night. That in itself is a reason worth staying there, but be aware of what you are paying for, and getting.

Reviews.Title: “tired and dated”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller606
Reviews.Content: on arrival chaos at reception,computer failures.Charged extra Â£10 for arriving early even though couldn't get in room as couldn't they produce room secuirty cards. Room dated,bed linen stained,wall paper pealing,hot tap broken,chair in room dirty and heavily stained.Overall appearance tired and dated.I've stopped in much better budget hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: jylSussex
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews, I realised there has been a mixed response. Our experience was similar - there are some good and some bad points to this hotel. Many describe this as a budget hotel - we paid Â£113 for one night, and I do not class that price (even in London ) as 'budget'. I was expecting something basic but not quite as basic as we got. The check-in using touch screens was efficient and, if you experience problems, there were plenty of pleasant, helpful staff on hand to help you. There were long waits for the lifts on some occasions, as there were only 2 lifts for our section of the hotel. I too noticed a strange smell around the lift area. The room was fine, I had no objetions to the size or layout, though was surprised there is no basic air-conditioning for a newish hotel in the centre of London - so beware if staying there when it is hot (OK - I know that is rare!). The shower room, though small (only room for 1 person at a time) again was fine and what I was expecting. What I do object to, though, for the price we paid, was that we only had 1 bath towel and 1 hand towel between 2 people - surely they can run to one of each for each person? Also, there was just one samll bar of soap. Again, for the price we paid, I would expect some shower gel / shampoo - standard elsewhere and therefore we had not packed any. Otherwise, everything worked, the room was clean,breakfast was ample, the bar is open when everywhere else seems to have stopped serving, and the location on Drury Lane is brilliant for theatreland, Covent Garden etc. Will I use it again - for the location yes, but not for that price, unless they can provide towels for each guest and shower gel / shampoo.

Reviews.Title: “convenient but NEVER go there!!!”
Reviews.Author: salsihash
Reviews.Content: When we 1st entered the hotel the desk was busy so we went to the self service booking in machine. This was very easy and simple to use. Definitely the highlight of the hotel! To the left of it is an entrance to one part of the hotel. We were impressed. It smelt nice had a lovely comforting feeling about it.The lift also gave the same effect. However this is where the compliments end. We realised our room was not in this part of the hotel. Ours was in the other half - the non updated side. We should have realised when the lift for this half had a dated feel about it stripped floor and dark. It said it all when we stepped off the lift to find a road sign in the hall - which remained their the whole trip!!!!! The hall was dark ugly and had stains on the ceiling and walls. Things got worse Our room was stiflingly hot. dark dingy. The main table had only 2 legs it was propped against the wall and so everything slid toward the wall. The light fitting nearest the bathroom had no cover. Stains on the wall Leak stains on the ceiling The slightest movement on the bed caused the loudest noises. Not good on a romantic night away! It was so uncomfortable we could not sleep at all. The pillows were awful. Since we were there through the unusual heat of late September it was boiling in the room the entire room. The board on the back of the toilet looked as though it was going to come off. The sink was cracked. Shower was not high enough for my partner who is over 6ft. Stains in the bath. The door was so stiff to open we didn't like to shut it so had to keep it pushed too whilst in it. We wern't planning on using the food areas as we found in our one and only other TravelLodge experience in Edinburgh how rubbish and overpriced the TravelLodge food was. Basically NEVER go to a Travel Lodge! You will be dissapointed!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Liz P
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night (2 rooms) for my daughter's "hen weekend". The rooms were ready for our early check-in (which we did easily on the touch-screen facility so avoided the queue) and were basic, but clean although maybe looking a little tired in places. Considering the location, it was surprisingly quiet and we had a reasonable night's sleep. The biggest plus point of this Travelodge is its location - a short walk from a range of visitor attractions, theatres, etc, so no need to spend a fortune on taxis or public transport. We will definitely use it again for our next trip to the West End.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money in London”
Reviews.Author: Primowino
Reviews.Content: For the price it is hard to beat, it was spotlessly clean, beds very comfy beds and pillows and good thick curtains to block out the light. OK its basic, the furniture looks like student halls furniture, there is an open set of shelves and wardrobe, but it served its purpose. I had read in advance that there were no toiletries provided so I took my own, so was able to have a nice (small) bath. I was on the 9th floor so had my windows open until late, but not all night at there was a lot of street noise, but that's the London problem not the Hotel. I did not have breakfast, but there was tea and coffee making facilities in the room which I did use. Bargain hotel when all the others in this price get bad reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel without extras”
Reviews.Author: PatrikPatrikPatrik
Reviews.Content: Travelodge is conveniently located in Covent Garden close to the shopping area. It also has quite good connections with buses and several tube stations are nearby. We stayed in the older building in a double room and enjoyed our five night stay. The room was big enough with just the necessities and nothing extra: bathroom, towels, a big enough bed, a desk and a few clothes hangers. No place to put your luggage except the floor, and no room for unpacking your clothes. The breakfast also includes just the basics: toast, scrambled eggs, bacon and cereals with coffee and juices. The hotel was clean and staff was friendly. If you get distracted easily by noise from pubs across the street of the clanking elevator you might want to reconsider, but neither of these troubled us at all. All in all, nothing to complain about, but no big praises either. If you only need the basics this is a very good choise.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge Covent Garden”
Reviews.Author: WaddoLeicesterUK
Reviews.Content: Our trip was an overnight so all we required was a place convenient to the the West End of London. Travelodge was it. It's basic but clean accommodation at a reasonable price. However, we were unfortunate to find ourselves in a room on the 6th floor facing the street. We returned from the theatre and retired to our room at about 11.30am. The noise outside was considerable with traffic and party-goers. It went on until around 5am. Breakfast was adequate with fruit jiuce, cereal, fruit and the usual english breakfast of scrambled eggs, bacon sausage, tea and coffee etc; The worst thing about the place was an obnoxious smell from the lobby to the lifts.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but nothing else”
Reviews.Author: TJNDP
Reviews.Content: This Travelodge is in a great location on Drury Lane, but from the moment I checked in it was one of the worst stays I've had in a hotel. The staff were just not interested in dealing with the guests, the room (115) was very poor, the bathroom had a missing ceiling tile and was in need of cleaning to remove mould. The main lights didn't work and one of the bedside lamps burnt the lampshade if you left it on for more than 5 minutes. I asked to a room change, but no help from staff. Never again, regardless of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: mariets
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and I have no complaints at all. The staff were very pleasant, the room was basic but spotlessly clean and the location is excellent. people who complain about little things like small rooms and no face cloths should remeber that this is a budget hotel, not the Savoy, and is great value for money,.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: rhutchinson
Reviews.Content: I was really concerned before arriving in this hotel. The other reviews were damning to say the least. We were however pleasantly surprised. The twin room was basic but we weren't paying for luxury. There was ample tea and coffee, the room was clean and well maintained and the TV worked - and that's not always the case in hotels twice this price. The beds were comfortable and the room temperature was fine. We only had one bathtowel but could have had a second one if we had asked. The location was central for everything we wanted to do. Not the place for a romantic weekend but as a base for a short visit to London this would be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Budget minder's best choice”
Reviews.Author: Big_Blue_Boy_21
Reviews.Content: So it's a Travelodge, meaning it's most attractive feature is the price - and for downtown London, the price was very attractive indeed. As for the hotel, there are parts that are good and not so good. The good parts: linen and towels were clean, bed was comfortable, staff was friendly and efficient, breakfast was pretty alright (combination of a limited selection of hot and cold foods) and all-you-can-eat, meaning you can pack in 1000 calories before 10:00am, which keeps you fueled for the day. A budgeter's dream come true. Good locks on the doors but no safe in the room. And location, location, location: 5 minute walk to Holden tube-stop, a Sainsbury local is a block away and Costa Coffee is a block north away. The bad parts: the carpet in the room was filthy, the bathroom's sink and tub drains were clogged with heaven knows what, there was black mold in the shower. Spartan furnishings (no drawers), no face-clothes (suppose we could have asked for them, but really?) and the one ironing board available has to be hauled up by yourself from reception area. We stayed in what is advertised as a 'family room' and had a good chuckle at what was being passed off as a pull-out bed - it was a rock hard pad stuffed under the room's sofa! Common areas were, er, 'well used' - ick much? The final verdict: you are not going to get better for less in London and our stay for three nights was more than pretty okay. Slept well, fed well and paid reasonably - what more can you expect? Break-open your piggy banks if you want something nicer or prettier; the Travelodge is for folks who want a safe place to crash while sight-seeing and spend their money on activities instead.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Covent Garden”
Reviews.Author: JBCURRIE
Reviews.Content: The location is very good..well for convenience to Covent Garden and Theatres. Location is terrible if you are in the Other Building on Holborn from the point of view that one of London's busier nightclubs is just behind the Hotel. I think it was The Den or Pitch Black. Anyway the revellers start coming out from 3 am to 6 am in the morning and stand outside your window shouting and loudly laughing. A great nuisance if you are hotel guest or having agreat time if you are reveller. Looked like a London Riot forming on the street below next to mincab office. It seems they hang around till 6.00 am when the tubes start so they can go home. Who does this on a Monday evening ?? Please do not accept a room in this part of the hotel at any cost if you value sleep. Also if you do dont bother callin police as the sight of 30 people on a street corner shouting at 5 in tyhe morning is not an incident according to the Metropolitan Police. That could explain why they did not recognise rioters in August as they thought they were nightclub revelers having a good time. Oh nearly forgot. If there is no soap in your room and you rare standing there with only a towel just get dressed and go down to reception and get some. Room service will ignore you completely explaining how there are only two people on duty and they cant possibly do anything for you. Not a hotel in my book

Reviews.Title: “We had a good experience”
Reviews.Author: OzzyGirlWiltshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed in numerous Travelodges and this was one of the better ones - friendly staff and couldn't really fault our room. Basic (as they always are), but clean and you get tea and coffee making facilities, which even some five star hotels don't provide!! Bed was also nice and firm - have slept on some dreadfully saggy ones in the past! Nice and quiet and an excellent location. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, recommended”
Reviews.Author: Jakesmum
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend with friends. As we all booked separately we all had different rooms/floors, etc so we sampled the first and fifth floors in the Drury Lane building and three other floors in the Holburn building - a good cross section, I am sure! (As others have said, there are two separate buildings to this Travelodge - just across the road from each other). All rooms were clean, well presented, and exactly what we expected from Travelodge - no less, no more. I was on the first floor of the Drury Lane building. My room had a comfy bed, a small desk/table and chair, tv on the wall, and an open wardrobe with 6 hangers and a shelf. The shower room was modern and clean. The room faced the back so no noise issues at all. We booked breakfast, which we felt was good value, with a good selection of hot and cold food - again, nothing spectacular (you are not going to get that for the price), but good honest food and plenty of it. As mentioned by others, the location is second to none - really easy to get about London from here and well worth exploring Covent Garden. Yes, there were a few niggles which is why this place gets 4 stars not 5. For example, there is no shelf of any kind in the shower so you have to put shampoo etc on the floor, also nothing is provided to put your suitcase on in the room, so again it has to go on the floor. Extra towels can be quite hard to come by (although did turn up eventually). Also some of the staff did not seem to know what they were doing (although they were nice and friendly, just did not seem to know the systems - probably new members of staff - so we got told one thing by one member of staff, then something else from someone else).. These are minor issues however, and we felt for the money this place is well worth staying in, and we will be back - we are in fact planning another trip here for Xmas shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Fair price for location”
Reviews.Author: drp38
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Covent Garden Travel lodge. An excellent location for gettng around the city with 2 tube stations within 5 mins stroll. The room was clean and a decent size ( compared to some broom cupbaords London hotels call bedrooms) The choice of food was basic but more than adequate. Friendly and helpful staff. My only issue (and not the fault of the hotel ) was that we found it noisy from the street as our room was next to Drury lane. Traffic beeping horns and the pub on the corner (despite triple glazing) managed to disturb my sleep :-( Having said that I wold stay there again as I felt the price charged was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: cbhawkes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night. The following day I came up with what I thought was a rash on all over my body. It was very red and itchy. I went to an NHS walk-in centre who diagnosed bed bug bites. I complained to the hotel who said they would complete a full investigation. They contacted me three days later stating there was no evidence of bedbugs. This investigation did not include taking any details from me. All they know is what room I slept in and that I have bites. In total I have 354 bites on my body. I know that they were from that room as prior to that I slept at home and my partner has no bites. The bites came up before I went to bed the next night. I have had no bites since. Travelodge don't know this information as their investigation did not involve taking a full history from me. Three weeks later the bites are still visible and Travelodge state there are no bedbugs and the matter is closed. Meanwhile the bedbugs remain for someone else to be bitten.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat it for Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: CeliaDevon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with a friend while we did the "Tourist Thing" - visiting Buckingham Palace, Museums, shows etc. This hotel is so handy for so many attractions and especially the theatres. If you are reasonably fit you can walk to most things although the bus and tube service is excellent and very frequent. We booked well in advance so got the room at a very cheap rate which always pleases. We were in the High Holborn building on the second floor. Yes there was traffic noise and some noise from people coming and going at the entrance below but you are right in the centre of London - what can you expect. However, even with the windows open we slept Ok and it is very entertaining watching the brave cyclists weave in and out of the traffic - heart stopping sometimes! The convenience of the location far outweighs any noise irritations. The room was very well presented with lovely white bedding. We didn't hear anything from any neighbouring guests. The staff at the Reception were very cheerful and helpful. Altogether a very enjoyable stay - I cannot knock it for value and convenience. There is a very good little cafe opposite the Drury Lane Travelodge entrance (on the corner of Stukeley St) which we used for breakfast every day. The staff were very friendly and the food was good quality and value. It set us up for the day. I will certainly be booking again as I can't see how I could get a better value hotel in such a position for seeing the sights of London.

Reviews.Title: “Central to attractions - good if booked early”
Reviews.Author: vodkawitch
Reviews.Content: Covent Garden Travelodge is ideal for visiting theatres, china town, London eye etc no more than 15 mins walk to Embankment. The hotel itself is excellent value if you book early, I booked 5 months in advance and got Thursday 1 st september 2011 twin room for Â£29.00. I did pay an extra Â£10 to book in early as the 3 pm standard book in was a little late in the day for making the most of a short visit to london.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for theatre goers”
Reviews.Author: SussexJudith
Reviews.Content: There are 2 Travelodge for Covent Garden.
