If you have a double room you will probably be booked into Drury Lane and if a family room is booked you will probably be booked into High Holborn which is a couple of hundred yards away. Both are very good Travelodges, I have stayed in both many times. The one in Drury Lane has had major refurbishment over the past 18 months and is now very good. The reception staff are very helpful and the breakfasts good especially if you book in with children as they eat for free. A kettle,2 mugs, tea,coffee and milk are in the room and are topped up each day. They dont have wardrobes so if you are staying fr more than 1 night take some extra clothes hangers with you. If you are traveling from Victoria get the 8 or 38 bus to High Holborn and a the bus stop is just a couple of minutes walk away. If you are on a budget there are a couple of Wetherspoons close by. The Wetherspoons at 1 Poultry Lane is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “No major problems.”
Reviews.Author: mikeromeozeroone
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated just about a five minute walk from Covent Garden plazza. And well within walking distance for all the major attractions in the city. We used it as a base for a couple of shows and had no problems at all. Guests cannot book in until 1500 but even though there was a sizeable queue there is an automated process that simplified the procedure tremendously. Room was not shabby and some of the public areas looked and smelled like a new carpet had been recently fitted. The only issue was the traffic noise which was mentioned during the booking process. The issue that was not mentioned and something the premises has no control over were people downstairs in the road arguing at daft o'clock late night/early morning. The breakfast was okay, although the orange juice needed less water and there no fried eggs at breakfast, just scrambled and I prefer mine less hard and bouncy. All in all I would go again as it was a good deal cheaper than premises we have stayed at not too far away.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing sixties hotel”
Reviews.Author: bossywoman
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights last weekend and found it shabby, run down and generally unpleasant. The only good thing about it is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly OK budget hotel convenient for theatre district”
Reviews.Author: buckfast39
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in September. Location is fine though on very busy road.Two buildings on either side of road. 10 minutes stroll to Holborn subway station. Rooms were large & clean though suffer heavy useage. Reception was welcoming & helpful Restaurant is basic but adequate. All 3 elevators were operating in our building 2. There are no toiletries so bring your own. There is kettle & tea/coffee in room. Traffic and human noise in street was quite bad up to 0130 and after 0630. There are vending machines on ground floor. Taxis plentiful in street. If you on budget and can't afford better then go.You will get value for money. Security in hotel is good.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: rosie503717
Reviews.Content: Had 2 nights at this Travelodge , Nice room very clean and very comfortable, Had 2 nights with breakfast and evening meals for the stay for 2 of us. It was cheap booking it well in advance. The only complaint we had was at 2.15 am on the Monday morning we were woken up with the fire alarm going of and flashing in our room. after grabbing our shoes and purse and hurrying down the stairs guy at reception said "false alarm" ( thank goodness ) then told us one of the guests had just came in drunk and smashed the glass on receptions fire alarm. I asked if they had been evicted from the hotel for this and upseting every ones sleep,they said no i asked did they have them on cctv only to be told the cctv does not work at this hotel, we had legs like jelly and could not sleep for hours after this as we had woken up with such a fright,

Reviews.Title: “Typical Central London hotel, run down and dirty”
Reviews.Author: GordyMac
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business meeting at the start of September and was unimpressed with the condition of the hotel. Like many brand hotels in central london it was expensive and poorly maintained. Check in was quick but completely robotic, lady didn't bother to make any eye contact or conversation. The bar area and restaurant appear to have had some money spent on it recently, sadly this investment stops when you go to the corridors and rooms! The bedroom was very spacious for London but was really tired. A mattress that musn't have been replaced in 15 years was only covered in a single sheet, no mattress protector to be seen. The bathroom was just about clean, it had about 6 different types of tiles where repairs had been carried out over the years and mouldy ceiling panels above the bath. Despite all that was wrong the location was great and as i was out all evening and away again early the next day so didn't need to see the room for very long! Breakfast was very good!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a central reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: amgv
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what you would expect from a Travelodge. Some parts a bit tatty but clean and comfortable rooms. Breakfast offered here which is great value.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better London travelodges!”
Reviews.Author: PatsyBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Managed to get a very cheap deal here (for a Sunday night). Having had two nightmare experences at Travelodges in Kings Cross, was a bit worried about this booking, despite the cheap rate. However, this Travelodge was quite acceptable (especially given the price). The staff all seemed to be native English speakers (quite unusual for a London Travelodge!), the room was clean and nowhere near as delapidated as the others and the tv worked. The hotel, in High Holbourn, is in a very good position. However, I still think the 'sofabeds' provided in the family rooms are not really fit for purpose and not very comfortable. However, I might now consider using a Travelodge again when I am in London (just not the ones in Kings Cross)!

Reviews.Title: “reliable and brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Kazi87
Reviews.Content: I always stay here when I come to London now. The location is amazing, a short stroll from covent garden, the tube and much of central London. The price for the location is pretty reasonable (about Â£69 a room on a sunday and Â£89 on a friday) The rooms are always clean, and for central London not too bad in terms of space - I've stayed here about 5 times and I have had a range of rooms, some nicer than others, but all clean and quiet. Never really hear noise from other rooms, all rooms with a small but sufficient bathroom. There are lots of nicer hotels in London, and I have stayed in a few on business - but the price and location make this my 'go to' London hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location but could do with updating”
Reviews.Author: Shineydancer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located and but could do with an updated of the furnishing and decor. However sheets clean towels clean bed quite comfy. Friendly staff, nice bar area. A great place to stay in central London but don't forget your shampoo or you will need to pay Â£2 to get some from vending machine.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but just too pricey for hostel style.”
Reviews.Author: skimanic007
Reviews.Content: Honestly, you can't beat the location however I know you can beat the quality for similarly located London hotels which are also better prices. Half this hotel appears to have been renovated but my hald was not for sure. Staff are nice enough but it is very much hostel style accommodation and in fact some of london's hostels are nicer or at least more interesting and also have cheaper private rooms available. Sad really as I have stayed in good places from the same chain.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is - basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: kathy535
Reviews.Content: I stay in London a few nights a week usually at chain hotels like Radisson or Millennium so I was interested to see how a Travelodge compared. Firstly, the positive - the location was great, just a few minutes from Covent Garden station and surrounded by restaurants and bars. It was clean and the staff were friendly. WIFI was only Â£5 for 24 hrs and bar drinks wer cheap. Breakfast was reasonable. The negatives - it's really basic! No toiletries - not even soap in the bathroom for hand washing. No wardrobe or drawers (although there is a shelf and a rail). V small TV with limited channels. Plastic cups. No bedside shelves as such, none of the 'luxuries' you usually get such as room service options, an information pack or in room hairdryer (they have them on reception). The room felt empty and cold somehow. Having said that this is a business model designed to reduce overheads and meet the basic need - a place to stay. And it does that just fine. I wouldn't race to stay there again but I wouldn't avoid it either.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, excellent location, Would stay here again at high holborn one.”
Reviews.Author: Gismo25nr
Reviews.Content: Staying in the high holborn building in a family room, was very spacious and clean. Would most certainly use it again as so central to everything and great value for money although I did book it 2 months in advance so only pair Â£180 for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Laurs2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in between the Covent Garden and High Holburn tube stops (about 5 mins from either) so it is ideally located for the theatres and great places to eat and shop. Rooms are very basic. You have to ask for a hairdryer and I would suggest asking for extra towels too as they only gave us one large towel and a hand towel for 2 people. Due to the popular location there can be noise from the street so ask for a room on a high floor if possible. Breakfast was self serve but quite good and plenty of choice available. Overall you get what you pay for and if you want somewhere to use as a base that is well priced this is your place. Would go back and would recommend but not for special occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay in London ever!”
Reviews.Author: Mike R
Reviews.Content: Ok first things first - this hotel is in a great location. It's a little disingenuous to call it Covent Garden, but Easyjet get away with far worse every day and so I won't focus too much on this point. But besides the location, I really can't find another positive thing to say about this hotel. And having read the other reviews, I get the overriding feeling of "cheap and you get what you pay for..." - which is fine, and understandable. Except that my 3 night stay cost me on average Â£193 a night.... which is not cheap by any definition. Anyway - arrived around 9pm to witness the most impressive display of indifference from a hotel receptionist I have seen in some time. Completely disinterested in serving me. This turned out to be the best interaction I had with a staff member at the hotel though. The room, in fairness, was large and spacious - probably appearing even more so due to the ridiculous sparseness of the furnishings. There was a double bed, creaky, and springy, but reasonably comfortable in certain positions.... a bizarre construction which looked like a wardrobe with no doors into which was stuffed several duvets, pillows etc; a "workstation" consisting of a narrow desk, and potentially the world's least comfortable chair (maximum time before I moved = 12 minutes) and something... something orange.... and couchlike, in the corner... frayed, battered, and nasty looking. See exhibit, er I mean picture 1. The bathroom was functional and clean - which is more than can be said for me after I took a "shower" - whether due to water pressure, the bizarre shower head, or some other reason, getting a shower was akin to standing under a dripping drain pipe hoping the water gets you. It was hot, granted, but I really didn't feel like I had achieved anything getting a shower. While early morning demand might explain this.... I took one in the afternoon (6pm) with exactly the same effect. The room is "equipped" with a TV (with signal quality varying from "Ok, I guess" to poor. That's it. Oh and a kettle with 4 cups and a small selection of drinks. Side story - I made a coffee and was staring at the coffee stain on the desk wondering how I became such a messy coffee maker... and how despite being such a messy coffee maker, the pattern of the spilled coffee on the outside of the cup was really quite intricate... until I realised that there was a crack in the cup so fundamental to its structure that coffee was literally leaking out of it and onto the desk. See exhibit 2. At this point I decided to mention this to reception... only to find... there is no phone!! NO PHONE!!! In a hotel room, in central London... Needless to say there is nothing else in the room - no iron, no safe, no wardrobe, no fridge, no ability to control the temperature, no drawers, no trouser press.... there is a bin. Says it all really. The walls are grubby and in need of a paint; the carpet is old, stained and nasty; the walls in the corridors are even worse and there is something very peculiar going on with the glass in the doors to the lift areas. In short (ish) I stay in hotels in London quite frequently. I know what you can get for Â£200 a night... and this is not it. This is an absolutely disgraceful hotel for that price - if the rooms had been Â£50 a night I would still have been disappointed. I will never return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic”
Reviews.Author: bzymom22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family room in the High Holburn building. Our room was on the 4th floor behind the elevators. i was a bit worried that we might have some noise from the elevators, but that was not the case. We had a couple of clumsily designed doors that blocked the hallway noise. The room was clean but very basic. There was a bed, a sofa that converted to a bed for our daughter, a TV and a counter area. No pictures on the wall. The bathroom was average size - you provide your own tolietries. There were only 2 towels and 2 pillows. My husband went down to reception to get them with no problems. We were there on a Sunday night through a Wednesday so although we heard some street noise (not shocking in a big city like London) it died down by 11 pm. Our room faced the street but we had curtains and some tree cover. We paid an extra 10GBP to have a late check-out. That allowed us to have time in the morning to check out some of the British Museum before heading to the station to leave for Paris. We did not eat the food in the restaurant. Plenty of other places nearby. We did not try to use the internet as we hadn't brought any devices with us. The location is great. Lots of shops and restaurants, close to theatres. Walking distance to British Museum. Close to two tube stops. If you book the room with the proper expectations, you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for: cheap (but not entirely cheerful)”
Reviews.Author: EMT64
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is about 70GBP a night minimum, and its main strengths are location and cleanliness. Everything else is rather shoestring. The rooms are small and cheaply furnished, though the bed is comfortable and the linen is clean. There is tea and coffee, a television, and you do get a towel and a tiny bar of soap. The staff at reception are quite unpleasant, and clearly don't feel they need to work to get your business. The bar was all right, and the breakfast seemed fine. Since the hotel is two minutes' walk to Covent Garden, it's clear enough why it's so busy. There were a lot of hen parties staying the night before I arrived (checking-out as I got there), so I was grateful not to have encountered them. If you have a bit more money, I'd go to a better hotel. If all you need is a pillow for your head overnight, then this will do well enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location!”
Reviews.Author: memphisbluesagain
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay here and enjoyed the whole experience,the breakfast was hot and there was plenty of choice. Staff polite and affable, the only bugbear was no air con but eh, the location made up for it, we shall be back.

Reviews.Title: “faulty towers”
Reviews.Author: valley20
Reviews.Content: firstly their are two buildings to this hotel and when booking we were not told which one we were in. thus we were redirected to the other building. when we eventually found 'our' building check-in was reatively easy, although the automatic check-in device either wasn't working or we didn't get the hang of it. room was okay quite clean although smelled musty. we booked a twin room but got a double with a sort of camp bed in the corner. both beds had springs sticking up and would not liked to have spent more than one night on them. the over-bath shower was set too close to the wall and had a very weak flow so found it pretty impossible to get under the water which was just as well really considering there was only one bath and one hand towel between two of us. the view from our window looked across the road to a vast, graffitti strewn and derilict office block (lovely) on the plus side we found the hotel quiet at night so apart from the bed springs and the toilet which seemed to moo loudly when flushed we slept okay. i booked on line and believed i had booked a two for one evening meal for Â£9.50 (great value! i thought) although this was not the case and had to pay an extra Â£12.50 for another meal. the resturant service was extremely slow considering there was only one other family eating. we waited over half an hour for our main then had to go and find the waiter (who seemed to vanish completey) to order our dessert! the food was unispired and considering the eventual price would have been better off eating out. we had a theatre booking that evening so had to scoff it down so as not to be late. the next morning lucky we arrived early for our rather over cooked buffet breakfast as the resturant is woefully under sized for the demand and by 9.15 guests were queueing out the door. we didn't hang around long for fear of being devoured by the throng of hungry looking guests who were queueing past our table! over-all the best thing about this hotel is it's location, being nice and central, although there are lots of other centrally based hotels. i would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Fab place for the West End.”
Reviews.Author: DELBOYHULL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel on a long weekend we only paid Â£35 but the room was small and the lookout from the windows was into more windows this we did not mind as we only had the room for one nite and at that price you cant complain as for getting to places its spot on Soho and the sq not to far to walk any place loads of bars for food and drink. if you want to be in on the action this is the place. AND A GOOD PRICE.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting accommodation and totally over priced. Avoid”
Reviews.Author: markyp33
Reviews.Content: We paid Â£150 for a one night stay, and if it had not already been paid for I would have walked out. The check-in process was pretty straight forward, and the lady who checked us in was pleasant. In the Reception are the hotel looks modern, clean and functional if not a little clinical. This changes as soon as you get out of the public areas and go to the room. The corridors and lobbys are in need of tlc. When we got to a room at the far end of the 2nd floor, the keycard would not open the door; I went back to reception who said it would be the batteries failed in the door lock; they escorted us back to the room to let us in. When I asked what I would do to get in and out the room for the rest of our stay I was told I would have to ask at Reception and wait for someone to escort us to the room to let us in. I complained but was told no other rooms were available. When we got in the room I was astounded at the poor quality levels, bearing in mind I had not paid 'budget' hotel prices at Â£150. See the photos. Follows a list of faults:- . broken and stained ceiling tiles . only one light out of three working so room dark (probably an advantage) . wall light shade hanging off . window handle snapped off - could not close . redundant heater left in room . exposed bed bases which are stained and disgusting . wafer thin pillows . electrical socket installed over bed . net curtains filthy . no complimentary soap . old wall plugs left in wall . orange crud and fingers marks built up on TV remote buttons . sink taps aged and tarnished, handles loose . many stains and finger marks all over paintwork and surfaces . furniture is chipped, dirty and aged . when dining together - meals served 20 minutes apart We used the restaurant and would not recommend it; the food is nearly all microwaved and of low quality. Also, there were 20 minutes between my starter coming out, and that of my colleague. I had finished my main by the time he got his starter. Staff are obviously used to getting complaints and act disinterested. The lady on reception was obviously put out when we went out on a couple of occasions and she had to go up to the 2nd floor to let us in because of the broken door lock. We were kept waiting until she could get away, and then displayed her annoyance; I pointed out that it was actually us that was being inconvenienced - not her, but all to little avail. Quite simply - if you want a clean comfortable room, don't stay here; if you have to I would not pay more than Â£45 and that's only because its in central London.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Accomodation - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nas301630
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for one night. For the price you pay, you can have little to complain about for such a convenient location. The room was very clean and well maintained. As with all Travelodges, you have to pay extra for Wi-Fi but this is standard across the chain so can't really complain about that. It's a little noisy at night but I would say that's the price you pay for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price - but too many faults leave poor impression”
Reviews.Author: paul-TA8
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the Drury Lane part of this Travelodge. First impressions from the street are of a very dated concrete block; the stairs to access reception were a struggle with our suitcase. Reception staff were very pleasant and efficient. We knew of noise issues locally (which their website makes very clear) and asked for a quieter room. We were allocated 730. Breakfast was good each morning and our room was cleaned to a high standard by a very amicable male cleaner - always wishing us a good morning, singing happy birthday to my wife and generally being a huge asset to this hotel (we left him a tip). Now, the bad bits...... The windows in the hotel are chained shut (to stop drunks falling out) and only open a couple of inches. The room has no air con or any cooling fans and the extractor in the bathrooms dont work (neither do the ones in Bristol where we stayed last night). The beds have plastic mattress covers. All of which made for 3 very uncomfortable nights in stiffling heat with no escape once the shower humidity invades the room. We heard several guests complain about damp in their rooms and we did find an area of our carpet (near the window) to be wet/damp - it hadnt been raining. The room is sparsely decorated to the extent that there are no shelves to store clothing, just 6 hangers on a small rail. There are also no places for soap etc in the shower. Despite staying for 3 nights, we did have to ask for a second towel every day as they only supply one per room - we just asked for this on the way back from a day sightseeing. The noise from the area (even from our "quiet" room) was deafening at several times of each night and again at around 6am when the refuse lorries collect all the beer bottles from nearby pubs/clubs. If the rooms had a simple fan the windows could be closed. The location was good but we wouldnt return to this Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “Never again, not budget just cheap”
Reviews.Author: Lorna M
Reviews.Content: Had a great time visiting London, but this hotel came near to spoiling the weekend. Lovely staff who man reception/bar of yet another establishment in this chain reeking of 'Eau de Travel Lodge' - what is that smell? I can only now assume they all use the same cheap cleaning fluid nationally. Efficient check-in system. I had dinner in the restaurant on Friday but would not recommend this; ordered a starter, a main and a side - starter was warm at best and came with the side, the wrong main was initially served and when the correct dish came back it was obvious I still had the same chips and peas, now cold from their first journey to my table. Plenty of cafe/bars/restaurants around the hotel to cater for any meals, don't eat in. Lucky if one of the two lifts was working Saturday/Sunday, which was the reason I didn't feel like running down to reception to estalish why no housekeeping had visited in the 9 hours I'd been away from my room. Had to use damp towel from previous evening and that morning's showers. HK did turn up at 6.45, by which point I was in the shower and not really looking to have my room cleaned, although I think all that was on offer was a clean towel and replacement coffee. By Sunday noon the reception/lift areas were really grubby looking. Whilst cheap for the area, not good value and I regret not having paid more for a significant improvement. Please, please Premier Inn hurry up and open Leicester Square and give Travel Lodge a run for their money in the West End.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't expect much and wasn't disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Hypnowhizz
Reviews.Content: As a cheap place to stay close to Covent Garden or the West End, it did the job. However the underground car parking was closed (since January) according to a tatty A4 sign taped to the wall. No problem, off to the local NCP around the corner. We booked in to be told our booking reference and paperwork was wrong - sorry I only brought what Travelodge gave me.. Soon rectified, but made to feel an "inconvienience". My wife is disabled and asked for a disabled facility room. Fortunately she no longer needs her wheelchair as getting up the formidible steps in front of the hotel would have been impossible albut a few weeks ago. Even better the disabled room was on the eighth floor as far from the lift as was possible?? The rooms facilities were good, especially the bathroom as it was a wet room. Even having alarm facilities by the bed with a plug in for floor mats. Problem was that on arrival the lifts weren't working. "Use the Service Lift" was the response. Fine, but the service lift stops at the 7th floor, but we had to go back to the fifth floor, navigate to the "new" building then attempt three flights of steps which got us to the eighth, a total of 57 steps. Fortunate again that we didn't need a wheelchair although we both could have used oxygen by the time we got to our room. One lift was working again by the time we had to go down, but WHY put a disabled person on the EIGHTH floor. Its seems absurd to us. There is no way my wife could use the stairs, and even the fit residents were very pink when they tried. The next morning we did enjoy a great breakfast from the buffet. All well cooked and quality items from the cumberland type sausages, to the not too salty bacon, and excellent scambled eggs. As much as you can eat, well worth the money! On departure when I tried to claim back 50% of the NCP costs (as advertised) I was told the "machine" was in the other reception... I went hunting for another reception to no avail. I was told later that there is another Travelodge over the road, and then the original person accused me of not listening. I let it go, and forgave her ignorance as I know my listening skills are excellent. All said about the Lodge, you get what you pay for, a clean, functional but excellent room with optional (recommended) breakfast. Some members of staff seemed switched on, but some others just ruined the overall experience. To have the lifts go down is inexcusable, to have the garage closed is ridiculous as I assume that the service lift could have been used if you use a wheelchair or have difficulty with stairs. The general feeling in our little groups was, "Well, they obviously don't expect to see us back so why should they care?" I didn't expect much from a Travelodge and wasn't disappointed! Such a shame.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: DarrenSwansea
Reviews.Content: Booked two bargain disabled rooms. Checked in at 3pm at the Drury Lane site. Quite a long queue and was told rooms were allocated at the site next door in High Holborn. This is not adjoining but across a busy road - it did have a pedestrian crossing and lights, etc. My first tip is to not have your disabled friends attempt the steps at the front until you know which building you're in! There is a lovely quiet reception at High Holborn so my second tip is to check in there instead - it's a 50/50 chance. We were allocated disabled rooms at the front of the hotel on 1st and 2nd floors. The rooms were brilliant - large with wet rooms. There were three front windows which left plenty of natural light in but when opened was quite noisy due to traffic. The only gripe we had was that, as we were above the entrance, people congregated outside for a smoke at all hours - even 4, 5, 6am. The delivery man for laundry came early too so we were disturbed a couple of times. The staff are great and food and drinks (which you could take back to your room) were good value. A lovely location meant we felt in the middle of everything. Perhaps Travelodge could email before arrival for guests to be told which building they are staying in to help the check in procedure? I didn't ring in advance to check either though. Would stay again but in a standard room at High Holborn, on a higher floor at the side or back of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: DaisyJ777
Reviews.Content: Booked this travelodge at short notice, so did not get a good price, however it served its purpose. Very good location, clean room. No view, but that really didn't bother me. Check in was quick and easy, despite the huge queue that I saw as I entered the reception area !!

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: king-cyprus
Reviews.Content: We booked a family room for 2 adults and 2 children for 2 nights. When we arrived there was no bedding for the kids, only 1 bath towel & 1 hand and 3 pillows. Went to reception to raise my concerns, only to be told the hotel has not enough bedding to go around. They gave me towels and told me to come back later for bedding. Before we went for an evening out i reported our bathroom light was no longer working. After an evening out we returned to reception to collect our bedding, only to be handed a single duvet and sheets, eventually we got another duvet but no extra pillow but was told one would be sent up....An hour later and fast approaching midnight i decided to rest my head on some rock hard towels. What a nights sleep!! Next morning went to reception and mentioned the lack of pillows to which the very shocked receptionist went and sourced within a couple of minutes! Bathroom light still not working though. Now if anyone wanted an 'ertha kitt' they had to sit there with door open to allow light in! not pleasant. We checked out with the bathroom light still not working. But the very nice receptionist refunded us 50% of our stay which made it all a little more bearable. Travelodges aren't cheap, so spend a little more and get some quality.

Reviews.Title: “'Back to basics' taken to the extreme”
Reviews.Author: mjh1977
Reviews.Content: I like Travelodge in general, and accept the underlying ethos of keeping things cheap and simple. However this one went too far - one bath towel for two people (in a double room), meaning someone had to go down 6 floors late at night for a second towel. Three pillows... surely provide either two or four? However bed comfy, location very good so it met the basic need to stay somewhere in London at short notice. If this hotel made some inexpensive tweaks it could be ok - but not for me next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “better places to stay in london.”
Reviews.Author: maudkidd
Reviews.Content: We,myself, my husband and our son, returned yesterday from our stay here. We arrived on Tuesday 30 th August after a rather long journey on the train, delayed due to a freight train fire. We got the tube to Covent Garden and went on foot to find the Travelodge. No problem finding it, just 5minutes from tube stop, so cannot fault location - especially with two weekend bags and a child in tow! We got to the Travelodge and were informed that our family room was in the other building two minutes away...so off we went! We checked in, absolutely no problem with this as we had online reservations...went up to our room...opened the door and it was awful. There was a horrible stale, blocked drain smell coming from the bathroom, the room looked tired, the chair had a horrid stain on it [ dread to think what it was!], the double bed had a mattress like marshmallows and the view...the London skyline?? Nope...derelict, graffiti covered, tatty, building that needed demolishing sooner rather than later! we were visiting for our sons 7th birthday and this was not a nice present!! We unpacked and went down to reception...I asked the receptionist if we could move rooms as it was not nice,[ also found a blood stain on the sofa beds mattress...YUCK] I was told that we might be able to move in the morning after people had checked out...ohhh noooo!!! We returned later on to our dingy, stinky room and I just cried. It was boiling hot and the window wouldn't shut properly so it was NOISY [ I know London is noisy but when you close the window you expect some quietness! ]My husband went to reception to complain at 11pm and a lady appeared 10 minutes later with an air freshener spray to try and combat the smell!!!! She asked if there were any other problems and I just gave her a list, she said she'd only been there 2 days and didn't know about the tatty building next door.erm?! Hey ho the next morning after an awful nights sleep [ whenever the toilet was flushed there was a terrible grinding noise aswell!!!! ] my husband went down at 9am and asked to be moved. We were moved and it was much better..not at all perfect but clean,no smell, decent flushing toilet and not like a sauna. I know we booked the room through a Travelodge promotion and got a cheap deal but standards are standards. Make sure you dont get room 1170 ... awful!!!! The air freshener lady was on reception when we checked out and said I looked happier..just about.Stay elsewhere in London.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for WestEnd Shows”
Reviews.Author: Llanelli-bloke
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on two sides of the road. We stayed the one next to The New London Theatre and just two minutes from The Shaftesbury Theatre. Very good transport links with Covent Garden Tube 5 minute walk away. Room was very clean but a little warm as you can not open the window very far because of safety. I needed two more pillows which the staff at the desk gave me with no problem. The Check In Computer is really fast and useful when the desk is busy which it is at 2.30pm when we Checked in. The breakfast is good value if you book before you check in. The staff are really friendly and helpful. Overall this hotel is great for show, sightseeing and sleeping after walking all day!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, typical travelodge”
Reviews.Author: topdisneybird
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at a cost of Â£180 in the High Holborn building (where most family rooms located). Was apprehensive due to other reviews but was pleasantly surprised. Used the computerised check in at Drury Lane and the friendly reception staff carried our case down the stairs so we could relocate to High Holborn - just across the road. All the staff we encountered were friendly and welcoming. I have stayed at Travelodges before so expect it to be clean with no frills, which is exactly what we got. Yes we had to ask for an extra towel on one occasion but this was not a problem at reception. We stayed on the fifth floor and there was some noise from the club next door but this did not disrupt our sleep. I have children of 3 & 7 and they slept no problem too. I would have no hesitation booking again, it is in a good location, you would not find anywhere else as cheap. Can't comment on the breakfast as we went elsewhere but it always smelt good!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel in Excellent Location in London.”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy D
Reviews.Content: 1) Location - The location is excellent. Very close to restaurants and pubs. Two busy, central tube stops are close by. 2) Room - The room is clean and looks recently re-modeled. The room is fairly bare however containing a bed and TV and not much else. My room did not have any drawers or a dresser or a safe. The bed was comfortable. Toiletries are not provided (only a bar of soap) so you will need to bring shampoo, face wash, etc. Also note that there is no A/C. 3) Noise - Extremely noisy in the morning. I think they were doing some sort of construction nearby. Other than that the rooms were well insulated and the hotel was not noisy. 4) Staff - Friendly and helpful. This is more of a corporate hotel so they are not going to go out of their way to make you feel like you are at home, but they are efficient and helpful. 5) Miscellaneous - 10 euros for early check-in (don't know what time is regular check-in). Overall, I would definitely stay here again. This was a great value in a great location and I was very pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for one of the refurbished rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Chatham75
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 3 times in all, the first time in one of the basement rooms (that was cold and felt a bit grubby & overlooked an underground car park), the second time in a really tired room that was adequate for the price and the 3rd time in a really fresh, modern room. So, when you check in, ask the girls on the desk for one of the new rooms - they're on a par with more higher end / expensive hotels. Be warned - make sure you take your own body wash/shampoo, the hotel doesn't provide it! Overall, pretty good, trump card is it's location, you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Make the right choice.”
Reviews.Author: Dunny0578
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this budget hotel in Covent Garden for a couple of nights when visiting London for the weekend. Having stayed here a few times, the location is perfect for Covent Garden, and there are plenty of shops to browse as you make your way onto Oxford Street and towards Leicester Square. Unless you are elderly or extremely unfit; everything you need this side of London is in relative walking distance. The hotel has been renovated fairly recently and it was a smooth experience on this occasion. I have previously stayed here and was shipped out to the 'annex' which is around the corner (Holborn i think). Do everything possible to avoid staying in this one. It's noisy at night and you can't sleep when the clubs turn out, the service was poor and we even had to collect our own pillows from reception. Many people complained the next morning. I was shattered due to the noise etc but any attempt to politely complain is met with a 'what do you expect from a budget hotel? response). Don't bother writing to head office, they don't care and one email I received was so dismissive almost to the point of rude. Enough said. Stay in Drury Lane and the experience is what I would have expected. Of the budget hotels I'm afraid that Premier Lodge beat Travelodge hands down, especially service and the breakfast. On this occasion however, the staff were friendly and helpful, check in was quick and they were happy to change my room so that I did not have the 'Holborn Experience' again as we were initially given a room around the corner. In short, it's the location that appeals and it's cheaper than most hotels in the area. Rooms are basic and there was plenty of room at breakfast, but not to the Premier Lodge standard. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin in a lovely location”
Reviews.Author: swedishstar
Reviews.Content: A good, clean Travelodge in a lovely well located position. Not the cheapest by any means but the room was immaculate, the location perfect for shopping, drinking, eating out and Theatres. Breakfast was available at an extra cost and was pretty good value for money. No late night noise whatsoever! Beds and pillows very comfortable. Quick check-In and good service. Ticks all the boxes for me for a budget option.

Reviews.Title: “Not great!”
Reviews.Author: RunnerRabbit
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends for cheap London break, room stank of urine and was damp, all felt very seedy, be better off looking at a Premier Inn for similar sort of price! Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable & Central”
Reviews.Author: Archer_011
Reviews.Content: Stayed seven nights 22-29th August at the Travelodge Covent Garden, room 165, Drury Lane site. Pros: Central location, close to Holborn tube station. Easy walking distance to attractions and eating establishments. Booked in at High Holborn site, helped with automated booking by staff member, stayed in Drury lane, this is only a short walk away. Room clean, nice view of wall, but didnâ€™t spend much time in room, so didnâ€™t matter. Coffee, tea & milk replenished each day Fluffy towels Comfortable bed Reception staff, polite and cheerful Small TV, but adequate Cons: Some days didnâ€™t get fresh towels, learnt after a couple of days to get a spare from reception when coming back in. Water in shower tepid. Spoke to Reception second day, said they would get it looked at, it was intermittently tepid and slightly warmer on some days after that, just bearable. We did not eat in the restaurant, but there were lots of people eating there so one could assume the food was ok. Booked this on the Travelodge sale, so was good value for $568 for the seven nights. Would I stay here again - definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but it is hard to have a good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: fionadaisy
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent being just two minutes away from Covent Garden; shops and the tube station. The room was clean, with tea and coffee and tv. Bathroom was spacious, shower was not as hot or as powerful than at home, but it was okay. There was quite a bit of outside noise when getting ready to go to sleep, which was surprising as I was on the 5th floor and really high up. I was woken up twice during the night with really loud shouting from outside, and again early with traffic noise and bins being emptied etc. When leaving in the morning there was dried blood all over the outside steps of the hotel, which may have been related to the shouting, but was not very pleasant. Breakfast was very busy, but you didn't have to wait very long to be seated or at the buffet. Everything was fresh and hot, but not especially tasty. The sausage, bacon, tomato and eggs all tasted of very little. Orange juice, coffee and toast were all fine and in plentiful supply. The location is really great, but it is not a fantastic place to get rest or have a lovely breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate only”
Reviews.Author: Oldmotherd
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a basic, no frills place to lay your head, this is fine. We stayed 2 nights which was was enough. Only 1 bath and 1 hand towel were supplied and although an extra was provided we had to ask 3 times. Also there were no curtains at the window, which caused no privacy issues (on 5th floor) but light pollution made an early wake up inevitable. Room was a little stuffy but an open window meant that noise from the street below was a problem. There is a 'restaurant' which serves service station standard food. We would probably only go back if staying for a very short time at budget rate. Staff appeared stressed; polite but short!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: brookie0079
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel august bank holiday weekend, amazing location as only 5 min walk to covent gardens! Rooms were very clean but we were in the 2nd building so it had only just been refurbished so I expected it to be clean and there were no signs of wear n tear! Walls were very thin n we couldn't slightly hear the lift but had a good nights sleep! Only problem was we had no towels, not even 1 for 2 people so went and asked at reception n was given only 1 n told he would report to house keeping to do a better job: not what I wanted to hear when 2 people were showering but after insisting we had 2 he finally gave us them: strange but we got it sorted! Would defo stay again

Reviews.Title: “Drury Lane good, BUT avoid High Holborn if you need to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: SarahnJ0hn
Reviews.Content: This Travelodge is on two sites so although we registered at Drury Lane our room was on the High Holborn Site, on the 10th Floor. The view was awful, disused building with broken windows, but we expected to be out most of the time so it was irrelevant. Around midnight however were were awoken by extremely loud music, a great deal of shouting & screaming. The nightclub on the adjoining block had just opened and continued until around 4pm!! The dim was dreadful and impossible to sleep through, I felt ill the next day. We complained and were transferred to the Drury Lane site - good views over the rooftops of London and slept well for he rest of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as you read BUT ..”
Reviews.Author: MrsG1996
Reviews.Content: Firstly yes i'd stay again as it was an ok location BUT only if i could get another bargin rate. On reading the reviews (after booking!) i was worried it would be a dive. I'm very glad to say it wasn't. it was clean and comfortable. Yes its a little tired but as a 1nt sleep it was fine. We got the wrong hotel and had to walk to the other one. we arrived just after 3pm so the auto check in didnt work (panic as i thought i didn't have a res!) but it's just because the rooms weren't on the system ready. As i have working in hotels for 5 years i know its something that happens and isn't an isue. We were on the 10th floor, right side the room was huge, plenty of space. The view was london sky line, the (very) top of St Pauls, the gerkin, Tower Bridge. the direct oppersit view was bad, a disused block but keeping 1 curtain closed fixed that! If you go up the stairs higher you get a great veiw of Big Ben, Parliment, london Eye, more of St Pauls etc DOWNSIDE! having lived in a rock music venue for over 10 years noise has never been an issue HOWEVER the club down stairs kept use awake with unck-a-ture unck-a-ture, screams, shouts and full on arguments! from 2.30am to 530am with a long day a head and 2 kids it wasn't ideal. but the kids slept very well and unsually didn't wake till 7am (bummer as i'd just got to sleep!) We didnt have breakie although it looked good on paper or use an of the other services.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: TheMarshalls1950
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here quite a few times but this stay was a real disappointment. A horrible room, bathroom terrible, dirty towels, noisy and in need of redecorating.

Reviews.Title: “Drury Lane building - recently refurbished, quiet, clean”
Reviews.Author: thomasmolloy
Reviews.Content: As many Travelodgers will know, it can be touch and go in cities - but don't hesitate with this one. There are two buildings (1 and 2) and we stayed in the one on the corner of Drury Lane. It has been refurbished recently, and our room was clean, well-maintained and comfortable. I can't comment on the other building. The reception and lobby areas in both buildings can be crowded - it has over 600 rooms, so no surprise there. But you're on the edge of Covent Garden, so why would you spend time in the hotel, honestly?

Reviews.Title: “What a difference - much better”
Reviews.Author: Kate G
Reviews.Content: I am not a fan of Travelodge so i really wasnt expecting much but this branch was amazing. The room was clean and had a nice city view, the location was fantastic as we were enjoying the theatre district to see Shrek. There were bars on both sides of the road and the prices were good. was nice to have somewhere to relax with the family, not usually found in Travelodges. The breakfast was good but really really busy! would definitely stay here again if exploring London more - more of the same Travelodge and you might pry me away from Premier Inn

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you intend to sleep whilst in London. Adjacent nightclub will ruin your stay”
Reviews.Author: craigmcarthur
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ©e and I stayed at the Travelodge â€˜Covent Gardenâ€™ for 3 nights between 21st and 24th August 2011. In short the hotel is conveniently located close to many of Londonâ€™s key areas. Unfortunately, despite booking the Drury Lane hotel we actually stayed in the Travelodge across the road which happens to be directly adjacent to a nightclub. Despite staying Sunday to Wednesday which I would personally consider not to be peak clubbing nights the noise level was unbearable. I would like to remind readers that my FiancÃ©e and I are only 25, still socialise in clubs on occasion and are probably easier going than most with regards to noise levels and what we expect from hotels. We donâ€™t like to complain and see hotels for city breaks as places to wash and sleep. Furthermore I am a deep sleeper and have been known to sleep through almost anything. The noise of the music was clearly audible in our room despite being on the 12th floor! The noise from drunken clubbers leaving and getting into the myriad of queuing taxis that sit directly below the hotel rooms is really unbelievable. No surprises that our quality of sleep was abysmal. The windows offer no sound proofing whatsoever. I have stayed all over London on much busier roads near much busier pubs and clubs. I have stayed in many other cities in busier locations and have never experienced noise like this. I would strongly urge anyone other than the deaf or hard of hearing to avoid this hotel. Location: Donâ€™t be fooled by the â€˜Covent Gardenâ€™ attached to the hotels name. It is about a 5 minute walk from Covent Garden. The hotels location is its one redeeming factor. Its situated close to The British Museum. Short walk to Covent Garden, The Strand, Shaftesbury Avenue, Oxford Street etc. It is equidistant from Holburn and Covent Garden tube stations. There is also a nightclub located directly below as I mentioned, if your looking for a nightclub. Room: The rooms are very much no frills. But clean and the bed was comfortable. The rooms are a decent size but sparsely decorated. Basically an empty room with a bed and dressing table with mirror and a flat screen TV. I donâ€™t believe this to be a negative and found it refreshing not to have several couches, tables and chairs that do nothing but clutter rooms with unused furniture like most other hotels. The lack of air conditioning may be a problem for some in the summer. The windows are latched to open a minimal amount meaning the rooms are warm. But for the price this is to be expected. Food: We didnâ€™t eat at the hotel during our stay. All you can eat breakfast is offered for a reasonable price of around Â£7.00. We opted t eat in a small cafÃ© Called CafÃ© Verona across the road which was quick, friendly, reasonably priced and very good quality food. We also ate in a small bakery called Le Pain Quotidien attached to the Aveda saloon directly opposite which we would highly recommend if your willing to spend just a little bit more for a quality breakfast. Facilities: There is a bar which is opened to 5am which seemed nice enough. We used the internet service in the bar which was Â£1 for 20 minutes which is reasonable value for a London hotel. Summary: All in all the hotel offers a great location, clean and comfortable rooms at a very reasonable price. If I could overlook the unbelievable noise that emanates from the nightclub and its clubbers unfortunately located adjacent to the hotel I would highly recommend this hotel for those looking for cheap digs in London. But the noise was so bad it ruined every night of our stay. I would strongly urge anyone considering this hotel to think again, or purchase ear plugs. Itâ€™s a shame really. Better sound proofing in the rooms or free ear plugs at check in might alleviate this problem. But I think anyone who stays on the evens side of the hotel on High Holburn will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed after an initial issue!”
Reviews.Author: beagle_UK
Reviews.Content: We checked in at the High Holborn building (which is newer than Drury Lane) and asked for a refurbished room and were suprised to be directed over to the Drury Lane building. The room was small, and didn't look refurbished but given we only paid Â£15 for a Friday night in the last sale we wouldn't have minded. However the room hadn't been cleaned since the previous occupants - they were helpful in reception, and gave us a room on the top floor of the High Holborn building - this was great - simple, refurbished, clean, powerful shower and a decent size. Location wise this was perfect - a 5-10 mins walk from Holborn/Tottenham Court Road/Covent Garden tube. The only negative really was that there was no air con in the room so we needed to leave the window open which obvously meant a bit of London noise! Woud def stay again even if it was a bit more than Â£15!

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge Covent Garden is just the ticket for a cheap central London hotel”
Reviews.Author: HotelValueHunter
Reviews.Content: Travelodge Covent Garden is the most central of the Travelodge hotel chain to the tourist centre of London. I stayed here once before in Oct-04 and I paid Â£80 per night. This time I paid Â£46.83 per night. What a difference in price in 7 years! The beauty of this hotel is its location, right in the heart of west end theatreland. If this hotel is fully booked or a bit pricey (which for a Travelodge it can be) use the postcode WC2N 5DN on the Travelodge WEB site. This is the National Gallery postcode and is effectively the postcode for Trafalgar Sq (TSq). Using this postcode brings up the other London Travelodgeâ€™s by distance from TSq, which are nearly always cheaper. Check in was quick and easy but there are two sites to this Travelodge but it seems not to matter which site you check in at. The two sites are only 1 minute apart. I cannot fault the politeness and helpfulness of the staff I spoke with during my stay. The newer building (about 18 Mths old) appears to be just family rooms. My room did the job but it seemed to have an ill-fitting window which seemed not to close properly. The light above the shower was not working making showering virtually in the dark. There is no phone in the room so you have to go down to reception or remember to put the reception phone number in your mobile. The rooms are not air-conditioned so beware in hot summer. The rooms do have heaters in. The bed I found very comfortable. I did not eat on site but there is a very brightly lit bar and restaurant area open 24 hours a day which seemed to be doing a busy trade. The newer building is right next door to Dominoâ€™s Pizza. To make the most of this hotel use its postcode (zip code) to find the quickest distance to walk to your destination you will be surprised how close they will be. I find walkit.co.uk/London to be the best site for this. For a cheap room right in the heart of the West End this Travelodge is unbeatable if you book early to get very cheap central London accommodation. A lot of negative comments are seem to be people expecting the world from a very budget priced hotel. Enjoy the location and remember you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Ryanair of the hotel world”
Reviews.Author: michael w
Reviews.Content: Every so often travelodge have there sales. If you manage to book a room at this time it could work out the cheapest bed in one of the best parts of london. Often covent garden travelodge is excluded from the sales, but not always... Rooms are clean, furnished with cheap but durable materials as with all other travelodges. Nothing special, but the location is superb. Not worth it at full price.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Travel Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Donstallione
Reviews.Content: Nothing special, basic Travel Lodge, could do with an update but was nice and clean, fairly cheap option very close to Covent Garden, I'm sure there are better options but if there is nothing else suitable availabe then it's O.K for the price

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: 74lumley
Reviews.Content: After so many negative comments I was apprehensive (to say the least) about our booking. We had a double room in the Drury Lane site. Check-in was extremely quick and we found our room easy enough. Yes the room (in particular the bathroom) was a little dated with some old lamp shades and chipped furniture. However it was spotlessly clean and very roomy and everything worked well. The bed was comfy and there was not a lot of noise at all (I think previous reviewer may need to adjust clock as roadworks on Drury Lane never started before 8.00!) The staff were friendly and helpful and getting extra towels, pillows etc was not a problem. The location was fantastic, we hardly ever needed public transport. We paid Â£148 total for a 4 night stay. We could have easily paid that for one night somewhere else. The limitations of the hotel e.g., no luggage area, no toiletries etc are clearly stated on the website so shouldn't come as a sursprise! If you just want a comfy place to sleep this place is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Typical Standard Budget Hotel, very Central.”
Reviews.Author: SCOTT2704
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many Travelodge Hotels all over Britain and have indeed stayed at the Covent Garden one many times before as well. The hotel is definitely a budget hotel, especially for Central London but I suppose you do get what you pay for and at Â£19.50 a night (in the Travelodge Sale) I can't really compalin !! The new reception, bar and breakfast area is a vast improvement on the old one and this makes checking in etc a lot, lot easier than on previous visits. The rooms are a touch dated and the entire hotel can not be far off due a facelift. All-in-all though it was an acceptable stay and as I said earlier, for the price, I would stay here again. Finally, the location just could not be better !!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Karen G
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights, expected basic but not dirty. Sheets and towls very clean but walls ceilings, floors filthy. The lights didn't work and when I complained they gave me a bulb. This didn't work and they said they do not keep spare lamps.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere rather than stay in this filthy place”
Reviews.Author: debefc77
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine booked us into the Travelodge because of the location to Covent Garden. Believe me - the location was the only good thing about it. After waiting 10 minutes at reception whilst staff were having a full blown argement with other guests unlucky enough to book here we were booked into Room 112 which was in the old part of the building. OMG! I could not believe they actually get away with passing this off as a habitable hotel room. As you can see from my photos, the room was awful and the bathroom was absolutley filthy. We immediatley complained and were given a much nicer room in the newer part of the hotel which has been modernised. At least it was clean! Very basic, but clean. It's not as if Travelodge is much cheaper then other london hotels, there are far better hotels or B&B's in the area for the same price. If you are ever unfortunate enough to stay here make sure it's not in the old building, for your own hygiene's sake, stay in the new building. Or better still, look elsewhere. I personally, have been put off staying in a Travelodge ever again. 'Get a grip Travelodge, you should be ashamed'.

Reviews.Title: “Really Central”
Reviews.Author: KateDan2
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel a number of times. I've always had a pretty good experience. Its not the lap of luxury by any means, but the location is just stunning. Piccadilly Circus and the majority of the West End shows are withing walking distance, and its only about ten minutes walk to St. Pauls and The Globe if you go the other way. Holborn, the nearest tube station is less than five minutes walk away. If you want luxury then this is not the place. The Drury lane part of the hotel is rather more shabby than the other part but it is always clean. In general I like this hotel a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for theatre land”
Reviews.Author: Sharon099
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in 2 buildings across the road from each other. We stayed in a family room (2 adults 2 children) for 2 nights. The room was clean and big enough for the four of us, a little worn in places, but all we wanted the room for was somewhere to sleep. 2 min walk to tube, theatres and lots of places to eat. Good selection for breakfast. If you are looking for a clean, reasonably priced, basic room close to theatre land this hotel is just the job. If you want luxury (why would you be staying in a Travel Lodge!) pay more and stay somewhere else. We had no complaints and enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in London but Avoid if disabled/limited mobility”
Reviews.Author: selkieNice
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage kids and i arrived at the coven garden travel lodge, London - which has a lot of steep stairs at the front entrance. The taxi driver said he would take us to the accessible entrance [my husband has mobility issues and walks with a stick ] The taxi driver pressed the intercom and the staff let the taxi in . We got out of the taxi and saw a woman in a wheelchair pressing the assistance button [labeled in braille and English with international wheelchair symbol] as only one of the double doors had opened and there was too little space for her chair to get through . We spoke to the woman and she said her husband had gone to speak to the front desk staff regarding access, We chatted to her till her husband arrived a few minutes later and her husband said that the staff had told him to ''just press the button'' but pressing the button had no effect. We said that we would speak to the front desk for them again but as we went through the door, my husband noticed that there was another button on the inside which operated the other door - impossible to reach if in a wheelchair! We checked in dropped the bags , then left via this accessible entrance , had something to eat and went back to the hotel a couple of hours later and pressed on the intercom for access. The guy answering said that this was not the disabled access point any more and that no one was allowed in. We said- we arrived this way by taxi, as had the other guest in the wheelchair. [and we later heard from the woman in the wheelchair that she had used this entrance repeatedly during her stay with no problems] The staff member was rude and told us to ''just climb the stairs '' and said he was not opening the gate as this wasn't the disabled access point. It is possible that the staff member did not initially see my husband's walking stick on cctv but i told him immediately that my husband could not use stairs and walked with a walking stick The staff member eventually said he would come down and ''explain'' the problem to us and he eventually let us in the gate after arguments After some more discussion the staff member told us that there was a different disabled access point - which turned out to be a series of steep ramps into an alley - totally unmarked with wheelchair symbols AFAIK but bearing info about being a fire exit - It would be a nightmare in heavy rain or snow or ice or if self-propelling a wheelchair . My husband found it awkward in light rain using a stick i wasn't 100% convinced about this route as an official entrance given that the lady in the wheelchair told us she was entering and exiting via the original disabled access point throughout her stay things we liked- location was excellent - handy for covent garden shops / theatres etc , bed linen and bathroom was clean we got a decent price for the one night stay [2 rooms double and twin ] things we disliked - severe disabled access problems Room standard was below average for travelodges- decor was poor, light fittings were broken The staff member told us that the covent garden traveldoge was essentially 2 buildings and that at some point soon the two would be separate entities. It appears that the other, newer building is more disabled friendly -with fully accessible rooms so we would opt for the other building if staying in the area again

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Nimbu2010
Reviews.Content: Internet reservation states you can check in at either of the 2 buildings [3 or 4 minutes walk apart] but doesn't specify which one you'll actually stay in - so a 15 minute queue to check in [itself fairly quick and painless] to be sent round the corner for another 15 queue to collect a room key only to be told none were available. Receptionist let me into room so another 15 minute queue later to collect a key for myself. Room was clean and comfortable if a little basic - I think the first hotel I have ever stayed in without a phone in the room. Double glazing didn't quite manage to keep out the noise from Drury Lane. No in room safe. Wifi was, I think ,20UKP for a week with a reasonably good connection. For the right price the hotel is fine for a couple of days, especially given the central location.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: stuart J
Reviews.Content: The window didnt shut properly. It was very noisey all night- got virtually no sleep. Building work outside added to the noise at 6am, and then a member of staff just let themselves into my room at about 8.30- obviously wanting me to get out! Hairs in the bed. food and drink over priced and not very nice! Some of the staff were quite helpful and friendly, otherwise it would have been the worst experience ever!

Reviews.Title: “Bad example of a Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: bianca_willis
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Travelodge's all over the country and you expect a certain standard but we were very disappointed with the state of the rooms. The bed was very uncomfortable and backed onto a corridor fire door which didn't have a soft close on it so every time someone went through it the noise and vibration reverberated through the bed and the room. It was clean, however, the shower rail which looked like it had previously been reattached with duct tape and was hanging back from the ceiling. Only two bedsides lamps and the bathroom light were working so it was very dull in the room. We got an ironing board and an iron from Reception which had definitely seen better days. It was very hard to get a table at breakfast between half 8 and half 9 and staff were very slow in clearing dirty plates, etc from the tables. The breakfast buffet had a lot of choice. The location was excellent, only a five minute walk from Covent Garden Station. The staff were friendly and helpful but wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: TripAddictorrr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2011, were disappointed at first (we got there late at night, had quite a tiresome trip and last thing we hoped to see was the poor condition of our rooms - one not even ready for us). Asked to change the rooms, got the top floor ones with marvelous view (Big Ben and Westminster Abbey) and fell asleep somewhat satisfied. Everything was much brighter in the morning. After a nice hot breakfast and realizing how absolutely fantastic the location of the hotel actually was, we rest assured that the choice was more than clever. Towels changed every day, a Sainsbury's 7-11 five minutes walk as well as the tube station Holborn (blue and red lines). Trafalgar, Westminster, Piccadilly, Covent Garden - all in 10 - 15 mins walk! The only bad thing about the rooms were these restricted windows that could not be opened wide, the shower was feeble and a lack of safe box or something. If you are after central location and don't have an idea of luxury rooms when visiting London - this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO THERE!!”
Reviews.Author: The Main Hen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on our anniversary! What a big mistake! The room was like something out of the 1950s, worse that staying in the "old" holiday camps!! The bathroom was disgusting, see photos! We had one bath towel and one hand towel for two people and had to use our mobile phone to phone reception as there are no phones in the rooms!! They broght us another hand and bath towel and the next day we had to ask again as the cleaner had only left us one of each! This place needs a total revamp, how people must be surprised at such dreadful accommodation when they arrive and because it's London trying to find an alternative at the time of arrival is almost impossible! So DON@T GO THERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, 5 mins walk to Covent Garden and Tube”
Reviews.Author: beebutler
Reviews.Content: We were a little concerned about staying at this hotel after reading some of the reviews on here! We stayed for 3 nights and were pleasantly surprised and relieved! We got the train and then the tube and the hotel was easy to find. Quick check in on the machine which gave us our room (519) and our key card. The room was in the Drury Lane building facing out over London, we could see the London Eye and lots more. Clean and functional, lacking in towels but had no problem getting more at reception. The bedside lights never worked, we did report it, staff were friendly and helpful but didn't resolve the problem. We didn't eat at the hotel as there are loads of cafes, pubs and restaurants nearby (get yourself a Tastecard and save 50% as long as its not a Fri or Sat). Covent Garden and the tube station were 5 mins away, we used an Oyster card which was quick and easy, bought online and posted to our home before we left. If you need a clean, comfy place to stay right in the centre of London near Theatreland this hotel is great. We paid just over Â£200 for the 3 nights, good value and right in the centre of London.

Reviews.Title: “Skimpy on the towels”
Reviews.Author: PinkButterflyUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double room where naturally you would expect two bath towels, however there was only one! We asked on the first night we checked in for an extra towel to be told there wasn't anymore at reception & the guy would bring one to the room. We ended up going to bed without receiving the towel. The next morning on our way out (one of us having had to use a hand towel for a shower!) we asked the receptionist again for a towel & complained. He said he would send one to the room while we were out. Imagine our disbelief when we returned later to find still only one towel & the cleaners had been in too. So on the third time of asking for a second towel my partner waited at reception until given a towel, instead of being fobbed off. What is so difficult with providing one towel per person?! The good points are the location most definitely. It is very handy for the West End & close to the action. 5 minutes from Covent Garden tube station. I suppose you can't expect the best when getting a hotel much cheaper than most in London, but I do expect enough towels. We didn't have the heat problem a lot of people have mentioned. We had a basement room which had air con in it, so that was another good point on a very hot weekend. This might have been because we couldn't open our windows though, being on the basement.

Reviews.Title: “A Good deal”
Reviews.Author: bigpapafrost
Reviews.Content: We booked this as we had a theatre show just down the road. After reading a few dofgy reviews on here we were abit nervous but when we got there we realized we shouldn't of worried. We stayed in the hotel over the road on Holborn road rather then the one on Drury Lane. This was just a minute walk and I reckon probably the better of the two. We had a swift service and when we got to the room it was clean, tidy and quite specious. walking distant to Oxford Street, Convent Garden and all the theatres. Didn't try food but each morning the breakfast area was very busy suggesting it was good. We walked a few yards to some cracking cafes and coffee shops on Drury lane. The bar always has an offer, last month they had 5 peroni for a tenner and this month 2 stella cidres for Â£6 so thats always good. Only downside of the hotel was in was blinking warm in there and the fan we "found " on the landing didnt really help but overall tidy hotel if yo just want a place to shower and sleep.Â£100 for two nights.....tidy

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, very clean and close to lots of attractions.”
Reviews.Author: JaneR53
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a Sunday night and got a real good deal. The staff were helpful and friendly and extra towels and a hairdryer were readily avaailable upon request. The rooms were very adequate plenty of room and were very clean. There was lots of choice for breakfast which at Â£6.99 was good value. Lots of attractions were close by and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and it shows”
Reviews.Author: LINS99
Reviews.Content: Ideal location, but you get what you pay for. Cheap for covent garden but it is far from comfortable or clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cjhbmc
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 6th august 2011 in a family room for 3 adults. Room was comfortable clean large on the 7th floor of the holborn building. Ideal location for a night well worth the money. Yes it is noise but it's central London.

Reviews.Title: “Travellodge your a disgrace”
Reviews.Author: traveller218
Reviews.Content: Stayed there after visiting freinds. Had herb sausage and mash for tea and found the same herb sausages for breakfast. The room was worn out with lino floor coming away from the wall in the bathroom. The sofa come bed was ripped on the edges and on our last night I placed my hand under my pillow to find a spring sticking out of the mattress. We left the next day and complained a few days later by e'mail only to be told in Travellodge return email that we should have lodged a complaint whilst there. Whats the difference. Also they never found any problem with the room on inspection. So I must of made this all up. I know one thing is that we will never stay at any Travellodge again, all I wanted was an opology. Not sure if there is a night club near here but you will be woken up through the night by gangs of youth's shouting and on our 2nd a fight broke out below our window.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: merlinandme
Reviews.Content: Travelodge Covent Garden is bare bones. An en suite room that offers little beyond a place to sleep and shower up. Not spiffy, a bit shabby, but our room was clean and serviced daily. We spent six nights, and we had clean towels everyday and clean bed linens every other day. The staff was friendly and helpful, always eager to supply whatever we asked for. And the location is superb. To find a hotel at this price in this place seems an impossible task. Close to both Covent Garden and Leiceister Square Underground, this hotel also offers easy access to theaters, pubs, restaurants. I love a luxury hotel, but generally the expense is lost on me because I am up in the morning and out of the room enjoying the city. So this hotel with its cheap cheap rates is a real solution to staying in expensive expensive London.

Reviews.Title: “Hot & Noisy - Pay the extra for somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Joey95
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this travelodge during a hot August weekend, we had the room on the Friday for Â£30 and Saturday Â£70 so a bargain for London and we probably got what we paid for. The hotel has 2 seperate blocks which are essentially different hotels with their own facilities, we stayed in the High Holborn block which we read on this site was the newer of the 2 (the other being on Drury Lane). There was no air conditioning and it was a weekend where temps were hot so we had to have the windows open, there was a nightclub nearby where the music played until 5am so be prepared for a restless nights sleep. You are warned of this on the travelodge website so I can't say they didn't let me know. Quickly the other positive and negative points of the hotel: + Location - Right in Covent Garden and walkable to Covent Garden&Holborn tube stations. Price - Book early on the website for a bargain. Clean - Doesn't seem as bad as some other Travelodges I've stayed at for stag/hen parties either. Space - Our family room was big and spacious - Noise - As detailed above Heat - No air con, not an issue in winter

Reviews.Title: “Family room for Â£29”
Reviews.Author: EscotiaIntrepid
Reviews.Content: Booked in April for an overnight stay to break up our journey North from a holiday on the South coast. Reception was efficient,room clean,plenty hot water for shower/bath.plenty tea coffee and towel's etc.We took breakfast,Â£7 50p each for my wife and i but the kid's ate free and it was an all you could eat affair so no complaint's there.We stayed in the "family section" of the hotel,Holborn ...Great location and for the price we paid unbeatable value.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but expensive”
Reviews.Author: BhuddaBean
Reviews.Content: One night was enough. Being caught in the Wimbledon season the price was sky high (>Â£200 a night bed and breakfast). Although clean, the room was very basic - double bed and smallish TV with limited viewing. Fixed desk (with kettle, tea and coffee) and chair in small alcove next to toilet and shower. No easy chair so lay on bed. Toilet and shower clean and in good condition but no toiletries such as soap or shower gel, and disposable plastic beakers. No room safe so tied my laptop (on business as I said) to the safety fixing eyelet in the floor when I sent out. No other fixings to use. Too basic for so high a price, the room was devoid of decoration or picture to help me feel more at home. No soul - just a cell really, though clean as I said. Breakfast was very much the self service type, including coffee, but bearable, including the hot food. Snack vending on the ground floor if peckish during the night. Quick check-in by machine at reception unless you have a company booking as I did. Reception in some disarray and it was busy. Everything else worked OK. Oh, and I might mention the fire alarm went off just when I had undressed for the night. Fortunately, it went off again after about 30 secs as I was struggling into some clothes. It could happen anywhere. At least the alarm was working. Hope I can find better next time I have to go to London.

Reviews.Title: “Served it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: emmspemms15
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my teen daughter , for a mini sightseeing , shopping theatre break .
