Our first room smelt a bit musty , and after looking in the bathroom and finding a sink full of brown water decided a change was needed! A quick trip to reception led to a room change with no fuss . Room a little shabby , but lovely and clean . Public areas very good , nice bar , had pizzas one night which were very good. The location is great , walking distance of Covent garden , and the theatre we went to , a Sainsburys nearby . Daughter loved the ben and jerries ice cream vending machine ! In the lobby . Bad point .... No air con and could only open the window a tiny bit and it was very hot !

Reviews.Title: “So so!”
Reviews.Author: wapitbe
Reviews.Content: Avoid room 33 like the plague, it is in the basement with a small strip of window looking into an underground car park so no natural light, it was freezing, the air con was on and could not be altered. Double room but only one bath towel plus a hand towel. Having said that, the room was only used for sleeping, you definitely wouldn't want to linger in it! Biggest minus point is you cannot leave your bags at the hotel if you arrive before 12pm (you pay extra for the 12pm check in) otherwise you have to wait and check in at 3pm. Only alternative is to take your bags to Charing Cross station and pay Â£8.25 per item plus the taxi fare!

Reviews.Title: “Location great; rooms awful!”
Reviews.Author: Smudge91
Reviews.Content: The location of this Travelodge is fantastic and that must be what you pay for. The rooms are not nice at all. Our room was painted a muddy orange and there were marks all over the walls. One of the lamp shades was broken and the bulb had gone in another light. Given the fact that the building curves round on itself, this lack of operating light made the room very dark. We were not supplied with enough towels and had to ask the cleaner for another one. There was mould all around the bath and the shower leaked all over the floor. I agree that the public area downstairs is really nice but the corridors are rather grotty. There is also an issue with drainage in the area outside the doors. Admittedly there had been quite a heavy rainstorm but we had to wade through inches of water to get out of the hotel to our taxi. In general I feel that the standard of Travelodge rooms has deteriorated when they used to be such a reliable option.

Reviews.Title: “Ok in Drury Lane ,avoid the site across the road like the plague”
Reviews.Author: Sc0tabr0ad
Reviews.Content: Please ensure you are not located in the building on Holburn/Museum Street. It was old, smelly and dirty.A twin room turned out to be a double bed and a camp bed. Admittedly there had been difficulties with the plumbing, but this could have been explained on arrival.The best part was breakfast the following morning. There wasn't any cups,glasses,croissants or knives(toast spread with fork,very innovative and extremely watered down juice.crowded room and dirty tables.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Theatres and shops”
Reviews.Author: nessy213
Reviews.Content: This hotel is five minutes walk from Convent Garden tube station. Check in was efficent and completed within minutes. Twin room on 4th floor was clean and quiet. TV didnt work but didnt really have time to watch it anyway. Beds very comfortable. Will recommend this hotel to friends and will definately use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for short stay”
Reviews.Author: dino07
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with some friends on a short trip away. It has just been renovated so everything was spanking new. The bar/restaurant/lobby area is not very big but it is bright and pleasant. We did not spend a whole lot of time here anyway so did not matter. The rooms are very basic but spotless and reasonably spacious considering it is central London. We didn't eat in hotel but got breakfast in a tiny deli right next door and it was perfect after a night on the tiles ;) Hotel is perfect location for walking around West End and we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location...but that's it”
Reviews.Author: WalesSteveE
Reviews.Content: Only stay here if you want to be in the heart of London and don't intend to spend more than a few minutes in your room. The hotel is very, very basic. I know Travelodges are budget hotels but why did the walls need to be painted grey, it was like sleeping in a prison cell. Everything is done using the cheapest, nasiest possible materials which makes the place very unwellcoming. Don't have the breakfast it's rubbish, there are better, cheaper cafes opposite. And by the way our room cost Â£160 per night - I don't call that cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointingly mediocre”
Reviews.Author: MyBigToe
Reviews.Content: When you dont go to a travelodge, you really dont expect much. a Room, a bed, a bathroom, some towels and a TV. We got one towel for two of us, and the hotel doesnt issue bath mats to step out on to after your shower, so when you go to use the toilet, the floor is soaking wet and your trousers (perhaps skirt) are soaking afterwards. The room is absolutely tiny, and the TV is so low, i kept catching it with my shoulder when walking between the tiny gap between the wall and bed. The view from our room was essentially the return corner of the same hotel. It was however, a lovely piece of concrete spoilt only by the lack of natural light available to it. Regardless of how poorly deisgned our room was, I have to say that the front desk staff were excellent and helped us whenever we needed it and had a good sense of humour. The hotels situation was good enough for a weekend in london, but not in the nicest part of covent garden and is more like Holborn area. Still, we paid Â£80, 3 weeks in advance. Next time, I'll use priceline again and get a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible and Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: flossy76
Reviews.Content: My two daughters and i stayed in the travelodge in Covent garden. The hotel itself was spot on for location, but unfirtunately that is the only good thing i have to say about this hotel. The toilet was leaking and we compalined twice about this, the curtains were hanging off the rails and did not close. Throughout the night we had some random person walk into our room, when we asked staff about it they did not know who the random person was. The breakfast was mediocre, the tables were dirty and the serviettes got stuck to them. I would never recommned anyone to stay in this traveldoge. It Cost over Â£200 and is definately not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “great for a 2 night stay”
Reviews.Author: krissbeach
Reviews.Content: great for theatre breaks, short walk to theaters shops & covent garden. great restaurant just around the corner called Sarastro, its like a theatre inside, great food & staff. the Hotel is clean, did not hear any noise at night, don't bother with breakfast its not very good, lots of places close by to eat, cost around Â£100 a night.,if you book early we booked the early check in so we could dump our bags, & used left luggage at the train station on day of departure. jump in a taxi to covent gardens on a Sunday around Â£12 well worth the money get there faster .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: lydiaibbotson
Reviews.Content: Standard travel lodge: not luxury but everything you need! Breakfast is moderate but the location is super!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean & great for groups... only let down = check in!!!”
Reviews.Author: AnneWillis
Reviews.Content: Booked this TL for a group of girls/women aged from 3 to mummy and nana ages! Was for a dance school trip to see the Wizard of Oz. (Wzard of Oz is AMAZING by the way!!!) After a train journey down from the north east we arrived at 10.45am into kings cross & with our show starting at 2.30pm, We had decided a few days before we visited to pre book all 6 rooms as check in from 12pm as this will only cost Â£10 per room (split 2 ways) i tried doing this on their web and as saver room could not amend even though to add something! Rang central res who said to contact hotel, i spoke to the hotel and the staff member said to email conf numbers/names and a CC to secure Early chk in and then will debit on arrival. When we arrived at the receptionn at Drury lane we were advised Whoops! they hadnt been reserved! The receptionist reserved 6 rooms on same floor close by and thought that it had been rectified! we were then asked to go across to the reception at the Holborn building and if rooms were ready we will get them maybe before 12pm We walked over and rooms were not ready and they were not aware of what the other reception had just done, the lady there even said the gentleman that i spoke to on the phone after emailing to confirm they had recieved it was new and he did not know what he was doing!! LOL! she then said if they knew we were coming they would of done our rooms first :-/ was quite a comical conversation! Eventually at 1pm we got 2 rooms on early check in (after changing our girls in the bar area as we were at a show at 2.30pm) paid the Â£20 and then put all bags etc in theose rooms upon return late on that night. There is NO LUGGAGE STORAGE! which stupidly i forgot to check until a few days before going also, As there were 24 of us staying at hotel when i booked initially i should of booked the next night and split the cost so we had somewhere to put bags.... as were were leaving from kings cross at 7.30pm we decided to do the secure bag drop at the station at Â£8.50 per bag. If the above had not happened and check in was smooth then i would of given the hotel 5 out of 5.... ok its not the Ritz but TBH for Â£55 for the room for the night it was more than adequate! especially as it worked out half that for me and my daughter as shared with another mum and daughter! We did opt for the Â£7.95 breakfast in the morning but this was only because 2 kids ate free per adult. It was a good selection of croisants, toasts, yogurts, fruit & cereals. Hot was Sausage, Tomatoes, Bacon, Beans and scrambled eggs. tea coffe and juice too. If we never had the children with us may of ate elsewhere but for that value cant fall off and also was easy with the little ones! We were on floor 5 and my room was 562 which i was a bit worried as right next to the lift shaft but never heard a thing from that, outside noise was a bit louder but being as in a central hotel in London maybe to be expected. One of the girls left their teddy in the room and we only realised when we were at London Zoo on the morning.... it was definitly in there but the cleaners said nothing was there... that was annoying but silly of us for leaving it there..... All in all would i stay here again = yes. recomend it = Yes if it was at the saver rate DEFINITLY! a bit gutted as have booked the London city road TL in jan (stayed at this one few yrs back)as the covent garden was coming up at Â£75.... friends looking to add and covent garden is now on the reduced rate.... shame as the the location is a bit better for walking into covent garden and the west end..... Ah well only paid Â£48 for the LCR Travelodge including breakfast for 3 adults and late checkout!!!! Go with Travelodge expectations and you shouldnt be disapointed ( obviously we stayed in the holborn annexe and not the main drury site so cant comment on their rooms although the reception/bar was extremly modern and looked all refurbed recently!?)

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm not all great”
Reviews.Author: SamTuddy
Reviews.Content: You certainly can't expect much when you can get a room for 20 pounds or so.... However I must say that the location is brilliant, the reception area is all new and lovely but the rooms feel like you are walking into an old school dorm! Whilst the rooms are big they are old and shabby. Very very basic. Bed is comfortable. No fridge in the room. Very cheap and cheerful. Service is limited . The one thing that really annoyed me was that they will not let you leave luggage, not even for a few hours. I find this ridiculous. In future I would book an extra night if I was flying out late... We didn't eat here so I can't comment on the food.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and well priced for centre of London”
Reviews.Author: MattBlossom
Reviews.Content: This Travel Ledge has improved greatly since I last stayed a few years ago. We used the automatic check-in screen which worked well and it even gave us our room key! The room was very clean and quite large and had coffee, TV etc. I had to pop to reception to ask for towels but that was ok, they were very apologetic. And the taps made a very comical noise when the water was running! The hotel is right in the centre of London and it's also right next to a car park - the hotel can validate your ticket to make the parking half the price - about Â£18 for a whole 24 hours is fab! Would highly recommend this hotel as you always know what you're getting with a Travel Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: popcorn31
Reviews.Content: Stayed with large group of girls for a hen weekend. Close to tube station,Good for what we needed. Rooms pretty much what you expect clean enough but some were shabby. JUST AVERAGE.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: lcoso
Reviews.Content: Travelodge, what can a person say? Don't expect some special things, but then again prices are low, rooms are clean, breakfast is great and location is incredible (well for this one). In Travelodge You get what you paid for, and for the price don't expect some crazy stuff, everything is there that You need. Ignore half of bad reviews. Location of this hotel is great! You are in Covent Garden, in the heart of West End for price that is few times lower that in other hotels on this location. Breakfast is typical Travelodge's "eat as much as You want" with english or continental choice. Dinning space is spacious and new. Reception is new, stuff is great with will to help. Hotel had two buildings and We stayed at Drury Lane building. Our room was for London very big and I mean big. Nearly 20 sq. metars, plus large bathroom. OK it was a bit shabby, but was OK. We had space for our luggage and for things we bought through day in London. Of course we got only one big and only one large towel but I asked to a guy who was in charge for two more towels and guess what? In the next days we were getting two pairs of towels. Only thing i didn't like, and because of that I gave 2 out of 5 was bed. I'm a big guy and the mattress was very, very uncomfortable. After 3 days i could sleep more than a few hours because my back were killing me. My girlfriend didn't sleep well also, but much better than me, well she is half my weight. Maybe it was just bad luck, maybe in other rooms mattresses are in much better condition. In short: OK hotel at great location for reasonable price. Only problem could be an old uncomfortable mattress. I'll stay here again, hoping to get lucky with comfortable bed next time.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a nights sleep don't bother staying here!”
Reviews.Author: PrincessFiona2
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay in this hotel and if you plan to have any sleep during your trip to London don't go to this Hotel. The even numbered rooms have a serious noise problem due to the pubs, taxi rank etc outside. The odd numbered rooms are slightly better but not much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, can't be beaten for the price”
Reviews.Author: Kyla68
Reviews.Content: I had doubts about staying here after reading reviews on this site. However, we were very pleased with our stay and wouldn't hesitate recommending this place to our friends. We were given a family room in the High Holborn building which was clean, tidy and well furnished. The beds were comfortable and we were given extra pillows on request. The staff were always helpful, and to be honest I think I would struggle to accommodate a family of four for 64 pounds a night anywhere else in central London. It was easy to walk to Covent Garden, Leicester Sq, Piccadilly Circus and Oxford St from this location. We would stay here again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff, horrible room.”
Reviews.Author: sopasopasopa
Reviews.Content: We chose this place as we were on a bit of a budget and couldn't find somewhere cheaper during the summer. The hotel is in Central London and about 8 mins away from Covent Garden. We checked in early -which costs an extra 10 pounds- as we didn't want to go around London carrying our bags until 3; they have self check in machines which are really good to avoid queues since this is a busy hotel. There was a mistake with our reservation but staff on the reception desk were extremely helpful and nice, they sorted things out for us immediately . Our room had a lovely view of a wall and it was really small. The "wardrobe" didn't have doors and there wasn't a bedside table, instead there was a tiny space between the bed and the headboard where you could put an alarm clock or mobile phone but nothing else. The TV was fitted to the wall but the space between the wall and the bed was so small (about 20 cms) that my boyfriend (who is 6 feet tall) couldn't go to the other side of the room without hitting his shoulder. The bathroom looked like an airplane or spaceship bathroom, it had plastic walls and it had a shower but no bath. To have a shower we had to put our toiletries on the sink and reach our for them as there's no space in the shower. We had to ask for extra towels because in a double room we only got one. Apparently all Travelodge hotels come with a kettle and super thin pillows, you have to use at least two to make a normal sized pillow. Of course this place is in London amongst residential areas so you can hear all the noise that comes with it during the night and the binmen in the morning. I wouldn't say we paid a cheap price for this room (80 something pounds) we really should have spent a bit more in a nicer hotel. At the end of the day we had to pay extra to check in earlier and to store our bags after we checked out which we wouldn't have had to do in any other half decent place.

Reviews.Title: “BASIC BUT OK”
Reviews.Author: Pat06_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after a visit to Les Mis if you ignore the fact that despite booking two rooms 4 months previos and confirming them an hour before we arrive they let one out and we were put in rooms apart from one another(we had complimentary breakfast as compensation).TV remote was broken ,could not get extra pillows only 1 towel between two of us (they sorted it) the rooms were basic and tired .Having said all that for Central London 5 mins from Covent Garden if I was to come to London again I would stay there just on Price alone.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but no excuse.......”
Reviews.Author: BlueEyesGal
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here. He was on business course and I was with him for the leisure time to explore London. The only good point about this hotel is the location. The lighting in the room was awful, especially the orange strip that lit up in the headboard on the bed. There was just a metal rail with two pieces of MDF either side and ontop to make a shelf. Another piece came off to one side to make a desk with a horrible plastic chair. No bedside cabinets and no drawers to put other items of clothing. Not enough plug sockets near the beds. The bathroom wouldnt look out of place in caravan. There was no where to put your toiletries whilst having a shower and the shower curtain was the cheapest thinist flimsy material. You can borrow a hairdryer from reception but on collecting it was a tiny travel one. Also there is no luggage room, so if you are checking out and not leaving London till later in the day you will have to go and pay for it to be stored at a train station of carry it around with you. Just because its a Travelodge it is no excuse as people are still paying customers. We have stayed in the Russell Hotel previously and wish we had done so this time.

Reviews.Title: “Can find better place”
Reviews.Author: lisverlinde
Reviews.Content: Poor service, Never change bedsheet until you request. Need to buy showergel and pick up towels, toilet rolls from counter. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Room ok but mirrors need relocating”
Reviews.Author: LesleyGYork
Reviews.Content: We regularly stay at this location and on this occasion we were given a room in the newly refurbished section of the Drury Lane site. Yes the rooms are basic but it was clean and comfortable. My only gripe, like other reviewers, was the lack of a mirror above the desk which is where the sockets are located. Trying to dry my hair with the mirror on the far wall was a bit of a struggle.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: sahbi10
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel whenever I visit London and must say that it is good value for money especially if you can book in advance and get the Â£29 offer. It is in a great location very close to all the Theatres and the West End. The hotel is basic but clean so if you are going to see a Show this place is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “A good cheap sleep in Central London”
Reviews.Author: EssexTrilobite
Reviews.Content: I lived in London for 20 years and now when I come back to visit friends I always stay in a Travelodge - everything I need at an affordable price. This is the second time I've stayed at Covent Garden. The location is amazing for anyone who wants to experience the buzz of London (though if you're not keen on noise or crowds probably best to go elsewhere). Its clean and reliable and the staff are really nice which is amazing considering the size of the place and the amount of hassle they must face. If you want the "hotel experience" of hairdryers, toiletries, trouser presses etc find somewhere else as Travelodge isn't really a hotel in quite the normal sense. However, in Central London expect to pay two or three times as much or else end up in a real dive.

Reviews.Title: “Sticky bible”
Reviews.Author: GlosOsprey
Reviews.Content: Took my daughter to the big city and chose this hotel for its location to the city centre and its value for money. However there is value for money and then there is this hotel. The only saving grace was the buffet breakfast which was very nice. The room however was less than basic with a window which wouldn't close properly, curtains that didn't touch in the middle, stains on the painted walls and when my daughter decided to have a look at the bible provided - it was sticky!!!!! Even as a place to rest your head for the night I would have to seriously think about using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Just like a cat carrier but less luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Trixie_B_100
Reviews.Content: Honestly, This hotel was cheap - it's in a great location.. No phone in the room, no hair dryer, not shampoo or anything. You can get a hair dryer and an iron and ironing board from reception, and they will allow you to buy food downstairs and bring it to your room. Every surface is wipe down, and really for the price, it's just somewhere to lay your head. Clean linens and sanitary carpet, and a comfortable bed. but this aint the Ritz.... Every surface is wipedownable and it's a bit bleak - but lets face it, just a short walk away from covent garden, you don't really want to stay in the room much anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, functional, great location”
Reviews.Author: Chaz-b98
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this area of London before, but this was a last minute getaway, and as it was Wimbledon Week, accomodation was in short supply. I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel, as TL don't have an overly good reputation. The hotel's location is great for accessing central London, with 2 tube stations only 5 mins walk. The room was basic, as you'd expect, but clean and functional, and the beds were comfortable. The corridors were a bit tatty, and one of the lifts wasn't working. The full buffet breakfast is worth having, as it does set you up for a day's sightseeing, and the great location of the hotel means you are ready to go almost as soon as you are out of the door. There are plenty of nearby pubs for eating out in the evening within 10 minutes walk. On the downside, the extra Â£10 for a before 3pm checkin was a tad galling, and no luggage store was available for a late departure. Tip - Go to the National Gallery in Trafalgar Square, where you can store small items of luggage for a donation of Â£1

Reviews.Title: “great location for the West end and the BM.”
Reviews.Author: ChesterVitalspark
Reviews.Content: We needed an overnight stay somewhere handy for the British museum . One of the party booked a month in advance for Â£96; the other one[ me ] decided to go at the last minute and was charged Â£235. The moral of that story is "book well ahead". However, the rooms were quiet ,surprisingly spacious, spotlessly clean with well functioning bathrooms.The staff were unfailingly courteous and helpful. Breakfast was good value. The corridors were looking rather tired but the bedrooms seemed to have undergone a recent refurbishment. We would happily use it again- only grouch is that it doesn't have a left luggage facility- ; if, like us ,you're catching an afternoon train because of the lower rail fares ,a free left luggage room saves the hefty charges at the mainline stations.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you would want from a Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: grandslam43
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights for a short break. Very good rates considering its location (barely 5 minutes walk from the main market in Covent Garden). Stayed in the refurbished complex which was very clean and comfortable. Nice bed, tv and bathroom (although only provided one towel?!). The staff were helpful enough although they will absolutely not let you check-in before 2.30 so either book a late check-in or plan your trip around it. If you're just looking for a good base in a great location this is a very good value option.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: halfastep
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and was very impressed with the service we had. Staff were very good and we had no problems getting checked in. The rooms are basic but thats going to be the case with a place in Central London where you can get a double room for less than Â£70 per night. The room was very clean however and the bed was comfortable. The bar area was very nice and modern. Beware of the hot water though...I'm not sure if it was just our room but it was boiling to the point that when I accidentally turned the dial the wrong way I was scalded...and I mean scalded! Reported the problem to reception and was told that the problem would be looked at but I would recommend you get out of the shower before turning it off just in case. Had breakfast at the hotel which was lovely and all very well cooked. Would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel room we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: roberts058
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night as we were going to a concert in Covent Garden and wanted somewhere close by. We didn't get the room on any kind of special deal so paid the room rate of Â£145 despite booking more than a month in advance. The location of the hotel is good for the tourist areas and is the only positive for this hotel. The downstairs of the hotel (bar and restaurant area) seems like it has been renovated although it smelled pretty bad. Beyond that the hotel is in disrepair and looks very tired. Our room was on the third floor. We have stayed in budget hotels all over the world so we were expecting it to be basic but what we found was terrible. The room was really small and cramped, the bed was so soft it seemed like there were no springs in the mattress anymore and we both ended up in a sort of crater in the middle, there were 3 really thin pillows, a couple of hard towels, and no toiletries of any kind. We had the worst night of sleep ever as the window in our room was jammed open a crack and would not close so it was pretty noisy. The bathroom was grubby and old and neither of us wanted to use the shower. Awful. This hotel is not worth the prices they charge. Only stay here if you get it on a very special deal and don't mind a really really soft bed.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, a Travelodge, but good.”
Reviews.Author: SLJDOGS
Reviews.Content: Was almost put off staying here by some of the bad reviews on this site but glad we weren't. Acknowledged that a stay in virtually any hotel can be a lottery, we have no complaints. The room was clean, the staff friendly and helpful, and the location great.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time and still impressed!”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandTinks
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for 4 nights while in London with a friend. This is the 3rd time I've stayed in the HIgh Holborn building, and the 3rd time it's been near perfect. Check in was nearly smooth - the folks in front of us were having a bit of an issue and therefore a queue built up. However it was quickly dispersed when another person came on to help. I think the idea of having the self service check-in machines were a good idea - just not sure that having them right infront of the actual reception desk is the best place for them - hence the queue! The room was big, and bathroom spotless.There was a plentiful supply of towels over our 4 night stay, and the room was cleaned each day. The only downside was the noise coming from a nearby nightclub in the early hours - which was in competition with the usual sirens. However, as we were in central London this comes with the territory. As far as value for money's concerned you really can't beat this hotel, particularly if you get a bargain in the Travelodge Sales. Have never stayed in the building at the top of Drury Lane so can't comment on that one. In the 3 times I've now stayed here I've never had to use a tube to get anywhere - it's just so handy for everything. Shopping, museums, theatre, sightseeing - you name it we did it. I've never eaten in the hotel, preferring to use a fab little cafe round the corner for breakfast, and eaten dinner elsewhere. All in all I'll certainly stay here again, and would recommend anyone looking for value for money accomodation. The Hilton it isn't, but it doesn't claim to be! You know exactly what you're getting.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location shame about the noise.”
Reviews.Author: CheshireFernando
Reviews.Content: This Travelodge is ideally situated for the West End and Bloomsbury. The staff were efficient and polite and very helpful. However we stayed on one of the lower floors with a window on to Museum Street and the noise from the nearby Taxi Office was constant from midnight to 4 in the morning. Families should ask for higher rooms or rooms on the other side of the hotel. Apart from the noise it was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: oddjob58
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the previous reviews i can only say i was very pleasantly surprised. The room ok it was basic but very clean and comfortable we were in room 60 on the ground floor overlooking the road the noise was minimal. The staff were friendly and helpful breakfast was maybe not as tasty as it could have been but was very reasonable for the price.Covent garden and holborn stations within easy walking distance as is Trafalgar square and most theaters plenty of pubs and restaurants around too.I get the feeling that some people expect too much from a budget hotel if you want pampering then pay the money on a posh hotel...tho i find them a trifle snooty i would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, but hotel left a bit to be desired”
Reviews.Author: sugacube
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge in Covent Garden for our wedding anniversary in June. Not too glamorous for an occasion such as a wedding anniversary I'm sure you'll agree, but prices for London hotels are so expensive that this was the best we could afford. And our actual anniversary treat was a meal at Gordon Ramsay's Maze Grill so we wanted to save our money for that! Our experience of Travelodge's in the main is that they are all of a standard you can expect, basic but clean, comfortable and well located. And this one was indeed well located and clean, but not at all comfortable! The hotel itself is a 5 minute walk from Covent Garden and bus and tube stops, so ideally located for sightseeing, shops, bars and restaurants. The hotel has two buildings, the main one (pictured) and another less glamorous looking building just around the corner. When we say the hotel is not comfortable, it was incredibly warm and as the windows only open a crack we couldn't get any air into the room making it very uncomfortable and difficult to sleep on a warm night. The plumbing also had issues. The pipes were very noisy and when a tap was run or the toilet flushed, the pipes clanked for about 20 mins afterwards! Also the power of the shower was abysmal, just a trickle and nowhere near enough to rinse the shampoo from my hair. Saying that, we'd probably stay there again simply for its price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: FussyTraveller38
Reviews.Content: Was worried when I read the reviews but having just spend 3 nights at this hotel I was pleasantly surpised. Ok its not the hilton but you get what you pay for. The location is fab! Our room was on the 3rd floor of the older building. The street below can be noisy but you must realise that you are in central London. Our room was basic but very clean. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. We asked for extra towels, pillows, iron and ironing board all of which was supplied without any bother. We didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on the food. The bar area was lovely and drinks very reasonable. Its ideal for a weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but that's it!”
Reviews.Author: Tibby26
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights as a base for a sightseeing tour of London. Chosen for location, which was excellent, only 5 minutes walk from Trafalgar Sqaure, so very convenient. Other than that, breakfast was OK. Everything else terrible! There were 3 couples in our party. We got allocated the worst room of the 3, in a type of basement, down windy stairs - I wouldnt have liked to be a solo female traveller heading firstly outside and then down to the basement at night! Our room was dark and smelt of damp, and there was a window at pavement level which you couldnt open. Carpet was dubious - I kept my socks on all the time when in the room! Bed although large was very soft, and the pillows were so thin they may as well have not been there! There were 2 towels in the room when we arrived, one hand towel and one bath towel, both of which were nearly threadbare, and hardly adequate for two people! Towels were not replenished during our stay, we had to ask at reception for towels every day, and received towels which were stained - nice. Room was quiet, although walls between rooms very thin, and you dont need to have the volume on your TV if next door is watching the same thing! Breakfast OK, self service, good enough selection but cutlery and crockery dirty. Staff were mostly unfriendly and unhelpful, particularly reception but Jeremy and the asian lady on breakfast were exceptions to the norm. My parents in law got a disabled room with a wet room, which was fine but the shower flooded the room and the water did not disperse for hours! Have stayed in Travelodges before and been pleasantly surprised, but definitely not on this occasion. Depsite location I would pay extra and walk further not to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Summertime37
Reviews.Content: Great value for such a central location especially if u can book ahead or stay midweek. Clean, decent rooms

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: matthewss4
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a twin room in the Drury Lane Hotel with my daughter for one night when we came to see a show. Room was basic but clean, everything worked - shower, kettle, TV. Only paid Â£49.50 plus Â£10 for early check in - well worth the price for the location. If you want luxury, pay luxury prices. It's only a place to sleep and was perfectly fine. Breakfast at Â£7.65 each was excellent - self service and plenty of choice, all well cooked. Staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. We didn't have any problem with noise as others have reported. Would definitely use this hotel again and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “When it's good it's ok, when it's bad it's appalling!”
Reviews.Author: alexjw80
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a 7th floor room a few months beforehand and having found that experience ok I wasn't too worried about booking another night here. This time however, the experience was awful! I was in room 150 and the first problem is the signage to the room. The first sign you saw took me to the lift so I got off at floor 1 only to find the sign for 150 still pointing up which I thought was strange. So to floor 2 I go, no sign of 150 on any signs now. Back to the first and then the ground floor and walk a few corridors to look for it. Still nothing. Only then did I notice another sign for 150 (not the one pointing to the lift) which eventually took us to the room, but via a flight of stairs, not a lift. All this at 10:30pm and after a long journey is not what you need. Once in the room, every 5 minutes the door at the end of the corridor banged shut very loudly. Also, being the 1st floor you're quite close to the road, which although looked like a seemingly quiet road was actually very noisy. I kept on having to check the window was still shut at times in the night as you could hear every word passers by said, let alone every passing vehicle. The toilet flush was hopeless and a few hours after finally managing to flush, it all slowly works its way back into the toilet! Absolutely disgusting. I can only hope that it wasn't anybody else's toilet waste in there. As you can imagine, the smell in the bathroom (as the sink drain also stunk) was not nice. Then just to top everything off, on the way to breakfast the following morning there was a 'waterfall' coming through the ceiling in the corridor. Luckily not near our room, but I hate to think what the people staying right underneath this torrent were putting up with!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, avoid, avoid”
Reviews.Author: awells
Reviews.Content: This place is truly awful. I had a room in a semi basement. It had a window onto an underground carpark and no natural daylight. The room smelt of cigarettes (disgusting) and damp (equaly disgusting). The room is bare; there is no bath only a shower. Everything is basic, and yet it cost Â£109. Rip off. The staff are surly and unhelpful. We wanted to leave some bags after we checked out. You cant. We wanted an iron and ironing board: there isntone available. We wanted a hairdryer: no. Dont be tempted by the central location. Premier Travel Inn at Euston or Kings Cross are MUCH MUCH better and cost about Â£20 more.

Reviews.Title: “Disoganised,disinterested dismal”
Reviews.Author: okwhatdoyouwant
Reviews.Content: Had not taken account of booking request.staff disintereted and nothing i can do attitude eventually tried and cobbled simething together. Rooms sparcleyfurnished,mimimum furnishings and fittings public areas grubby signage poor seemed understaffed at busy times all led to feeling of let down and lack of feeling adequately served

Reviews.Title: “Pared to the bone”
Reviews.Author: grumpychef
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night which was enough. Absolutely terrible bed, like sleeping in a sunken crater. Only one set of towels provided and three? pillows. Good location admittedly but absurdly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic and little service”
Reviews.Author: hitsambredi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights. First room was still dirty on arrival so I got a new one. Noisy area and windows need to be shut if you want to sleep during night in the summer. Very warm in room. They advertise that you can buy internet access to be used in room. I needed it for business reason. But reception was so poor it was literally unusable. Staff could not help and could not give me a refund. Internet company said they could not find a problem (on the phone...?) with the reception. I had to sit in the bar for internet access. Expensive but poor breakfast. Dry bread and rolls. British breakfast was ok, but still too expensive. I advice to rather find a cafÃ© nearby (e.g. towards the British museum) and eat breakfast there. Much better quality and mostly also cheaper. I would stay there again since it is difficult to find hotels with decent prices in central London but I did not enjoy my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing ,bland rooms. Unhelpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: springador
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights everynight I came back from work my card wouldn't work so back down 5 floors to get it working. No towels in room after being cleaned, reception staff rude and very unhelpful. Bar is unwelcoming,food is terrible. This was the only hotel in London that could do 3 nights, which is why I booked it, I will never come here again. No phone in room,no wardrobe just a rail , nothing in the shower to put your soap on,water pressure terrible. Could not wait to get out of this place. It spoilt my trip down here.

Reviews.Title: “Never again. Etaps are better. Worst Travelodge I have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: colininahill25610
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we were going to see Take That at Wembley. We arrived and the hotel reception area and bar seemed nice. That thought didn't last for long when we got to our rooms (2 rooms booked). We had no phone to ring reception so had to go down and ask for a hair dryer. There was no safe in the room and the one in our other friends room didn't work. The bedding and towels were dirty. The bathroom had one spotlight working out of 3 or 4 so was dark when trying to do anything. We reported this to reception when we went out and on our return nothing had been done. No toilet roll holder in either rooms as it looked like it had been wretched off both walls. Luckily we had packed toiletries and no shampoo dispenser or shower gel like you normally get in hotels. Neither of our TV's would work and we didn't even have any cupboard doors in our room either. We are well travelled ladies and this was one of the worst hotels we have ever stayed in. Being in Covent Garden we thought the hotel would be nice and for the price we paid we expected more. Very disappointed and it put a dampener on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “New rooms are great - Fab location”
Reviews.Author: martinlp1
Reviews.Content: Read many bad reviews on this hotel, and I was pleasantly surprised. This is a budget hotel, but I asked for a newly refurbed room and it was great. Clean quiet and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel disappointing, location good.”
Reviews.Author: ah100
Reviews.Content: First impression was not good; I paid extra for early check in and even though I arrived later than expected at about 2pm there was a struggle to find me a room. I was allocated a room on the 5th floor; the sofa bed was disgusting and the room had a very musty smell. I asked to change rooms. The next room I was given is on the second floor; 290 and had a much better feel to it. However, I feel that the sofa beds in this hotel should be chucked in the skip. Furniture and carpets stained. Breakfast was nothing special but everything was well stocked and seemed to run smoothly. In general the staff do not seem very happy and are not particularly friendly. In the fairness the bed was quite comfortable and this hotel is in a good location; 5 mins from Tottenham Court Road Underground. I paid around Â£100 for the room and around Â£8 for the breakfast and in my view this hotel is poor value. I would recomend this hotel only for the location. However, there are probably other hotels in the area that would provide a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “A typical travelodge!”
Reviews.Author: Clembo81
Reviews.Content: The good: - excellent location - comfy bed - bargain as booked in the sale - bath in room The bad: - first room had a damaged door (in the refurbished section) so had to change rooms -the next room was in the old part of the building -tired room with a stained carpet -staff speak VERY little English -had to get extra towels (when will travelodge learn to provide 2 towels in a double room?) Overall a great stay as the location and price (Â£50 pn) outweigh the bad points. Excellent base for a tourist break!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor on everything else”
Reviews.Author: Dontbookibiswembley
Reviews.Content: Booked a twin room... We were provided with one towel to share! You could ask for more towels at reception, if you fancied queuing for an hour behind everyone else! No hairdryer in the room either. Fancy flat screen tv which didn't work! No left luggage, meaning you either pay for late check out at 2pm or trail your cases around with you which isn't fun! Also very noisy at night!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location and price for a family room”
Reviews.Author: AnnCoco
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family last year (2 adults 2 teenage kids) Location was fantastic .Sunday night price is very cheap, No frills but we knew that. (Bring your own shampoos and shower gels). Bed linen and towels were clean.. We paid Â£10 extra for early check in and a further Â£10 for wi fi ( but we were aware of that too) .Definitely worth staying in.

Reviews.Title: “As good as you would expect being a travelodge.”
Reviews.Author: craneg91
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with friends for my birthday, it was fine rooms were small, but to be fair it's a travelodge not somewhere you would stay for luxury.. Great for one night room was very clean although my friends was damp and immediately got moved to a different room and got half her money back which was decent of them. Great for people who like us stayed for birthdays hen nights etc :)

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: BoroBookGirl
Reviews.Content: This is a very large hotel over two sites, just a few seconds' walk apart on either side of High Holborn. I stayed in a single room in an unrefurbished part of the Drury Lane site. I've stayed in the hotel before, but in rooms that had been more recently updated and found them to be of good, basic, quality - just what you expect from the travelodge brand. This stay was however a disappointment. The room I stayed in was extremely dated and downright shabby. The bedlinen was clean, and the bed comfortable enough, but the general appearence of the room (eg; scuffed furniture, cracked tiles) and corridors was depressing. There was no net/voile at the window, although it was very much overlooked, and the remote for the tv was AWOL (not that that was a problem, the single room was so small I could reach the tv from the bed quite easily!) The bathroom, although appearing clean on the surface, had the same worn-out, run-down quality. The shower fittings were damaged, but the water pressure and temperature were fine. Thats's the bad, and the ugly, but there is also good. The reception and cafe-bar area has been refurbished and is smart, clean and unfussy. When I arrived I was welcomed by friendly, smiling staff and guided through using the self check-in machines - very quick and easy. I had no problems with noise in my part of the hotel. The location on Drury Lane is the real selling point of this hotel, ideal for seeing central London sights, especially the West End - although it might be more geographically honest to call it the Holborn travelodge, as that is the closest tube station, just a few minutes' walk away. The price, I paid Â£34 for a Sunday night, at this location is hard to beat, and I would certainly stay here again *if* I could be sure I'd be a refurbished part of the hotel. Tip: Don't bother with the buffet breakfast on site, nip over the road to the "Ideal Sandwich Bar" (actually a sit-down cafe), opposite the New London Theatre, for a far better, and cheaper, meal to set you up for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great price -- worth it”
Reviews.Author: ngsosu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and were pleasantly suprised. The hotel is clean and tidy and we had no problem getting the service we needed. The hotel has a bar and also serves breakfast for an additional fee. The breakfast is a good deal especially if you want to get a quick start on the day and not have to search for food. The location is unbeatable. It is two blocks from the Tube, right across the street from a theatre, and walking distance to many sights. We had no complaints. The room is rather quant, but most rooms in London are. You won't have a tub, but rather a standup shower. The room is small, but has all we really needed since we hardly spent any real amounts of time in it. Don't overlook this place -- it is a bargain for London and will meet the basic tourist's needs!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints - it was fine”
Reviews.Author: MissBugg
Reviews.Content: I don't normally review Travelodges as they are usually consistent, I was worried by what I read but it was fine. I stayed in the Drury Lane building, it was clean and newly refurbished. Staff were friendly and helpful, it even had a bar that was quite lively. No complaints at all. Yes it a bit noisy in the street outside but you're slap bang in the middle of the West end so you can't have it always!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff, Rooms basic furnishings but clean, no complaints at all”
Reviews.Author: topbananaBristol
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 3 night stay here. Was slightly concerned after reading previous reviews, however was pleasantly surprised. All staff we dealt with were polite, helpful and friendly. The rooms are basic in terms of furniture, but clean. Fine for the amount of time spent in the room as I'm guessing most people will want to be out and about in London, not the room. We stayed in High Holborn building, no problems with noise at all. Towels were changed daily and tea/coffee etc topped up. I would definitely stay here again when coming to London and would recommend it to others like us to whom location is more important than luxury! The location is excellent approx 5 mins walk to Covent Garden. Cost approx Â£14 in taxi from Paddington.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service/rooms ever”
Reviews.Author: NCarroll
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friend recently booked a Travel Lodge in Marylebone only to find out on arrival (3am) that they had given away our room (despite having rung ahead) and we were sent to Travel Lodge Covent Garden. Apparently, something Travel Lodge do quite often to guest who book months in advance!! Worst hotel i have ever stayed in. Staff were unpleasant, we were met by 4 guys behind the desk, one gave us a room which was already occupied by a guy, who we scared half to death at 4am and then gave us a smelly room in the basement. No towels were provided, we had to go back to reception to get these. Room was down a number of grotty, smelly staircases. Never ever booking with travel lodge again. We were offered compliementary breakfast...starting at 7am despite the fact they knew we were checking out at 6.30 so that was handy! Avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location - very central!”
Reviews.Author: Looby1977
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean, comfortable and conveniently located. Bed was comfortable, bathroom was clean. Only a 5 minute walk to some of the main attractions in London. It is what you expect from a Travelodge. We only stayed the one night, but everything was ok. Had a lovely breakfast there - all you can eat buffet style. Staff were courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A decent nights sleep for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Globalloco
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the TL for three nights in the main building which has been refurbished in a double room. Good Points Nice spacious room Newly refurbished bathroom Flat screen TV Bad Points No toiletries No hairdryer No iron No phone in room You get what you pay for, lacks some amenities and staff attitude is rubbish. But for Â£125 pn in Covent Garden during Wimbledon you can't complain!

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Luff78
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel. There s no frills and then there is no frills. Stayed here for business this week and couldn't even get an iron in the morning for my shirt. Not only were there none at reception then had a) no idea when they would get some back or b) which rooms they had gone to so they could go and get them back if they had been there for a long time. If you are going for business GO SOMEWHERE ELSE.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but otherwise awful - Avoid”
Reviews.Author: katckam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as having our bathroom refitted and decided would be nice to see a show and stay somewhere central in order to walk to work the next day - so location excellent and by coincidence, our show was in theatre next door so couldn't be better. I have no fault with reception staff, who were courteous and did their job. I checked in via the machines but was directed to another building by the helpful receptionist who was very polite. Room itself was fairly spacious and clean. Towels were like sandpaper, mattress was so soft you sat on it and just sank. TV small for size of room. Room was overlooking busy main road (you are warned about this on the website and we packed earplugs), no blinds/voile or any thing other than curtains to give you privacy so these had to be closed. Room unbearably hot so had to have windows open but then too noisy to sleep. Even with windows closed and ear plugs in, the noise was too great for any sleep. We were supposed to stay 2 nights but checked out after one and I got a refund with no problem, we'd paid in advance. The price for the first night was ok considering the location but the second night was double the price (presume because of Wimbledon). No toiletries at all in the room which having stayed in a Travelodge recently I know is not standard. I would stay here again if desperate (would ask for a room away from road) and was on a cheap deal but for the second night, the charge was Â£145. We found a B&B close to home, Â£80 a night, lovely room, toiletries, fluffy towels, breakfast included, quiet, big tv with all freeview channels, lovely helpful staff and even a garden, free wifi. (Aber B&B for those not needed to be in central London) Come on Travelodge, you can do much better than this, the hotel needs a facelift or at least something to deaden the noise, warning people on the website is insufficient. When earplugs make little difference, you know there's a problem. Avoid if you want a good nights sleep

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CardiffTilly
Reviews.Content: The worst, dirtiest, noisy, unhelpful, disgusting, and hideous hotel i have ever stayed in!!!! It was not cheap, Â£340 for 6 of us!!!! Please do not book this hotel, it was filthy!!! The other guests were loud and i could not get to sleep until 5 in the morning because of the noise!! Dreadful place, will NEVER stay in a travel lodge again!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than last time”
Reviews.Author: LittleMissBrightside
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on June 23rd and found it to be a lot better than our previous stay. I think that this time we must have been in the newer part of the building. We were greeted on arrival - a first for Travelodge! Self check-in was straightforward enough and our room(363) was fine. Breakfast was good value, by London standards anyway. The location of this hotel is a big bonus and we will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “TRAVELODGE YOU SHOULD BE ASHAMED OF THIS DUMP .............”
Reviews.Author: kel241
Reviews.Content: I would advise you only stop at this hotel if you have no sense of smell, are very hard of hearing, don't mind extreme heat as their is no air conditioning and like to be spoken to like a piece of s**t by the reception staff. If you must book and stay here I would check that you are up to date on your jabs. Ok, where to start, it does say on the web site there maybe some local bar noise and traffic noise but to be kept awake for two nights by constant screaming and colourful potty mouth language was a bit too far on the noise stakes. I'm also not sure from other comments where the refurb had taken place but I can tell you room 704 was a dump, it was damp, the bathroon floor was filthy, you needed to keep your shoes on to walk around the bedroom as the carpets were that nasty. As for what we saw in the rest of the hotel, only one lift was working so you waited ages, the corridors smelt like something had died in them, the paint and wallpaper was peeling or stained and there was also damp ceiling tiles. As for the reception staff, not sure what charm school they went to but they didn't pass with flying colours, they were very rude and be wary of asking them to book you a taxi, you get a private hire driver and not a black cab, which quoted us Â£21 from Covent Garden to Hyde Park until I questioned him and managed to get it down to Â£15 and even that is about Â£6 over priced. All I can finally say is I know this hotel is slightly cheaper than some others but for the bad experience you will receive it's really not worth it......

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL I'VE EVER STAYED IN.”
Reviews.Author: holidaygirl29
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Dury Lane Travelodge late afternoon and we had comfirmed that we had rooms on the same floor as the rest of our party but, the assistant at the desk had know idea what we were talking about and we ended up with a room on the 3, 4 , and 5th floor. This also took round about twenty minutes which delayed us in getting ready, and were late for our dinner reservation. When we got back from dinner, we found that in our "family sized" room; which had a double bed and a "sofa- bed", the "sofa-bed" was dirty and wasn't at all a sofa bed, it was a cusion that we ourselves had to put sheets of and clean up as it was too dirty to sleep in, the other side of the sofa bed had also dirty quilts and we resorted to sleeping on top of the quilt. The cusion had also to be on the floor as there was no stand for it to go on, which the carpet looked as if it hadn't been cleaned in a month. The plug socket was hanging out and we thought too dangerous to plug in our phone chargers. The wall was covered in staines of goodness knows what! The window wouldn't open and the bathroom stank of waste. DO NOT STAY HERE! It is cheap but not cheerful. It is worth paying an extra Â£10 for a better hotel. I can safely say that it was the worst hotel we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin! Good for a tourist base.”
Reviews.Author: MrsMac2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Travelodge on a business trip as my normal hotels were booked up as it was Wimbledon week. Not the prettiest of hotels but perfect for tourists who just need a base to sleep. Great location near Covent Garden. Check in ------------ There were a couple of self-check in machines available if you had booked on-line. i had a few issues with reception as they wanted to charge me for the room but this was a mixup between our company booking system and them I think. I asked if they had a map they could give me and I was told it was in the other building??? My room was through into the other building (but didn't find any maps) They could very easily just print out an A4 local map and leave in rooms or reception for guests to take) Room --------- Room was really quite large (compared to some hotels) very comfy bed. Basic room with an unexceptional view facing another building so I had no daylight and couldn't open my curtains as everyone could see straight in. No wardrobe just a small rail (which is fine if you're just staying a couple of nights) Bathroom was obviously recently refurbished as it was spotless, no niceties just a small bar of soap. Again fine if you have your own with you. I never use hotel hairdryers as I usually find them to be too basic but there wasn't one in the room anyway! (Assume you could have got one from reception if you needed one) However from a working woman's point of view the plug socket was on the desk but there was no mirror there, the mirror was about 20 feet away so it was quite difficult to see if you wanted to dry your hair, I did ask at reception for an extension lead but was told they didn't have any. Again something really simple to fix by putting in a small mirror over the desk. (Maybe they assume guests don't bother drying their hair?) Breakfast -------------- breakfast was a help yourself buffet, good range of cereals, I didn't have a cooked breakfast so can't comment on that. It was nice though to be able to help yourself to tea and coffee. On the whole a good basic hotel for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sal12345
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Found the location quiet and a good base for visiting different places in central London. Room was good size but dull due to dark tint on window. Had to ask for extra towel as only one in room despite room booking stating two people staying. Also had to return to reception late at night for extra pillow as none were available. Bar area very good with some good offers. Overall decent place to stay, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Lingo72
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the HIgh Holborn building for a Fri - Sun break primarily to go and see Shrek so the location was perfect. Actually it is a great base if your doing some sightseeing or whatever as Holborn tube is a short walk away, with plenty of bus routes too, and Covent Garden and Soho are all within easy walking distance. Really can't fault the location. Plenty of eateries and pubs right on your doorstep too. Checked in early for a tenner and broke the automatic check-in machine! So keycards etc done manually but quick and no probs. First floor room great, spacious, plenty of pillows, towels etc. Asked for extra tea sugar and milks and were left loads so no shortages for a cuppa first thing in the morning or at night after getting in. Didn't want to have breakfast there because at Â£7.50 each you can get an absolute feast elsewhere for Â£15, although kids do eat for free which is great. However, Sat morning was resigned to the fact (decided for me really!) that we were going to have breakfast in the hotel. Went down and the lad who was clearing tables showed us to a table and off we went to fill our plates. The choice was excellent and the bacon was brilliant. But best of all was no-one came to check us against their list for pre-paid guests. So full bellies and free breakfasts all round! I don't feel guilty about it as there was a girl kept coming from the kitchen with endless replens of bacon and sausages! Had a meal there in the evening which cost Â£20 for the three of us. Could do with more choice on the menu but reasonably priced and it filled a hole. Staff were really helpful, room was clean, telly worked, although could do with a TV guide so you know exactly what channels you've got. Overall fantastic, especially if you're after no frills and in need of a base while down London. The Savoy it definitely isn't but we all know that, does exactly what it says on the tin. One extra thing the internet access in the restaurant can be a bit hit and miss and is Â£1 for 20 minutes, but we went onto the London Zoo site and started playing the Penguin game on there and I noticed the countdown timer for your online time stopped so my little girl got a good 90 minutes play time which is great for 4-year olds!

Reviews.Title: “Good value as a base for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: volleyqueenYork
Reviews.Content: The rooms are functional rather than luxurious but that is what you would expect for this price and location. Staff friendly and room was very clean although lacked a little natural light as small window and the view was a disused building. No heating in the bathroom for towels and shower only. Breakfast good value and surroundings more cafeteria than dining room. Ideal if you are using just to sleep in but if you want to relax in the hotel it is worth paying a little more for nice lounge/bar areas and a little more comfort in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the city of London for basic clean hotel room if that's all you need"”
Reviews.Author: Hotelinspector08
Reviews.Content: Booked on line with a months notice and got a good rate. Good value for a room that was quiet large, tea and coffee plus towel and a cake of soap. Internet was free in the reception area (great for I phone use) and took advantage of the late check out for 10 pounds extra. Customer service at the reception and from staff was generally very average with a poor attitude. Don't try and check in before time or you will be hit with the early fee, even a half an hour and you will be charged. Food and bar facilities seem good. Good for a few nights in London but would never pay the full listed rate for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly nice”
Reviews.Author: DJS23
Reviews.Content: The double room was large and the service was good. We slept well and enjoyed the breakfast in the large eating area. It's a busy hotel but they manage well. Great for a budget trip to London or a stop over. Can't really beat the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean rooms no real complaints”
Reviews.Author: travelbugjen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with work for one night in May. Close to Holborn underground station. Arrived at the hotel and had to check in using the machines - so no help from the two attending receptionists, so if you dont want the personal touch, you will be fine. I had room 800 and something. My room looked onto another building so no nice view or anything. The room was very basic. No wardrobe, but a pole wiht a few hangers, a small desk and tea/coffee making facilities. There was a new flat screen tv in the room with a large variety of channels. The bathroom was clean but compact. No shampoo or shower gel, just one bar of soap, two towels and 2 plastic cups. If you are in London and want to spend your money on seeing the city, i would recommend staying here as the location is great and the room was clean, after all you really will only be sleeping here. Breakfast the next day was ok. Bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, bread, yoghurts, cereals. Enough to get you through to lunch thats for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with standard and service”
Reviews.Author: JayneK_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the "High Holborn" part of the Travelodge for 4 nights as a base for a London sightseeing /Theatre trip. Reception and bar staff were friendly and attentive at all times, as were the breakfast "team" - special mention to the young lad who was working as a waiter on Mon 20th & Tues 21st June - he couldn't do enough for the guests and was very cheerful. Our room (973) was huge compared to some London hotels I've stayed in, it was clean and modern - the bed was comfortable and everything was as advertised. We collected an extra pillow and a hairdryer from Reception when we checked in - during our stay we collected additional teas / coffees and milk - these were readily supplied upon request. Bar prices were reasonable and the breakfast was good quality and plentiful - "help yourself" to all the usual menu items. I've read some mixed reviews of this hotel - all I can say is that our stay here was relaxing and problem-free. The hotel & room facilities were exactly as advertised - everything worked (shower, TV, kettle, lights), the linen was clean and smelled fresh and the staff were helpful and polite. We were within walking distance of Covent Garden Market, Leicester Square and Chinatown (very central for Theatreland) but it wasn't awfully noisy at night as it was away from a "main" road - we slept with the window open.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and location”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made our first trip to London last May. Considering the location and price, this place was great. The hotel is situated near a nice shopping center and only a few stops from the major attractions. Our room was minimalistic with little space to hang clothes and the walls were a bit thin (we could hear our neighbors). The beds are not great, but after a long day of sight-seeing, we could have slept on a rock. The tea and coffee in the room was a nice touch and the TV had a good selection of channels. We only spent one night and found this hotel to be perfect for just that.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jane186403
Reviews.Content: Came to London for birthday celebration with four friends and have no complaints about the hotel. Clean, good size rooms, friendly staff, reasonable rates = 2 x rooms between the 5 of us = Â£40 each. Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and practical would use it again”
Reviews.Author: Bex1987
Reviews.Content: We went with travelodge because you know what you are going to get. It was the cheapest, reliable hotel in the Covent Garden area and so our best bet. My partner and I stayed in the "new" section of the hotel apparantly. The room was small but perfectly fine for 2 nights. It was very clean, the bathroom very modern and shiny and the bed was comfortable. We had a flatscreen tv attached to the wall which provided freeview channels and the bed was lit up nicely with built in headboard lamps. The room was quiet and quite warm for our whole stay. Our view was of the rest of the buildings and a loading bay. The breakfast was very nice with a lot of choice and the staff were friendly enough. However I wouldn't recommend the food which you can order off a menu throughout the day. It wasn't very nice at all. I will stress that you really shouldn't try and check in before 2.30pm because they just tell you to wait in reception until that time and we were already tired and hot and so weren't very impressed as our letter said 2pm. Luckily we arrived at 2.20pm and didn't have to wait too long. They will not let you leave luggage and so we were backwards and forwards to Euston station where we used the "left luggage" service and had to pay 8.50 per bag per day. I would use it again if I had to but now I have been to London I would probably look around a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Do not underestimate the comments regarding noise on website”
Reviews.Author: FamilyfromLeeds
Reviews.Content: We previously stayed at this hotel with our two small children two years ago and had a great stay. On returning this year we booked a family room and had no reason to expect anything less than we had experienced before. this time we had the worse nights sleep i have ever had in a hotel. it was like sleeping in the middle of a football match. We thought that there was a rave over the road from the hotel. The noise was actually from a nearby nightclub which lasted all night with no respite. Eventually when i went to recpetion and complained they said there was nothing thye could do about it and it was mentioned on their website. Do not be fooled by the comments about some noise from nearby bars. This was all night noise, shouting, screaming, arguing. Other people in the hotels suffered similar disruption and had slept with their pillows over their ears to block out the noise. If you have booked this hotel and paid in advance like we did make sure you ask for a room that is on the quiet side of the hotel away from the noise otherwise expect a sleepless night. Staff were apologetic and it is not their fault but guests should be advised fully of the extent to which the noise from this all night club is disturbing the area.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Roxybelle
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Reception and cafe clean and new but rest of corridors and our room were shabby. Miserable reception staff when we arrived, gave us nonsense directions to try to find our room, but when eventually finding it and being unable to gain access, returned to reception 20 minutes later to find told us the wrong number! Also wrong number on the card. Usual TL bed with crater in the centre meant 1st night's poor sleep. TV didn't work throughout, complained whenever we passed reception and said it was simply the aerial cable missing, but not solved until 3 hours before we checked out. To gve credit to the pleasant receptionist who checked us out, she did give us a part refund. Only positive is great location - so if you don't mind roughing it a bit to save a few quid, and can sleep well anywhere, then okay, otherwise don't bother. Let's hope 1 day TL will take notice of the reviews on here and refurb the place - I thought it was a shame/embarrassment to our country to give a poor impression to the many foreign tourists who were staying there, for a hotel placed in one of our best tourist areas

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for no frills here!!”
Reviews.Author: insight59
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night whilst in London to see The Wizard Of Oz. I would describe this hotel as no frills, fairly basic, fairly clean! The location is ok quiet at night and not far from Covent Garden itself. Our room was obviously one that had not been re furbished and whilst it was ok for one night would not have wanted to stay longer! The bed linen was clean but the beds themselves were filthy, this could have been disguised with valances but it wasn't. I would describe the breakfast as pretty basic really and felt the cooked options were of a low quality and not a lot of choice. I have always stayed in higher quality London hotels in the past and can see why now as there is no comparison as I say you get what you pay for!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location....won't be returning.”
Reviews.Author: 186394Jo_Jo
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Drury Lane Travelodge at 2.20pm and were asked 'Can I help you' by a female member of staff. I said I wanted to check-in, she rudely told me there would be a 10 min wait. I looked around and there were a few other customers waiting but the staff were doing nothing!!! After further investigation a friendly male member of staff told me the check-in desks don't open until 2.30pm and if you check in earlier it would have been an extra Â£10. That was fine, if she had told me that in a friendly manner it would have created a better first impression to the one I received from her. We were in the High Holborn building and our first room was on the first floor and the window did not close properly so we did not sleep a wink on our first night, the sofa bed for a family room was incredibly shabby, it looked like it had been used in a homeless shelter. We asked to be moved for our 2nd and final night and the male staff were absolutely fantastic and got us moved to the 10th floor, which was still incredibly noisy but at least the window closed! Still not enough towels, or facilities for a family room. Location couldn't be faulted, don't eat there for breakfast, it's not worth it. I won't be staying here again, it wasn't cheap and you can find much better hotels in London.

Reviews.Title: “For location only!!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayJunkies13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband for 2nights to see a show. Excellent location, a moments walk from covent garden tube. Hotel was at full capacity and check in was mobbed as to be expected. Room dirty, glasses used, lots of hair on carpet, no towels (and 1 towel the following day??) bathroom door handle broke so couldn't shut door, mirror in room filthy as were windows you couldn't tell what weather was like outside. Breakfast was a shambles, no seats, no cups, no knives, everyone was going a bit mad......however we slept like a log and rarely heard our neighbours or people in the hallway. Location and price was excellent for London, but I wouldn't go back due to condition of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!!!”
Reviews.Author: ElkieW
Reviews.Content: Unless you are fond of the smell of damp and love a basic bathroom stay away! I booked a double for single occupancy for a business trip - I got a single. No toiletries. No hairdrier. An overwhelming smell of damp. What to say??? Just don't do it!!

Reviews.Title: “central location for exploring London”
Reviews.Author: AstridLuxembourg
Reviews.Content: comfortable hotel within a 5 minutes walking distance from Covent Garden and Covent Garden underground station, renovated rooms, rich breakfast, friendly staff. The annexe building on High Holborn just around the corner has a public parking and when staying in the hotel the parking fees are half price but you have to ask for it at the reception. BUT, please not that the Hotel has no luggage room so if you check out at noon and your plane goes later in the evening you have to find a solution for your luggage, we locked ours up at Charing Cross Railway Station which is not too far away

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: babypink83
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Travelodge Covent Garden twice now, once in each building, and if there is one thing you cannot fault it is the location. It is a very short walk from a number of theatres, Leicester Square, tube stations etc. The room I had in the Holborn building was much nicer than that I had in the Drury Lane building, but friends who we travelled with and stayed at Drury Lane with had a lovely room. Our must have been one that hadn't yet been refurbished. Having said that, there was nothing really wrong with ours other than it looked a little tired. As hotels go in this area, Travelodge has got to offer possibly the best value for money. It will definitely be top of my list for future theatre trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Hotel Clean and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: pingpong213
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a weekend away in London rooms were clean and in a very central spot with lots within walking distance would definetely recommend to friends family

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money - ask at reception for a 'new room'”
Reviews.Author: lipschick
Reviews.Content: Make sure you ask at reception whether your room is a new room or not, and if not, ask for one. The hotel is split across two sites, Drury Lane and High Holborn (2 mins walk from Drury Lane) in my many stays Holborn building has newer rooms. It is worth ringing them when you make your reservation, as the old rooms are battered. Get a new rooms and it is perfectly fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Value, Clean & Basic Room”
Reviews.Author: georgeon
Reviews.Content: Its a Tavelodge, What is there to day about it! Great location 500m from Holburn Tube Station, 10min walk to all the important places in and around Covent Garden\Leicester Square. No Problems with the room apart from being a little basic.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the negative reviews...”
Reviews.Author: Uplyme
Reviews.Content: this hotel is just fine. I've stayed here probably a dozen times and my room has always been clean, bright and comfortable with lots of space. Sure the service is minimal, but you can't beat the location; you can easily walk to Covent Garden, the National Gallery & the West End. Oxford Street is a short bus ride away. I've paid as little as Â£19 and as much as Â£60 so it pays to plan ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Good Service!”
Reviews.Author: naughtydinosaur
