Reviews.Content: One night for a family of four in Covent Garden Travelodge, first room had a blocked toilet, second was occupied... However in less than 10 minutes, the friendly and helpful staff had us safely in a clean and surprisingly spacious room. Noisy, well yes, even on the 10th floor. Hot, yes a bit. Apart from this, the room was very clean, the breakfast was good and plentiful. The location was perfect. The price, at Â£39.50, incredible value. Parking at Â£17.50 for 24 hours, right in the centre of London's theatre district, amazing. Most importantly the staff were friendly and helpful. Would I stay again...until the lottery comes up, yes!

Reviews.Title: “Got the essentials...or has it?”
Reviews.Author: weemini
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and had a fairly peaceful stay. Definitely the cheapest hotel in Covent Garden and that is worth taking into account as its such a lovely area. Breakfast was reasonable and well-priced and the food all felt freshly made which was a bonus. Staff were very helpful and the bar stays open to 1am. More strangely....only one bath towel was provided every day in our double room although it was quite obvious we were a couple sharing the room! We had to ask every day for an extra towel from reception and they seemed to expect us to ask for a towel as they have them waiting for you behind the desk! One day we also did not get our room cleaned which was disappointing. Also, if it was a very hot summer, the room would have been way too hot. We found it pretty hot and it wasn't particularly warm outside (no air-con)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, shame about the room!”
Reviews.Author: GrBristol
Reviews.Content: You can't fault the location and the cleanliness and service was fine, however the room was quite depressing! It's a shame because if they just made the rooms even a bit nicer I think it would be perfect. I recommend getting rid of the tainted windows, the tacky artwork, put in a decent wardrobe and chest of drawers, 2 towels per room and more milk!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely dreadful!”
Reviews.Author: abw60
Reviews.Content: I wish I had checked these reviews before booking as I would'nt have booked. We stayed in room 615 of the Travelodge Drury Lane, Covent Garden. I wasn't aware of any refurbishment work as some of the other revies have mentioned, but the rooms definately needed it! It was the worst hotel I've ever stayed in and will never be staying in a Travelodge again! The room was small, had ill fitting curtains, lumpy bed, mould in shower and a stained carpet. We were woken at 4am by young lads in the next room, who kept us awake with their shouting and swearing - smashing glass etc. Although there is supposed to be 24 hour security, no else seemed bothered about it. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, newly remodeled section clean,great value for London.”
Reviews.Author: Nanandpaul
Reviews.Content: We were concerned when we checked in. However, we were on the eight floor in the new section. It was functional and very clean. Some noise from local bar when it closed. No ac but was not needed. Staff nice. Just ask for extra towel, only one in room. Don't know about High Holburn section. about High No telephone or wake up. Try Porters restaurant in Covent Gardens .

Reviews.Title: “great for london tourists”
Reviews.Author: mandy186225
Reviews.Content: stayed for one night here, it is very central and you can walk to most of the centre of london. Our room was 506 in the main building and was just as we had expected from travelodge, it was clean and seemed well maintained... until I went to use the shower, and try as I might I couln't get it to work as a shower until I went to turn it off and hey presto it worked that was after I had washed my hair on my knees in the bath under the tap LOL, but that said it was a great place for theater and sight seeing and would stay here again but could do with some instructions for the shower or a new tap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Not Bad Value”
Reviews.Author: Bonters
Reviews.Content: Paid just over Â£100 per night for a 2 night stay, which is still cheap by Covent Garden standards. This included pre-booked breakfast. We were in the main building and after some confusion, found our room. A bit 'boxy' but as you'd expect really. Only the following morning did we discover that we were supplied with only one hand towel and one bath towel between the two of us. Totally unnecessary, and our friends had the same experience, so not a coincidence. However, I left a note for housekeeping asking for more and they left us 2 x more of each as well as the used ones, so now we had 6 in total! Breakfast was very creditable, but it was manic in there both mornings, with a proper bun fight to get to the toaster! Also it is a bit 'school canteen' and does not lend itself to comfort or relaxation. The bar in the evenings was understaffed, but the prices were pretty good. All in all, it's what you'd expect from a Travelodge. It's no frills, functional, and with some of the niceties stripped away. But all in all we were satisfied, given the deal we got. And of course, it's biggest bonus is location.

Reviews.Title: “Does the Job”
Reviews.Author: cantthink
Reviews.Content: This hotel does what it says on the tin. It is budget accomodation in central London. The rooms are very basic but they have everything you need. I wouldn't want to stay fro more than a couple of nights but for a bed when your in London for sights and shows it's great. The room was clean and had everything you could need - shower. bed towels, soap and even tea and coffee. The staff were helpful and we had breakfast that did the job. Yes that are some stains on the carpet but if your that fussy you probably won't want budget accomodation. Remember you get what you pay for. The purpose of our visit was theatres not the hotel. If all you need is a clean comfortable bed that don't worry this place will be great. Whilst we were there it was very quiet s we all had a good nights sleep. If you've booked don't worry as long as you're not expecting luxury it'll be ok.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive (probably due to Champions League Final) but great location.”
Reviews.Author: wishiwasonholiday68
Reviews.Content: Like all travelodges it is basic, e.g. not being able to sign drinks to your room, no toiletries. iron or hairdresser in the room. However, the latter two items can be collected from reception if you need them. The room was clean and modern and had tea making facilities and a tv. Wireless connection was available but expensive @ Â£5 an hour, Â£10 a day or Â£20 a week. The bed was a little uncomfy but it wouldn't deter us from staying there again. We stayed for 3 nights but the Friday and Saturday nights were ridiculously expensive. We were going to the Champions League Final and most hotels seemed to cash in on this. The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is a short walk from the many bars and restaurants around Covent Garden and Soho. Shaftsbury avenue, Leicester Square and China town are all in easy walking distance. So as a result I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: bettybee3
Reviews.Content: Sadly this place has gone downhill since our last visit a few years ago. On arrival the receptionist was very rude and sadly we did not come across 1 helpful member of staff throughout the entire stay. Rooms were clean and spacious but were the bare basic and were in a bad state of repair. Our tv made a very annoying humming noise, which made it impossible to watch some channels. We were given 2 towels for a family of four! Only 1 pillow is provided per person and reception ran out of any more. Tea and milk were not replenished which meant we had to trek down to reception to ask for more supplies. However the worst part of the stay was the day we left. Fire alarms were going off and all the lifts were shut off, meaning that we to get down 10 flights of stairs with suitcases. 1 poor lady was stuck on the 10th floor with a child in a wheelchair and asked us to make sure at reception that they were aware she was stuck on the 10th floor. When we finally got to the ground floor it turned out that it was just routine lift maintenance!! Luckily i paid a bargain price for our stay and the price we paid was all it was worth! Great location for getting about easily..but would be worth paying the extra and going for something a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location - will defo use again”
Reviews.Author: george29575
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find a queue to check in and after a few moments realised we could check in via a little touch screen, which was ideal and took 2 mins, was also able to book breakfast this way also. Had to ask where to find room as a massive building. Think we were in the section of the hotel which has been reviewed here recently as the older building. I would say to this that maybe the other building is more 'new' but this building was perfectly acceptable. I had no reason to note any problems or tattiness. The bar cafe area was very modern and clean. Plenty of staff to ask if you had a question. Room over looked a central courtyard so we thought that we would have peace, unfortunately and this is no fault of the hotel (other than they did nothing to try to stop it) but we had a very drunken impromptu party going on in the courtyard till goodness knows what a clock! Bed was clean and fairly comfy but again as I have found with every TL I have ever stayed in is the lack of pillows or a decent one even. really does ruin sleep. Yes I could have asked for more but think unless you had 3 it would have made little difference. For 3 30 something women there was plenty of room for all 'equipment' needed to beautify selves. Bathroom nice size, shower hot, towels x 4 ( 2 hand 2 bath). 3rd bed ( sofa or slide out) not fabulous the matress was grotty on slide out. and sofa overlaps bathroom door which didn't make for discreet visits in the night, but not a prob for us. Breakfast Fab really good value and tasty and plenty to eat. For Â£35 for the night a really good base.

Reviews.Title: “Not Value for money”
Reviews.Author: daveraw
Reviews.Content: How basic can a hotel get? Double room, tiny shower,2 persons - one towel, one small bar of soap, one pillow each. Dismal lighting in room caused by depressing tint on window. bar area with no comfy chairs.. Noise levels apalling - 3 hen parties screaming down the cortridor at 3am, 4,20 am and again at 5.30 am. One good point - Breakfast bar is acceptable Not value for money even by London standards

Reviews.Title: “BIG family rooms, very clean - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: melsers
Reviews.Content: There are two Travelodge Hotels very close to each other at Covent Garden - a stones throw away from each other in fact. We initially went to the wrong one (after having to climb & haul our suitcases up a flight of steps). When we went across the road to the Travelodge that had family rooms, we were pleasantly surprised! Very clean, great cafe services etc. We had a few problems with key cards and had to change them a few times and we also had to ask for more as were only given 1 for 3 people. Our room was on the 4th floor and as there were 3 adults, the amount of room we had was FAB for the price - very spacious! The only gripe I would have is that they don't have single bed rooms for 3 adults. We couldn't get the kettle to work; we weren't sure if it was broken or if we just couldn't work it. Not enough towels for 3 women, but apart from those minor points, we had a great stay. The rooms were VERY clean. Be aware that if you sleep with the window open, you will more than likely hear sirens all night (well we did). Overall, we would def stay again!

Reviews.Title: “average hotel in a good position”
Reviews.Author: rouge88
Reviews.Content: clean spacious rooms, location good for tourists. staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Big_Al_65
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times in the last year and it is OK. It is cheap by London standards, and what you get for your money reflects this. The room had a comfortable double bed and adequate space. Theere was a TV and wireless Intenet (Â£10 for 24 hours). The bathroom was tatty. The room was dirty (hair all over the carpet and grime on some surfaces and it looks like an office that was quickly converted into a hotel room at minimal expense. Soundproofing between rooms is not good. Breakfast was quite good (choice of continental or cooked) and very cheap. The best thing about the hotel is its location as it has lots of restaurants and pubs nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing price for comfortable room in the centre of London”
Reviews.Author: Trowelman
Reviews.Content: Travelodge basically does what it says on the tin , which is why I like it. It's dependable and the one in covent garden is no exception. We paid forty quid for a Sunday night room which was an absolute steal!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: smudgerHull
Reviews.Content: We must have been in new rooms cos these were like brand new! Cheap as you like in central London!! If these aren't good enough at the price then nothing is!! Well done!!

Reviews.Title: “Bedrooms in need of some attention”
Reviews.Author: tiamaria19
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a large group for my sister in laws hen weekend and the location is very central and great for getting around all the main attractions of London. At the end of the day it was a bed for the night and nothing more and if thats all you want then this is fine. It is in need of some modifications although reception and bars are ok the rooms are not great. I have to say it did look like building works were taking place here so this could be in hand. The hotel is split in two and are only a short walk apart. There are no hairdriers in the rooms but you can obtain these from reception but make sure you do this before you get to the room or its a long walk back to the room we also only had one set of towels so had to get more. Because the rooms are tired although I am sure they were clean they unfortunately looked grubby because of the old decor and facilities. it wasnt expensive and if you just want a bed for the night then its ideal, and are plenty of places in covent garden for a great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “very clean but basic”
Reviews.Author: hcotts
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and had a clean and daily serviced room. It was quiet due to the quadruple glazing and 5th floor location but there was no AC so we would have roasted and been v noisy in hot weather with windows open. Only one towel between two people (had to ask for more) and no toiletries. The breakfast was plentyful but of very poor quality.... reminded me of school dinners. The location was brilliant, so add that to a basic clean room and I would stay again, but eat out for breakfast in the local area. Wi Fi in rooms chargable but free in reception lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't as bad as expected”
Reviews.Author: Lamby15
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at the beginning of May with hubby. Having never been to London before we wanted a central hotel without having to take out another mortgage. This fit the bill perfectly. It only cost us Â£70 for the both of us for two nights. Bargain. When we got to the hotel the reception was busy but the staff where polite and helpful. A lovely lady helped us to check in in about 5 minutes and then gave us directions to our room. Reception has had a lot of work done to it and looks fabulous. The same couldn't be said for the room. The room was clean but tired. The bathroom was ready for an overhaul and window was in desperate need of cleaning on the outside but it's only a room and I didn't go to London to sit in a room all day. The bed and sheets where clean and the bathroom was clean. Just what we needed. All in all we would stay there again as we saw other rooms which had been done up and so maybe we would get one of those next time. For Â£70 we had a fantastic break. If you pay full price I can understand being upset but at least they are trying to improve the hotel so give Travelodge the chance x

Reviews.Title: “Definitely looking tired and in need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: lottie1105_11
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our first ever stay in a Travelodge, and we stopped 3 nights at Drury Lane Travelodge. It was definitely in need of some TLC, our room door as we left would not lock, we had to use our room card to lock it again, although it appeared to work once on the second day, but a little maintenance would have sorted it. The bathroom could do with a spruce up, the reception on the TV made it not worth bothering with, and we like to watch the news and sometimes a spot of TV before going out, but it was such terrible reception it was not worth putting on. We had to have the window open as the air conditioning (if that was what it was) caused us to cough and my husband had a headache with it on, but then having the window open caused problems with noise, i.e. horrendous traffic hooting and people shouting at 3 a.m. on the Sunday morning. This was not a supersaver room, so we felt we should have got value for money, but didn't feel we did. We didn't book breakfast and so glad, we found a cafe on Museum Street called Giovanni's who we would highly recommend for Full English + coffee or tea for Â£4.95 and excellent, we went there every morning and had excellent service and food. We also went to see War Horse which was brilliant, and Priscilla which was fantastic, two completely different shows and both well worth going to. We would go to a Travelodge again, but not at Covent Garden. I hope people may find this of help to them.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dirty Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: captnorman
Reviews.Content: My wife and sister inlaw stayed at the above hotel 15 and 16 May 2011. A twin room had been requested but on arrival were given a family room on the 10th floor. This was filthy and totally unacceptable, the second room on the 6th floor was not a great deal better. The sofa bed was not used as it was most unsavoury and the main bed had stains on the base unit, it looked as if someone had been sick at some time in the past. Considering the location, this should have been a showcase venue, not a dirty venue. We have been advocates of travelodge in the past but the two most recent experiences have changed our views and would no longer recommend travelodge. The Covent Garden being one to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “overall great stay - bargain price !”
Reviews.Author: blondie00125
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 16th may for 3 nights with my boyfriend. Having read some reviews after booking we were a little concerned and unsure what to expect but on arrival we were more than happy. We checked in at the High Holborn building but were moved to the Drury Lane site which was just across the road (rooms are split between 2 buildings) Check in was quick and easy . Our room was on the first floor (61) The windows had blackout type windows and curtains which was great as there were cafes and offices directly opposite. Room was clean and spacious - everything looked like new, bed was comfy, bathroom was a little small for my liking but it did the job. Only one towel was provided for a double room so we had to ask at reception for more but staff were happy to help! Great location...... just around the corner is Covent Garden market itself. lots of shops, cafes and resturaunts all just minutes up the street also the nearest tube station High Holburn. Room was pretty noisey from traffic and people throughout the night and first thing, but being right on the lane and on the first floor this could not be helped and didnt really bother us. Overall a great stay, will be booking here again! Could not have asked for more for the price we payed and considering the excellent location we deffinatley got a bargain with this hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but ok (if forewarned)”
Reviews.Author: GrahamMacclesfieldUK
Reviews.Content: Never checked in at a terminal before, but it seemed to work. Had trouble finding my room (36) - the signs said rooms 1-5 this way, rooms 41 up another. Asked 2 people and found it - had to go outdoors, then down a flight of stairs. Room was spacious and quiet, small window to street, dim lights. The bathroom smelled musty but the shower was very good. I was glad I had read the reviews and brought my own shampoo and hair dryer. There was a kettle and tea. The bed was very comfortable. It's a shame there wasn't a comfy chair, as there was plenty of space for one. Breakfast was ok, so was the chicken bacon salad for dinner. Good value for central London.

Reviews.Title: “Poor impression for a first time visitor to London”
Reviews.Author: gill186338
Reviews.Content: The only thing going for this hotel is its location on Drury Lane; the whole hotel is in need of a deep clean and the only surfaces that are dusted seem to be the ones within easy reach by the staff. We stayed on floor three- it was filthy and gloomy with dust on every surface and a very musty smell. The corridor walls were scuffed, carpets dirty and dust was thick around the doorways and on every surface. The ceiling panel outside the room was missing exposing the pipework; in the room there was thick dust on the wardrobe, the shower had black mould in the corners, the tiles were coming off the wall behind the toilet. Despite there being two of us in a double room which was on my invoice, only one set of towels was provided as 'the staff were told to provide only one set of towels' (I quote from a staff member at Recepton). It meant I had to go to Reception each day to get a second set of towels to carry right through the hotel, past the bar and restaurant. There was no housekeeping service to do this and no telephones in the rooms to call down and request anything. Room 349 had a new carpet fitted while we stayed and the furniture from that room was piled in front of the emergency exit, blocking the exit completely. Dirty towels and linen were piled up in the corridor and were collected only late in the afternoon. I stayed here with my partner from New Zealand on his first visit to the UK and I was embarassed to have to stay in a budget hotel (although it was still Â£85 a night) of this standard. I made a complaint at reception and was dealt with very courteously by the evening duty manager on Thursday May 19th and he came to view my room and witness the points I have made in this review. I think a reasonable standard of cleanliness and maintenance should be expected whether staying in a budget hotel or not - especially in the capital city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value and location”
Reviews.Author: woodykibworth
Reviews.Content: Obvioulsy this is a travelodge so dont expect five star luxury, but for the price paid it is extremely good. Recently refurbsihed the hotel is very clean and pleasantly decorated, everything works and has a quality feel about it. Of course some of teh facilities are basic but they are at least functional, ckean and well laid out. Right in the heart of Covent Garden, unless you are really looking for luxury I dont see the need to look anywhere else. I will certainly be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: hairybearmark
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel at 2.50 expecting to have to wait for 10 minutes until check-in opened (like in other Travelodges), but was surprised to find that people were already being checked-in. A 5 minute wait and we had our room keys. Our room was on the first floor so never used the lift. The room itself was the usual Travelodge type: double bed, flet-screen wall-mounted tv, hangers, small desk and chair and tea/coffee and kettle. Small but adequate shower room. The windows had blackout type curtains which was great. The usual gripe over the number of towels and pillows in the room (1 towel in a double room and only 3 pillows). Both issues were sorted with a quick trip to reception. We chose not to eat breakfast in the hotel so can't comment on quality/value of this. Bed was comfortable and the room was warm and clean. Couldn't ask for more considering the price we paid for a central London hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Business stay”
Reviews.Author: Jazzy1869
Reviews.Content: Basic and functional. Personally I would choose to pay a little more and get a few more frills. The room was clean however the bathroom smelt of drain. Also there only a small window that overlooked the service yard.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and worn”
Reviews.Author: FoxyPhilDerby
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location and the breakfast is very good value for an "eat as much as you like" basis. That is where the good points stop! We had twin rooms on the fourth floor and these were very tired and worn in desperate need of refurbishment! The carpets were badly stained and grubby; the bathroom needs a total makeover as does the decorating! There are holes in the walls and cupboards where things were hung previously (i.e. shelves and equipment). Windows a disgrace and fan heater did not work. The shower was powerful though there was no way to hang the shower head and had to be hand held in the bath! Beds were ok and so too the linen. I was only there for two nights and I suggest to anyone not to look too hard at the cleanliness, the more you look the more you will find wrong! Still it was "just" ok to lay your head whilst exploring Inner London or a show as it is great for walking to most places in Covent Garden. I believe they have some rooms already refurbished though I was not offered one and did not know this till I got back home!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: WrexhamSteve1945
Reviews.Content: Read here before we booked and was put off by the negative remarks, but we went ahead and booked and every thing was fine clean room and breakfast was as good as anywhere. Booking again for end of May

Reviews.Title: “Poor room but good location”
Reviews.Author: MesoMike
Reviews.Content: I had an old poor standard single room (221). Not very clean, a bit smelly, dingy outlook. Fortunately it was just me and I was out most of the evening at an event. Plus side the automatic check-in was great and the lifts quite quick and it is a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Food awful and access hopeless for disabled travellers but good location.”
Reviews.Author: CBH78
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here and had one of the refurbished rooms in a quiet section of the hotel, which was fine (aside from the smell of feet!). Room 374. Took up the web offer of a two-course dinner for Â£6. Lukewarm soup, cardboard-like veggie burger and burned chips. Wish I hadn't bothered. Plus, it took a very very long time to order at the bar as only one person serving. No apology when my order was eventually taken. Breakfast nothing to write home about. The bread was half frozen. The worst thing about the hotel? I arrived and faced the steps outside. I had two wheeled suitcases, my laptop and a further bag, so was somewhat overladen. Thought I would use the disabled exit, but no sign of one (looked for signs but nothing). So, I struggled up the steps (pregnant female, lots of male onlookers - marvellous!), and then got to the door to find a very helpful sign aimed at wheelchair users advising them to contact reception if they need assistance. This is absolutely ludicrous. The following morning, I tried to get out of the hotel using lifts etc. (again, non-existant signage). It would not be possible in a wheelchair. It was hard enough to work out how to get out of the back yard (where the 'disabled exit' brings you out) and I had to ask a man delivering laundry. The exit gate would not be possible to operate and go through in a wheelchair. Crazy and thoughtless design for disabled users. Paid Â£110 a night, seemed a bit criminal for a Travelodge, but cheaper than alternatives. Would be tempted to stay again if it was a bargainous rate, but might feel a pang of conscience and allegiance with my less able brethren and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Refurbed. But missed the service and essentials”
Reviews.Author: JamesSharpe
Reviews.Content: Poorly trained staff, shocking front of house, rooms without towels no chair at desk, no toiletries. Told to help myself for a chair from the bar and I can buy soap from the shop around the corner. Noisy rooms. Staff are rude to interational travellers. Shan't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value, comfortable room - all facilities on hand or at request”
Reviews.Author: rainbowspuds
Reviews.Content: I went with my Mum to London for a long weekend, and while I really wouldn't mind where I stay I would like the hotel to be comfortable for my Mum. No worries were needed - despite some dodgy previous reviews on the site! We were in the new hotel section (one is across the road from the other) and I can just say that the room was really spacious and clean and was cleaned very day - which I really wasn't expecting. This hotel is in a very busy area - inevitably there will be noise at night from traffic and pub-goers, but unless you're a really light/sensitive sleeper this shouldn't be a problem. Tea/coffee making facilities, towels, soap, tv in room. Hairdryer, ironing board, internet available downstairs. We got breakfast there each morning, and while some other reviews warned you to get down early because the food would be gone quickly, we arrived at different times each morning and there was always plenty - typical fry up-up, cereals, yogurt etc... The jewel in the crown for me was the great location - you are just a 5 min walk from Holburn underground station, which is just a hop and a skip into the main sightseeing areas - by underground or foot for that matter. And if you really want to extend the good value, note that Holburn is on the Picadilly line, so you actually could get a tube all the way in to the hotel from Heathrow much more reasonably than making taxi/train connections. (It could take 45mins - 1hr and a half depending on how busy it was) Will definitely use this as my London sightseeing base in future :)

Reviews.Title: “spotless accomodation,thats all you want!”
Reviews.Author: ron-cowley
Reviews.Content: Great location for all the sights and theatres.The travel lodge itself was excellent .Ok the room was small and it was in the basement part,which was a bit dark,but it was all new and spotlessly clean.There were no frills,but they warn you about that on the web site.To be honest ,dont go to london if you want to stay in the room all day admiring it. The breakfast was ok,not the best i've had,some of the produce was a bit cheap,but passable.I would stay again ,without a doubt and recommend.By the way,i never heard a single noise where i was(drury lane building)in the night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good hotel, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Pops_Mccrill
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night 23rd/24th April for a theatre visit. Paid a bit more because it was Easter weekend, which I guess you have to accept in a major city over a Bank holiday, but it was still better priced than a lot of other hotels in the area for this particular weekend. Check-in was very easy, all done electronically, although you could also check in at the reception desk. Just make sure that you have your booking details to hand, but a very friendly member of staff was on hand to assist in the process, just in case! The room was excellent, it had clearly been recently refurbished, so it looked new, but it was also very clean, including the bathrom. Unfortunately our room was at the rear of the hotel so the view from the window was pretty naff, but for one night we could live with that. The only criticism of the room was that the extractor fan in the bathroom was either not working or not strong enough, because the bathroom steamed up pretty quickly and took ages, even with the door open, to clear. I did mention this to the reception desk on checking out, and they promisd to look into it.... The bar was nice, the staff were friendly, and I don't thik we were ripped off with the prices. Breakfast (all you can eat!) was very good! We didn't have to queue, there was plenty of food and it was good quality. Admittedly the coffee machine broke down on the morning we were there, but as soon as it was reported it was sorted out straight away.... The lifts, unfortunately, were rather slow, and one was out of order... but we only stayed on the 5th floor, and were perfectly capable of using the stairs, which we actually did when we left. All said and done though, we would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - basic accomodation - ok for just a flying visit”
Reviews.Author: Number1Fanilow
Reviews.Content: It was a little disappointing to arrive to discover our booking hadnt been taken correctly, though a room was hurriedly found for us. The room itself was basic, as one would expect. It was ok for a night, but was generally a little run-down and in need of some tlc. Main gripes were peeling wallpaper, stains on the carpet, and a hand-held hosepipe style shower reminiscent of a school camping trip to Thetford Forest back in the 90s! There were not enough towels in the room for two people which seemed like quite a basic schoolboy error and whilst reception happily gave us extra, it was just a nuisance to have to ask for them. On the positive side though, there were plenty of staff about who were friendly enough, and the location is great. The bed was dead comfy, and the room surprisingly quiet for its central location. The public areas downstairs were more modern, clean and bright.

Reviews.Title: “The clue is in the hotel name”
Reviews.Author: Helfrag
Reviews.Content: For Â£70 I got a double room and breakfast. It's not the ritz but it does what it says on the tin. Basic room, but for a business trip what more could you ask for? There is a nice bar area down stairs and the rooms are adequate. Definitely the cheapest place to stay near Covent garden.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Dreigiau
Reviews.Content: Picked a cheap Hotel for our latest trip to London, we were not too sure about the reviews but we wanted three in the room so our options were limited. The Hotel was very basic but clean, the pull out sofabed was OK for a couple of nights, breakfast was quite good. No air conditioning but room was cool enough in April with the window open. Great location for Dominion Theatre, Oxford Street and Covent Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: TheLittleEstonian
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with my parents and their friends over Easter holidays for an extended weekend Fri to Mon. We were located in the Drury Lane building, which I don't understand why everybody has a big issue with, as we never experienced any noise that everyone has been talking about. Hotel itself is clean in general, though they should make sure their lifts are all working.. Also, the fact you have to ask for hairdryers or irons/ironing boards is quite standard at budget hotels. The housekeeping could use their common sense though and leave more than one towel in the room, when it is obvious there is more than one person staying. However, only met one helpful receptionist throughout the whole weekend, and that was on Sun morning, when I left. The staff likes to postpone things, so for example for an extra bed I had to ask reception three times before that was passed on to housekeeping. For extra towels I was given one and told to fetch another one in the morning - how were we supposed to have a shower with one towel for the three of us? Night staff is quite rude and arrogant, at least the ones we encountered. A positive thing about the hotel is its location and that's also one of the reasons why I WOULD go and stay there again. There is plenty of places only a short walk away for breakfast, lunch, dinner, or drinks! Hotel could consider left luggage service though, especially being in such an area of London!

Reviews.Title: “MIxed experience about this one!”
Reviews.Author: HotelExaminer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Travelodge Covent Garden for a few nights in April 2011. This review relates to my stay in the Holborn/ Museum Street site (the tower block) and not the Drury Lane site (with the steep steps up). The mixed reviews on Tripadvisor about this hotel may be attributable to some of the Drury Lane site rooms having been refurbished (from what I can gather). Both sites operate as one hotel but with separate receptions apparently. Anyway, I have stayed at this hotel in the past, albeit some time ago shortly after it had been refurbished. I would say that this site is quite badly in need of another refurbishment, or at least major re-painting and deep cleaning. It's starting to look a little worse for wear these days as evidenced by marked walls, cracked sink, stained carpets and so on. The room heater was fairly ineffective and the window didn't open (broken catch). You get what you pay for; it's basic and fairly clean. Aside from the cosmetic issues I also found some other problems in evidence. Staff generally appeared hard pressed and stressed. Unfortunately reception staff in general presented as sullen (no smiles at all) and I did have the feeling that any requests made of them were considered troublesome. On one occasion, with four members of staff located behind reception, they appeared to be able to deal with only one guest collectively. Two self check-in machines located in reception (and occupying much space) appeared to be non-functioning. Breakfast on the morning of the royal wedding was a bit of a rugby scrum; tables uncleared, guests queuing up etc, staff thin on the ground. The overall impression was a lack of coordination, stressed staff with low motivation and no visible management providing a feeling that someone was in control. Regrettably this Travelodge has acquired the feeling of a hostel at some point along the way. The experience was not totally awful, but it could be made a lot better. On the plus side, the location is very good and when they decide to undertake a refurbishment of the hotel I would probably come back but in the meantime I would probably look elsewhere first. Would I recommend to a friend? It depends on the friend I guess! Read this review in conjunction with Cheemar's excellent review of 26 April 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Bronni1991
Reviews.Content: After reading lots of the reviews about the hotel was rather concerned about staying here but, really didn't need to be. We stayed in the Dury lane part of the travel lodge(room 674) When we arrived we checked in easily and staff were very polite Our room was clean not the greatest of views of a disused building but we only wanted the room for some where to sleep so didn't bother us and after all its only a travel lodge. Was woken through out the night by people being very loud outside but being in central London didn't expect it to be quiet and this was not the travel lodge's fault. We had breakfast at the hotel there was a great choice and the staff kept topping up things that had run out, again the staff were very polite at breakfast and efficient. The location is fab we went to see the Lion king and it was less then a 10 minute walk to the theatre from the hotel. We have all ready said next time we come to London we will happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent VFM!”
Reviews.Author: seasoned_traveller79
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and went to War Horse. Brilliant hotel. Our room was at the back so it was completely quite. It was spotlessly clean. The room was faultless: immaculate and all new. Excellent VFM. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Useable but unpleasurable!”
Reviews.Author: CSferg
Reviews.Content: Writing this having had little sleep due to nightclub being below my window (which is broken incidentally). Bed ridicously soft with only one soft pillow. I have stayed in more comfortable hostels. Location and proximity to Covent Garden is only thing that saves this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Go for breakfast at 7am!”
Reviews.Author: sues36
Reviews.Content: Reception: Arrived to a very short queue. Reception staff were friendly, fast and efficient. Booking in was quick. Lounge: Had some chairs and tables which were available to sit at whilst you had a coffee and planned your day. Downside was it was directly opposite the door and smokers were allowed to smoke by this door. Bar: Great service by a lovely waitress for which nothing was too much trouble. Clean area, tables and bar stools or sofas available to sit on. Room: Basic, clean bedding and towels. Had a few holes in the ceiling which were a bit weird? Window was dirty both inside and out and curtains smelt of damp. This could possibly be due to being so high up. Windows only opened 3 inches which wasnt enough to get some fresh air!! If you wanted the standard iron and hairdryer you have to ask at reception...bit of a nuisence if you dont know this and have to traipse down 5 floors! Offered food and drinks to eat in room....but you have to go downstairs to order so no point in offering this service imho. Kettle, tea, coffee, milk and sugar in room. Breakfast. Go at 7am! Much later and you dont get juice as thye run out! Scrambled eggs were cold, bacon cooked in oven and still had white coating on!! If you want brown bread for toast then get this early as it soon goes. Also costs Â£6.95..but if you go outside and turn left..4 doors along is a fab cafe which does an amazing full english for Â£4.50. Dont try asking the breakfast staff for more juice / bread, hotter eggs and bacon as they find it difficult to understand what you mean. They dont hold luggage for you so if your train is later in the evening then use Euston left luggage.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Travelodge, not the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: SNSUN
Reviews.Content: I'm not quite sure what people expect when they book a Travelodge, but they don't proclaim to be anything but cheap and cheerful. If you buy Lemonade, you can't complain that it's not Champagne. As an infrequent user of Travelodges, but a user nonetheless, this is pretty much as standard as all the others. It's cheap, perhaps the cheapest rooms you can find in London are here, is in a fantastic location, and has an en-suite, a perk of any room in any hotel in my opinion. My fiancee and I actually don't live too far outside of London, but as we were both on holiday from work and because my friend, who lives in London was having a birthday, we decided on a mini-break for a couple of days. That this coincided with the excellent weather was a massive bonus! I actually prefer Premier Inns, but their rates were very expensive, so I booked the Travelodge for two nights at Â£70 a night, which was very reasonable for London. The location wasn't quite Covent Garden, as it advertises, but is only a short walk a way, and is convenient for both buses and the superb, fantastic London Underground (yeah I work for them...:-)) station of Holborn. We actually wandered into the reception area of the new building, was seen to straight away and given our room card for the building opposite. (The older building) On walking across the road to the older building, we saw that their reception was about 6 people deep, and they looked swamped, so I was quite glad we'd gone to the new building first. We went to the lifts, there were two, and one wasn't working. In fact it did start working later in the day, but they must've got about 2 hours out of it, as it soon broke down again, which meant the whole 7 or so floors were using one lift. We were on the 5th floor. Aside from that, everything was fine. The room was your standard Travelodge room, the bed wasn't as comfortable as some Travelodges I've stayed in, but after two nights on the drink, I hardly noticed it! Reception were helpful enough when we asked for a second keycard, and as with any Travelodge, there is minimal contact with staff anyway. All in all, a good all round stay, and when we want to stay in London again, I will definitely check the rates for this Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: poppy57
Reviews.Content: The hotel is as expected, basic but clean and well maintained. The room lighting is a little gloomy with only harsh central fluorescent lights, but the bed was comfortable and the room soundproofing was good. Breakfast was good value, but much better food at cheaper prices could be found adjacent to the hotel. The location was excellent. On balance, I think I would have preferred to spend more for a little luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: RachnPaulR
Reviews.Content: This Travelodge is better than other Travelodges we've stayed at. It was in good order, clean and surprisingly quiet at night. The location is fabulous, just five minutes walk from Covent Garden, loads of nice places to eat round about. Also well placed for buses ( we went up to Camden Lock and to Victoria Apollo to see Wicked, and found we were on the route for both). We booked well in advance, and although the Saturday night was over Â£100, we got Sunday and Monday nights for less than Â£40. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, as there are three great cafes just across the road doing a full English for under Â£4. I would stay here again, especially if trying to keep the budget low. For those with children it is a good location for the British Museum, again only a few minutes walk. Facilities in the room are basic, but we got a hairdryer, and iron on request, and there are vending machines with toiletries and snacks, so everything you may want is available. Good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and good solid 3 star, read why below”
Reviews.Author: reverend_brush
Reviews.Content: first off, prices: 3 night stay, friday to monday over easter bank holiday. room was Â£350 for two including full buffet style breakfast. room: (159 Drury Lane site) perfect for what we needed. nice and clean (newly refurbed, everything was brand new.) 19" flat screen tv kettle tea/coffee reason for 3 stars: 1 towel provided, you need to ask every day for another. need to go to reception for iron, ironing board and hair dryer no drawers for clothing and wardrobe is just a modern exposed hanger rail. Breakfast options: full cereal. orange/grapefruit segments. yoghurts. Toast. Croissants Blueberry muffins Bacon/scrambled egg/ sausage/beans tea coffee and juices. all in all, a great stay and would go back there in a shot if in that part of town again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a weekend in London”
Reviews.Author: hullboy39
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from spending two days at Travelodge Covent Garden and after reading all the negative reviews at first we were very apprehensive about staying there after all the bad things people have said....Well let me put your mind at rest, We arrived about 2pm on friday and we had to wait about 30 mins to check in (you can pay Â£10 for earlier check in if you wish), we were processed quickly and efficiently by reception with no issues and were put in room 164 in the Drury Lane building. This is the one everyone all had issues with.... I cant understand why ?.... Our room as well as the corridors to our room and the lift area all seemed like new and had that new carpet smell about them and freshly painted. The room was what you would expect from a budget hotel, it was very clean and tidy with everything you need for a stay. The bedroom looked like it had just been modernised, the carpets were like new, the bathroom was immaculate and we really could not find fault. There was a LCD TV on the wall facing the bed, tea and coffee making facilities and space to hang your clothes...everything you need !! If you required a hair dryer or iron, reception have them there if you need them. We also had breakfast each day in the restaurant and again, it was adequate for a budget hotel, it was well presented and was nice and hot and all you need to fill you up before venturing out into the capital. So all in all i we really liked our stay here and will be using Travelodge again a well as recommending it to friends... P.S The Wizard Of Oz was fantastic !!!........

Reviews.Title: “It's what it says it is”
Reviews.Author: Micklefielder
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are basic, but we were quite satisfied with what we got. We stayed in the new part and our room was modern, clean, comfortable and of adequate size with good bathroom facilities. I mean, let's be realistic here. What other hotels of this standard are available in this part of London for the same rates? And when I say basic, what I mean is that there's nothing really missing unless you're planning to move into your hotel room and live there. And, if you do need extra, there's absolutely no problem in getting it. I know from reading other reviews that towels are an issue, but you've only got to ask at reception and you can have as many as you like. At least coffee and tea making facilities are available in the rooms. Unlike in some other hotels that charge an awful lot more and consider themselves to be far superior simply because there's a sofa and a mini bar in the room. And really, that's all that's missing here.

Reviews.Title: “Paper Thin Walls!!”
Reviews.Author: Melbarnsley
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights but only slept properly for one. The Walls are paper thin so for 2 nights we listened to a pack of girls screaming and shouting in the early hours for a good couple of hours. They only gave up after the people in the room above hammered on the floor and I called reception. It's a pity because the bed was very comfortable and the location to covent garden is perfect. We were in the old building so the room was quite tired and in need of an update. Lots of steps to reception and no storage for bags, Â£10 for a late check out and Â£10 for early check in. But despite all that we had an excellent time and the weather was really warm for an Easter break.

Reviews.Title: “Some people expect to much”
Reviews.Author: Noddy1973
Reviews.Content: I suppose it depends where you have stayed before and what you expect,I was pleasantly surprised when entering reception it was like a new build inside clean but slightly short on staff, but ha Ho. Got to the room and once again it was lovely clean and new looking, tv on the wall lovely shower room comfy bed. The location is excellent walking distance to every where. I give it the thumbs up for travelodge they've done a great job for a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, neglected and a sleep from hell”
Reviews.Author: Rouleur2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this place for 3 nights and hardly slept a wink on each. Room was seedy almost, bathroom was disgusting and the noise was unbearable. Don't even consider as a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: soosiepip
Reviews.Content: I booked up in February to take my niece ( age 14) to London to see the sights and a show. I chose this hotel because of location, a couple of weeks ago I read the reviews on this site and was so disheartened, I contemplated cancelling our stay because of the negative comments, IM SO PLEASED I DIDNT. WE HAD A BRILLIANT TIME. The location to Holborn Station is a two minute walk, its right near Covent Garden, and lots of shops, eating out places are on the door step. Its only 2 stops from Kings Cross, and so central for getting about. We were in the new building, Our room was small but lovely and clean, the bathroom was immaculate and our bed really comfy, loads of channels on the tv, crispy clean towels, and the staff were all really helpful, kind and smiley, I appreciate that some people have had a bad time here but we loved it, and credit where credits due, the price of our stay was the cheapest in London that I could find, We are booking up again and will definitely stay here. Dont let the negative comments on here put you off, I wouldnt stay anywhere else now................ FAB> thanks to all At the hotel for being so lovely.

Reviews.Title: “BE WARNED -The Worst Experience of my life - SAFER STAYING ON THE STREETS”
Reviews.Author: Regular_Traveller02
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with a friend, booked 2 rooms and paid the extra on one for early check in as going out for the day and pointless paying double just to leave a bag in the room. However, asked the hotel if we could have rooms closely located as the hotel is split into 2 buildings. All OK, upon return was told I was in the other hotel and that my request that had previously agreed was not possible. Frustrated I argued with the night manager, and eventually they found a room in the same building in the basement (sounds nice!!!). Tried to get into my room but key did not work, went back to an empty reception and slammed the room key down to get some attention. Was then met by 2 "Thugs" employed by the hotel who man handled me. Was asked to leave or they would call the police!!!!! So asked them to call the police and waited outside. when police arrived they made the hotel manager see sense and I was given my "Working" room key. Overall an awful experience and when I complained took weeks for Travelodge customer services to respond with a standard response hoping this experience would not stop me staying agan. Guess what ????? I will not be staying at a Travelodge again, can't think why????? Be warned

Reviews.Title: “Shocked At How Good The Hotel Was”
Reviews.Author: neil123456789
Reviews.Content: Turned up at the the hotel after reading tripadvisors website expecting horror hotel, then proceeded to check in, good welcome from staff, used early check in which cost Â£10 but was worth it as it was 11am. The room was clean and spacious, recently modernised. Stayed for 3 days, room was cleaned daily with clean linen. The hotel was close to local amenities and an ideal location, would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location....great value”
Reviews.Author: stevielatphoto
Reviews.Content: Having researched this hotel, there were conflicting reviews. We are so glad we didn't take notice of the negative ones. It is on the Piccadilly line, so we caught the tube from Heathrow, and the hotel was about 2 minutes walk from Covent Garden Tube Station. The hotel itself looks recently refurbished, and is right in the heart of Covent Garden, with loads of restaurants, bars, and attractions within walking distance. The staff were very approachable, and it proved to be the perfect trip. We have already booked a return visit and will be making the Travelodge our first choice. Although it wasn't the cheapest hotel, I'm sure if you book well enough in advance you should get a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “You cannot expect champagne on beer money, but I recommend a stay.”
Reviews.Author: oscarposh
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many London hotels and have come to the conclusion that the Travel Lodge Covent Garden is the best option as the value for money coupled with the excellent location is unbeatable. It is a bed for the night and it works very well and I have already booked my next stay. No-one could possibly expect The Ritz when you are paying less than Â£100 per night. Have a look at the other London hotels and ratings (even some of the really luxury hotels fall short of providing a luxury stay). You can pay twice as much and still be disappointed and I much prefer to pay less and enjoy spending the rest on enjoying the many delights of London including retail therapy! In short, if you are looking for reasonably priced accommodation, on the doorstep of Covent Garden and the theatres, then I would recommend Travel Lodge - just don't expect champagne on beer money!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Antho909
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Didn't have any great expectations of this hotel and what you see is what you get. Very basic, room was clean, hotel in a good location. If your wanting something cheap for one night then this is probably going to hit the mark. It's nothing fancy and the breakfast is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful value for money”
Reviews.Author: recharnock
Reviews.Content: we stayed for two nights at just over Â£70 per night,the location is good just a 5 min walk from covent garden tube station and it was clean, but that was about it, the rooms are small, dark and very basic, the bed isnt the comfiest and the staff were not particularly helpful, early check in (before 3) is an extra 10 pounds and they wont store bags, there is steps to get to the hotel entrance so if carrying heavy vases can be tricky, shampoo and conditioner is extra, you have to ask for a hairdryer and iron, plus the view isn't the best.i would not stay there again i felt ripped off as it wasn't a cheap stay and have stayed in much better travelodges so thought they would be of similar standards, i was wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, don't understand the negative reviews!”
Reviews.Author: dexter0808
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on the 4th floor in the High Holburn Building. The Hotel has obviously just been renovated, including the public areas and corridors. The room smelt brand new and was, although basic, comfortable, extremely modern and homely. We had everything we needed, and nothing that we didn't. (The flat screen TV was much appreciated!) The breakfast was brilliant, a good selection of fresh food and cereals etc - something for everyone. The bar was also reasonably priced. The best feature of the hotel, however, is the location. Very central, in walking distance of most attractions. Yes, there was only one set of towels, but this was quickly sorted by the helpful reception staff and yes, there is no phone in the room, but to be honest, a trip to the reception area really isn't too much bother. The hotel became busy on the Friday night, but the staff were very efficient, making sure this did not interfere with our stay. Would definately stay again, great value for money. A great base for a trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “There's basic and there's BASIC!”
Reviews.Author: ExeterToller
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay in the travel lodge at Covent Garden London because we've stayed in travel lodges before and been very pleased,how wrong this time! we know you get what you pay for and as we didn't want to pay major money for staying in london and really only wanted somewhere to sleep and relax we thought this would be ideal. After a long journey we arrived and we were told we were at the wrong building and directed across the road where we were greeted or not by the receptionist who really didn't want to be there, the whole time we were there i don't think we saw her smile once, she really is in the wrong job!. Now for the room, it wasn't very clean,ripped sheets, mouldy areas in the bathroom,dirty windows, the light switch looked like it had been punched in and tried to be repaired, badly! 1 bath towel and 1 hand towel for three of us, the sofa bed was stained and yes our daughter had to sleep on that, so i dread to think what our matress looked like! We never saw any fire safety instructions. We paid in advance for evening meals which were served in the cafe area, we were left just hanging around as no one was around to ask what was the procedure, when someone eventually came they didn't seem to know what they were doing,the meals we chose were unavailable, the tables were disgusting our daughter put her mobile phone down on it and it actually stuck to it,filthy! There was only one person around who was expected to do everything. Although we had paid for the next night we chose to lose our money and eat elsewhere. When we returned the next day the cleaners had obviously been in, the only reason we knew this was the bin had been emptied no other reason, no new toliet roll left, we had to ask at reception for another. We do not feel it was good value for money, we've always been pleased with our stays at travel lodge, but definitely not this one, travel lodge really need to review this place, we definitely won't stay here again. The only plus we have to say is the location!

Reviews.Title: “disgusting, s**thole”
Reviews.Author: clairea82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hoel for "nights with my mum and young daughter who we were taking to see Wizard of Oz. Never have i seen anything more disgusting in my life, there was only 1 curtain hanging at the window in our room which was over looked by other windows the curtain wouldnt even close half way across the window because it was falling down the staff werent interested and did nothing the room overall was dirty there were scorch marks on the walls and ceiling from the lights we only had 1 set of towels left on the first night (luckily we had took some of our own)! The food wasnt very good we ate tea on our 2nd night that looked like a ready meal from tesco we kept having to remind staff what we had ordered as they were only bringing half our order before serving other people. on the 2nd morning i noticed the cereals were nearly all out of date we complained to staff and they told us that it was a production date needless to say we went hungary. would never stay in another Travelodge again

Reviews.Title: “I am going to stay again very soon”
Reviews.Author: pomocnice
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with this hotel. It was nice and clean. Very specious room. The only problem which occured to us was there is no possibility of leaving your bags in the hotel after you check out. We had to leave out baggage in Victoria station and pay Â£8 for each. But I guess thinking of how many rooms they have in the hotel it would be impossible for them to store so many bags. I am going to stay again next month. Cheap and sweet.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad!”
Reviews.Author: sjy67
Reviews.Content: me and 13yr old daughter stayed for 3 nights - room was fairly ok, except we were on the upperground level (room ug5) which meant our room overlooked some sort of enclosed delivery access road - it was very quiet, but absolutely no daylight! Other than that it was fine - very central location, room was clean, bed comfy, asked for more pillows, towels and teabags and got them with no problem. staff polite and helpful. had buffet breakfast - big range of hot and cold breakfast that filled us up for the day! would def stay again, but next time ask to be put in a room that wasnt on the ug floor! on the whole, not bad for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, basic, faded hotel”
Reviews.Author: danco28
Reviews.Content: This Travelodge is very close to Covent Garden/Soho and the West End and does have a smart-ish looking bar. The corridors of the hotel are dingy and the rooms are pretty much the same. If you get the right price it's good value for London but I wouldn't recommend staying for too long or having high expectations! The breakfast is good - evening food is not!

Reviews.Title: “Grim”
Reviews.Author: alanf8
Reviews.Content: Whilst the Reception area and cafe have been given a makeover the rest of the hotel is not pleasant. The room was awful, basic doesn't cover it. Dirty carpet, thin sheets and the mattress well.. Bathroom well past its sell by date. Not worth the money at any price.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pooja23
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed for 2 nights, which was ridiculously over priced and we didnt get our moneys worth. We got to a room which was small, very dull and miserable.The view from the room overlooked another building where people could see into our room. We were given one towel to share!! We didnt get any soap or shampoo or tooth paste.. When my partner asked for shower gel we were given a tiny piece of soap, the bathroom didnt even have a soap dish we had to buy all the essentials for only 2 nights stay!! Also the lighting was terrible in the room! However the the location was perfect all the train stations are walking distance. The staff were nice. But overall the we didnt get anything for the stupid price we paid!!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good - will stay again”
Reviews.Author: conan
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful reception. Pleasant looking restaurant/bar area, although we didn't make use of it, Hotel seemed very clean, the worst you could say was that one of our rooms was a little tired and could do with a refurb. Could also have done with another pillow, but I could have got one if I could have been bothered to go down to reception! It was perfectly adequate, quiet, and very good value. Room sizes seem to vary but you could pay much more in London without getting a bigger room. There was even a reasonable view. We'll use this hotel again if we need to stay over in town.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!”
Reviews.Author: Tubbycat50
Reviews.Content: Dirty, smelly, badly signposted rooms, staff didn't seem to care, curtains hanging off rails. Worst hotel I have ever stayed in. First and last time with Travel Lodge. I have heard that the newer end of the hotel is better, so maybe request this.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: shazza05
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the old building on Drury Lane, one member of staff was very un obliging at check in. The Carpet in our room was dirty, drinks splashed up walls,and skirting Boards filthy!! Stayed for two nights, room wasnt cleaned properly and only got one Bath Towel and One hand Towel each day. This is the worst Travelodge i have ever stayed in... On a positive note, the beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for central London!!”
Reviews.Author: tanewman
Reviews.Content: Overall, we really enjoyed our stay. The Good: we had a family room for 3 adults - lots of space, and very comfortable. The central London location is fantastic. You can't beat the price - we booked 3 months in advance and paid Â£52 for the room, absolute bargain! The staff we spoke to were very very friendly. The Bad: cleanliness!!! Out sink had loads of hairs around it. The carpets looked dirty. My sheets were stained and there was a questionable hair on my sheets! Secondly, 7.95 is too expensive for a breakfast! But there are cafs as well as restaurants just over the road. Fantastic hotel for nights away with friends, but wouldn't recommend it for romance

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...dont expect the Ritz, it's a Travelodge after all”
Reviews.Author: rgowan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in other travelodges in London and have never had a problem as you get what you pay for. And this one is no exception. It annoys me how people complain...its a travelodge at the end of the day...you get a bed(s), sheet(s) and towel(s) and a toilet, shower/bath, TV, Mirror and chair and some storage space with a couple of hangers THATS ALL YOU EXPECT!! If you need more towels or sheets then they will give you as many as you like, all you have to do is pop to reception and ask. BE WARNED if you turn up before 3pm and havent paid for early check in then they will make you wait (some other travelodges will let you check in i.e. the ones that arnt as busy). The location is FANTASTIC, covent garden and most of the theatres are in walking distance and you can get a bus or the tube anywere. I wouldnt recomend getting a breakfast as its not very good quality and their are plenty of places near by to get something to eat. I stayed in the High Hoburn side but they were doing up the Drury lane side so odds are those rooms are nicer now. Family rooms are all in the High Hoburn side with all other rooms in the Drury Lane building. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone but only if they paid Â£59 a night or less as I dont think a Travelodge is worth more thand Â£59 a night. I only paid Â£49 a night for 5 nights, pre booking is essenctial to get the best price. If you can get another Travelodge for less then I would consider it unless location is key for you. I am returing in August for a week and paid just Â£36 a night for 5 nights, I CANT WAIT!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kristine88
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Travelodge for 5 nights.... the location was fantastic.. it was like living in a little village erverything was near and the staff were quite helpful. Our room was a little cold due to a draft but the bed was comfy and the water was always hot. Would have been nice if there was more of a selection of food in the lobby and maybe had 7up for my wine!!!!! But apart from them little things we had no problem, we really enjoyed our stay and the hotel was always busy and a great atmosphere....So yes I would recommend this hotel for the central location and the good atmosphere... 4 out of 5....

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with Travelodge!”
Reviews.Author: mmichaeluk
Reviews.Content: The new part (old rooms are naff) of this hotel is clean, smart and have comfy beds. Great nights sleep. Staff were helpful and very polite. I was very impressed for the cost of Â£43!

Reviews.Title: “BIG BIG WASTE OF MONEY”
Reviews.Author: lililoulou28
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Travelodge Covent Garden last weekend and it was...HORRIBLE. Had a nightmare getting there due to protests etc, finally checked & had to wait till 2.30 or would of got early check in fee and then had to lug our stuff over to BUILDING 2. Room numbers not well sign posted but finally arrived and the room was awful. The curtains were half hanging up, scorch marks on ceiling and tables. Bed too soft and wonky, the sofa had brown marks on it (nice!), bathroom tatty with a rubbish luke warm shower. Went for a birthday night out and returned to find hotel looking like a keebab shop seating area full of drunks eating and drinking ( worrying there is 2 doormen there!!) Paid about Â£100 for an awful nights sleep as our room overlooked main road. We actually checked window wasnt open as noise so loud. Didnt have breakfast as had to pay and I thought a nerve considering room expensive. Appreciate London not cheap place to stay but will definatley pay extra and stay somewhere with standards next time. Made me laugh as this hotel features on Travelodge advert on TV....mark my words......NOT LIKE THAT AT ALL!!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: lynseyrobertson
Reviews.Content: perfect location, near theatres train staions and shops, easy to see the sights. I found the travel lodge very good value for money just what i wanted, a basic room to sleep. didnt expect much else to was really happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...but had a few negatives...”
Reviews.Author: missyd247
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the travelodge for just 1 night... it was a perfect location for us. Very easy to get to Covent Garden tube station. Whilst we thought the customer service was good we were rather shocked at the extra charge for wanting to check in 35mins early even though our room was ready, we decided not to pay this and spent the Â£10 charge in the bar instead...better spent!!! The room itself was clean however smelt stuffy and our first impression was how bad the room was lit by very artificial lighting. Shower was very powerful and did have hot water on the first evening of our stay however the following morning the water was cold...also had to go down to reception to ask for another bath towel as there was only one in a room for two people!!!! Found as girls getting ready to go out for the night not only was the lighting bad for makeup applying but there was no mirror over the dressing table and no plug sockets near the one mirror that the room had...not good room planning!!! Also thought that the room could have done with a phone to be able to ring reception should we require any assistance rather than having to go all the way down to the reception desk. All in all rather disappointed with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the High Holborn building and you'll be fine”
Reviews.Author: robertNewYork
Reviews.Content: Whenever we visit the UK or Ireland, my partner and I try to stay in Travelodges. I avoid the ones that are older if they get a lot of negative reports, but the newer ones are wonderful. As I am writing this, we are staying in the High Holborn building. Our 10th floor room is typical Travelodge, spacious, with a large bathroom with great shower and tub with temperature controls. The view is beautiful. Staff have been pleasant and helpful. Be aware that in all Travelodges, if you need additional towels or pillows, all you need do is ask. here is some noise from the street and nearby bars, but we closed the window and it was not a problem. Any location in central London would have the same problem. There is absolutely no noise from within the building. The complaints about awful rooms seem to all be related to the Drury Lane building. The way to ensure that you get a room in the Holborn building is to book a family room, as they are all in that building. The price is the same as for a double, and you get a queen-size bed and a pullout sofa. We do not use the pullout, but the sofa gives us a place to sit. Our rate for Saturday was 96 GBP, but Sunday is only 29 as I booked it using the saver rate. Other than Saturdays, if you book well in advance you can get the saver rate. To my mind, this is an amazing bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great, if you just want somewhere to drop your bags off”
Reviews.Author: sor006
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 night stay at this hotel, picked mainlly for the location and the price-although we did pay Â£75 per night. Self check in was quick and easy-what's the point in having a reception where 2 members of saff totally ignore you anyway! Finally got to the room on the 3rd floor after passing through the maze of corridors... The room was basic: no welcome pack, no fire emergency instructions (should I have been scared?), no telephone and no hair drier. It did however have tea and coffee facilities, a small bar of soap, 2xplastic cups, stains on the ceiling and wall and to top it all off we were fortunate to have pubic hair in the bed!-yes i know it's a hotel and other people have slept there, but it's not something you want to see.... The lampshades on either side of the bed were wonky. The bed was hard, the pillows were really thin they had to be folded over and the duvet was as thin as a blanket.... The windows were closed and there was still a draught and the noise from the street was soo loud you felt as if you were standing in it yourself as you could hear everything! There was a tv, but no remote and the only light switches were by the door and not on the wall next to the bed as you would get in most hotels. We didn't eat in the hotel, but the menu looked reasonably priced. Overall, if you're lucky to get this hotel on the Â£19 offer then it's a great hotel because you pay for what you get it, but anything more than this-you're wasting your money...

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I Have Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: RJNash
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this hotel is split into two. The better reviews apparently all refer to the High Holborn part. The Drury Lane site, where I had the misfortune to stay, is by far the most depressing, dismal hotel I have ever visited. My girlfriend and I booked for a long weekend and we chose Travelodge on the grounds that it may be basic but you know what you're getting. However, this one falls well below the standards you would expect, even if you don't expect much. Surly staff greet you at the reception and point you in the direction of the check-in machine - which will not entertain a check-in until 3pm. The room was very difficult to find and required lugging our suitcase down several flights on stairs and around corners. Okay for my but for elderly people no fun at all. The room was breathtakingly depressing. Grimy, dingy, stains on the ceiling, no telephone to contact reception, no bedside tables, no toiletries other than one wafer thin bit of soap which was still thicker than the pillows on the bed. The bathroom stank. There was constant noise from the hen night staying next door. One set of towels between two people. The bed displayed the most spectacular example of roll-together known to man. We managed one night here before getting out the credit card and treating ourselves to staying somewhere decent. It was either that or have the whole weekend blighted by this appalling hotel. Do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else. The staff didn't ask why we were checking out two days early. They've probably heard it all before.

Reviews.Title: “Aside from location there is NOTHING to recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhilR75
Reviews.Content: On Arrival I was grunted towards an auto mated check in, which led me to a room 287. I walk up the 2nd floor to find the rooms stop at 271. On walking back to reception I'm told 'Of course there's a room 287, would you like me to show you?' in an incredibly patronising tone... I agreed to go and look again, noting that the lift also listed to only room 271. A quick scan and back I went. There was absolutely no apology as they scarwled a new number on my paper and agreed they had sent me to a room that didn't exist. This I could live with, mistakes can happen and I went to the room, booked as a double... It seems travelodge want to cut corners and this is fine if it reduces costs. But I do feel that the expectation that 2 people share a towel may be taking things too far. Another journey down to the ground floor where I was handed a towel, again no apology (Repeat this the next day after the room had been cleaned - This does lead me to believe that it may be the hotel's policy to encourage towel sharing? I have no idea) I was then forced back down to reception again when the key card stopped working, only to be eyed suspciously and be told I had 'put it on a magnet' The issues themselves may have been trivial but the responses from staff were rude again and again. The location of the hotel was perfect for getting round and about central London, but I would think twice before staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Apart from the location not a lot going for it”
Reviews.Author: Foybes
Reviews.Content: As far as location goes the hotel is ideally located for the Covent Graden area as the name suggests, but after that not a lot else to recommend it. We arrived at about 2pm to be told that it would cost an extra Â£10 to check in before 3pm though to be fair to the receptionist she advised that ifwe came back at 2:30 we could check in for free so we went off for a coffee. At 2:30 we checked in using the automatic check in machines which we had to queue for despite the fact that there were 2 or 3 members of staff around the reception area none of them could ceck us in at the desk! Our room (No 35) was not accesible from the reception area so we had to go down the steps (not sure what provision there were for disabled guests) onto the road around the corner and into the basement. The room itself was small and gloomy in part due to the lack of natural light it only had a small (10"x18") window which looked out onto the underground carpark. The extractor fan in the bathroom did not work and the one in the bedroom was noisey and stayed on all night. There were also only 3 pillows! The room was als quite cold and we noticed other people getting portable electric heaters from reception but we didn't bother. The bathroom was small with noisey plumbing evrytime the tap were turned on or the toilet flushed. It was also grubby in places and the corners of the floor could have done with a good scub.
