I know Travelodge are budget hotels but this was not particulary cheap and for example no hair dryer in the room which is standard with equivalent Premier Inns. Perhaps the main building rooms are better and we were unlucky. We did not have breakfast in the hotel but there are lots of nice cffee shops in andaroundthe area. I would probably not book here again.

Reviews.Title: “great budget choice in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: elsaskelter
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 1 night stay here we booked a family room after reading reviews and managed to get it in one the frequent travelodge sales for Â£30. It is in easy walking distance of Covent Garden and Leicester Square. The room was clean and large as it had a sofa bed in it. I was surprised at how quiet it was although we did stay on a Sunday night. The bed was a bit soft but for one night perfectly adequate. In an area where Hotel prices are routinely Â£100 and up we felt that we had very good value for money. It's no frills but for the amount of time you spend in the room we were very pleased. We would definitely stay again if we got this price!

Reviews.Title: “Worst night's sleep ever!"”
Reviews.Author: Railwaychick
Reviews.Content: My employer at the time booked this hotel and they were charged a lot of money for me to stay there. On arrival I was sent to a room that wasn't ready - there was a massive stain on the mattress & the duvet, not a good impression about their cleansiness. The front desk apologised and blamed their cleaning staff. I asked for a quiet room but I had to go through six double doors to get there (there are no ironing boards/iron in the room) and I was put beside a very busy road. Stains were everywhere - on the bed, on the lampshades (burn marks), in the bathroom on the ceiling tiles, the shower was rusty and the shower curtain a trip hazard. I later complained and they didn't even address me by my name (they called me by another name but sent their reply to my email address) nor did they take any responsibility for the issues raised. Their saving grace was the breakfast - it was really nice, good variety and the serving staff went out of their way to please.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills but Ideal Location and place to put your head”
Reviews.Author: Button_382
Reviews.Content: I give this a very good because if your looking for something reasonably priced in London in a great location this is the place. Covent Gardens is the best area of London in my opinion, and I love the theatres. There are however NO FRILLS at all about this hotel. it is a place to keep your stuff and a place to shower and sleep. However, we arent people that sit around in the hotel or eat at the hotel when traveling so all i want is somewhere clean and in a good location. I also dont have any trouble sleeping so i'm not too picky about noise etc. Service is not the Ritz but friendly enough staff. Going to be passing through london again in June so we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rubbish beds”
Reviews.Author: EvoProudSalopian
Reviews.Content: Firstly, we stopped in the family building, which I think was in High Holburn St, the location was great, not far from a couple of tubes, and only a five minute walk to Covent Garden Market. The room itself was very clean, however, there were old sausages on the floor in reception! The beds in the room were awful, and gave both the adults bad backs. We hd a great view from the 11th floor and could seee Wembly to Big Ben, however even though we were high up, it was still noisey - traffic, sirens and revellers! The woman on reception wasnt up to much, and people coming into the hotel to book in were simply told not yet, but not why. One chap seemed to earn his money at breakfast, think he was called Jeremy! The facilities were fine - TV, kettle and wardrobe space. Dont bother stopping for a breakfast, across the road, are two or three cafes which knock up breakfasts, fresher, cheaper and tastier.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location and for the money an excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mabelbedsox
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from a 2 night stay. We were in the Drury Lane building which is still undergoing a refurb but that didn't cause any problems. Upon arival we were met by a friendly receptionist who directed us to the self check in machines. She gave us our reservation number and directed us to our room. Once we got there we found it was clean, tidy and quite spacious. Only downside was only 1 pillow each and 1 set of towels. I popped to reception and could have got any number of either. We didnt have breakfast in the hotel but did have a meal on the second evening and it was reasonably well priced and of a good standard. I must say i was a tad apprehensive about staying here after reading the reviews but it was great. I wouldn't hesitate in going back and would definitely recommend this travelodge to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What do you expect from with Travelodge???”
Reviews.Author: Jarrh
Reviews.Content: It's a Travelodge hotel. They're so popular because they are cheap and have a high guest turnover of mostly tourists. The hotel is simply somewhere to sleep. If you want to spend the whole day and night there it's pretty pointless booking. It's within walking distance of Covent garden and London theatres. Booked again to go this April. If you want the Ritz go ask for the same room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: BooBooYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Having read recent reviews i was worried, but it was absolutely fine. Staff were helpful and friendly, yes it was noisy in the annex from traffic but it's central London, take ear plugs! Dinner wasn't 5* but it was hot and tasty, breakfast was plentyful. yes the room was 'tired' but it was clean and the bed was really comfy! Would i stay again...absolutely

Reviews.Title: “basic place, HORRID food”
Reviews.Author: charny_ox
Reviews.Content: Stayed when me and my family went to see The Lion King at the theatre great walkin distance from the lyceum theatre, once we finally found the place. Parents booked evening meal as part of our rooms, but the food was basic and cold. One woman was running around by herself trying to be a waiter as well as serve people drinks at the bar. After waiting too long for cold food and sending it back and it still coming back cold we decided to eat elsewhere. Location wise id recommend for the rooms and food i would not.

Reviews.Title: “Tired but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: badger064st
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Travlodge at Covent Garden previously and had not hesitation booking again. Its location is excellent there are plenty of good eating and drinking spots nearby and close to many of the tourist attractions and transport links. Check in was a little odd, as the new world is creeping in with automated check in which did not really speed up the process as it still requires the same number of staff to man the machines and guide novices through the process. The room was clean and tidy, a bit dingy but it is just a bed for the night. While the foyer is quite spick and span the rest of the hotel is now quite tired and dated which seems to be somthing all Travelodges are suffering from during its recent massive growth purchasing up lots of inner city hotels. We paid for breakfast in the morning which had actually improved on previous experienes the food actually tasted what it should be like! The staff were helpful but I feel that they could be better they weren't rude but they werent that polite either, At the end of the day it is a budget Hotel in a very good location in Central London which is considerably cheaper than anything else in that area you can find on website like late rooms. I would and have recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in very good location”
Reviews.Author: CHARLIEBOY-68
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights ,with wife & 2 young children .We had a great deal b&b & evening meal for Â£206 great value . This is the second time we have stayed ,this time we were on the quieter side of the building & had great nights sleep ,but we heard from other people that it was quite noisy .The breakfast was excellent with a great deal of choice .The location was very good ,a five minute walk to Covent Garden & five minutes to Holborn tube station ( there is a large family friendly Witherspoon's pub outside).In summary i would say buy some earplugs with the money you save from booking this great value hotel to be sure of enjoying your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible and hard to find room.”
Reviews.Author: sian0203
Reviews.Content: Obviously I know that Travelodge is a budget hotel chain but they are usually fairly standard and nearly all the same. I felt that the standard of the room I stayed in was not up to the usual Travelodge standard. It was clean but it was very old fashioned, the furniture was scratched, the bathroom looked like it was straight out of the 1970s, the walls were painted blood red in a very patchy fashion, the carpets were tatty and old etc. I was particularly concerned by the large brown patch on the ceiling above the shower. When we arrived the reception checked us in and then sighed and said â€œDo you know where the lift is, by any chanceâ€�, obviously not as we had never been there before. We were not warned about the wet paint everywhere (they were working on the bar area). The room was also extremely difficult to find, involving going up one floor in the lift, then along a corridor, down a flight of stairs, around a corner and down another flight of stairs; all this without any directions from reception, a map or even any signs to point us in the right direction; we looked for 15 minutes and then had to find a member of staff and ask for help to locate the room. We also had to hurdle over dirty sheets in the corridors and on the stairs which were just abandoned in large piles. It was definitely not up to the standard of other (less expensive) Travelodges that I have stayed in before. I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “No phone in the room!”
Reviews.Author: luwerner
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my mum, who is 70 years old. We were put in a room outside the main building and I had to carry both our suitcases up 4 sets of steps. The room was small, but clean. I was surprised , though, to find there was no telephone in the room, not even an internal one so I could contact reception! On our second night, we got back to the hotel late and tired to find they had put only one towel in the bathroom. Because there was no way to communicate wit reception, I had to go down and out to get an extra towel. On our third night, again, only one towel when we got back and no toilet paper. At the reception, they gave the towel and told me someone was going to take the toilet roll to the room. I waited until 2AM and gave up! The next morning I had to ask a friend that live in London to call the hotel (which only has a premium rate number so I did not have enough credit on my mobile) to ask them to send us some toilet paper! I really regret having booked this hotel. I would rather spend a little bit more for a better service!

Reviews.Title: “No concept of customer service”
Reviews.Author: christianuncut
Reviews.Content: We had some items removed from our room by a staff member - just some new magazines so the cost was not great, otherwise we'd have called the police. When we complained we were told it never happened. So, the rooms may be cheap but you get called a liar when you complained you've had something stolen. We are going legal on this

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, No problems with the hotel”
Reviews.Author: footyboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the travel lodge for 2 nights tues/wed 22nd/23rd feb 2011. Had a family room and a double room booked for myself,wife and 6year old and my 70 year old mum and dad. We arrived b4 15.00 so we were aware of the Â£10 early check-in. The efficent receptionist allocated us a room and told us to come back after 15.00 to check into the 2nd room thus avoiding a 2nd Â£10 charge. The rooms were next to each other on the 9th floor with decent view of the BT tower. The lifts ran smoothly and quickly so no problems there. The rooms were clean and the beds were fine, all we wanted really as we didnt spend much time in them anyway. Didnt eat at the hotel as there are many places in the area, wetherspoons 5 min walk for breakfast etc. The location is a fantastic base for getting around, did the london eye,changing of the guard and watched the LION KING at the lyceum theatre, would stay there again, cheers.

Reviews.Title: “ASK FOR ROOM 418”
Reviews.Author: WARREN888
Reviews.Content: We had booked the hotel for a five night stay before reading all the bad reviews,so it was with some trepidation that we checked in.The check -in was swift and problem free(although as we were early so we paid the Â£10 charge)and the staff pleasant.Our room was clean with modern furniture,good tv sevice on a flat scrren tv.The bathroom was clean and had an excellent shower,two sets of towels were provided,the only thing we had to request,was extra pillows,which we received right away.During our stay the room was very quiet,except adjacent room noise,which you can`t blame the hotel for.The view from the room wasn`t brilliant,but that didn`t bother us.Our only complaints were that on three days out of five,only one set of towels was left and we always had to request toilet rolls,but paying Â£42 a night in such a good convenient location,we could put up with that. We stayed in the Covent Garden block which is under renovation,but the noise was minimal.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT - dont be put off by reviews”
Reviews.Author: theatre_lover70
Reviews.Content: i have just returned home from staying at this hotel. on arrival i and the group i and 4 of my friends were nervous of this hotel due to previous reviews we had read. all we wanted was a clean basic room to stay in for our trip. on arrival we checked in and we were placed in two different buildings, after reading the reviews of drury lane, we asked at reception to place us all on the same floor in the newly refurbished building on museum street. the staff were very friendly and welcoming and moved all our rooms to the opposite building, and they were also moving other people at request. my friend was in a single room as she was not travelling with a partner and as there were no single rooms available in that building they placed her in a double room with no extra charge so she wouldn't be separated from us. the room was spotless, very basic (but thats what a travelodge is!!) and very very comfortable. could not hear any noise (on 9th floor). towels etc changed daily. better again was how central we were, a two minute walk from holborn underground, a 5 minute walk from leicester and trafalgar square, a further 5 mins to westminster / big ben and along to buckingham palace. surrounded by many pubs and restaurants...we were spoiled for choice. i would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again. my friends have also said they would definitely return to this hotel for Â£55 a night, an absolute bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: SomersetLaubo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location to get around central London, and the quality is what you would expect from a Travelodge. However we stayed in the annexe across the road. The disclaimer at the bottom of the hotel description, about noise during the night did not prepare us for total sleep deprivation. There is a nightclub next to the building which was playing loud music until 7:30 am. I would never use Travelodge again. Also be warned they have no left luggage facility.

Reviews.Title: “No need to have worried about our stay.”
Reviews.Author: blue270807
Reviews.Content: After booking up to stay at the travel lodge I didn't read any of the reviews untill the day before we we due to go, after all I thought Travel Lodge would come under one 'good' heading. I wasn't impressed and was worried as to what to expect. We checked into the reception on Dury Lane but we were then directed to the High Holborn site as we had booked a family room ( 3 x adults) Staff polite and helpful. The room was large, clean warm with towel( only one pillow per person another one given on request) quiet very basic but what else do you need if you are spending your days sight seeing? So handy for the West end and for the first time on our visits we didn't have to rely on the tubes to get us around. Breakfast - good choice of food and the staff were so quick to clear away and keep things moving.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine. You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: helens04
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just for one night. Quick check in via a machine. Building work going on so had to exit reception and enter a separate building via a side street by keycard. Room was basic, tired furniture, but clean, a reasonable size, and although some general noise from outside could be heard. It was nothing unsurprising for central London. Would happily stay here again, on my own or with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a dump”
Reviews.Author: Shropshire91
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel as appeared to be good value for us and our teenage daughter who we were meeting in London, avoiding the need for two hotel rooms. However, family rooms all appear to be in a seperate block away from the main hotel and whilst the reception area was OK and the staff friendly the room was awful. It was freezing cold the cover on the sofa bed and carpet were stained and looked like they had never ever been cleaned. There was graffiti on the walls and the room was generally in need of a good paint. Both lifts had broken buttons with exposed wires which we refused to use necessitating a walk to the fourth floor. I did not expect luxury for the price but basic cleanliness isn't too much to ask for is it?

Reviews.Title: “travelodge - motel like motel”
Reviews.Author: traveltop16
Reviews.Content: when you go & book travelodge . get ready to be in motel with all the meanings attached. the location is very good the room is ok & the furniture is quite sufficent. the toilet& bath room is another thing. although there is hot water the water instaltion is bad & turn to stuck from time to time. & here i come to the critical points. travelodge should learn 1 thing or 2 about service. service is unfamilier word in travelodge policy no shamoo or other bath acccesories 1/2 rool off paper with no extras. worst- there is no phone to reception which include only 1 man at shift . we stayd at the 11th floor. i dont want to think what could had happen incase of fire event. there is no option to communicate the reception . for the dessert there is a special warrning for guests which need to leave there thing for couple of hours after check out. : THERE IS NO LUGGAGE ROOM IN ALL TRAVELODGE HOTELS AS POLICY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! so we need to take our heavy belongings & put the in kings kross station for 8 ukp aday per each peace!! take all this in considratation when you go travelodge, very good for students. for other- stay away!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but ok.”
Reviews.Author: waynebilling
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came down last weekend, and as I had also arranged to come down a cple of weeks later I wanted to work to a budget so we booked the Covent Garden Travel Lodge. We stayed over for 3 nights and we were absolutely dreading it because of all the bad reviews but guess what it wast that bad at all. The room was very basic room no 314, it had the crappiest view in the world the back of a office but so what. We were on the supposedly worst side of the Rd where the work was going on but it didn't effect us at all. We also found all the staff we encountered to be very pleasant. I guess it must be the luck of the drawer on what room you get and maybe how bad the room is but we obviously touched lucky and as long as we had a similar room again I wouldn't hesitate in booking again. Only complaint I would have is that in the hallway it did smell of damp but nowhere else in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: tiger064
Reviews.Content: had to move rooms first room damp smelt mouldy broken lightshades water marks on cieling no cubourd space 1 towel 1pillow for two people 2nd room better but no kettle or bedding had to go to reception 3 times from top floor as there is no phones in any of the rooms it took 2 hrs plus to get things sorted very disapointing

Reviews.Title: “PRETTY DEPRESSING”
Reviews.Author: yangste
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights - room 338. A long way from reception via building work. Bathroom extremely tired - I could not turn off hot tap on badly stained sink. Shower was good and powerful. Only one set of towels so I pinched some off the service trolley in the corridor. Duvet inside cover was filthy. No phone in room. TV poor reception. No shaver point or extractor fan in bathroom. Having said all that, the location is excellent and there are plenty of cafes to have breakfast in. The most bizarre thing though was the fact that not one of the staff said Good morning or hello or anything at all. Not even when they shared a lift with us. This simple courtesy would cost Travelodge absolutely nothing except a bit of customer service training. They would not even look at us. All in all it is a pretty depressing hotel. I believe the rooms are better across the road but I wonder if they talk to you over there either!

Reviews.Title: “Very poor quality for Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: fragle60
Reviews.Content: We were so disappointed with our stay at this Travelodge as we have experienced such higher standards from other hotels in this chain. We stayed at the Drury Lane site in room 303. As noted on the website this hotel is currently being extended, however what they should really be concentrating on is the refurbishment of the extremely tired exsisting rooms!! Our bed sheets were ripped, there was no hairdryer, very tired furniture,there was thread bare patches on the carpet, broken extractor fan in bathroom, chipped bathroom sink, one set of towels (for 2 people?), grotty ceiling, poor lighting, no hotel info pack. The bed was very uncomfortable which resulted in next to no sleep. All in all the room and hotel has been very neglected. The hotel reception was a very long way from our room due to all the building work going on and there was no telephone in the room to contact reception. Looking at other reviews it sounds like the other site accross the road would be the better option!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Value, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MultiMoose
Reviews.Content: Bit wary on the automated check in when we were allocated room 666! but it was fine, another clean warm place to crash after a days sightseeing. As others review make clear there are 2 separate sites we had a family room on the Holborn road but there is clearly massive refurbishment going on at the other site so it wont be long before both buildings are up to scratch. We had a good nights sleep, there is some road noise but 6 floors up it is more background than anything. Breakfast was buffet full english and continental spread which was very good for the price paid (Â£9 for 4 people, kids eat free) The room cost just Â£29 as we stayed on a Sunday, we will definitely stay here again as it just so close (short walk) to the west end. There is a Domino's pizza place right next door to the Holborn building entrance which will be useful to some.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: laurajb71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the covent garden travelodge due to its central location, it was excellent and we walked to the areas we wanted to visit. We stayed 3 nights and it was around Â£200. For london we think this represented good value for money. This is a budget hotel and we expected clean, warm and good location, it was all three. This is not the Ritz and the bathroom was a lttle tired and dated, they are undergoing a refurbishment in the main areas and if this extends to the rooms, this cheap hotel would be a winner. In summary this is a budget hotel and you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “A BIT OF A DUMP.. THERE ARE MUCH BETTER PLACES TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: jagc
Reviews.Content: The Travel Lodge in Covent Garden is a dump.. the hotel is old, the rooms are old, grubby and not comfortable at all! You can find much better hotels for the price that you will pay here... not recommended at all.!

Reviews.Title: “make sure your in the new block or stay away”
Reviews.Author: mallordhouse
Reviews.Content: whole hotel seemed very outdated and warn-out no warning of extensive buidling work, with booared off areas etc passageways and room smelt of damp/mouldn seen better quality condemened soical housing room 218 window catch broken, couldnt close window- very cold during high winds curtains torn . very badly discoloured , badly creased very poor lghting 2 x40 lamps for the whole room - no light over mirror 2 bedside lights no brighter) bathroom sink missing plug plunger handle taps very old and discoured had to ask for 2nd pillows

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - however book in the newer block”
Reviews.Author: John42Manchester
Reviews.Content: Bedroom clean - overall decor shabby - requested 3 times for lightbulbs to be changed in bathroom and bedside light - no action - watch out for outdated water taps in bath/shower - the hot water is scalding and burnt my feet. Breakfast poor value for money - cheaper to go across the road - much better value - not the best Travelodge by any means - On the plus side - fantastic location for the West End

Reviews.Title: “didnt have any problems here”
Reviews.Author: geordietom
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel for a value one night stay in a decent area,got exactly that,room was like every travelodge i have stayed in,clean and basic (bring your own soap and shampoo)we had a twin room so were in the hotel where the work is being carried out,no real issues with that,i was a bit concerned reading the previous reviews but speak as you find and i found this place to be perfectly adequate for a short stay

Reviews.Title: “Bargain! Good Central Location! 2 Buildings = Confusion!!”
Reviews.Author: SELBYLOU
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel months before our stay and grabbed yet another Travelodge bargain - love a bargain I do! I booked 2 family rooms, 1 for 1 night the other for 2 nights (didnt actually stay a 2nd night but was cheaper to book a room & split the cost than find / pay for luggage store elsewhere!) The website says that you can get off at either Covent Garden or Holborn - we got off at Covent Garden & went for a beer till it was check-in time! We found the hotel pretty easily only to be told we were in the other building - down the street and round the corner! Upon arrival at the correct building (where all the family rooms are) we checked in using the new electronic check-in, what a great idea, easy peasy fab! We were in rooms 470 + 471 - they were totally fine for what we needed. A double bed and sofa bed & a view of the BT Tower from 471!!!!! The building is closer to Holborn underground - a good 5-7mins walk away! On your way you pass a pub called Princess Louise - go in and have a beer, its the coolest Victorian pub I have ever been in, made better cos its my name! I would defo stay at this hotel again, it was perfect for everything we needed. We were attending the NTAs at the O2, and from Holborn you are there in about 30mins, easy peasy! The staff were friendly, most of them foreign, didnt hear one Cockney Accent! I return to Travelodge many times, I have had good and bad experiences - this was one of the good ones!!! PS - dont buy the brekkie, find a cafe for a nicer / cheaper option!

Reviews.Title: “Depends which building - such a difference!”
Reviews.Author: ShireladBristol
Reviews.Content: I booked in to the Drury Lane building as I was staying just one night for a conference. I realise Travelodges are pretty basic, but my room was foul. Filthy net curtains, half the lights not working, stains on the bedclothes and all the depressing looking old furniture was peeling away fronm the MDF underneath. For the first time ever, i complained about the room. I was cheerfully given a room in "the other building" on High Holborn. What a difference - clean, spacious, view towards The Gherkin. And the breakfast at this building was far better than I was led to believe. SO - insist on the High Holborn buildinmg, and you'll get a reasonable bargain. Not brilliant, but ok for the price. Avoid the other one at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: homelover48
Reviews.Content: I wish we had read the reviews on Trip Advisor before we booked this Hotel. It is shabby, cold and dirty. The breakfast at Â£6.50 pp was a basic continental, not value for money, the cafe nearby serves a full english for Â£4.50. We will not be using this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “At this price, I can tolerate the downsides”
Reviews.Author: IndoTripper
Reviews.Content: I paid around Â£80 a night for a double room here, which given that a single room at a hostel in central London can come in upwards of Â£50 - and that a hotel room can easily top Â£200 - is extremely good value. The location, too, is terrific - Leicester Square and Covent Garden about ten minutes' walk away, buses and Tubes within easy reach, a handful of coffee bars adjacent if you don't fancy the Travelodge's breakfast, and a decent pub (the White Hart) just over the road for a drink in the evening. The room was basic - which is part of the deal with Travelodges - but adequately clean, the shower was good, the bed comfortable. The main cautions I'd express are: (a) don't book in here if you want a luxurious full-service hotel - it's more of a budget-motel-in-a-tower-block setup. (b) you might want to wait until the current building work has finished. It didn't disturb my sleep, but it did seem to have put the service elevator out of use, so the staff had to use the guest elevators to move their cleaning equipment around - resulting in hugely long waits. But at this price, in this location, that's tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but dull”
Reviews.Author: WhyShouldIStayHere
Reviews.Content: Typical Travelodge, cheap and not particularity cheerful. Not my first choice and I would have spent more if I could have found anywhere with vacancies. The web connection was slower than my phone dongle and the cost is a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for basic lodging!”
Reviews.Author: Jenga0411
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this travelodge to find that we'd actually gone to the wrong building, so we had to trundle our cases across the road to the other building, which wasn't that much of a big deal, but it would be useful if they would tell you which building your in before arrival as you can check in at both receptions. The room, which was huge was actually incredibly basic compared to other travelodges I've stayed in before. You were supplied with a bed (obviously) a large desk with a television, a wardrobe, and as we had a family room a sofa bed. The em-suite bathroom was fine, no mould or mildew that other guests have complained about. None of these were the problem thoug, it was what we weren't supplied with that was the problem. The room lacked basic amenities like a phone, a hairdryer and even bed sheets for the sofa bed, and when we asked for them I found myself with a pile of sheets chucked into my hand to take to my room myself!! Overall the hotel was OK, just not for why it's priced at, the location is great, just a short walk from holborn station and a 10 minute walk from covent garden itself. If they halved the prices I might consider staying again, just not as the prices stand now as you can stay somewhere much better for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but definitely not cheerful”
Reviews.Author: jonboyWakefield
Reviews.Content: Stayed at a Travel Lodge for the first and last time.We arrived early told there was no where we could leave our case,try the British Museum!!! We could access our room at 2.30 . If we paid Â£10 extra we could go in at 12.30.Why??No shampoo,soap etc in room thougth there were 2 tea bags!! Room was cold,only a thin cover.Bathroom was dirty,gaps in tiles etc.Knock on door at 10.30am day od departure wanting to know when we were leaving??Are all Travel Lodges like this.We are coming in March for a few days BUT not to a travel lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but wouldn't go again!”
Reviews.Author: Drumspyce
Reviews.Content: We really just wanted a place to put our heads down but this couldn't have been more depressing. The family room had one duvet in it. When I asked for another I Wss told I could only get one when I returned later! In fairness the manager intervened when I said I'd only be back at 2 am and he put one in my room. There was no soap or shampoo in the bathroom - you have to buy this from a dispenser in the foyer at daft prices. The hotel feels like a prison and is stark and depressing. The only real positive is that it is well located at Drury Lane - a lot to put up with for a good location. It is perfectly obvious that Travelodge care nothing for their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, and not even the basics.”
Reviews.Author: Littlemissb1
Reviews.Content: Not even a towel in the room. Freezing cold rooms, and staff were no help. Good location, but avoid spending any time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basic - remember to bring your own shampoo!”
Reviews.Author: floss24
Reviews.Content: We stayed with this hotel trying to find a cheaper alternative to theatre break prices. We were happy with what we got! I think we got lucky with the room as we had a side room and was very long and big. The room was clean and plenty of room to hang your clothes up. I was a little suprised that we had to get our own soap etc (as travelling round london on the tube with a suitcase is never nice - i tried to pack light) but there is a boots nearby and we bought some. This hotel is in an ideal location to the west end etc, although i wouldnt take the tube to covent garden, i'd always get off a leicester square as its a very short walk, and less hastle. I would stay here again when visiting this part of london, its basic but this is reflected in the price and is smashing to not have to worry about catching the last train back home!

Reviews.Title: “Stay well clear.”
Reviews.Author: davidmowbray
Reviews.Content: This is the worst Travelodge I have ever stayed in. The room was a very poor standard. The bathroom was dirty with broken tiles and taps stained. There were eletrical sockets which were live and could have caused shocks! It is evident that little care is taken with this hotel. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.

Reviews.Title: “Apalling”
Reviews.Author: BurfordOxfordshire
Reviews.Content: In all our years of travelling - both for leisure and for business - this counts as the worst experience we have ever had. We arrived and checked in - automated system - and had to ask where our room was. We were told that it was in the other building across the road and down the side street. The standard of the room was terrible - especially the bathroom. No lock, stains on walls and ceiling. Paper thin duvet on bed. We turned up the heater and had to leave to get to the theatre. Once in bed later that night, we discovered just how thin the walls are. They are paper thin and match the pillows. We had no sleep whatsoever, and left very early next morning. We'd have gone in the middle of the night but didn't relish walkiing round the NCP car park at that time. Take our advice - give this a big miss. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and un cared for - great location”
Reviews.Author: Travel_JJ_2011
Reviews.Content: Great location - poor quality accommodation, mould in bathroom, holes in wall - TV fuzzy, remote not working properly, no signage to lifts while work is being done - no warning about work before booking, signage broken by lifts - rubbish scattered across common hall ways - I have stayed in may Travelodge's and never in such a poor one. Its a shame as I am often in London as are clients and colleagues will not be using again.

Reviews.Title: “High Tec Reception”
Reviews.Author: hansardtony
Reviews.Content: Got a promotional price of Â£34.99 - so excellent value. It is now essential to bring your booking number with you as registering is now totally automatic. Your room key is given to you by a machine! Similar system to train / airport ticketing. However, excellent location and good value breakfast - just a pity about the queue.

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly as bad as some reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: jdboyd
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here (High Holborn block) on two separate occasions now, and continue on balance to be highly satisfied. Have also stayed at 5* London hotels, but I can't and don't expect similar comforts and amenities here. But the location couldn't be better and thevalue for the money too. Yes, there were a few issues with our last stay, which I have raised with Travelodge Customer Services, but still, overall, highly satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous”
Reviews.Author: ljlNorthEast
Reviews.Content: Nothing else to say except we left our bags in a room (only one of three which was ready, even though we had paid extra for early check in) which can best be described as 'dire', went for a meal, booked another hotel, came back and collected our bags and never returned. I thought my previous experience of a Travelodge was bad (two years ago in Kingston) but this was even worse. Disgusting rooms, dirty public areas, mayhem on reception and staff who really didn't care. Goes without saying we will not be returning! (We were in main building, I understand there are two blocks).

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel i have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: londontrip19
Reviews.Content: we wanted to see a show in london and thought this was well situated, the location was good, the hotel was the worst place i have ever stayed, the room we were given had water puddling outside the bathroom door, we got another room the next day , it had mould growing in the bath gout, the next morning when getting ready to go for breakfast the power went off on the entire second floor. when you get off the elevator to the second floor it smells realy bad, when we made this booking we were not told that we would have to go to there sister hotel to get our hot breakfast[5 mjn walk] this was the worst four nights, travelodge should be ashamed of themselves.

Reviews.Title: “It's location is convenient and it's price is relatively cheap...and you have the option to upgrade to a cardboard box”
Reviews.Author: maxandria
Reviews.Content: OK, let's get one thing straight. Travelodges ARE cheap and cheerful, no-frills and adequate - that's their place in the market. We've stayed in several, all over the country. They've always met and usually exceeded expectations. The London Covent Garden one however is simply horrible. Every negative comment you'll read on here is true - the lowlights for us were: Room was poorly maintained. Light fittings and loo roll holder broken, window incredibly draughty and nasty old huge, redundant air con unit left sitting in the corner. Someone's godda be next to the lift shaft, sadly for us..it was us. The worst night's sleep we've had in years, due to constant clanging, bashing and grinding from the lift mechanical parts. Carpet was filthy - minging doesn't even start to describe it's condition. Room looked like it was last refurbed in the seventies, simply depressing. Bed was rock hard uncomfortable and....itchy as hell!! Both the wife and I woke up having dreamt (fitfully) about ants!! Couldn't wait for the night to end. The shower was ok, but desperately needed instructions....very unusual mechanism! The TV remote controller did not match the TV - consequently most the buttons did not work. On the plus side, it was very close to the theatre. In retrospect, we'd much rather have paid double what we did and got somewhere cheap but bearable. Failing that, a cardboard box in an alleyway would have been more luxurious and vastly preferable. Try this place at your peril.

Reviews.Title: “Keep your expectations low and you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: marob37
Reviews.Content: Visited London for Christmas and booked two rooms well in advance. Checking was efficient as we checked into one room early (Â£10) premium and were told, following our request' that the other room would be on the same floor. Checked in later and it wasn't which meant we felt we couldn't leave the kids by themselves. rooms clean but showing age with floor stains and paint coming off. Extra beds were not made up but left to us to do- and have to chase the Linen from Reception for one of the rooms.....and get a remote control for the room too!. Breakfast was fine but the cue on the first day for those getting up after 8.30 was long. Location is five minutes from Covent Garden. Staff friendly

Reviews.Title: “I read other reviews and was dreading it, I was pleasently surprised”
Reviews.Author: loz8836
Reviews.Content: We choose this Hotel for its location and low cost compaired to other central London hotels and to be fair wasnt expecting too much! we had read the reviews about being dirty and the breakfast was dried up pastries etc. We just wanted a base and somewhere to sleep. well the location is brilliant, forget the under ground the taxis are must quicker and cheaper, unless you are going further like wiimbledon, but anywhere in central London is easy to get to, even walking. We got on the hop on and off red bus in trafalger sq Â£25 for two days and we went around all the sites, the ones we didnt get off at, we actually found we could walk to from the hotel. Madame Tusuades was about Â£9.00 in a black cab for four, the underground would have cost Â£4.30 each. The hotel breakfast was pretty good, we had bacon, sausage, scrambled egg, tomatoes,beans, toast, ceareal, youghut, cheeses, muffins, pastries, fruit, cant really complain only the sometime shortage of cuttlery or cups, they have quite afew foreign workers that seem to need direction by someone. The reception staff are friendly but few. I think they could make alot more money on drinks, if there was someone there to serve you. We had a meal there one night because the weather was pretty bad and it was really nice, pitty they never had any red wine. The rooms are basic but clean and warm, we had clean towels each day, they leave a small soap and toilet roll, bring your own toiletries. I cant understand why there has been so many bad reveiws for this hotel. We stayed in the high rise one 12th floor no problems really. Weve stayed in 5* to basic hotels in the past, I think if your booking a travelodge you should be expecting basic and clean and this was, I have stayed at better travelodges but dont be put off.

Reviews.Title: “the worst travelodge”
Reviews.Author: shazz016
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in different travelodges over the uk, this has to be the worse. Went with my teenage daughter and husband, my parents for theatre break. The rooms were tired stains on the carpets bathroom dirty, windows would'nt shut therefore noisey from outside. Had to ask 3 times for towels for 3 persons as they only left 1 set. workmen out side my parents room using drill breaking concrete.. Overall very dissapointed in standards compared to other travelodges i have stayed in when complained not interested at all. Weekend was great but hotel ruin it. would never go back

Reviews.Title: “Reliable, Cost effective and in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: FuriousGeorge27
Reviews.Content: The check-in process has always been fine at this hotel. This time we were encouraged to queue to use an automated check-in machine. Fortunately one was broken and the other was causing confusion for a big party wanting to book adjacent rooms. As a result we were quickly served by a check-in clerk. She completed the process far quickly and efficiently than any machine! Our room was a standard travelodge bedroom; clean, well equipped, roomy with good bathroom facilites. Location is superb, as said in other reviews. We always avoid breakfast at Travelodges as they're a bit pricey for what you get. I don't mean this as a criticism of the Hotel as it gives us the chance to use the many cafes around the hotel that do great bacon-butties to take-out!! We've stayed at this hotel a few times before and have always found it to be up to expectation. The introduction of automated check-in machines can achieve nothing other than to lessen the customer experience, and can only make the hard-working staff even more remote from their guests. Hope this is just a pilot that doesn't proceed!

Reviews.Title: “Scruffy”
Reviews.Author: silversue
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on theatre trip with friends. Had single cupboard overlooking adjacent active building site. hotel reception a muddle. Automated signing in system which doesn't work correctly. Room very basic. Needs refurbishment. Heated by electric radiator. Enormous old fashioned air con unit next to bed. Staff nice and did their best.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: harters
Reviews.Content: Travelodges are much of a muchness. If you've stayed in one before, you'll know exactly what to expect - very reasonably priced, if no-frills accommodation. Here, the good central location was a selling point and , in this part of London, you're not going to find anything else at this sort of money. As with other places in the chain, you're going nto get a clean room with comfy bed and not much more. Now, unless there was no convenient alternative, I would not touch a Travelodge breakfast with a bargepole - it's poor quality and, in spite of it being a buffet for only Â£7.50, it's poor value for money. I've stayed in this one before and know that there's a really good "greasy spoon" cafe a couple of minutes away on Endell Street - Diana's Diner.

Reviews.Title: “London calling...I don't think so”
Reviews.Author: Vasgo
Reviews.Content: My first room had no ceiling tiles and a bed borrowed from the seaman's mission. On request I was given an alternative room, although this did have a complete ceiling, the bathroom door did not close and the dÃ©cor was finished in Travelodge shabbiness. The bathroom comes with see through towels and toilet paper of the type found in the toilets provided for public servants. Breakfast is a sorry affair, no trays, few plates, a meagre assembly of tinned fruit displayed on the bar and Danish pastries better suited as a resource for shoe repairs. The newly re-furbished bar area resembles a drop-in centre for drug addicts, with Sky news competing with elevator music for attention. The one plus side, the location, five minutes walk from the heart of Covent Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Grim”
Reviews.Author: anneandchris
Reviews.Content: Oh so grim .... very dificult to find my room (lots of annexes and multiple entrances), very poor instructions and oh what a room. A 'window' the size of a letter box, looking out onto the inside of a multi-storey car park. Very thin duvet. Just grim and all for Â£110. Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: gaiadream
Reviews.Content: The Covent Garden Travelodge was a complete disappointment. When we arrived, we were literally pointed to a machine to check in, which I suppose was fine, but a bit better customer support would have been nice. While checking in, we were offered the option of a breakfast buffet, which sounded nice so we took this option. This proved a terrible idea as the breakfast was not advertised as a continental. In fact, when we did go for our breakfast, there weren't any plates out to even put our food on. There were a few pastries, some old looking fruit, and a few pots of yogurt. My husband was so disappointed, the he didn't even touch his coffee and insisted we go somewhere else for a proper breakfast. But back to the check in experience. We were told from the main counter that our room was on Drury Lane, which was fine, but after spending 20 minutes searching for our room in this building which was under construction, we were finally told that it was 'outside and to the left'. This was even the wrong information and so after walking outside with all our luggage up and down steps in the snow, we crossed paths with a member of staff from the main building on High Holborn. We asked her where our room was, and she said 'inside'. So at this point, we insisted that we be shown to our room as the directions in broken English were getting a bit redundant. (outside, left, right, inside, etc.) Once we found our room, and went in, there was one towel for the two of us to share, though we specified two people staying and someone had helped themselves to our tea, leaving their mess in the bin before we arrived. The heater in the room was not working properly, which we did not realize until the next day. The thermostat stated 29 degrees, but I would estimate it never budged over 20. The shower was a nice power shower, but water went all over the floor with the curtain fully closed. Also, there was a half roll of toilet paper which was not replaced, so we were required to ration it to ourselves. All in all, this was a horrible stay and the value for the money was absolute rubbish! We will never EVER stay in a Travelodge again and have told all of our friends about this experience. I sincerely hope that someone from the Travelodge company will see this review and make changes to this hotel. I hope no one else will have to experience this in the way we did.

Reviews.Title: “OK but basic”
Reviews.Author: djl44
Reviews.Content: When you get past the building site at the front ,this hotel is OK. I had the corner room on 7th floor, so 2 windows, unfortunately it was a cold couple of days and the room was very cold. Heater was a little small, so I left it on all day and left a note for the cleaners to leave it on so thesecond night was a bit warmer. Bins were not emptied but towels were changed. Good location, next time I will try the open air swimming pool which I could see from my room at OAsis.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay there again - ever!”
Reviews.Author: UK10006
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to start. Had we not prepaid for the room we would not have stayed there and in retrospect we probably should have just walked away and stayed elsewhere. The air in the halls smelt of 'I don't know what' but certainly not fresh air. There was no phone or clock in the room and to get a wake-up call you needed you celphone with you. The beds were so uncomfortable that a nights sleep was impossible. Cleanliness of the room was poor and that is being charitable. In the morning the cleaning staff monopolised the lifts so that is was easier to take the stairs than wait which was not a problem since we were only on the second floor. I could go on but if the above does not discourage you from staying there nothing else that I say will.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby but does the job”
Reviews.Author: really_razamataz
Reviews.Content: Winning no medals for architecture, this hotel is split on two sides of High Holborn. I think I stayed in the older part (room 218). Once inside, the lobby, reception desk, and breakfast area is clean and tidy. There is construction work going on but it wasn't that intrusive compared to th normal street noise of London (though I was there late at night and checked out by 09:30). Access is controlled by key card which gets you to the lifts. The second floor corridor was unpleasantly smelly. The room itself was largely okay. Twin beds, TV, kettle etc. A good size with a decent bathroom (and good shower). It was clean but let itself down by having missing bits, slightly broken taps, and worst in my opinion, a dirty teacup. The room did also smell unnaturally clean, probably because a whole tube of Shake 'n' Vac had been used on the carpets - or that is what it smelt like! Breakfast was supposed to have a cooked option, but it only seemed to be Continental style in the building I was in. But there was a good selection to choose from, so no real complaints. It is a good location and I think that if all you need is a bed and breakfast, then it 'does the job'. Cheaper than the other branded hotels, but it really ought to be considering that it is in need of a facelift in the corridors and bedrooms. All the staff were polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “its better to get a cab home then stay here”
Reviews.Author: freddy00
Reviews.Content: don't sleep in room 312 check the comfort of your bed

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: dunnitt
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for two nights, despite some less than flattering reviews, for one reason- its location. It is within very easy walking distance of both opera houses, theatres and museums, and is surrounded by decent places to eat. I was certainly not disappointed by my decision. The new automated check in system was very fast. The room was of a reasonable size, with plenty of storage space, and clean. The bath room was also adequate, although the water pressure was low for a power shower, and there were no free toiletries- bring your own shampoo etc or buy from the surrounding shops. Although construction work is still in progress, the noise/ disturbance was absolutely minimal, and the room was well sound proofed. Do not bother to take breakfast , or drink in the soul less bar- there are plenty of nearby choices, including several Italian " caffs" for a good, cheap cooked breakfast. I shall return to this hotel on future cultural visits to London.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL AND AVOID!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PaulOrton
Reviews.Content: There was a small piece of writing on the website saying it was currently under renovation and some disturbance might happen. We wasn't expecting the entrance to resemble Steptoe's yard, the reception to look dowdy and miserable, the staff to look like they hated it there, the room to have a black hair on the toilet wall, a leaking shower, a shower curtain that didn't reach the floor so even when closed water sprayed everywhere, the view to look directly into the window of the council block opposite, the noise of cleaners outside the room having what must have been an argument in the morning, slamming doors and shouting, and the construction work was so loud, the second morning we were woken by a bang, then a bang so loud that it made us jump, and then a third bang that was so loud it jolted the curtains open. When we left a member of staff was talking to a potential resident, but her customer service was clearly poor and she was poking holes into a piece of paper with a pen. It was the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. The location was mediocre and at one point there was a gang of kids smoking outside making us residents feel incredibly uncomfortable. I will NEVER stay with a Travelodge again. EVER. Even if it is paid for by work. This time was leisure and it ruined our whole experience and we couldn't wait to leave. NOT worth the Â£260 we were charged to stay. I've written TWO complaint letters, which we were told we would get a response within 10 days, however nearly a month later no reply to either. DO NOT STAY HERE EVEN AFTER CONSTRUCTION HAS FINISHED!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “TravelSPLODGE - Dirtiest hotel room Ive ever been checked into”
Reviews.Author: tourismstudentdublin
Reviews.Content: Arrived at around midday on the day of check in wishing to be checked in and paid a ten pound fee for checking in early. Left our bags into our family room (room 2) and went off sightseeing for the day. Came back that evening to get changed and go to see a show on the West End. This is when my friends and I noticed how dirty the room was. Neither of the bins had been emptied, mirrors in both the bathroom and bedroom were manky with finger prints all over them, Bath had black gunky-mouldy stuff in it ( Im not sure what it was but I can safely say it probably shouldnt have been there). The taps were covered in a dust and there was hairs in the sink. The sheets had a series of odd stains on them including one kind of lumpy stain. The pull out bed had the most disgusting mattress I have ever seen with two HUGE big stains, one white coloured rimmed one and another one quite similar in size but darker in colour. The hotel itself is in the middle of getting works done to it but this was not explained at the time of booking. To get into the hotel you have to go up these set of steps outside which leads you then down through this little gap which is between the hotel and the building site, I presume. The staff we met (only those who worked on reception) were absolutely lovely and I cannot fault them in any way. We complained and got moved to the Travelodge across the road to another family room which was nice and clean and served us well. As we were only spending one night in London we were extremely disappointed in our choice of accomodation. We booked that Travelodge for a number of reasons, the main one was its location to the theatres but it was also because we had stayed in Travelodges in London and in Ireland before and they were grand. We were especially disappointed in this because this Travelodge had been found and booked through a visit london tourist website. As a tourism student myself I was appalled at the fact that I had booked this on a site that was recommending it as accomodation to visitors. Since returning I have told friends and colleagues NOT to stay here as it was pretty disgusting in general. Travelodge Covent Garden - Never again.

Reviews.Title: “a warning rather than areview”
Reviews.Author: CastleJack
Reviews.Content: When we stayed we had a blocked sink which, as it was quite late and wanted to go to bed meant we didn't bother reporting it ... mistake. We used the shower / bath and reported the problem in the morning. Previous occupants appear to have blocked the sink with tobacco. Without warning Â£150 has been taken from my credit card by Travelodge as a smoking fine. Neither my wife nor myself smoke. I have lodged a compliant but it appears others have been caught by this charge. Guess who won't be getting anymore of my custom.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: ryan1469
Reviews.Content: As has been mentioned, the hotel it split into two buildings that are over the road from each other. The first is the Drury Lane building, which houses all of the twin rooms. This is the older building of the two and is currently a building site with workmen and boards up everywhere. The other building is the High Holborn building, the newer of the two and houses the family rooms. We booked a family room for one night for two of us, and including breakfast it came to Â£110. Thankfully, we were in the High Holborn building. The staff at reception were perfectly friendly, no complaints about them whatsoever. There are 3 lifts and despite there being 13 floors in the building, we never waited more than 2 minutes for a lift to arrive. We checked into our first room, however the mirror had been removed from the desk. We told reception about this and they moved us to another room with no problems. The bed was extremelly comfortable, I had a perfect nights sleep and as for the noise, What noise?! I didn't hear a thing all night. We headed down for breakfast which was in the Drury Lane bulding. When entering this building is really is quite shocking how much of a state the building is in, there are workmen everwhere and half of the walkways have been blocked off. We were told they're building 249 new rooms here, and thats the reason for the construction work taking place. Breakfast was really nice, and again staff there were friendly and helpful. Location-wise, it doesn't get much better than this hotel! It's a 15 minute walk from Euston station, and the same from Waterloo. Leicester Square is 10 minutes walk away and there is a Domino's Pizza and Subway next door. Perfect!! Overall, I had a good nights sleep in a decent hotel, for a relatively decent price, so I was happy and would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location makes up for no frills rooms”
Reviews.Author: cu_travels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with group of friends. Booked as best price could find for such a central location (double room was Â£280 for 3 nights). Location brilliant, 5 minute walk from covent garden tube stop. Rooms and hotel no frills!! Rooms small and old fashioned, though clean and with tv with free view. Be wary of some noise from street as nearby pubs, though this to be expected as central London! Don't stay here if expecting anything other than a place to sleep! Perfect place to stay if not expecting any frills and wanting to stay in central London without paying a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel but not as bad as some of the reviews”
Reviews.Author: MMmd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of London. I was concerned when I read some of the reviews but the experience was not as bad as some other reviewers suggest. The bed was large and comfortable but both the room and hotel are in need of renovation. Currently, when entering the hotel is like entering a building site.

Reviews.Title: “Why I would never want to return to Travelodge Covent Garden”
Reviews.Author: mickeygib
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Travelodges before and having no problems, it was shameful to come to this one... The bathroom had a pubic hair stuck to the tiles on the walls, with random other hairs on the floor. There was mildew around the bath and sink with what appeared to be an overflow with water running into the hand basin constantly. The shower curtain was stained with patches of damp stains on the ceiling. No toilet roll holder meant the toilet roll was either balanced on the protruding metal stump or just plonked on the sink. No hook on the bathroom door, but a clear indication of were one used to be with a dirty great hole in the door. There was a loose wire cord not attached to anything that hung below the table with a sign stating "do not unplug". The breakfast was extremely disappointing, the latte was cold and had no milk, the bacon had a very strange texture to it and the sausages were disgusting. There wasn't one pleasant welcoming face amongst the staff (not one person smiled at us or said "morning" or "hello" or even responded when we greeted them) and some of their personal hygene was so overpowering it left the whole corridor with foul body odour stench. So much so we didn't have our room tidied with fear it would be filled with the same smell. They promote themselves as competitively priced due to just providing the "basics" but when the duvet is oversized for the bed, which is undersized for the side tables, the extra duvet tucked under the bottom of the bed leaving it on a dramatic slant and causing us to wonder on first arrival if the whole room was at an angle, we very much don't think they even got the basics right. We did find the first fly easy to kill as we entered the room though! The disruptions to the service due to building works played no part in our poor stay as we were on the 6th floor and heard no noise.

Reviews.Title: “Building Site....”
Reviews.Author: hobo4thenight
Reviews.Content: You have to walk through a building site to get to this place. The rooms are horrible, some sort of black 'gunk' in the bath, strange smell in the room and hallway, ceiling tiles and carpets stained, some of the lights not working, towels didn't smell clean, holes in the bed sheets and it isn't cheap to stay here. Stay clear of this place. Unless you're looking for an expensive hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Let me give you some advice.....”
Reviews.Author: sugarkane82
Reviews.Content: Ok, I have stayed at Covent Garden travel lodge a few times and here is what I know. There are 2 separate hotels that come under Covent Garden, one on Drury lane, one High Holborn. Drury lane is the pits..... moldy, smelly, cold, dirty blah blah blah. High Holborn is fine, clean no frills, but what you'd expect a travelodge to look like. Still good location. Just be sure to go for High Holborn. Hope that clears up why there are so many mixed reviews! P.S, there are no twin rooms on High Holborn, but all the Family rooms are there so it may help when booking on line to get a family room................

Reviews.Title: “To be shuddered at”
Reviews.Author: tomroths18
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night at this hotel with my partner as we wanted to shop a little in London before driving to France for a holiday. We paid 110 GBP for the room for one night (shocking) and on arrival waited over 10 minutes at reception for someone to see us, the staff were abrupt and seemed to think guests were more of an inconvenience then anything else. The room was fairly clean but one of our door keycards did not work so we went to change it and lo and behold it was then the other that wouldn`t work, this was finally resolved on the 3rd attempt. Location of the hotel is convenient however the views from the window were revolting (people urinating against a wall directly opposite) and the works going on at the hotel are invasive to say the least, there has not been much thought put into how it affects guests, no matter how necessary they are. All in all we were extremely upset at the price being charged considering the works going on and the overall appearance of the hotel, glad it was only for one night.

Reviews.Title: “POSSIBLY THE WORST HOTEL ROOM I HAVE EVER HAD THE MISFORTUNE TO STAY IN”
Reviews.Author: JoCoSi
Reviews.Content: We chose the Travelodge Covent Garden as a budget hotel in a central location whilst visiting London for a friend's Engagement Party. However, at Â£110 a night it was not particularly budget and was definitely not value for money. The hotel is in the process of being renovated and the updated model may be a great improvement but I would not recommend staying there until the work has been completed. The room was on the ground floor in an annex, an old 1970s grey concrete building, facing onto a back-alley off Drury Lane. The standard of maintenance and cleanliness was simply appaling, the ceiling tiles were dirty and full of holes, the walls had patches of damp and exposed plaster on and the shower was covered in mildew. The TV stand was very lose and potentially dangerous, there was no hair dryer, iron or ironing board and no telephone to call reception and ask for them. I will be filing an official complaint and expecting compensation for such a disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Liberton
Reviews.Content: The hotel is currently a building site and I was given one of the older rooms. It was very tired with worn furniture, curtains didn't fit windows, discoulered bath sealant, cracked door frame - all the usual signs of a room that needs some tender loving care. The noise was not excessive for the location except for the banging of ill-fitting doors. This is perhaps what to expect in a budget hotel except that it was more than Â£130 for the night. There are other, better hotels that are cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced, jaded and desperately in need of upgrading”
Reviews.Author: welshlady1954
Reviews.Content: All the staff we met were kind and helpful, but they couldn't make up for this downtrodden, scruffy, damp smelling hotel. Airfresheners were plugged in here and there to try and disguise the smell, but they didn't help.The infrastructure is desperately in need of refurbishing, although they are in the process of building a new extension so perhaps the whole place will be upgraded at the same time. The bathroom was badly lit by just a shaving mirror light, the plughole in our bath was full of disgusting hair which made the bath fill very quickly with murky water making showering impossible, and the wash basin was exactly the same, but we couldn't see what was blocking the plughole there. (yuk) There was mould along the edge of the bath tiles, and the ceiling was badly waterstained from a leak in the room above by the look of it. There was no heating on (late October) and our room was freezing. In fairness the bed was comfy although we had noisy neighbours who woke us up, and the breakfast was really nice but it didn't make up for the grotty surroundings. To top it all, we booked a disabled room and were told after we arrived (up a steep flight of steps) that they don't actually have any disabled rooms!!! It is grossly overpriced, we could have had a 4 star hotel including breakfast just a couple of streets away for less than we paid for this basic place. I will never book aTravelodge hotel again as long as I live.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Sarajay19
Reviews.Content: For a budget Hotel, this one was clean, friendly and roomy. Breakfast's are lovely and a wide choice of food is available. The location is amazing, your right in the heart of the West End, and only a few minutes stroll to Covent Garden Market. There are plenty of things to see in the area. Lots of places to eat, have fun or just relax. The only fault I can find about This hotel and other Travelodge hotels are the fact they don't have rooms to accommodate my family of 5. If they did I would use this hotel on a more regular basis. Fantastic place to stay for a romantic, sightseeing weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find a better located hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Guildmaster
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews, I am a little bit perplexed as to what peopleâ€™s expectations of this hotel were. Basically, it IS a Travelodge hotel, you get what you pay for, it is very basic!!! However, as I had travelled to London for a sightseeing holiday, this wasn't really a factor for me as I spent the majority of my time out of the hotel. The location is excellent and when I next return to our fair capital, I shall certainly endeavor to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location, large room, clean and tidy”
Reviews.Author: Hazel96
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from staying in this hotel with my sister whilst on a 2 night stay in London, I feel I have to write a good review for this hotel as there seem to be a few negative ones which I feel don't reflect the true value you get from this hotel if you book on one of the special deals they offer. We paid approx. Â£110 for TWO nights here which we considered to be excellent value for money which also included an early check-in payment of Â£10 which allowed us to get into our room (from 12pm) as soon as we arrived in London around 1pm (rather than the normal 3pm). This worked out really well and gave us more time to explore our surroundings. We reached Covent Garden within minutes and were well placed for the train stations. We stayed in the newer building closer to Holborn station - only 2/3 minutes walking time from station which was handy when first arriving in London. Had booked to see Oliver at Theatre Royal in Drury Lane which is also closeby, and afterwards were able to just stroll back to our hotel - no taxis needed. The hotel was a bit noisy outside on the Sunday night as we overlooked a side road which had a taxi cab office in it and people tended to congregate there. On the Monday night however it was quieter and we didnt hear anything. This wouldnt put me off staying again though as the position is such a good one and also the price is so good. I would definitely stay again and would say to anyone thinking of staying but maybe getting put off by some of the reviews, to stay and make your own minds up. I wouldnt like to pay the top rate of around Â£110 per night but if I can get the special rates I will definitely be staying here again and in the newer building. We had quite a heavy case and the reception in the new building is at street level whereas in the older building on Drury Lane there are quite a lot of steps leading up to it. The Reception staff were all friendly and helpful and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “WILL NEVER STAY AT A TRAVELODGE EVER AGAIN...”
Reviews.Author: Evs39
Reviews.Content: We went to London as a family - me, hubby & 2 daughters aged 12 & 9. My daughters had saved long & hard for this trip and it was their first time to the London attractions. The hotel staff were not very approachable, and the part of the hotel for families is on a very busy and noisy main road. We visited the main attractions of London and had a fantastic day at Madame Tussauds. When we got back to our room the day after, our shopping bags were missing from our room and the hotel were not in the slightest bit interested in helping. We got the police involved and since we came home and sent various emails, phone calls, and even recorded delivery letters to complain direct to the Chief Exec, we have had not even one letter of response back My girls had all their memorabilia stolen and lost Â£100 worth of items, without a word of apology or offer of compensation whatsoever. I WILL NEVER STAY AT ANY TRAVELODGE EVER AGAIN...

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings but not as bad as expected”
Reviews.Author: carlosftw
Reviews.Content: Was also panicking after reading the reviews. Just to be clear, there are two Travelodges across the road from eachother. We booked a family room and all the family rooms are located in the High Holborn building and not the one that is currently being refurbished. We stayed for 3 nights (mon - thurs) and it cost around Â£45 a night, which is not bad for London! Upon arrival, the hotel looked a little 'tacky' from the front. There were bins outside the entrance. Check in was swift. Receptionist didn't say much. Our room was located on the 6th floor - room 670. Room looked ideal - pull out sofa bed (which looked a bit worn) but once the mattress was on it wasn't an issue. Tea and Coffee available, bathroom looked alright. Decent flatscreen TV with a few channels. It's a Travelodge after all so wasn't expecting too much. But this was basic and ok. Once we had unpacked, a cleaner came straight in our room and asked us if we were staying here. That was bizarre. First night (mon): Outside traffic was noisy, but this was due to there being two main roads on either side of the building. I would have probably complained if we were any lower than floor 6. Other than that, got plenty of sleep. Second night (tues): A nightclub started late in the night, which woke me up and kept me awake. Very loud bass and clubbers in the street could be heard. Third night (weds): The fire alarm went off, four times within about two hours. Went down to reception to find many other people complaining about it. Everyone was told that there was a faulty circuit error and that they were fixing it. No apology! Apart from this and the traffic, the night was fine. No nightclub opening. I wouldn't stay at this hotel again, mainly due to the fact that it is very noisy outside and there is a club right next to it. Very odd that the windows aren't double glazed, as the noise seems to get into the room very easily. Also, staff showed little emotion, not even a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: loumcg71
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. Having read the reviews I was somewhat nervy on arrival! We were allocated a room in the extension and therefore avoided the building work. To say we were pleasantly surprised is an understatement. The room was clean and very spacious. The bathroom was clean with perhaps one of the best hotel showers ever. We booked the travelodge knowing that it is a budget "no frills" hotel and therefore do not expect to be provided with toiletries, a hairdryer etc. The location was great - just a short walk to Covent Garden and the underground station. We didn't book breakfast and didnt eat at the hotel, There are so many cafes etc around, we were spoiled for choice. I will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Travelodge. MAJOR building works. Poor substandard rooms.”
Reviews.Author: CandidReviewer444
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a major building site as they add on another 249 rooms. The existing rooms should probably not be let until all work is completed and they have themselves been totally refurbished. Our room was shameful. The en-suite was damp & mouldy (the extractor didn't work) the door had been smashed in, hence no lock or catch at all, and there was a hole right through the outer skin. Water escaped from under the basin somewhere onto your feet. The mattress on the bed was completely exhausted and every spring could be felt. Lighting in the room was gloomy with the lampshades scorched by the bulbs (you've seen it all before!). The TV didn't work properly. The reception staff tried but were pretty hopeless. And so it went on.... The room was a total disgrace, and at Â£99 per night (even in London) you ought to be provided with a better standard of accommodation. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location,Lovely staff, clean room, comfy beds & excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: cariadbrans
Reviews.Content: After reading a few of the negative reviews was a bit nervy about taking two kids age 10 and 13 here. We arrived and were greeted by two lovely welcoming receptionists, our room was spacious and clean and so was the bathroom. We needed extra bedding and towels and these were brought to us immediately when we told reception by a very nice lady. Breakfast was served 7am-10am and we had an excellent choice of full english, cereal, pastries and fruit. Coffee, tea, juice and water were also available. The food was self service and eat as much as you want -kids ate free so even better value! I found all the staff to be friendly, helpful and efficient. The location of he hotel was excellent and only five minutes walk from the Dominion theatre where we had tickets to see We Will Rock You. Covent Garden, the British Museum,Trafalgar Square, The London Eye and Buckingham Palace were all a manageable walk away. We had dinner at the hotel and unfortunately there was a problem with the ovens in the kitchen so we waited a very long time for food that was served by one very busy and stressed lady-that was the only complaint we had and it seemed to be something that couldn't be avoided on that night.

Reviews.Title: “Just rubbish”
Reviews.Author: Jeevesthebutler
Reviews.Content: Just don't do it. Save your money and sleep on the streets- more comfortable than the 'matresses'! On reception there was reference to a customer feedback form you could request. No doubt they had run out as I was asked to email their customer services dept. If you like slumming it- stay here.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: dporter10
Reviews.Content: I have travelled for many years for business and pleasure and this is the first time I have ever stayed in a hotel that does not have an alarm clock or wake up calls, not sure how i am supposed to wake up in time for my morning meetings. No shampoo or a blow dryer...I can sign one out from the front desk to "borrow" for 2 hours only. The television does not work nor the heating. My 2 pillows are so flat I have not idea how i will sleep. The front reception is under construction so feel like I am walking through a construction site.
