The sounds of both my neighbors makes me want to speak softly while using my cell phone as I can hear them clearly.Yes, the location is great BUT spend a little more and feel good about your stay not frightened.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't think it was that bad”
Reviews.Author: Texel1745
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night, had stayed before. Didn't quite get the negative view of the place others have seen. The check in was quick and the staff were fine. The room was modern, clean and had what this chain provide (TV, tea/coffee and not much else). Slept well and the room was quiet. No towels in the room but asked one of the staff and they came right away. Breakfast was average and you can buy much better in any of the local cafes or coffee shops. Location is very good with access to the tube a couple of mins away. The place looks like it is undergoing a refit. It isn't the best of this chain, nor perhaps the worst. That said it isn't as good as the one at Euston or any of the Premier Inns I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: holliebee86
Reviews.Content: After spending the night in this covent garden hotel, I will never stay in a Travelodge again. The staff were rude, when we arrived we were given a twin room instead of a double, even though we had asked for a double at the time of booking. The room was sparse, no toiletries, no hairdryer, no iron, no ironing board, only one towel, NO PHONE!!! We had to trapse down to reception to get another towel and I happened to mention to the girl on the desk that there was no phone in the room and she laughed at me! The room was stifling hot with no A/C and the windows anly opened a little way. Apart from the location, there is not much else going for this hotel. STEER CLEAR!

Reviews.Title: “The only reason to stay here is the location”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaUK
Reviews.Content: I'm familiar with the Travelodge brand and have stayed in quite a few in various locations so I know not to expect luxury or amenities, just the absolute basics. This TL is grim. We had a room on the second floor. The corridors smelled of damp, the whole place was so tatty, dark and dingy. We expected some noise from outside as the TL website does warn of this. The volume of noise was just the same with the window open or closed. The shower curtain was rank. There are building works/renovations going on but these were not an inconvenience. I wonder why spend a fortune on new rooms when a lick of paint, some new carpets, shower curtains and nicer lighting would make a massive difference for a fraction of the price? At least the bed was comfortable and the bedlinen and towels were clean. Next time we will choose a 'proper' hotel for a similar price, but further out in the City.

Reviews.Title: “Worth avoiding”
Reviews.Author: ian56
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel to be near Covent Garden. It was the worst hotel my wife and I have ever stayed in. The hotel was a building site, our room was in an annex, almost below street level. The room was badly furnished, the airconditioning was noisy, the bathroom only had a tatty shower (no bath!) - no bath mat, not sufficent towels and one stupidly small piece of soap. Carpet in the bedroom was dirty, the bed uncomfortable. Service was offhand. Had we arrived earlier and not already paid for the room we should have moved to another hotel. Given the standard achieved by competitors like Premier this Travelodge hotel has a long way to go.

Reviews.Title: “This is a hovel, not a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AnneFMcG
Reviews.Content: Some friends booked this hotel for a weekend trip to London. We obviously didn't expect 5 star luxury but had always thought of the Travelodge chain as cheap and cheerful. It was a joke to have paid Â£125 per room per night for this place. It's a big scuzzy tower block and the reception looks like a bookmakers. Staff weren't rude, just uninterested. The bedroom was clean and spacious but lacked even a hairdryer. There was no iron or ironing board either even though the website claims all rooms have one. When we asked for one at reception, having trekked down eleven floors since the rooms don't even have phones, we were given one to lug back up ourselves and told to return it immediately. They'd left one tiddly, foul-smelling bar of soap and no other toiletries. There was a faint yet lingering smell in the bathroom that got rather irritating. The window in the room opened only a fraction and there was no air-conditioning, which really didn't help. Speaking of windows, I don't think they were even double-glazed as we could hear lots of noise from outside in the middle of the night. On the Sunday morning, a cleaner just waltzed into our room without so much as knocking and this was several hours before check-out. He looked at us then wandered out again without even apologising. The Travelodge in Covent Garden is in a good location for shopping and exploring London but has nothing else going for it whatsoever. Avoid at all costs - even if they advertise rooms for 50p.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful ...avoid this hotel and its rubbish staff”
Reviews.Author: CardiffFizzy
Reviews.Content: Oh my god ! Please please do not stay here . The rooms are terrible not even a hairdryer in the room ,Mattresses were FLAT ,complained to manager and they replaced it but was as bad as the original one .Simply terrible .The window didnt close properly and there was a nite club nearby with music playing till 5 am ,I hardly slept ,all this for the 130 pound ,total con .Shocking breakfast.Please avoid this hotel ,covered in scaffolding builders every where .Everyone was complaining ,total waste of money .Couldnt wait to leave and get out of there .Just terrible ,will contact Travelodge for a refund .Their catch phrase is "sleep tight " .....not here I am afraid ,DO NOT BOOK THIS IF YOU WANT TO SLEEP .I was on the 12 th floor ,it must have been terrible on lower floors .AVOID ....RUN BY PIGS

Reviews.Title: “HORRIFIC AND NOISY”
Reviews.Author: danielleholliex0x0
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in late September, early October 2010 for 3 nights with my mum for a shopping trip to London. We were by no stretch imagining the Ritz but basic cleanliness was to be expected. We arrived and from the outside it didnt look bad, bit of a concrete high rise but we say this in the pictures online. Lots of builders outside making a lot of noise (didnt mind as we were out most of days and they stopped at 5 each day). Arrived at reception and a nice lady greeted us, gave us a room number and we proceeded to get in the lift and onto the first floor. Opened door and we were greeted with the most dingy dark smelly room. It looked like a brothel/ bed sit. Bathroom was filthy and shower curtain had about 5 inches of grime on the bottom. Window didnt even open and view was practically a concrete wall. We were not sleeping in here and went to reception and said we wanted a different room, given a room on the 7th floor and prayed it was better. Entered room and yes it was better than the first, but only slightly. Bathroom was filthy, 1 towel given for 2 people, and one poxy bar of soap. Window opened about an inch.... its humid in London and it was so stuffy in there so we got a fan from reception. Damp ceilings and walls, cob webs everywhere and uncomfortable itchy bed. Sheets smelt like they had been washed in bleach. I dared look at the matress and i was greeted with the dirtiest mattress i think i have ever seen. We walked around in shoes as we didnt want to touch the floor. Bathroom had soap scum everywhere and again another disgusting shower curtain. Bathroom floor was filthy!!!!!!! It got worse in the nightime,,,,, didnt get a wink of sleep due to noise from outside. All night we heard traffic, revellers coming out of nearby nightclubs. Even with window shut you couldnt get any sleep. Also every time lift was in use it made an awful squeeking sound which woke us up everytime. No phone, no tea and coffee provided and all in all a horror show. I will never go back to this travel lodge, if any ever again. BASIC is was we were expecting but got 3rd world basic. Absolutly digusted. Coudlnt wait to leave and it completely ruined our stay in the capital.

Reviews.Title: “pretty grim; has the location, but still over-priced”
Reviews.Author: AkondofSwat
Reviews.Content: Faceless service, very hit and miss, with staff constantly changing. A string of service problems; no towels one day; no soap the next; and no apology when you have to schlep over to reception to get them. Bedroom not properly cleaned; not vacuumed once during the week I stayed, and I bet not before my arrival either; yuck. Lower bedrooms very noisy from traffic. Main site a building site a present; access really grim; grotty dining room with all the windows boarded up for the building works (rubberised scrambled egg type breakfast, funny little d.i.y. conveyor-belt toasting machine). In all, a pretty horrible hotel experience. You may get a central location, but Travelodge are over-charging for what they are currently offering here. You grin and bear it.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't waste your money on this place!”
Reviews.Author: loubs
Reviews.Content: Ok, so here goes! We wanted a centrally located hotel for the weekend as only styed the one night. First impressions, goodness me what a dump! They are having alot of building work done which id fair enough but this did not really bother me. When you walked onto the reception area, very tired looking and walls could do with a new lick of paint as very grubby looking. Checked in all ok, staff behind the counter very polite and efficient so could not fault her. Onwards to our room! mmm! well what can I say, again very dark, dreary and tatty in need of refurbishment. One wall had the wallpaper ripped off, there we're marks all over the bedside cabinet, light did not work, the window did not shut properly and was filthy, looked out onto flats, not the best view but hey better than being on the main road with traffic noise. The bathroom was cleanish, taps we're a bit tatty and rusty in places and the door of the toilet was dirty, very flimsy mattresses far too soft. We decided to have breakfast in the morning, cost Â£7.50p perhaps a bit pricey but the basics we're there so sufficient enough, found the staff in the breakfast area rude and miserable and felt like you we're an inconvienince to them. Defitnatley not worth the Â£120 for the night. So very sorry to say would not return there, thank goodness it was for only one night!

Reviews.Title: “The Ryanair of the "hotel" industry....felt let down”
Reviews.Author: Imjustatourist2
Reviews.Content: Whilst its got the name Covent Garden attached to its address its several streets away from Covent garden, plus on two sites. The first site where we booked in was being renovated and the entry was hemmed in by hoarding...narrow, not very nice and up quite a few steps. we arrived at 1.30 pm.......book in was a rather late 3pm. Major FAULT No 1..They don't have a baggage storage room.......in 2010..!!!!!!!!......NO storage room, so instead what do they do ,...(Major FAULT no 2)..... ask if you want to book in early for an extra Â£10......remind you of anyone???!! Came back at 2.55pm....queue of 10 people,,,,quite slow to get booked in, staff pleasant, advised then to leave the building and go to second separate building across a busy street 50 yds away. Room on 7th floor, was told it had been refurbished....but it hadn't.! So looking forward to a nights sleep......it was Sunday last, and to our horror.....a club/bar on the street below was on the go until 5am....double glazing had no real effect of the loud talking/shouts from below!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Stay clear of this branch of Tlodge.........waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Shopaholics186346
Reviews.Content: We had read other reviews so we were worried about the noise, we stayed on Sunday 19th September, we did ask for a quiet room, this we certainly got, the room was basic but very clean, the beds were comfy, included tea & coffee and TV. The location could not be better, however we did not try the breakfast so cannot comment on that, We booked a while ago and only paid Â£29.50 for a twin room, this was a real bargain considering the location, will certainly be bookin again.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: OsloSina
Reviews.Content: Great choice if price and location is what you're looking for. There is no cosy homy feel, there is no luxurious amenities, and there is really no reason why you should stay more than needed in your hotel room. However, you cannot beat the location - close to Oxford Street, Covent Garden, Soho and the theatre district - you get a hotelroom for a competable price to any okay hostel in the city centre, and you get a fair place to stay. The rooms are large, clean and basic. I read somewhere that the hotel markets itself as "everything you and need, and nothing you don't need" - and I think that sums it up pretty well. It's a great base for shopping, eating out and any kind of entertainment - but no place if you are looking for total calm or cool - as the outside streets can be noisy and there is no aircondition. Regardless, we have stayed here twice now, and would go back! You can't really beat the price or the location!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Deb1820
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it was near my early morning meeting. I could cope with the tiny bar of soap, just a sheet covering the mattress and wafer thin pillows but I couldn't cope with not getting any sleep. If I got two hours sleep, I'd be surprised. Even though I was on the seventh floor, the noise from a nearby nightclub persisted until at least 5am. Next time I'll find the time to do my research.

Reviews.Title: “NOISY NOISY NOISY”
Reviews.Author: staniscoop
Reviews.Content: Checked in for one night (a Sunday night) as out in London and due in work early Monday morning. The room was a bit odd ... very long with a huge gap between the end of the bed and the unit with the TV on - we were not bothered but there would be no way you could actually watch TV from bed as it was so far away. Apart form that pretty standard "Travelodge" room. The main problem..... THE NOISE. We assume it came from the nearby clubs outside smoking area as it was people noise as opposed to music. We were on the 8th Floor and could hear them as clear as a bell until around 6am. Had to get up at 7 so not much sleep to be had. Would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Travelodge Ever?”
Reviews.Author: Englishman_Rob
Reviews.Content: Just got back from two nights in London and I need to tell you now poor the Drury Lane Travelodge is; its the pits! This hotel is split into two, with the main block and reception currently being refurbed, we were sent across to the second building and the 9th floor. Something odd had happended in this room; as a double the room was a good size but other than the bed it contained no other furniture, just a big space where things had been in the past. Anyway, back to the main problem with this place THE BL**DY AWFUL NOISE! On both evenings (Thur/Fri) the racket from the nearby nightclub did not stop until 7am, at which time the traffic noise took its place. The acoustic meant that you could actually hear the conversations of revellers as they left the place from my room ON THE NINTH FLOOR! Do yourself a favour do not bother with this Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT NIGHTS STAY IN THE HEART OF LONDON”
Reviews.Author: MikeB_9
Reviews.Content: Well I had a some trepidation after reading some reviews but I have no complaints We stayed in the old part of the Hotel and the rooms were very clean, large and airy Very friendly reception staff and cleaners Heard one customer complaining about the view from his room which I found a bit strange and probably indicative of the sort of people who like to complain about everyting Worth a mention that there are day time building works taking place to extend the Hotel Not noisy although it was a Sunday night but anyway what do you expect in central London??

Reviews.Title: “good location but room not so good”
Reviews.Author: weatherchannel440
Reviews.Content: short walk from holburn underground station next to the shaftesbury theatre WC2H 8DP dominos pizza underneath. very close to covent garden seven dials and oxford street which was why we picked it. Paid Â£22 a night in the sale which was why i took the chance despite the previous bad reviews. we stayed in room 1070 in a family room on the tenth floor. the carpet was dirty but the bathroom was clean bed was comfortable good wardrobe and desk we used earplugs but could still hear traffic. woke on morning bank holiday monday to what sounded like a market. tues n wed evenings there were late night early moring drinkers go didnt sleep that well again. didnt try breakfast wound not book again but might try a double room in the drury lane site when they have finished the building work

Reviews.Title: “Great location on a budget”
Reviews.Author: colinangusmackay
Reviews.Content: I've read some poor reviews of this hotel. Yet, my experience hasn't been all that bad. I've stayed at this hotel a few times in the last year and I would go back. If you are on a budget and want easy access to Covent Garden, Piccadilly Circus, and Soho then this really is your only mainstream choice. It is the only one that I've found that will come in at under Â£100 per night. Sure, I've stayed in better Travelodges, and this is the most expensive Travelodge I've stayed in. I think that the main problem with the hotel is that perhaps the hotel management know that what they have most in their favour is location. There is so much in walking distance that you don't have to spend lots of money on the tube or busses. I can't review the food at this restaurant as, firstly, I rarely eat in hotels and secondly, travelodges are hardly known for their culinary delights so I arrived expecting to eat out from the get go. The hotel has always been clean enough. The decor could do with a bit of sprucing up and some of the facilities are getting quite worn and should really be replaced. The rooms are quite large given the position of the hotel and the price you are paying. The service has always been quite satisfactory for me, but then I've always arrived with a cheery smile and I find that always helps. I've always found the staff to be quite helpful and the check-in process has been smooth. Finally, I've always slept quite well in the beds. While on one occasion the room was right next to the fire doors to the elevator the sound from the rest of the hotel does not pervade too much. In summary, it is very expensive for a travelodge, it is very cheap for the location it is in. However, I have stayed here multiple times and I will continue to use this hotel as it is very convenient for many theatres, shops, restaurants, and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, had better.”
Reviews.Author: chloe0
Reviews.Content: The hotel wasn't as i expected it to be, the rooms were not very clean however they were manageable to stay in. The hotel didn't have any luggage storage so they charge you Â£10 to either check in earlier and check out later if you didn't want to carry your bags around, which i thought was wrong. A lot of people were complaning that their rooms were not tidy, which i thought played a part in our stay aswell due to other people not being satisfied either. It was not very expensive however i would say a Premier Inn is luxury compared to this Travelodge, it is the first i have stayed in so others may be better, but this one was not very good. Staff were ok, nothing really to complain about in that area, breakfast/dinner area was very small and there was building work going on at the hotel so that also did not make the hotel look very appealing. They need to improve the hotel a lot if they want to get good reviews and more custom i'm afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Complacent Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: Donschwain
Reviews.Content: I had read some mixed reviews about this hotel but was willing to give it a try - I really wished I hadn't. The staff were a mixture of dour, unhelpful and inefficient. The receptionist was most put out that we didn't know that there was a split site arrangement and had bothered her to try and check-in with her. We requested a quiet room and were given the room next to the corridor door which banged all night. The "restaurant" had filthy tables, no mash, no margharita pizza, no naan, no bottled beer and no draught beer. My family and another family ended up walking out and traipsing our small children around Covent Garden to find a restaurant which could accomodate the 8 of us. The breakfast was no better with one broken chair, one wet chair, one wobbly table and stale croissants. The comparison was made so much more stark having stayed in a brilliant Holiday Inn Express in Epsom for the two previous nights. I have complained directly to Travelodge and received a (late) cursory response (if I am being kind). So glad to leave - will never go back !

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you can get a good deal, but not worth full price.”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeParrot
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times which must mean that it's ok. A lot depends on how much you pay. More recently I've managed to get far better deals in far better hotels, so this most recent time was for convenience with a group of 6th Formers that I taught, to show them Covent Garden. Our rooms were fine - both had decent views (floor 7 I think, in the Holborn building). Service was slow, but ok, and the same could be said for breakfast. I've stayed in the Holborn building several times with my family (2 adults, 2 children), and the family rooms are lovely and big, and ideal for young families. My worst experience was in December 2008 in a double room with my partner, and the only time they put us in the Drury Lane building. We had a dingy, dark basement room with a tiny shower room that wasn't particularly clean. We'd paid top price for the room so were very disappointed. However, the other times in the Holborn building it has been fine. I'd recommend for location if you can get a good deal, but the Â£100+ prices per night that seem to come up every time I search these days are too much and you can get better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Way below Travelodge standards.”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller0017
Reviews.Content: For a short 2 night stopover in London we thought we'd be safe with Travelodge on 10 Drury Lane. We've never had a problem with them in the past. This location was simply appauling. The sink, toilet and tub were disgusting and I refused to step into the tub to shower. The garbage was still full from the last occupant. No air con and it was stuffy with the 2 very small windows only able to open about an inch each. One bar of soap, and a very small one at that, to do us both. No hair dryer and no phone. With a friend recently having a heart attack in a hotel, I alway assume there'd be a phone. Or just to call the front desk!!!! I complained after the first night and was moved over to the other location. They were well aware of our conditions in the room and complied with my request for a refund for the night. New location offered a bigger room but loud shower, broken converter and a stench coming from below. Again no air con so you needed the windows open. The noise from the nightclub down below kept us up all night and didn't stop until 5am. We were on the 9th floor and it was soooo loud. Thrilled to leave the next morning after breakfast. It was edible but it's the same thing every day. No variation whatsoever. Goodbye, good riddance, and never to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Very adequate indeed; superb location”
Reviews.Author: jdboyd
Reviews.Content: Spent a few nights in the block on High Holborn which we'd obtained on www. offer for s great price. Thrilled to be sent to a large, top-floor room with stunning views across central London. Not sure what lower floors would be like (saw the nightclub round the back) or the Drury Lane branch, but for our purposes it was just fine, and excellent value for such a superb location (Covent Garden is a bit misleading to describe location - it's decidedly in nearby High Holborn, but no great matter. Didn't experience any breakfasts, but probably better and cheaper opportunities in nearby cafes, such as Giovannis in Museum Street. Yes, it's not the Waldorf Hilton or the Park Lane Intercontinental, but it's not a seedy fleapit either and, overall, exceedingly good value if you can get a good deal. ps Highly recommend a visit to the Princess Louise pub just down the road towards High Holborn tube - a period piece with vibrant clientele and high-quality but very cheap (for London) beers: a great credit to Sam Smith Brewery.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, worth a try”
Reviews.Author: Beni1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Convent Garden Travelodge mid August in a family room with a double bed and sofa bed. What you expect from a Travelodge, no fancy extras. Was clean and a decent shower, towels provided and changed daily. Big room and TV, comfortable enough bed. The best part about this hotel is its location, being next to the Shaftesbury Theatre and within 10 mins walking distance of all the theatres/cinemas. Was fairly quiet as well considering its on a main road, mite be worse if you're facing the street. If you know where you're going you wouldnt need to get many taxis which can bump up expenditure. Would highly recommend mainly for this reason alone and if you get a cheap deal throught he week its ideal. Breakfast which we booked online before was good price at about Â£12 for three of us (kids under 16 eat free at breakfast) and there was plenty to choose from, was a lot busier on a weekend understandably so you may have to wait for a table.

Reviews.Title: “Great value accom if you do it right”
Reviews.Author: helenandizzy
Reviews.Content: Was very worried about this hotel after reading the reviews on here, but heres our experience. This hotel has 2 sites about 50 yards apart, one in drury lane and another on holborn. The drury lane site looks a bit run down and has a major refurb going on. We were in the holborn site and it was fine. The room was standard travelodge and exactly what we would expect. Great location 5 minutes from covent garden. Great value for us family room Â£50 per night Decent breakfast Â£7.50 per adult kids eat free. (eat as much as you want) This hotel doesnt have air con. It was warm in the room even though it was only about 22 degrees when we stayed. I suspect this would be uncomfortable in a hot spell. Its central london, you have the window open cos its warm...its noisy outside. Didnt bother us but if you have to have peace and quiet then this may not be the place for you. I saw from their site that some nights are much more expensive, this hotel is fine for bargain prices, but if i had to pay a lot i would choose to stay elsewhere. There is no left luggage facility. We had a great stay and at these prices, in this location we would definitely use it again. (insist on the holborn side until the refurb is complete though) andy

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Adequate Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Kags09
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my sis in law and nephews for a 3 day tour of London. Walking distance from Kings Cross, initially went to Drury Lane building (extensive alterations being carried out and quite a few steps up to reception). Directed to High Holborn as this is where family rooms are, however we were checked in at Drury Lane. High Holborn is at the top of the street and across the road so no dramas. Room was double bed and sofa bed, not enough bedding for us all but managed to catch the chamber"person" and this was quickly rectified. Room was fine, nothing flash but bedding was clean and beds were comfy, our room was at the rear of the building and was quiet enough, Curtains didn't close properly and had to keep window open as it was quite warm. Breakfast?! We booked and paid online and paid half price, kids ate free. It was total chaos when we went for breakfast, no cutlery and no speakadeenglish staff. Once seated and cutlery obtained the food was very good, only 2 members of staff to contend with a full breafast room with queues forming. It was much the same the next day, but grab a seat and get on with it. Location is fab, would stay again just for the convenient location, we didn't get a super cheap deal but it wasn't too bad as it is central london. Kids appreciated the Dominos next day, a bit of planning is required on lead up to check out as the hotel wont keep your luggage, something to consider if you are planning to wander around on your last day.

Reviews.Title: “Was adequate for our 2 night stay”
Reviews.Author: 1689ACKO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights during early June 2010. If I remember correctly we were allocated Room 516 in the older part of the premises . The premises were a former hotel currently undergoing a major overhaul. The room was large, clean and tidy with plenty of storage space. We stayed for breakfast though the dining area and food quality was quite basic. Although we didn't have that much contact with staff members we didn't encounter any problems with them especially when we discovered we were void of two towels. The purpose of our visit was to attend a stage production at The New London Theatre which was literally 2 minutes walk along the street. In general this Travelodge is well positioned between 2 tube stations and also minutes away from pubs and cafes. There are some poor reviews for this Travelodge but if you don't expect too much then it will prove to be a convenient place to stay and also cheap if you book up well in advance.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect, basic base for London”
Reviews.Author: Pingu9
Reviews.Content: We love this Travel Lodge. The location is great. There are many nearby restaurants and the obvious allure of Covent Garden. Book ahead early, or in the sale and you can get a family room for Â£29. Not the sort of hotel you can pamer yourself in, but where else can you stay in London for such good rates? We've tried other hotels in London who can't quite match the 2 adults and 2 children requirements we need with the price and location we seek. We've been to covent Garden Travel Lodge 5 times now and haven't had one bad experience yet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, disspointing stay”
Reviews.Author: newman_z
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed with the current condition of the hotel and the rooms. On their website they have kindly mentioned about the noise from building work, which actually was not an issue, however they failed to mention that the building is covered in scaffolding. Furthermore, the reception staff were quite rude and unhelpful. The first room we were put in had two spot lights not working and a wall light hanging of the wall with exposed electrical wires. When i mentioned to the reception team that i was unhappy with the condition of the room, i was rudely told â€˜that on the website it does state that building work is being carried outâ€™ to which i answered that i didnâ€™t expect that to mean that i would be in a room with exposed electrical wires! Eventually I was moved to another room.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in fantastic location...”
Reviews.Author: RoadTrip30
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a stay in the Covent garden Travelodge with my partner and 2 young children. We booked in at the main hotel but were actually moved to their other hotel (literally across the road) where all of the family rooms are. Was really happy from when we first arrived, all the staff we came across were friendly and some extremely helpful. Public areas very clean, no matter what time we were in the lift area it smelt freshly cleaned...3 lifts all very clean too. Rooms, really basic, but this is a budget hotel (we paid Â£55 per night for a family room), and yes, some walls did have marks on them, but a hotel in the city would have to decorate once a week to stop this from happening. Above all though (and my main concern after a recent trip to another London Travelodge-Kings Cross Royal Scot) was that the rooms, and especially the bathroom, were pristine. Beds comfortable with immaculate bedding. Location is FANTASTIC, minutes away from the nearest tube (with most tourist destinations within a 10 minute journey), few minutes walk from Leicester Sq, Soho, museums etc with some amazing restaurants and bars (not that we made use of the bars on this trip with the kids!). We bought a daily travel pass for just over Â£5 each (unlimited buses and tube rides...kids free) but didn't really have to use them that much. There is a swimming pool straight across the road which costs Â£4 for adults and just Â£1 for children, open til 9pm every night. Also an Aveda spa opposite which I didn't get the chance to use, but will definately try out next time (presume you'd have to book a while in advance?) Breakfast cost us Â£7.50 per adult but the children are free...all you can eat buffet...full English, cereals, continental. Area for food is very small but managable, and food was hot, well cooked and reguarly topped up. There were a few niggles, that would stop me giving it 5 stars...although it was close! No plug in bath, had to ask house keeping. No hairdryers, but can get one from reception, could do with more pillows (1 each...sure we could of asked for more though) and basic tv choices (bit of a pain in the evenings after the kids have gone to sleep), nothing major...and definately nothing to worry about...just thought i'd put all of the facts down. None of this really matters to me, as long as it's clean and good location. Overall would definately recommend and will certainly stay here next time we stay in London, even if we don't get as good a rate.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect a good nights sleep...especially with inconsiderate people in the next room!!!”
Reviews.Author: emma68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the travel lodge on Drury Lane for 3 nights. We paid Â£200 for 3 nights so got an ok deal. Check in was fast and efficient but when we saw our room (room 617) we were straight back down to reception. The bed was smaller than a double (the mattress sat a few inch smaller than the base) and we thought we had been given a single room due to this and the fact that there was only 1 towel and 1 spare pillow. We were given a key to the room on high Holborn but the mattress was so old, springs were showing through and we rolled into the centre of it because it was so soft and un-supporting. We decided to go for the original room because there is no way I would have let a dog sleep on the mattress at high Holborn. We ended up sleeping top and tail because you still fell into the centre of the bed because of how old it was. We requested additional pillows 3 times and kept being told â€˜we have none here but we will have them sent up to your roomâ€™ which didnâ€™t happen! Our first night was horrendous. The walls are paper thin anyway but the couple next door insisted on having very loud sex about once an hour until we saw the day light through the curtains! 2 hours sleep was at most all we got! We spoke to the manager and asked for them to be moved. She said that we would have to move which we thought was unfairâ€¦it wasnâ€™t us making the noise, why should we be inconvenienced! She was not very helpful at all! We were given room 719 which had slightly quieter neighbours! All rooms we saw were shabby, old and quite dirty. The lifts felt like they were ready to break at any point and the service light was on one of them and they all made loud banging noises at random times going up and down. I really cant say anything good about the hotel . There is also building works which although it says on the website starts at 8amâ€¦it started at 7:30am on 2 of the days. There was no sleeping through it, it was very loud! Not what you need with late nights due to paper thin walls. The location of the hotel is good. Less than 5 minutes to covent gardens and up to 10 minutes walk will get you to most theatres. Breakfast looked ok but we opted to eat out. Garfunkels did 2 breakfasts for Â£10 (there is one on the strand and one at Leicester square) and they were great! No need to spend Â£7.50 on low quality buffet food. I would not rush to book this hotel again and I most certainly would not pay more than Â£40 per night. At full price of Â£100+ per night, you could stay at much nicer places in the west end (e.g. a couple of the thistle hotels are about Â£100 - Â£110 per night). Finally I would like to say that they are extending to add 200 more rooms. In my opinion they need to sort out the current building first because it is in dire need of a deep clean and lick of paint! If anyone has any questions, feel free to send me a message.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as before”
Reviews.Author: Frostycat
Reviews.Content: I reviewed this hotel some years ago where I raved about it. How things have changed! The staff are still nice and friendly but the room was old and tired. The window restrictor was broken and the window could be opened wide - no problem for us as our son is 16 but for families with toddlers this would be a major issue. Surely somebody must have noticed. The room was clean enough, but very worn and unfortunately on the 4th floor to the side of the hotel, close to a night club called 'The Den' which was rocking until 4am every morning. I know this is not the hotel's fault, but I would recommend anyone checking in to ask for a high floor - we were on the 9th floor before and it was very quiet. Breakfast is still good and of course the location is excellent. I suppose it is still the best value in London (we booked way in advance and paid Â£49 per night) but I notice somebody recommends asking for a room in the new High Holborn building and I think that would be a good idea. We would stay there again, but we would ask for the newer building.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: SmokieJo
Reviews.Content: Where do I start - OK, a quick list of the problems we had 1) Poo in the toilet on arrival - as in a whole one - obviously not cleaned or even flushed 2) I hope what was only dirt on the towels. Then no new ones the following day (despite following their instructions for new ones). Then did get new ones - which were also dirty! Took down to front desk - no apologies but given a new and now clean one. 3) They told us the wrong times for breakfast so we missed it. 4) Not made aware there was major building works going on so was very very noisy. The location is good but apart from this, I can do little but warn you to avoid this hotel at all costs. The only reason I have given it 2 stars for service is that after a word with the manager about our problems, one nights stay was refunded and of course our breakfast we never had was refunded.

Reviews.Title: “The worst I can remember!”
Reviews.Author: MediMan22
Reviews.Content: To say this hotel is tired would be a major understatement, it's exhausted!. I have never stayed in a chain hotel in such poor condition. Carpets, ceilings, paintwork, OMG! The toilet roll holder had been refixed so many times it looked like the back of a dartboard and yet it, the towelrail and the poor hook on the back of the door were all failing off. Great location (Covent Garden) but no wonder it was the only hotel in the area available when I booked it late. My advice, spend 5 mins more of the internet and Â£5 more on a taxi and stay somewhere else. Finally, "we have no facility to hold your bags" so when I had to check out at 11am on Saturday I had to get a taxi and then pay Â£16 luggage storage at Charing Cross even though I'd just spent over Â£400 at this shabby hotel - rubbish!

Reviews.Title: “YUK”
Reviews.Author: Mrs01
Reviews.Content: My room was desperately in need of refurb; carpet coming up at the edges, dirty walls, cracked sink etc etc. Ordered food to take up to my room and waited 40 minutes for a plastic pizza and warm wine. Horrid. The staff were friendly, but I felt sorry for them working in such a hideous place. A blot on travel lodges lanscape. There are LOTS of other hotels in the area - stay in one of those.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy ventilation system needs sorting, is aircon meant to work and beware of underground rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Been2China
Reviews.Content: We were placed in the new High Holborn extension at 10 Drury Lane. It was all newish, staff nice and room not bad. Here's the issue: You cannot control in an advance booking whether you get a below ground level room or not. We got a below ground level one with a slot of a window facing an underground facilities area, this window did not open. A wall vent was taped closed. While outside temp was only about 18 dec C, room was more like 28 for the first couple of hours of the night. Air con would not switch into cooling mode, possibly because outdoors was too cool. Could not be bothered to complain as I suspected all rooms were the same. Finally, the standard ventilation duct fans were very loud indeed, a bit like a jet flying over the building but constantly. Since we bought on an advance promo deal the price was as they advertise, a steal (for central London). But I would hesitate to ever book this location again and certainly not at full price. Covent Garden/Holborn location seems to be well below the usual Travelodge standard. I have stayed a various Travelodges and recommended the chain to others who have stayed too to this is all a pity.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed Stay”
Reviews.Author: danty11
Reviews.Content: On arrival the senior receptionist was less than welcoming - not a smile in sight! There seemed to be a problem that my first name wasn't recorded on their computer record even though I had the confirmation. The rooms are in real need of renovation - the furniture is shabby much like student accommodation, the windows in both booked rooms wouldn't shut properly, the floors needed cleaning and the decor is in serious need of repair and update. The bedding was clean and the bed comfortable. The bathroom was clean. Breakfast was good however the receptionist, again, had a problem with us sitting down 5 mins early (one of us is in late 80's) as there were no seats available in reception. The senior receptionist does not engage with customers in a reasonable manner and needs customer care training. This Travelodge in our opinion is not worth the money and does not do as the advertising suggests. We have stayed in many other Travelodges where we have been completely satisfied and happy with the accommodation and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: happydays1234573
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights with young children, the hotel was better than I expected, after reading reviews I was uneasy about what to expect. Found the check in easy with lots of staff around, the room was basic as others have said but it is a travelodge and you get what you pay for. Location was excellent, with the little ones aged 6 & 8 they were fine walking the sights, very easy to get to the squares, parks and main sights. We booked breakfast and were very happy we did, the hotel had a 3 hour slot 7 till 10 Monday to Friday and 8 till 11 Saturday, so never felt rushed to get up and rush down, got seats easy each morning, and you help yourself so can make as many visits to the food as you need. Again lots of staff around and they kept the tables tidy and food topped up. We had a great couple of days, hotel is in a great spot, would we stay here agian? YES we would.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, room and views but very hot and noisy”
Reviews.Author: Squidgeykin
Reviews.Content: We requested a room in the High Holborn building as it seemed to get the better reviews, and like others were really pleased with the cleanliness, size and views from the room. The staff were also very friendly and helpful but also, like others, found the room was really, really hot and with the window open got the constant noise from a nightclub at the back of the hotel, until 6am!!!!!!! There was a constant thumping of base music and shouting and screaming, the noise was not good and we were on the 13th floor!!!! If you can stand the heat and noise it is otherwise fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Desperately in need of Refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Huskyrides
Reviews.Content: Great location, right in the heart of Covent Garden. However it's pretty dire inside and desperately requires a makeover. Paper thin walls, shabby carpets and tired furniture. However it was very clean and the staff, when prompted were nice. It's not always cheap, but you get what you pay for. I would recommend the new Travelodge in Waterloo.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, large rooms, friendly staff, great location, great views”
Reviews.Author: NorthEssexLulu
Reviews.Content: Family rooms are situated in the newer Holborn Road building. The staff were very friendly, the rooms were clean and large and the view from the tenth floor was great. Ther was no noise from other rooms and the traffic noise was not a problem from this height. The hotel is in a great, central location and if booked far enough in advance the rooms are great value for money. There is no air con in the rooms and it could get a little warm, however, staff provided a fan for us to use during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't sleep”
Reviews.Author: tkeddie
Reviews.Content: Arrived in London early to make the most of our weekend but no facilities to store luggage until room available. Had to take it to nearest railway station's left luggage. Room basic but clean. Had to leave window open to keep cool but night club next door closes at dawn and with the noise from there and the police sirens - we hardly slept! Staff didn't seem concerned about helping guests - some couldn't even direct us to some well known attractions. However, if you can accept these problems then the location is great.(Take your own map though.) Bit pricey compared to other hotels in thearea for what they are offering.

Reviews.Title: “Not one for the summer !”
Reviews.Author: Stykindemud
Reviews.Content: With temperatures outside of 30degrees, the atmosphere in the 7th floor room we were allocated was unbearably hot. No a/c, no fan, and not even a window that would open, so back at Reception a friendly and helpful staffer offered us a room in the basement, which strangely, seems to be the only area with a/c. The small pavement-level window onto Shorts Gdns was secure and we experienced no disturbance from outside (Monday night). A great budget place for Spring and Autumn only, unless you are lucky and can get down in that basement !

Reviews.Title: “Good location even better when works finished.”
Reviews.Author: lonboi
Reviews.Content: Had a single room in duty lane buliding.was very old and is construction site.stayed last year in buliding on holborn was much better.nut that will change.room suitable for 1 person was clean but old.people should stop compaining when they are doing something about frying it up to standard.stayed in about 5 travelodges in past few weeks and all good I know u are booking a simple room otherwise the price will be higher.nook in advance I paid 19 pounds slot better then a hostel which is far more expensive.will be stayin again

Reviews.Title: “yuk”
Reviews.Author: citynorfolk
Reviews.Content: i dont like to complain and I'm normally very easy going however I really wasnt very pleased with this travelodge, Ive stayed in many travelodges in the past and have always been happy with them, but this really was disapointing so I just had to write a review on it! Good points:this hotel is in a great location, three minutes walk from covent garden tube! bad points: the hotel was sooo HOT! couldnt sleep or relax as it was stiffling, we couldnt open our window as the next door room had theirs open and they kept banging together. the carpet was full of hairs, the beds very uncomfortable, decor was unkept and it felt very dirty and shabby. the corridors and lift smelt very badly and we felt the staff to be very rude and unhelpful. outside of the hotel was a nightclub which we found very scary walking back after our night out walking past it. the hotel was having work done to it and it looked a right mess, hopefully the work will make this hotel alot better!

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel but great location!”
Reviews.Author: Girlie99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the weekend of 2/3 July. Reception staff were quite rude and didnt have the basic idea of customer service. We arrived at 2.10pm and were told to wait until 2.30pm to check in or pay 10 pounds and we could check in right away! Went for coffee and came back at 2.30pm to a huge queue, everyone had obviously done the same!! Room was in the basement with the smallest window I have ever seen, the view was of a wall but at least we had air con! The basement rooms are the only ones with air con and with the temp being above 30 degrees all wknd it was a godsend!! The hotel is very basic but in the end if you just want somewhere to sleep then its fine, the location is great. Covent Garden is literally 2 mins away and you can walk to Leicester square, piccadilly circus etc with no prob. Would recommed this hotel for wknd breaks with friends where you just need somewhere to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Building Site Outside”
Reviews.Author: KIRSTY26
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this week and it is a building site outside-they are building 200 more bedrooms and a 200 seater bar being built. The location of this Travelodge is great, hopefully it will get back to normal when the building work is completed.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Travelodge stay!”
Reviews.Author: SHOEGAL1977
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in a Travelodge as they are reasonably priced and you know what your getting, basic necessities. We have all stayed in Travelodges before and let's just say this has got to be the worst one ever! I was coming from Holborn, saw the hotel went in to ask at the reception if this was the Covent garden one, and receptionist replied, part of it. I asked well can I then check in here and she said ok. Checked in went to room and being the hottest day of the year I just expected it to have A/C and I was so wrong. I piddly little fan which I am not sure what good it would do and it mad a horrendous noise. My friends both went to the Covent Garden of the hotel but then had to transfer themselves to the correct part. As there are no phones in the rooms or on the floors, anytime we needed anything it was a trek all the way back down to reception which when your on the 10th floor it's a bit of a pain! Asked for an iron which when taking back up to the room leaked all over my dress and then had to dry it out luckily it was like a sauna in the room so dried quickly. Went back down to get a hairdryer and some ice. The ice was given to me in a plastic bag, i did ask if I could have it in a pint glass and was told she had run out of glasses! Quite poor to be honest. Managed to still have a good evening despite the issues with the hotel, got back to the hotel and deicded to keep the window open to let some air in. Big mistake as there was a party going on next to the hotel which went on till gone 4am and we got no sleep whatsoever! All in all it was a poor stay and will not be recommending or staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay again”
Reviews.Author: pickles1162
Reviews.Content: I would never stay here again, the check in was fine but the room was dirty, the bed had a spring protruding through it and we were on the 11th floor near the all night club, which unless you are a heavy sleeper or have ear plugs there is no chance of any sleep. The room was dusty, the carpet unclean and the family bed hadnt been made up either, there were crumbs over the windowsill and dirty marks on the inside of the room window and down the side of the bed. The carpet near the lift was all ruckled up, definate trip hazard. The windows are on a retainer so you couldnt open them more than a few inches which on a hot summer night, with the disco downstairs was unreal, no fans, or air con. If I had paid full price i would of certainly of asked for my money back.

Reviews.Title: “Come on in the waters lovely”
Reviews.Author: harveydog22
Reviews.Content: Had a two night stay on 10/11th Ju;y for theatre and sightseeing trip. The hottest weekend of the year made the hotel a bit of an oven but for location it cannot be bettered for the price, Â£29 for Sunday night in Covent Garden is a real bargain. The hotel has the hottest water of any hotel anywhere in the world and even has a warning to close bathroom door when showering to stop the smoke alarms activating. I could have gone around with a magnifying glass and found faults but all the basics were there. It has a high turnover of guests and is bound to looka little tired. New rooms are being built but as we were there at weekend it didnt effect us, all the wokers were there on Monday morning but made no noise as they were all to busy ogling the checking out hen parties. The room sizes were good and we had a brilliant view of all the sights from the 7th floor room. We had breakfast in the hotel which was plentiful and a good way to set us up for a days strolling around. when the plates run out just ask the staff instead of throwing a hissy fit its amazing how it works. If you go expecting the Ritz you will end up on here moaning but go with a realistic view and you will realise what a bargain you got.

Reviews.Title: “great location -no air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: deniro10000
Reviews.Content: this hotel is great value for money. It is ideal to get to Oxford Street, theatreland, and leicester square etc Clean, but beware. There is no A/C and with temperatures hitting 31 degrees it is an uncomfortable nights sleep even with a loan of a fan............

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArgyllIslanders
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights for a bit of sightseeing and to visit the theatre. Great location -Covent Garden and Leicester Square within approx 10 minutes' walking distance. The room was shabby - mould in bathroom, cracked toilet bowl, window would not close properly. Also, although the website warns of construction work, rooms facing Drury Lane, of which ours was one, were extremely noisy and not helped by the non-closing window. There was only one lift working and at check-out times had a lengthy wait. At an average of Â£105+ per night, albeit cheaper than most for London hotels, fhe comfort of our stay was very disappointing. Have stayed in other Travelodge locations and found the standards, whether the hotel was old or new, to be pretty similar. However, this location falls short. How do you get to book the one at High Holborn across the road as it never seems to come up as an option on the Travelodge website?

Reviews.Title: “Oh those summer nights..”
Reviews.Author: fenrotherwitch
Reviews.Content: Checkin at 12 noon as requested, no real problems just receptionist working alone. Room on floor 8 of the Holborn block spacious and identical to all travelodges good bed lovely towels and clean and fresh. Opening window good as weather was hot. Noisy with window open but this is central london, so what could we expect.. stayed in worse 4 star hotel rooms at much higher prices. Staff helpful and professional in reception and cafe bar.. despite being abused and provoked by some very rude customers who seemed to forget they had paid for a Travelodge not the Ritz, and had been too dense to read the booking information provided regarding check in times and leaving luggage!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and not expensive - but a sauna in July !”
Reviews.Author: PeterPan2
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend Travelodge as a brand in general - but I'm afraid not the Covent Garden - at least not in summer ! With no air conditioning, and windows that don't open at all it was an oven in the room ! Reception did lend me a fan which made it just about bearable, but if they'd run out of fans it would have been unbearable and unacceptable. My most recent stay at Travelodge Euston was a dream tho' !

Reviews.Title: “don`t beleive all you read”
Reviews.Author: georgie61
Reviews.Content: we read the reviews after we had booked and before we went and went into panic, it sounded so awful on previous reviews but on arriving and checking in i think that these people must have stayed in a different place!!! the rooms were clean, beds clean and comfortable, shower hot and worked well, towels clean. staff were helpful. slight noise from outside late at night but to be expected i feel. great location for all we did and places we went to - convent garden, leicester square etc.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: KieransMum
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be excellent value for money and locationwise it was perfect. A 5 min walk from the centre of Covent Garden and the tube, with many places to eat and drink surrounding it. Be warned, this is not The Ritz, the rooms were very basic and were not full of mod con appliances. However they were clean and the beds comfortable, we took the optional extra of breakfast which was actually really good, basically if you just need a base to explore the city and sleep at this is ideal. We don't have the budget to stay in central London hotels on a usual visit and have to use outer London ones and rely on taking the last tube out to get back to our accomodation. Its was wonderful to not have to do this and be able to stroll around the bars etc. We would stay here again as it made for a great budget break.

Reviews.Title: “Dont be put off by bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: EthelEssex
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews before I went and really panicked but the room was clean and comfortable and the shower good and hot, beds reasonable and perfectly adequate for an overnight stay close to all the nightlife. Air con worked but a little noisy but overall fine.

Reviews.Title: “don't know what all the negativities are for”
Reviews.Author: thebadgerSheffield
Reviews.Content: High Holborn / Museum Street great location , great price Â£32 glad I ignored all the bad reviews will be definitely be stopping next time I'm in London

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed!”
Reviews.Author: dmg31
Reviews.Content: Needed a one night stay at a sensible rate. oK, the location is good but the room was poor! No aircon, no hairdyer, cramped, and the bathroom was disgusting chipped enamel on the bath, mold around the bath/shower area. Reception staff were bordering on rude - took ages before one of them even looked up to serve us! On the flip side, the staff in the bar area wer friendly and helpful - weill done guys. I'm sorry but at Â£93 a night I wouldn't stay here again. Would rather pay more and get a decent room.

Reviews.Title: “Good situation, Comfy beds, Expensive.”
Reviews.Author: KGLoki
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a sunday night and fortunately booked early so got room for Â£35. Whilst comfortable the room was a strange shape and i am glad i had room to self as there is no extra space. The prices i have seen quoted for this hotel [over Â£110 a night] seem way over the odds and i can only believe you are paying for the location. The bar in the hotel is a little overpriced and staff not over friendly. I would use again though if the price is right. If you do not wish to pay for hotel breakfast there is a cafe over the road. A number of nearby public houses sell food throughout the day. My main concern was the dozen steps outside to gained entry to the building. But these are not too steep. There are extra security doors before reaching lift but i did not see the sign and just pulled the dor open, so obviously not that secure. Overall worth the money i paid and the situation is excellent. The top end of the price range though i cannot see it being justified.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but . . . .”
Reviews.Author: MarcelTheFrog
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights during one of the UKâ€™s occassional warm spells. The hotel is well located, BUT it is squalid, scruffy, stuffy & depressing. Looks as if it's a converted 1960s office block. No aircon, small room, the springs in the mattress were also on a mission to escape. I accept that Travelodge is a low cost brand, but it would need to be a much lower cost before Iâ€™d be tempted back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the location and price”
Reviews.Author: Sunjoy
Reviews.Content: We found the couple of nights we spent here just fine and would return again. It was a bit dirty in places, but nothing too bad, and we found the bed comfortable. We are a family of 4 (2 young kids) and I really doubt we could have found anywhere else that cheap, that central and that comfortable (we have some experience with over-priced tiny hotels). There are two parts of this hotel though and I think we were not in the main part since there were no evening meals being served. This was the main hassle for us since it was raining, cold and we didn't want to drag the kids out. The location of the hotel is almost right in the middle of Holborn and Covent Garden tube stations. It is probably easiest to find from Holborn - about a 5 min walk. We booked the family room, which is OK for 3 people or 2 adults and 2 kids if the kids can share. It would probably be tough with older kids.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: TravellersO
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. It is accepted that Travelodge is basic but this was way below basic. Room was shabby, grubby and in need of serious refurbishment. Bed was so small and mattress so uncomfortable got no sleep and packed to check out after first night. Sleep deprivation compounded by (false) fire alarm going off several times early morning but on 6th Floor with no way to contact reception to find out what was going on (no telephones in the rooms). Staff did eventually find alternative room for us with better bed but room condition and mattresses still poor. Issues included: only one set of towels for two people, broken toilet roll holder, TV not tuned in, missing (ie broke off) 'bedside cabinet', broken window fitting (had to use folded envelope to close it), holes in tiling in bathroom (crudely filled), plug in sink did not work. This experience has put us off Travelodge for life.

Reviews.Title: “avoid this travelodge like the plague”
Reviews.Author: seasonedtraveller078
Reviews.Content: stayed in this travelodge in may 2010 after a holiday in texas,we have stayed at a few other travelodges around the uk and never had any cause to complain,but this one was terrible, dirty corridors, mattresses and bed bases that were ripped and soiled,in the dining area there was a large piece of wood backing missing from the seating,exposing the lagged pipework,(a haven for germs and vermin giving all the building work going on around the hotel),have complained to travelodge head office twice re this hotel but they have completely ignored my complaint,needless to say will never use this hotel again despite the price or location and will seriously think of using any travelodge again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and super location but the hotel is no more than someone to go to sleep”
Reviews.Author: MissDior76
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights, well I was booked in for 4 nights, last august 2009. Tthe room was awful, like something from the 60's and airless, after the initial shock I realised the location was awesome and if you use the hotel as somewhere to literally sleep then i recommend, however if you want to spend time in your hotel room ie single traveller, then AVOID! That said the staff were friendly...so make your own mind up but dont have high expectations, i checked out after 2 nites....was spending too much just trying to escape the room.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby but good location”
Reviews.Author: Rosie_Beagle
Reviews.Content: It is a great location and for central london pretty cheap. But it is pretty shabby and the beds uncomfortable with very thin sheets. In future I would trade location for a slightly better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: daisy61
Reviews.Content: We were in the Drury Lane building, found it surprisingly clean and quiet. Although most other reviews say that the other building is better they are the people who also comaplin about the noise so maybe the Drury Lane site is actually the better of the two. We didn't hear a lot of noise at all even though our window was open all the time. Found reception staff very helpful. The hotel is in such a brilliant location close to tube stations and covent garden but alo within walking distance much of central London, many theatres and place to eat etc. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The shabbiest, most run down Travelodge I have ever stayed in. Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Visitor_from_England
Reviews.Content: Long queue at reception on checking in. Two bored and disinterested staff members hovering around but doing nothing to help the one person actually checking people in. Corridors are like a prison, the rooms have threadbare carpets, dingy lighting; very depressing. My room was at basement level and had no window opening at all so was very airless. In my room: The shower tray drained very slowly indeed â€“ taking in excess of 15 minutes to drain so it was clearly blocked. When I ran water in the sink there was a very strong foul water smell coming from the plug hole which was most unpleasant. There was obviously hair or other blockages in the trap that need proper clearing. When I first arrived there was an almost over-powering smell of bleach coming from the sink, so somebody had clearly been trying to clean / unblock the sink plug. (unsuccessfully) The hot water in both the shower and the sink reached no more than tepid temperature. I did not complain to reception in the morning as there was a large queue and I just could not face their indolent indifference again. Avoid at all costs. You can get much better for the Â£86 they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: nbarnett86
Reviews.Content: We went to London for a birthday treat on a shoestring budget. We had read some really bad reviews on here but it was one of the few hotels we could afford in the location we wanted and we thought we take a gamble. When you check in at this hotel you have to go to the older building, the actual Travelodge Covent Garden Hotel which looks very unappealing from outside. We had heard from others on here to ask for the High Holborn hotel which is part the Covent Garden Hotel and is just across the road. The receptionist had no problems in swapping us over and we were glad she did. The High Holborn was much more modern than Covent Garden and it was much quieter. The hotel itself was fairly inexpensive and we got what we paid for. The room was spartan but comfortable and as we were on the 13th floor we had a very peaceful nights sleep. We didn't opt to have breakfast there, and we were happy with that option as there were some very nice cafes nearby that were cheaper than the breakfast on offer at the hotel. The hotel is a very short walk from Holborn Tube Station and Covent Garden Market so it is ideally for exploring London. If you want somewhere cheap and are happy with basic accommodation we would definitely recommend this to others, just remember to ask for the High Holborn when checking in.

Reviews.Title: “beware check in times and baggage”
Reviews.Author: Grahamek
Reviews.Content: It's a travelodge, so yes, it does what it says on the tin. The rooms are bare, but clean. The location, great. The staff, sometimes mentally aware, sometimes not. The one thing that got me was the check in/out policy. We arrived at 1.30 and were told check in wasn't till 3, but we could check in now if we paid an extra 10 pounds. I wouldn't have minded, but there was nowhere to leave our bags, which was the first time this has ever happened me, in very many hotel stays. The same rule applies with check out, so if you have a long day ahead of you in london, do not stay in this hotel if you have a lot of bags.

Reviews.Title: “Un-decided, but cheap and central”
Reviews.Author: GLSA
Reviews.Content: Un-decided on this hotel, yes it is cheap, very cheap for London if you get the right deal. Yes it is Central, close to Covent Garden and Leicester Quare and many central locations, plus 2 or 3 tube stops nearby. Main problems I found was the noise, a lot of outside noise going on until very early morning, not sure exactly where it was coming from but possibly the Seven Dials district just next door (which has a vast array of pubs eateries and boutiques next door to Covent Garden and well worth a visit during the day or evening) Or perhaps there was other nightclubs nearby but 1 particular night the night before a bank holiday there was lots of activity and noise outside until around 5 in the morning, really made it impossible to sleep, even though we were on the 11th floor, the noise was terrible and the double glassed windows did not block anything out. I guess it depends on what night it is and which side of the hotel you are on, next night was not as bad, quitened down not long after midnight. The room we had was basic, a very large space where they obviously put in a second bed if needed, but there was only 1 char in the whole room !! Seemed clean but I did get the impression some wee bugs were flying round that room and we did get some bites, another thing that would really make me doubt I would go back. Then just a quick note on which building of the hotel to take, we were in the Holburn Road one, think it's the taller of the 2 and slightly further from Covent Garden tube, this did seem the better hotel to get and indeed knowing that we pre-booked a room, which they were very happy to do, I had also asked for a quiter room, which is even more suprising considering the noise problem mentioned above

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good value for money, more than made up by brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Poopsiethecow
Reviews.Content: We booked this in advance from Australia on the Travelodge website, and paid 55 pounds per night for two nights. On arrival found that rooms were being offered at 105 pounds, so very happy with our rate. Considering the excellent location, so close to Covent Garden, theatres and tube station, we were happy to put up with basic but clean accommodation. Would be happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain - central London for Â£32!”
Reviews.Author: Poliwhirl
Reviews.Content: Booked a single room over bank holiday weekend. Checked in at the Drury Lane reception (the old building); I suspect that if I had turned up at the High Holborn building (the new one) I would have got a room there but I was happy with my room. Yes the reception could have been a bit friendlier (having read a few reviews which warned of outside noise I asked for a quiet room and was told "your on the second floor, its fine" ???) Yes, the room was a bit shabby and needed some maintenance but was clean. My room was a single with a single bed but in a previous incarnation had been a double room (it had a double headboard) so there was plenty of space. Bed was comfortable, room had a wardrobe, tea/coffee making facilities, flat screen tv, a heater, a very old a/c unit that only seemed to blow out warm air (not a problem as it was not warm in London that night so room did not need cooling); I do wonder what the room would be like in summer as you can only open the window about an inch. Terrible view from my particular room (see photo). Bathroom clean but worn at the edges with cracked/loose tiles but otherwisee OK. You are supplied with one small bar of soap and nothing else so bring your own shower gel/shampoo. You get one hand towel and one bath towel per person but no bath mat to step on as you exit the shower. Shower was powerful and hot. I had some sort of air vent near my window which 'hummed' so slept with window closed, noise level was fine. In the morning opened the window and aroma of bacon wafted into my room. I took breakfast at the High Holborn hotel with my sister and her family, it was bit chaotic and often there were no cups, plates, bowls etc. but there was a reasonable choice (cereals, bacon/sausage/scrambled egg/tomatoes/baked beans, yogurts, croissants, toast etc. and you got what you wanted if you waited/asked. Location was excellent just 5 minutes from Covent Garden market. So all in all for Â£32 you could do a lot worse - just think you could pay a lot more and stay in a very grotty hotel in Bayswater, I know what I would choose.

Reviews.Title: “Basic City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sningbat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice (Drury lane not the High Holborn block) and both times found the hotel to have all that we've needed. Its not luxury but its clean,hot shower every morning and enough tv channels for first/last thing.Approx 3 min walk to the tube/CG market. We found the staff to be helpful and polite at all times (if you want ott friendly go to Disneyland). We always pay the Â£10 early check in and arrive at 12pm-room has always been ready so worth it for the extra 3 hours (if you consider Â£10 steep you're staying in the wrong city). Cant comment on breakfast as we never have it-no way we would eat enough to validate the Â£7.50 charged.(If this applies to you theres an M&S by the tube doing porridge/yogurts/crossiants etc).Have eaten from the hotel menu before and it was very fairly priced for central London. We have stayed on 2nd/7th floor here and only thing preventing a good nights sleep was the noisy people in the next room.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: wcvan1
Reviews.Content: arrived at hotel at check-in time on May 24th had to carry luggage up stairs to lobby.the room was like an oven no air conditioner,couldn't open windows.no phone in room went to desk got a fan that only half worked.one hand towel and one bath towel for two people one little bar of soap no bath mat,the taps didn't work either got all hot or all cold water couldn't adjust it.room small no place to put luggage.not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel,will defs be back!”
Reviews.Author: DerryChunkyMonkey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a superb location, right in the heart of Covent Garden. We found our room to be extremely clean and spacious. All the staff were extremely helpful. For some people the Â£7.50 charge for breakfast may seem a bit expensive but it is a buffet style breakfast allowing you to go up as many times as you wanted. The only down side to the breakfast is that during our stay the toaster was out of action! Overall, we found this to be a fabulous hotel which was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in the one on High Holborn and was very happy”
Reviews.Author: Phillygirlagain
Reviews.Content: So, I cannot comment about the one on Drury, but the one on High Holborn (which also classifies the Covent Garden location) was just fine. The website warns you ahead of time not to expect shampoo, shower gel, etc. (although all can be purchased from the hotel if you like), and as long as you come prepared with your own, this is not a problem. Sheets and towels were provided, and our room was very clean and VERY large, though also very bare (not a complaint, just an observation - who ever uses all of those excess chairs in a room anyway?!). The staff was EXTREMELY helpful and friendly, and anything we asked for, we got. We actually liked breakfast a lot. It was basically a full English buffet with cereal, yogurt, pastries, etc. as additional options. For the price (6 pounds if booked online), it was excellent. Yes, you could probably find a breakfast sandwich for less outside of the hotel, but you could easily skip lunch if you opt for the hotel breakfast, which is a testament to how filling it is (I can eat!). There is also a bar within the hotel, which was a nice option on our last night when we had to pack but still wanted a few more beers. If I had one word of warning, it would be that the showers could prove problematic for older/shorter travellers as there was a huge step down that could be dangerous for them. Honestly, though, I would recommend this place to anyone who wants to spend a little time in London. The location was great, the staff was wonderful, and the room was very nice for our needs!

Reviews.Title: “good location...”
Reviews.Author: gemmajane
Reviews.Content: we stayed high holburn across the road.. our train got us in at 12.45 knowing check in wasnt till 3 went to try our luck as we ave managed to check in early b4.. by this point it was about 130 , anyway the not so friendly lady behind desk didnt even smile or greeted us, she said earliest checkin is 2.30 ok fair enought expect that Lol. but she was so cold and not helpful when we was asking if there was anything we could do with our case.... anyway came back at that time and waited at the desk for ages without any common acknowlegdement, then finally she did just to say not time yet 5 more min....anyway room ok same old same old... but fantastic location.. would deffo stay again...

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, horrible, horrible”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller078
Reviews.Content: Probably the worst hotel I've ever stayed in - and I travel a lot. Room stuck in a 70's time warp; electrical appliances all marked with stickers saying "no longer in use"; no mattress protector between sheet (thin) and it - yuck; only two light bulbs worked in the room; blue grotty carpet fraying at the edges; skirting boards bashed to bits and looked dirty; chair at "dressing table" dirty and very old; furniture all old; light fittings hanging off wall; bathroom poorly lit, one small bar of soap only, no bath mat to step on and no grab rail so I nearly killed myself getting out of bath onto slippery floor. Window in main part of room didn't shut, never mind lock - note I was a woman on my own - Suzy Lamplugh Trust should look at this one - might as well have had my bed in the road below because of the noise. Breakfast very poor - no toaster working so bread only, croissants seemed like yesterday's, didn't even go near the cooked stuff. Tea cups smelt liked they'd been dried with the cloth that wiped the benches down. All this for Â£100, it is a joke and our foreign visitors must think we all live like this. Signs of refurbishment work but I will never visit this one again. Only 1 good point - location.

Reviews.Title: “Warning”
Reviews.Author: Pompeychic1
Reviews.Content: Where do i start ? On arrival we were faced with a dirty looking concrete building with windows to match. The reception staff where very polite and our room was ready on arrival at 5pm. Although we were only on the 1st floor (room 104) we used the lift due to our luggage. The floor of the lift was covered in some sort of fluid. Our room was basic, as expected. What we we were not expecting was a matress which we feel should of been replaced about 10 years ago ,along with the brown stained celing tiles above the mouldy bathroom. Breakfast on 1st morning was good although the guests were all using knives or tablespoons to stir coffee and tea. 2nd Breakfast......oh my god ! No cutlery.
