I shared the only fork i could find with my mum. Then 6 knives arrived and there was a scamble for these.Toaster was broken, Brown bread was covered in green mould. But you could eat " as much as you want !" After complaining we were promptly given a refund for our breakfast. After being informed that the hotel could not hold our luggage , we walked up the stairs to our room which was filled with the aroma of urine. This hotel was vile and i wouldn't use Travelodge again if my life depended on it.

Reviews.Title: “A balanced review”
Reviews.Author: MrMrsFussy
Reviews.Content: I was panicing a bit having read some of the other reviews, so here's a fair and balanced review from someone who is well travelled, expects a good night sleep ( I find it hard to sleep with much back ground noise ) and value for money. ( we paid Â£90.00 per room per night for 2 nights ). Important - there are 2 hotels classed as Covent Garden, they are 30 seconds apart walking. The one located on the corner of High Holborn and Museum Street is the one to stay in, specify when booking and here are the reasons why - it has been refurbished, it is not joined / near to any clubs or pubs, therefore other than police / ambulance sirens and some acceptable traffic noice it is quiet ( this is London ! ). It sits on top of an NCP where you get half price parking if you take a car as we did. There is a Dominos pizza 10 yards from the entrance if you need. The bar and eating area is light, bright and in very good order, we had 2 rooms on floor 9, both rooms were large and exactly what you would expect from a Travelodge. Both were clean, spacious, good views and offered a good nights sleep. Breakfast was very good, plenty of everything. The other hotel which we poppoed in to look at having read other reviews, immediately made us feel relieved that we were not staying there. It felt dark, cramped, old and scruffy, it was also very very close to some clubs, easy to see where the noise issue would come from. In short, if you want luxury pay a lot more and stay else where. If you want a base to stay to have a couple of nights in London this hotel is fine, but make sure you stay in the one located on the corner of High Holborn and Museum Street. I would stay there again and I would be happy to take my children next time, which says a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service, relaxing stay!”
Reviews.Author: LauraBeeLondon
Reviews.Content: Service on arrival was friendly and helpful...the family room we booked was spacious, modern, bright, clean and quiet, despite looking onto a busy street. Well stocked and maintained. Beds were comfortable and warm, and bathroom was spotless. Restaurant had a limited selection, however, the hotel is conveniently surrounded by cafes and eateries. Staff were extremely helpful with directions and suggestions. Would definately re-book!!

Reviews.Title: “A central hotel, but not worth the money we paid for a room.”
Reviews.Author: dmred
Reviews.Content: We paid for our room in October, paying over Â£100 per night. We therefore expected that we would have a decent room when we arrived, even though it was late in the evening. Our daughter and husband had arrived the previous evening, having also paid over Â£100 per night. They had to ask to be moved because the room they were given was smelly and not fit for occupation. We were slightly apprehensive after their experience. When we arrived at about 10.30pm it was immediately obvious that there was a problem with getting a room, since it took half an hour for us to be allocated a room, which happened to be in the other building. When we arrived at the other building our keys didn't work, and we found out that the lock was broken. We were eventually offered another room which was in the basement and completely unheated. We refused to stay there, since we were aware that we had paid over the odds for our room and were being offered an unheated room in an unheated corridor. After ONE AND A HALF HOURS we eventually landed up back in the room with the broken lock, and were told the lock would be sorted in the morning, which it was. The room itself was adequate, but not of the standard we would expect for the money we had paid. The staff were pleasant, and not to blame for the inefficient and unfair method of allocating rooms. We spoke to the manageress in the morning, expecting some sort of financial compensation for the inconvenience, since by that time, having heard conversations between staff and guests, we were aware that we had paid way over the normal rate for our room. She refused this, saying that the policy was "first come, first served". When I pointed out that we had indeed been first-come since Travelodge had had our money for over 4 months, the policy for allocating rooms was quoted again. When we were e-mailed a general questionnaire by Travelodge asking about our experience, I told them, and asked for a response. I have never received this, so the questionnaire was pointless. My advice to anyone would be that this is a very central hotel, handy for theatres, tube etc. However, don't pay over Â£100 a night as we did, because you may arrive to see signs quoting rooms for less than Â£20, and then realise that people paying the cheap prices may well have the best rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz,but reasonable for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Alan_Maxted
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife for two nights whilst I was making a visit to Great Queen St. The cost was about Â£150 for both of us for the two nights including breakfast booked online.The ensuite room was basic and clean, but no furnishings at all except for a dressing table/mirror, I hard chair and a tv..,two cups and a kettle with coffe and tea There was plenty of room for a table and two sitting chairs, it would have made the room much more pleasant, although the bed was soft it was it comfortable. Check in was easy, but watch out! if you arrive before 3pm they will charge youÂ£10 if you want to occupy the room. The security to the corridoors and rooms was good, you needed the room keycard to get through the door at the reception desk three lifts serviced 12 floors. The was a bar lounge at reception, I used it once to take a pint of San Miguel to my room and I have to say it was the cheepest pint I had in London. The breakfast was OK yoghourt, cereals, toast, Eggs bacon sausage tomato etc but only scrambled eggs, No fried poached or boiled appeared available. There was a comprehensive menu available for other meals during the day there was also a Dominoes Pizza shop next door to the hotel, this closes at 11pm. The hotel was a short pleasant walk to Covent Garden and the theatres and within 15-20 minutes walk to Trafalgar Square, Oxford St, and the River Thames. All in all a clean basic place to get your head down for the night, it suited my purpose and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “sleepless nights”
Reviews.Author: amandastub
Reviews.Content: Beware this hotel. In pictures shows the Drury Lane building, but this is a dual site hotel not mentioned on its website. When you book you do not know if you will be in the building 200yds away in Holborn road. On the website it states some outside noise may be heard due to location, and I cannot vouch for the level of noise around the rury Lane block. However we were directed to the satellite block after having a taxi drop us off at Drury Lane and walking up several lots of stairs to the main reception only to be told to go to the other block. Check in was fine, if a little slow, and the room was clean and spacious. The curtains were hanging downbut that would not affect a stay. It was noticed the traffic noise for a room at the back ot the hotel appeared rather loud and on checking to see if the window was open it could be seen the fit of the double glazed window left a lot to be desired, it was draughty round the seal and therefore did not block out sound. But again the level of traffic noise would have ben acceptable. However come 12 midnight a club opened directly at the side/rear of the hotel, music was not too bad but bass beat was quite noticeable, what was a big problem was the clientele of the club who stood in the street shouting, screaming and swearing. On Saturday this went on until 5.00 a.m, on Sunday night and Monday night until around 3.00 a.m. This is not "some noise disruption" as described in the hotel "blurb" This is not a cheap hotel where you would say "you get what you pay for". If you must book here take some very good earplugs. A complaint to Travelodge did get a reply after my 2nd attempt, none of which I am able to copy in this email due to confidentiality, it basically says they cannot help in any way and referred me to make a complaint to Camden Council Licensing Department, giving me a website address and telephone number, which I will do. They are sorry I had to write but not apologetic in any way for the bad experience, customers are easy to get in London.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: figgibumbum
Reviews.Content: We had 2 family rooms on 4th floor of the Holborn building for a easter hol break. ROOM We were looking out onto a side road (Museum street I think, follow road up for 5 mins to British Museum) there was a disused office block opposite, not a nice view but hey who goes to London to look out of the window? having said that my 2 teens took the lift to top floor to see great view of London Eye, big ben etc. The room was just as I expected, large and spacious, bathroom clean and bed comfy. I was unexpectantly in a wheelchair for the holiday following a broken ankle a couiple of weeks before, but found the facilities excellent for wheelchair users. The room was plenty big enough and the doors and corridors very wide. I have been in some London hotels where the corridors are very narrow and like a rabbit warren with steps up and down etc, but this was fine. On check in they said we could have a look at a disabled room, but it was only a double so we stuck with the family room. FOOD We had breakfast in the hotel one morning, it was good value with 2 teenagers eating free. Other breakfasts included, Mcdonalds on New Oxford St and Wetherspoons further along High Holborn. We also had an early evening meal before a theatre visit, it was reasonablely priced and okay. NOISE There was not much traffic noise, but there is a nightclub behind the hotel which was probably why we heard some late night clubbers a couple of times. and a couple of doors slamming in corridor one night, All in all I was very satisfied with the hotel, if you have statyed in TL before and know what to expect that you wont be dissapointed. I knew there was no pnone in the room and limited pillows and towels but you can ask for these at reception, and also hairdryers can be borrowed for 2 hours with no charge. extra coffe and sugar etc is available on request, or just pop into the restaurant area and help yourself. Staff were busy but still friendly. All in all I was very satisfied with the hotel, if you have statyed in TL before and know what to expect that you wont be dissapointed. I knew there was no pnone in the room and limited pillows and towels but you can ask for these at reception, and also hairdryers can be borrowed for 2 hours with no charge. extra coffe and sugar etc is available on request, or just pop into the restaurant area and help yourself. Staff were busy but still friendly. There is NBC parking under the hotel, entrance on Museum street.not sure about charges for that. Overall excellent location and good experience, I will go again when ankle is mended.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing, uncomfortable, noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: cap1294
Reviews.Content: DO NOT stay at this hotel. Arrived at 10.30 am and although check-in was not until 3.00 presumed we would be able to leave our luggage there but were told that that was not possible by extremely rude reception staff. Room was grotty. the mattress was just a mass of lumps. there was a building site outside the window of our room and also the hotel staff gathered there for a night time smoke and extremely loud, foul mouthed conversation around 5.00 am. Would never stay in a travelodge again

Reviews.Title: “Super location girls for shopping, eating and theatre!!!”
Reviews.Author: LeaIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel room price was very reasonable for the area. It is only 5 minutes walk from Oxford street and Regent street. It is also ten minute walk from many theatres. The tube is just down the road. Excellent location for a girly holiday. Dirty dancing showing in the theatre down the road so our girly holiday was well catered for! Hotel was clean, quiet and staff very helpful. We requested a twin room on arrival and they accomodated us.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: GLASGOWBOY999
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night over the Easter Weekend. My flight got me into London very early in the morning and although my confirmation said check in wasnt till 3pm i tried chancing my arm and arrived at 9am only to be told by a very pleasant friendly receptionist to come back at 12pm as there were no rooms available at the moment. Fair enough, but no left luggage facility which means you either have to carry your bags about London with you or find an alternative facility at one of the main Stations. Arrived back at 5pm after a days sightseeing and was checked in no problem and given my key. Again staff were really friendly and was advised that my room was in the High Holborn building approx 30 seconds walk along the road from the Drury Lane building. This was a fairly modern building which looks like an old converted office block. There was a sitting area in the lobby with vending machines selling confectionery, drinks and coffee and a bar and restaurant. My room was no 262 on the second floor which was a good size for london standards. As expected it was basic with a double bed, open plan wardrobe and shelving, flat screen tv, bathroom and kettle with tea and coffee. The room was clean and pretty modern but had no air conditioning or phone. I never use the phones in hotels but i still think this is an esential piece of equipment for hotel rooms in case of unwanted visitors or emergencies. From a security point of view I found it strange that you were unable to contact reception from your room. There is no room service in this hotel although there is a reasonably good selection of hot food available from the restaurant and you are able to order your food down at the bar and take it back to your room if you want. The hotel is on a very busy 4 lane road and the noise during the night was awful. I can usually sleep wherever i go but woke about 5 times during the night due to non stop traffic noise and boisterous clubbers walking past. Even at 06:30 in the morning folk were still heading home from the clubs etc and insisted on shouting loudly. I know theres not really a lot the hotel can do about this as all windows are double glazed but i think it is an important factor to take into account when considering whether or not to stay here. The hotel offers a buffet breakfast for Â£7.50 which was very good value for money. Food was fresh and a good selection of cereals, tea coffee, juices, pastries, yoghurts, bacon, sausage,scrambled eggs, etc. Overall i thought the hotel offered very good value for money as i'd only paid Â£45 for the room. Staff were really friendly, rooms and public areas clean and food pretty good, plus a fantastic location on minutes from Covent Garden. Would I stay here again? Probably not but purely due to the noise from the street at night.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Travelodge- stay in the High Holborn building if possible!”
Reviews.Author: lisaq42
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Covent Garden Travelodge at the beginning and end of a week long trip to England. After reading the reviews here, I arrived with ear plugs for the expected night club noise, and low expectations. Firstly, if you take the tube and get off at Holborn, come out and head towards the Sainsburys. Continue along that street (High Holborn-it bears left) for about 3 blocks. Down Drury Lane is one of the TL buildings, and on High Holborn is the other, newer building. I checked in at Drury Lane but to my relief, my room was in the High Holborn building. I suspect the family rooms are in that one, which I had booked, before my friend pulled out of the trip. So it may not hurt to book a family room if you want that building- but that's just my suspicion. Anyway, I had a room on the first floor (2nd floor for Americans), which faced the road. High Hoborn is a very busy street yet it was quiet! It's a standard TL room with no frills, but it was very clean. They had made up the sofa bed with the linen for the (absent) 2nd guest which was nice. (I felt kind of bad though, since I didn't use it) The bathroom was clean (with a huge towel!!) , and the bed comfy. The flat screen tv was nice too. I heard no noise either night from any nightclub that people on here have mentioned - maybe I just got lucky. On the second leg of my trip, I had a family room on the 2nd floor, facing another building, so it was even quieter. I had the buffet breakfast, as well. (7.5 pounds) It was perfectly fine- bacon (Canadian style), eggs, sausages, toast, cereals, muffins, coffee, juices, etc . The first morning I headed down about 9:30 am and there was no wait, though the room was almost full. The second time, I arrived around 8:30 and there was a queue of about 10 people so I headed to a Costa coffee around the corner instead. In the cafe at the TL there are 2 pay per use computers- 1 pound for 30 min. Also a couple vending machines scattered throughout the hotel. It seems the High Holborn building is the better of the two. Beware, Holborn is a very busy tube stop, so travelling to/from Heathrow at rush hour could be precarious and there are some stairs involved. That said, I would absolutely stay there again! Travelodge has never failed me!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: helsthomas
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews on this site, I was slightly apprehensive about our stay here. However, having stayed at many a Travelodge, my expectations were at the right level; I knew there was no phone, toiletries, trouser press or the other plethera of extras that you usually pay for and never use. I did phone ahead and request a room in the newer High Holborn building (as opposed to the older building set back on Drury Lane), and the room was perfectly adequate - clean, large and bright, and warm. Reception staff were polite and helpful (request for extra bedding and towels was complied with quickly) and the room was cleaned well during the day with new towels supplied and tea/coffee/cups replenished (we left a note for housekeeping in the room just to make sure!) So, basically - do your research. If you go expecting all the bells and whistles of a four star hotel, you will be disappointed and will probably have a bit of a whinge on this site. Go with the right expectations, and you will find a good welcoming hotel, in an excellent location, at a decent price. (Oh, Dominos Pizza next door, ten minutes stroll from either Tottenham Court Road or Holborn tube stations. Lots of good little cafes for non-hotel breakfasts if you're that way inclined nearby. Oh, and there is no left luggage facility (not surprisingly), so be warned!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bikesbmr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night on a trip to London, the hotel is in a great location surrounded by some good bars and restaurants, and just a short walk from Covent garden market itself. The room was what you would expect from the Travelodge chain clean tidy just what you need. A good tip, if you book well in advance there are some good deals to be had, our family room cost just Â£32 for three adults a bargin considering location

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: Violet_plum
Reviews.Content: Booked online and phoned a couple of days before stay to request a room in the newer building on Holburn Road. Very pleased with hotel!!! The room was on the 13th floor and was large, clean and quiet (apart from normal London traffic noise). The room had towels for us both, a tv and kettle with a few sachets of coffee etc. The hotel staff on reception and bar were extreamley helpful. The location was spot on for Covent Garden, the sights and the night life etc. All in all the hotel was excellent for the price you pay at Travelodge and I would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “never never again take note”
Reviews.Author: swanseanurse
Reviews.Content: i took my mum aunt sister and daughter for a four day trip to london wanted to stay central as mum can not walk very far and we had a wheelchair for her. booked the travel lodge what a mistake. It was shabby very noisy was woke up early every morning with the nosy of delivery or rubbish trucks with reverse hooters. we were 3 in one room and two in another . we had 6 hangers for 3 of us for 4 days when asked for some more there said that was the allocated amount. We run out of soap they did not replace it when asked for more they told us it is not replaced automatically and we would have to request another small very small bar there are no phones in the room which made it difficult to contact my eldery mum who was put on a different floor there was not one picture in the room my mums room had stains on both of the beds and the furniture that was in room 210 was fit for the skip. we asked for an early morning knock to enable us to arrive at our arranged tour they did not knock or contact us or even appologise.The whole building is depressing dark the staff have no pride in the place and many people complained. Terrible access for disabled people no help offered with anything never never again. I would like to invite any representive from travel lodge to get in touch with me to retify this. which I doubt very much if they will or if they care. I will write again on the review if anybody gets in touch with me please do not book this place. travel lodge ring me [--] if you care

Reviews.Title: “Dire - a huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: VirtuallyGrey
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel in Drury Lane and were sent up the road to an annexe - no explanation. The room was at the sparse end of sparse. For my wife and I there was one towel ( I asked for and got more), one small chair. The room was bare. Commotion on the street lasting an hour or more in the early hours woke us up. We didn't expect luxury for the price we paid but it felt like a prison cell! But the room was warm enough and dry and the bathroom facilities all functioned so, phew.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps not Again”
Reviews.Author: Ruddocks
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a stay in the Travelodge Covent Garden and whilst it is an excellent location (although a bit daunting for a female lone traveller) it was not an expereience I would like to repeat. The room although reasonably clean needed a good cleanof the carpet, mattress was not too clever, the curtains were hanging off and white nets were filthy. I was first down to breakfast at 7.00am and it was cold and tasteless sertainly not worth the price they charge. Staff although helpful were obviously only there for the money! It was in need of a good opverhaul and clean - carpet in the bedroom was not very clean and I didn't feel safe - it was very noisy and people knocking on your door For Â£19 I might have put up with it but not for Â£86!!!!!! There are better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting dangerous filthy!”
Reviews.Author: ImogenSWEngland
Reviews.Content: Surly staff; insulation on window missing; gaffa tape on hair dryer; no cold water; freezing room; tv remote didnt work; toilet hadn't been flushed;dubious red light in bedroom; no bath mat. I have stayed in many travellodges around the country and they have all been up to scratch. This one was disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in suberb location.”
Reviews.Author: Citytraveller12
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel with family. The location of the hotel is excellent only a 10 minitue walk from Holborn tube station and the lively covent garden. Very Central to Oxford street and leister square. Room basic like all Travelodges. Rooms were very clean and spacious. Quiet noisy at night time but was expected as the hotelis in the heart of london. Buffet Breakfast was very good value and plenty to choose from. Overall a great hotel for anyone visiting London mainly because of the location

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Sue2310
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was slightly worried about staying at this Travelodge, but have come back feeling very pleased that I ignored the negative reviews and booked it after all. We stayed at the High Holborn Travelodge in a family room on the 5th floor. The staff were very helpful, room was basic but clean, everything in the room was in working order, we had booked to have breakfast, we had no problem being seated straight away and food was lovely. We were out sightseeing after breakfast and came back early evening. It is the perfect base for anyone wanting to do the London Eye, Covent Garden, Trafalgar Square, Palace etc, everything is more or less within 15 minute walking distance. Will stay here again, unless I win the lottery then i'll stay at the Dorchester but for anyone wanting to visit London on a budget this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a pleasant stay, don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamTim
Reviews.Content: Staff unhelpful at check in. Mugs in room had not been washed. Carpet stained badly. Nice view from 12th Floor, but lift not working properly. 2 hour wait and 3 trips to reception to borrow an iron. Staff clearly demotivated and unhappy. May be worth it for Â£19 per night, but for Â£79 per night there are better deals in London.

Reviews.Title: “Clean friendly basic”
Reviews.Author: norterTheNorth
Reviews.Content: Stayed at High Holborne for 3 nights at half term with two grandchildren. Asked for a quiet room and were given a family room on 10th floor. There was some noise when nightclubs closed but nothing so intrusive that the children were disturbed or woken. The rooms were clean and bright and everything worked. the linen and towels were clean and changed regularly but the carpets were quite worn and marked. The staff were friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was good but the dining room is small and there were queues at certain times. Many families were taking advantage of the children eat free breakfast.. One of the best located hotels for tourists, within easy walking distance of Oxford Street, The British Museum, Covent garden Theatres and Chinatown. Plenty of places to eat within a short walking distance. The only concern was that the lock on the door from reception to the lift area was broken and therefore not safe at night, this should have been repaired immediatetly. Brilliant value for money, we paid around Â£39 a night for a family room for four people..

Reviews.Title: “Avoid unless you are desperate!”
Reviews.Author: dunclivvy
Reviews.Content: Queued in reception to check in. Miserable receptionist, she didn't even look at us when we checked in. Bathroom sink was leaking in room from a pipe below sink. Reported it but nothing was done. Best thing about the "hotel" was the bloke serving behind the bar. He was busy but polite, friendly and courteous. The location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: NorthantsDragons
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the High Holbourne address and managed to book a room for Â£19 in their sale. The bathroom was very clean, bed was king size, flat screen telly, plenty of tea & coffee, radiator worked fine, only downside was a horrible stain on the carpet and other guests banging on bedroom doors in middle of the night. The location was ideal for walking around London didn't need to use underground. We ate at a Weatherspoon pub there are plenty to choose from nearby. Considering what we paid for the room it was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Be cautious”
Reviews.Author: Llangatwg
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed here on 3 occasions and cannot really complain too much. There are actually 2 separate buildings; both are termed 'Covent Garden' on the Travelodge website. I have always stayed at the one on High Holborn and not the one on Drury Lane - ex Moat House as I have learned from reading the reviews here - that seems to be the one to avoid at all costs. The HH one I find to be basic, but clean and functional. And the location is great. Luckily, never been troubled by noise there. This time I rang ahead to request a room not too high up [hate lifts] and the receptionist allocated me a room number on the first floor there and then. And that was the one we were given when we turned up 2 weeks later. It was at the end of a corridor with only 4 rooms, past a fire door; so nice and quiet internally. No external noise from clubs either. I made a note of the room number to request that next time. As for price - well I would never pay the full price for a Travelodge room anywhere. I booked this on-line quite well ahead and paid just under Â£80 for the 2 nights. I did pay Â£10 extra for an early check in as our train arrived in London early. Well worth it. [Once we were in a queue with the world and his wife wanting to check in at 3pm, and it took ages.] Don't eat breakfast in the bar cafe. Le Pain Quotidien - opposite is great for breakfast; or thereâ€™s a Wetherspoons near Holborn tube station. The White Hart pub opposite [corner of Drury Lane and Holborn] makes a great place for a nightcap. So, be cautious. Book ahead; request the one at High Holborn; pay for an early check in if you will be arriving early; donâ€™t expect too much! And after reading some reviews here I will be extra cautious next time! [BTW the Travelodge at Southwark, very new, is very good. But it depends where you want be in the city.]

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: littleleys
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the recommendation of a colleague. I'm now wondering what I did to upset him. Unfriendly welcome on arrival before heading up to a sparse room. The room contained a bed and pretty much nothing else - there may have been a single chair, one cup and one spoon. Some serious noise from the road below despite being on one of the higher floors. Soul destroying

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Essexfarmers
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from 4 days in London staying here - we booked it just before Xmas to celebrate a birthday. We got a good deal online - average Â£54 per night plus 20% off breakfast. The room was nice and clean with loads of room up on the 10th floor of the High Holborn site so it was quiet enough. There was a bit of traffic noise but it didn't disturb us much (well, it is a big city!) and we are VERY fussy about noise! I don't know what the Drury Lane building was like but it looked pretty similar from the outside. Breakfast was good - lots of choice of hot and cold and enough so it didn't run out if you weren't there at 7am! The checkin staff were friendly and efficient and we thought the location was great - theatres, Covent Garden, tube station, China Town and the British Museum all within 5 minutes walk. Our only minor complaint was the bed was a bit soft for our taste and had a bit of a dip in the middle. We had a great stay and would definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: beaumontleys
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 7 night stay at the High Holborn Travelodge ( this is the modern 13 storey one across the road from the Covent Garden Travelodge).We got a good deal ,Â£60.00 per night which included breakfast. You check in at this travelodge so request a room here, We requested a high floor room with a view and were allocated room 1171 (11th floor). The room was spacious, clean, with good individually controlled heating.The bathroom was modern and very clean with lots of hot water and a great power shower. Breakfast was buffet style with a good choice of a hot cooked breakfast or you can opt for a continental option( it's cheaper to book you breakfast online when making your reservation). We had a view of Big Ben and Westminster Abbey when you looked left out of the window..The location of this hotel is superb,left out of the door and a 5 min walk brings you to High Holborn Tube. Turn right and it's a 5 min walk to Soho and Theatreland (We saw Priscilla and Phantom) All in all a very pleasant stay. REMEMBER- UPON CHECK IN REQUEST A ROOM IN HIGH HOBORN TRAVELODGE

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel imaginable”
Reviews.Author: TurnerPatrol
Reviews.Content: I stay at hotels around London and the UK with work and this is without question the worst hotel I have ever stayed in for business or pleasure. The corridors stank, the staff were useless, the room facilities were non-existent, the hotel only owned 3 irons and could not supply me with one as, not surprisingly, all 3 were in use. Breakfast was served in the uncleaned bar area and I wouldn't have fed it to my dog! I am serious - it looked disgusting and I personally do not want to eat my breakfast at a table with sticky beer stains! I ate at a cafe round the corner. In addition the hotel is a decent walk to Covent Garden! Why and how can are they allowed to call this hotel "Covent Garden"?! Why isn't the hotel called Drury Lane? The internal floors are unclean tiles, the doors are made of glass with metal mesh and I felt this represented a borstal more than a hotel that I had paid Â£115 for one night!! Please do not stay at this hotel. I refer this complaint especially towards tourists! This hotel is disgusting and You will get the wrong impression of London if you stay here. If you have to spend another Â£20 a night to get an alternative hotel then you must! John Turner

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: bob089
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel for a week to do some sightseeing. could,nt have picked a better location. we checked in at the hotel on drury lane but were sent to the sister hotel on high holborn.(a good move apparantly) we were allocated a room on the 13th floor which was great, no traffic noise and great views. the room was spotless as was the bathroom. basic but cosy room with tea/ coffee making facilities.staff were very friendly and helpful with directions etc.breakfast was ok (nothing to write home about) great bars and places to eat within a minutes walk. tube station a few minutes walk away. overall if you book well in advance this place is a bargain!!

Reviews.Title: “No sleep due to Disco/Night Club”
Reviews.Author: martin31260
Reviews.Content: Just stayed in the Travel Lodge for 1 night and it was 1 night too much. I checked the previous reviews and can confirm that there are 2 buildings to this Travel Lodge. The old building was previously the Drury Lane Moat House Hotel. Since being purchased by Travel Lodge no investment has been completed in this hotel. (just read previous reviews). And then there is the new building. The reception/bedroom was just like a typical Travel Lodge room. But when we went to our room we could hear continual noise from the local night club. Music and people shouting all night. At 5am we finally room moved (but could still hear the music). When we complained they already knew about the problem and said it is worse on Fridays and Saturdays. Immediately they gave me a form to complete which was addressed to the local authority to complain about noise. Unbelievable - they knew they had noise issues, they even have the forms ready - so they checked us into a room knowing that we were going to complain. The only good thing about this hotel was location to Covent Garden. Either stay in the old building and complain about the condition or stay in the new building and have no sleep. They were not interested and just gave me the guest relations email address and told me that I will have a guest questionnaire sent to me to complete

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: FoxmanLimerick
Reviews.Content: We stay here every year for an annual trip to the West End. We book early and get it cheap. This year we paid Â£45.00 a night for the room. I recommend booking into the second building (beside the Shaftesbury Theatre), its the better of the 2 i think. No frills, but I have always found it clean and convenient. Location is superb for the West end. Rooms can seem cold, but if you turn up the radiator its grand. Plus as a couple we always book a family room, they are larger and you usually get a quilt for the pull out bed, so if you are cold you have an extra. We pay for early check in (12.00 pm) and have on occasion been given our rooms at 10.00 am. Have always found the staff, good and helpful. NO toiletries or left luggage, but for Â£45 a night for the room, what do you want !! I'd highly recommend it for the price and the convenience !!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute disgrace....shameful poor standards of accomodation and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Bonny7
Reviews.Content: This was a shocker...and I have never complained about a hotel before. The room was cold and damp. Corridors smelt of chemicals and again, smelt horribly of damp. No loo roll, no soap, no toiletries ("this is a BUDGET hotel you know!!") no bath mat, only one towel. Plastic cups and no glasses ("health and safety issue madam"), hairdryer broken and taped to wall, as was shower which was also broken but not taped to wall. TV remote not working, 5 radiators of which only one small electric type which was tiny, was chugging flat out to try to warm the room. Decor was drab, lampshades burnt, chipped old furniture...think student digs/ hostel stuck in the seventies. When I wrote to complain they didn't address the issues I raised and generally lifted text to form the basis of their response. No apology of course. Never ever ever again a Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “hit and miss usually miss”
Reviews.Author: IRBaboonLondon
Reviews.Content: stayed 4 times in jan 2010 on various occasions, in summary the location is good, after that its very patchy first time the room was cold and stank of damp and heating didnt work with furniture like student digs, second time pretty similar, third time room was ok but a disabled room where there was a smell of urine and shower drain didnt work and flooded the room, 4th time had nice room with view of big ben (distantly) and centrepoint dont like the noise either from street or the club til early hours (general noise, fighting ,vomiting, all a bit tedious) , the ridiculous check in time of 3pm without extra fees, no hairdryer in room, all in all i found most thing sthere a hassle , i had paid between 21 gbp and 39 gbp for rooms, in summer the place goes for about 90 a night at which point there is no way on earth id stay there rooms dont even have a fone and the internet whilst cheap is totally unreliable and not worth the stress, go to an intrenet cafe instead

Reviews.Title: “the other building? - It's a comfy bed and the shower worked”
Reviews.Author: Wickirach
Reviews.Content: Wasn't expecting much after reading the reviews, but we were allocated rooms in the 2nd (newly renevated?) building. It was sparse but clean. The bed was comfy and the shower worked, and that's all I worry about in rooms. I was a little disappointed they could not give us our room cards earlier (one of the 3 couples booked an early check in which allowed bags to be dumped and for us to hit the town) And Price was OK for London, Â£90!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cds5
Reviews.Content: Arrived Saturday afternoon and found the Travelodge on Drury Lane very easily, 10 mins walk from Covent Garden tube station. We were given the keys to room 107 and were amazed when we opend the door. It was like a converted broom cupboard! The double bed had 15 inches at each side and about 12 inches at the bottom plus a narrow work surface with tv. The shower room was 4 feet square plus shower cubicle. I had to kneel on the loo to do my makeup! Everything did look clean though. We left our bag in the room and went to ask to be moved to another room,however there was a massive queue and only 1 person on reception. As we wanted to get out and see the sights and only had 1 night, we decided to put up with the room. We returned at 11 pm after an easy walk from the theatre. We had a drink (bar prices were ok) and then went to bed. We couldn't sleep for the road noise and we thought the window (12 inches by 30 inches) must be open as there was a terrible draught. It turned out that the window was closed but didn't fit properly so we had to stuff a pillow into the window recess which did help the noise and cold draught. We could still hear police sirens outside and the bed was too soft for us (although I do realise everyone has their own preference with mattresses). We were woken at 5.15 am by the fire alarm and had to try to dress quickly in the doorway as there wasn't enough room to dress by the bed!! Fortunately it was a false alarm. I wouldn't have minded the room if we had paid the reduced rate but we had paid Â£88 and the money had been taken from our account several weeks in advance. The position of the Travelodge is ideal for Covent Garden and the theatres but we have used Travelodge many times and certainly expected a room which had a window we could see through and have room to get around the bed easily.

Reviews.Title: “What a contrast to the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: Sailboatowner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a Sunday night at the High Holborn Travelodge (Saver Room for Â£12 ) having been prepared for the 'Travelodge from Hell' having read and noted some of the earlier reviews on Tripadvisor. We checked into the High Holborn Travelodge as opposed to the Drury Lane building having read that this was the newer of the two 'Lodges'. In the light of the experience of other we asked for a bright and quiet room. The reception staff members were very friendly and accommodating and gave us a room on the 12th floor with excellent views towards the BT tower and Centre Point. During the night we could hear a little noise from High Holborn through the double glazing but we expected as much in a central London location. The room was spacious and clean, the double bed large and quite comfortable and the furniture basic but functional. The bathroom was spotless and although I'm not keen on showers over baths it did offer options. Having been forwarned that shampoo etc. were not generally available, we came suitably equipped and for one night that wasn't a problem. The television worked and the coffee making facilities were fine even though we missed the usual shortbread biscuits! Having been pleased with the room, we waited to be disappointed by breakfast but we couldn't fault it. Breakfast was available from 7.00 until 10.00 and we attended at 9.00. The tables were clean and used trays and plates cleared promptly by smiling and helpful staff. The full english breakfast items were hot and well presented with staff on hand throughout. It was an unhurried affair ( perhaps because it was a Monday ) and we enjoyed our meal. Available on an 'eat as much as you like' basis, breakfast proved to be good value. This Travelodge is ideally located for making the most of a stay in London ( Holborn Tube Station being 5 mins walk away ) and the staff were happy to help us to find our way about the city. We would have no hesitation in making a repeat booking.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expect from Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: ajsw_uk
Reviews.Content: We are used to Travelodge rooms, new buildings, purpose built rooms, comfortable, clean and functional..no frills! BUT...our room was none of those....very poor state of repair, dirty, broken tiles etc...Ridiculously warm and very poor quality linen. We didn't bother complaining and we literally only "slept" in the room and for only 1 night! When I say slept, I mean listened to the traffic noise, tried to get comfortable in the bed and warmth..I'm a heavy sleeper and it took me 2+hrs to get to sleep! BTW - breakfast is simply not worth it..you'd get better food from McDonalds, and cheaper too! Please don't bother with this hotel...it desperately needs refurbishing and staff training. Stay round the corner in the High Holborn Travelodge instead if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than anticipated”
Reviews.Author: DawnLeicester
Reviews.Content: After reading review's I was really concerned, so much so I E-Mailed them and specifically requested a room in the "new building". We booked an early check in and arrived at 11.30 which wasn't a problem and found we were booked in the old building as they don't have twin rooms, (nobody bothered to mail me back with the info) The room we were allocated was clean and warm although a little tired, but for the location and money paid Â£49 was real value for money and would have no qualms about booking again, yes there was some noise in the early hours of the morning but thats to be expected considering the location and if you are a light sleeper just invest in ear plugs. Didn't bother with the breakfast and ate at one of the traditional pubs about 20yrds from Covent Garden tube station Â£4.50 for full english, toast and tea..........!

Reviews.Title: “Relieved”
Reviews.Author: floraCambridgeshire
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews on here we set off with some trepidation. We were travelling by car and had set the postcode in the sat nav which took us to the Drury Lane address.We couldn't find anywhere to pull over to enquire where the carpark was and had to follow the one way system round at which point we saw the second Travelodge on High Holborn, being in the wrong lane we had to go round again. There was an NCP carpark immediately behind the hotel but nothing to say where the 20 spaces mentioned in the web site was. We pulled over and ran in to be told that the Drury Lane one had a carpark attached (where?) but this one had a reciprical arrangement with the NCP carpark to do 24 hours for ~Â£15 and thank goodness it turned out this was the right building for our booking. The place was spotless, the lifts, common areas, cafe and room were really clean. The service was polite, efficient and friendly and the bedding immaculate. I may add that the breakfast was hot and good and the tables clean and cleared quickly. I think it may be most of the previous bad reviews were for the other building and certainly if we stay there again I will book by phone in order to request this building. I do think travelodge would do well to put the parking information on the homepage for Covent Garden to save several trips round the one way system and I also think you should have a choice/be informed which building you have been allocated to. However, I can thoroughly recommend the High Holborn travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but this is basic.”
Reviews.Author: WayOutWest76
Reviews.Content: We had to stay in London on Christmas Eve and needed a cheap room. You can't argue with the value we got as we booked well in advance and got the room (for a family of four) and breakfast for all of us for around Â£42. Amazing. The location of the hotel(s) - there appear to be two under the same name, are well located being very close to Holborn and Tottenham Court Road. The room was basic and the sofa bed didn't appear to have been cleaned for some time. We also had to make up the sofa bed, which is no big deal (especially given the price). The bathroom is fine, but the bed was possibly one of the worst we have ever slept on in any hotel. Also we were given a room on the first floor and given that it was Christmas Eve, it was still incredibly noisy. I wouldn't want to be there on a regular night. If you value your peace and quiet then ask for a room at least 5th floor or higher! Breakfast the next morning was nothing amazing, but more than adequate in setting you up for the day. There are plenty of other places close by to eat at. If you can afford to spend a little more then I would recommend you do so, especially if you plan to spend any decent amount of time in the room. However, if all you are looking for is a cheap room in central London where you can leave your bags, catch a couple of hours sleep and have a shower before you go out partying again, then this is probably just what you need.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it used to be”
Reviews.Author: AlisonJW
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a few times and have previously been impressed with its location and value for money, and clean rooms. But this time the twin room they gave me had a grotty bathroom (cracked sink, broken tap, broken loo roll holder and dirty looking tiles) and grubby marks on the walls. When I complained I was quickly given another room which was fine - but why not give me that room in the first place and sort out the other one so as not to irritate and disappoint previously satisfied customers like me!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: HolidaySaaj
Reviews.Content: This Travelodge is so well situated for much of London and is a 5 minute walk from Covent Garden and 15 minutes from Leicester Square. It's also near the tube (Holborn) and so very handy for going all over to see the main sights. We even travelled with a buggy and a baby and found it no problem. We stayed in the newer Travelodge and had a family room that was HUGE! It was clean, warm and we even got a travel cot in there for our little one to sleep in plus her buggy. I have not seen a room this well proportioned. We checked in at about 4pm and it was quick, friendly and efficient. The room had great views of London too which was a surprise. Next door to the Travelodge is a Dominos Pizza and there are plenty of other food outlets very close by. There is also a bar in the Travelodge. We only stayed one night but it was quiet - even being on a main road - on the 11th floor. We got a great deal with the Travelodge sale - it was super to be able to stay somewhere warm and comfy and cheap in central London. Pros: location, clean, price, warm, sizeable for a family. Cons: we can't think of any! Other people have commented that this Travelodge isn't great but we have stayed in many around the country (see my other reviews) and would definitely come back here again - in fact we are later this year!

Reviews.Title: “Basic,but excellent value”
Reviews.Author: garywilcock
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2-5th Jan in the newer of the two bulidings and paid just Â£19 a night for a family room,The room was clean and basic and its a great location just 5 minutes to Covent Garden,Leicester sq & Soho

Reviews.Title: “Excellent comfortable and roomy hotel in a very central location”
Reviews.Author: SarahLovesLemonade
Reviews.Content: There are two receptions, the first on Drury Lane is quite old, the second on Museum Street is more modern and this is where the family rooms are located. I stayed two nights in this hotel, the first in June with 3 friends. The second in August on business. on both occasions the room was far too hot with no air con, just a plug in fan which just generated more heat really. The windows only open very slightly so we were sweating during the night. We stayed in a family room which was absolutely huge, we felt like we had a catwalk for getting ready on. The double bed was very comfy. Room including bathroom very clean and tidy. Location fantastic, within walking distance of Covent Garden, Leicester Square, piccadilly and Oxford Circus. Hotel is right next door to the Shaftesbury Theatre where Hairspray is currently showing. Very convenient for the tube, both Holborn and Covent Garden stations are just 5 mins away. Travelodge does a good breakfast, lots to choose from. it is just a very small eating area that there is usually a queue for.

Reviews.Title: “Don't!!! Just ...... Don't.”
Reviews.Author: shiteyditey
Reviews.Content: Travel Lodge is what it is. Budget. But like Premier Inn you know what your getting ..... Normally. This place is squalled though!!! Filthy top to bottom start to finish. Breakfast....just don't...nasty. Location is this hotels ONLY strength but save up a little longer and get somewhere else. This should be Travel Lodges jewel in the crown and no doubt financially it is. But like so many facilities around the toursist heavy streets of the west end Travel Lodge have clearly adopted the" that will do they will come anyway" attitude. Never again ..... And I mean for Travel Lodge anywhere. Seems you can no longer count on what you'll get.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - shame about the noise!”
Reviews.Author: sazzle25
Reviews.Content: Have always used travelodges for weekends away etc (can't argue at Â£19 a room) and rarely have any cause for complaint as you know what ever part of the country you are in you will get a decent room at a good value price. However after staying at Covent Garden i'm not so sure I will run the risk of staying at a travelodge again. We decided to see a show in London and the location of this hotel suited all our needs but it was actually the location that ended up being the problem. We returned to the hotel at 10:00pm and it soon became obvious that the noise from a nearby pub/club was going to be a problem. Ironically the room was double glazed but this did not prevent the noise from entering and after hearing non stop music, 3 fights, 1 car race and endless police sirens it was finally 06:00 in the morning and I had only had 30 mins sleep! Possibly the worst nights sleep ever. As I said before I wouldn'y normally complain as you get what you pay for, but this particular hotel had cost me Â£49 (more than double any other travelodge I have ever stayed in!!!). Great Location but take ear plugs or take a nice frock and join in the rave!!!!!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Rocketman1000000
Reviews.Content: Recent stay at Travelodge Covent Garden. Complete shambles from start to finish. Firstly, arrived at reception to be informed that we were staying in an adjacent building. Hence, carrying of luggage back down the steep steps & a 100m walk. Evenually got to room. First impression, the room was a good size and clean. Further inspection ... minimal furniture and fittings. No toiletries (other than a small piece of soap). The bed has no powerpoints beside it so had to move the bed. On doing so, a used condom was found. Then, in the bathroom numerous specks of dried blood on the shower curtain. As the room had no phone, we waited till morning to report this. No staff member at reception. After waiting a few minutes, no one arrived so we left. On our return, we complained to the manager who apologised and replaced the shower curtain. Re: the condom, we felt the manager disbelieved us regarding us finding it ( we disposed of it ourselves). I sensed he thought we were fishing for compensation which was not the case nor was it offered. There were additional issues regarding "used toilet roll" from the previous guests; maintenance issues with the lifts and more. Considering we paid 100 pounds per night, this travelodge was not value for money and lacked teh most basic of standards ans service. I would NEVER use travelodge again. A word of warning. There is no luggage storage facility available after checkout, though you may be able to leave it in your room till 2pm at an extra cost. NEVER AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother, sleep rough if you need to”
Reviews.Author: uk_hotel_expert
Reviews.Content: Ok, the good bit first - the location. Close proximity to Covent Garden and the delights of London. That's it. Â£10 "early" checkin fee, even at 1.30pm. Hotel looks like ex-council housing stock, rooms are just 'funtional'. Generally falling apart, miserable etc. Brekfast in the freezing cold, food specially selected from the Tesco "value" range. Don't make eye contact with the staff. Let's be real - for the money you can do a whole lot better in a location which is just as good. Bye Bye Travelodge

Reviews.Title: “Service was awful followed by a sleepless night, definately not frills here!”
Reviews.Author: abiroses18
Reviews.Content: Service was terrible was waiting for ages for check in. Room was very basic and quite dirty the sofa bed was disgusting. Bathroom was ok but had no toiletries (not what you would expect for 100 pounds a night!). Was woken up in the night, overall pretty rubbish. Don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average room, but breakfast...aargh!”
Reviews.Author: Bully103
Reviews.Content: Great location close by to Covent Garden nightlife (although not too close to the tube) The room was OK; clean and functional, but with expensive wireless internet (why don't hotels offer this for free?) The dining area was bland and COLD; the beer was very expensive and the breakfast was almost inedible - cold soggy bacon, cheap sausages, and very solid powdered scrambled egg.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again... just for the location”
Reviews.Author: rockeyb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Loved the location of the hotel but thats all its got going for it. The room we stayed in was freezing and the tiny heater didn't make a difference. The room was so dark and the lighting again did not make much difference. The furniture in the room had also seen better days. Â£5 an hour for wi fi internet access which is robbery. Didn't have breakfast as lots of eating places to choose from at cheaper prices. The Thai restaurant across the road is a must if you like Thai food.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: gingernutnorfolk
Reviews.Content: I usually assume travelodges to be a safe and reliable form of accommodation, but found the Convent Garden travelodge very disappointing and not what I expected from previous visits.. The room, although spacious and clean, was lacking amenaties. We were in a family room as this was all that was available, which consisted of a double bed and a put me up (which I unfortunately acquired). All I can describe it as is like sleeping on a Dr's couch, as it was so hard, narrow and uncomfortable and left me with neck pain and lack of sleep. On entering the room is was surprisingly cold for the time of year, the heater although very small was turned off which didn't provide much warmth when in operation, and the room extremely basic. There appeared to be no introduction pack informing customers of fire prodedure ,useful contact numbers, restaurant details, emergency contacts, places of interest etc. which I assumed was standard in most hotels. There appeared to be no telephone, in case of emergencies or no way in contacting switchboard. The curtains were hanging off the curtain poles, the duvet were very thin and tatty. There was no hairdryer. The bathroom was lacking items, mainly shower cap and soap which again I assumed would automatically be provided. The hotel wasn't exactly cheap, so expected a bit more than what we got . What is happening to their previously high standard I wouldn't recommend or stay in a travelodge again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: MarrobinWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of Travelodge (normally). Nothing posh but you usually know what you are getting and it does what it says. Unfortunately this is not the case with this one. Long queue for check in which couldn't happen till 3.00 so had to do my sightseeing with my luggage (try that on the narrow spiral staircases at Tower of London. Room had peeling wallpaper, hoover parts had been left in room by cleaner, mugs not washed properly, bathroom dingy. I was asked what I thought by the receptionist when I left, but not convinced anything would be done. The weird thing is that this Travel Lodge seems to be split in two. The new frontage you can see in the Trip adviser photo is just along from the Shaftesbury theatre and no doubt the interior is as new, but the other entrance on Drury lane is the old bit which I was allocated to. I don't know how you get allocated to the newer end as it does not seem to be listed as a separate T.L. Perhaps if any T.L. management read this they can explain?.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: melannNotts
Reviews.Content: Room 217 very good, clean bed linen towels changed daily . This is an hotel at a budget price in an excellent location. Five minutes from theatres and Covent Garden within easy walking distance of China town. Admitted the place could do with a face lift and a lick of paint ! The cafe/bar area where breakfast is served is cold and very small and is definitley in need of a face lift as this is the first place you see on booking in. It would be a good idea to screen off the entrance door from the dining are as the cold air whips round this area , not very pleasant when eating. We would stay again though purely for its location and price.

Reviews.Title: “DREADFUL ACCOMODATION - NEVER AGAIN!!”
Reviews.Author: holidaylover1111
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY IN ROOM 226. Stayed here for 2 nights. The only good thing I can say about this hotel is the location. The room was appalling - wallpaper hanging off, mouldy tiles in bathroom, dirty shower curtain, most of the light bulbs were not working, the furniture looked like it had come out of a skip. The whole room smelled damp and musty. Cannot comment on the food as we chose to eat out. I would never, ever stay at his hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “It could do a lot better”
Reviews.Author: Kingfisher512
Reviews.Content: Check in slow. Once got to the bedroom realised no toilet paper, had to ask for some - gave me a left over roll from another room. Then realised there was only one set of towels for 2 people! Next day after returning from day out, dirty coffee cups left in room, no restock of coffee, tea and milk - had to go to reception for replacements. Then realised that only one set of towels had been left (we were willing to use the previous days towels but they had removed them). Back to reception for another set of towels ( and had to ask for a toilet roll again!). Breakfast poor/ - croissants not fresh. Yoghurt available one day but not the next.. OK it's a budget hotel but GBP 210 for the 2 nights it's not cheap. Their staff were polite and friendly but obviosly a problem with ensuring bedrooms were checked and serviced correctly They need to get their act together. To add insult to injury, their online questionnaire asked me one question and then said "Thank you for completing the survey" - Obviously as a company not interested in what their customers think.

Reviews.Title: “excellent , clean and friendly, good value”
Reviews.Author: swwanderers
Reviews.Content: Stayed in family room for 4 nights. Staff lovely and very helpful. Room was spotless and linen changed everyday ! Breakfast free for kids and was good value as it was eat all you like.Evening menu in restaurant. Plenty of coffee / milk etc included in room. TV . Excellent location, central London. It was a bit noisy at night , but this was outweighed by everything else. Will be using this hotel for future trips, Excellent place to stay !

Reviews.Title: “Needs a facelift!”
Reviews.Author: Bob1949
Reviews.Content: We booked here purely for the location. The check in was poor, long queues and disinterested staff. There is no facility to leave luggage if you arrive early and want to hit the sites. The whole place is tired and lacks professionalism. The rooms were adequate but again, need love and care. The best thing is that check out is 12 noon so you don't have to head off too eary. The cafe doesn't open until 5pm which is bizarre. Overall, a great location but a second rate hotel which needs a refurb and management who care.

Reviews.Title: “Great position & good value”
Reviews.Author: faithfull
Reviews.Content: Read quite a few of the reviews which were not that good so expecting the worse.Never stayed in a Travelodghe before either.Very pleasntly suprised although notice that there is another building further up the road which does have a night club next door & maybe the one people didn't like, Four of us stayed a couple of nights - fantastic position - round the corner from Covent Garden market - near the theatres & pubs & shops - what more could you want !! Breakfast at the hotel was nothing special but good value for Â£7.50 eat as much as you want.Only critism for me was the coffee was machine rubbish.There is a better machine in the foyer but you pay Â£1.50. Lots of moans about nowhere toi leave luggage from various people. Rooms was quite big claen & very comfortable.Would go back & recommend but make sure the new building.China town a short walk .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: drhodesbfs
Reviews.Content: Arrival at the hotel at 09:45am, (i'd booked for a 12 check in). We had the buffet breakfast (a bit pricey, but you could eat as much as you like) Got checked in at 11am (result) The room, was clean, tidy and basic. Pretty much what I expected. Location was fantastic, 100m from Hairspray the musical, so we booked that through UK tickets. Half a mile from a restaurant we had booked, and a couple of hundred meters from Chicago. Leicester sq just down the road. When I go back to London, i'm going here.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is great value for money but if you want a good nights sleep - don't bother!!!”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireBowBow
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an ideal location for the West End, theatres etc and offers great value for money. The rooms are clean, modern and fit for purpose except that there is a night club adjacent to the hotel on Museum street which discharges its clients from 02-00hrs onwards and then the noise starts. This continues until circa 05-30hrs when you can then resume sleep!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location With Clean Modern Rooms (At The Newer Site!!)”
Reviews.Author: jamiegrifter
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at The Covent Garden Travelodge. There are two lodges about 200 yards from each other. One of them is old on the corner of the main road, but the one I stayed at was just 200 yards further down Dury Lane in an old office building. My room was very clean and modern with comfortable double bed, small bathroom with shower (no bath), flat screen wall mounted TV and air con. I arrived quite late and was told my room was on a lower floor with small window. The window looked into an underground carpark that was lit 24 hrs which didn't hinder my sleep, but never knew what the weather was like in a morning! Didn't bother me but others may not like it. Avoid the Â£7.50 all you can eat breakfast! Sounds great but had to queue to get a table, then queued and had to hang around for food to be replenished! There were no cereals, teabags, milk, cups, and croissants and muffins had all gone by 9am. When I asked for cups and tea bags - took forever! Restaurant is far too small to cope with demand. Save money and go to the coffee shop right opposite for a freshly cooked breakfast and tea or coffee for Â£4.50. Nowhere to store luggage. Ridiculous in central London Location is fantastic! Turn right and and you are a few minutes walk from Covent Garden, turn left and you are a five minute walk from Shaftesbury Ave, China Town and Piccadilly. WiFi vouchers were available at reception for use on their computers in the bar area. Irons, ironing boards and hairdryers were free of charge and just needed to be returned to reception within 2 hours. Room service menu available - didn't use this but prices seemed pretty reasonable but there are loads of great places to eat on the hotels doorstep. Overall I enjoyed my stay and would definatley stay again as long as I was in this newer Travelodge - it seems a lot of the bad reviews refer to the older Covent Garden Travelodge! Great price for a central hotel! Justmake sure you are booked into the newer lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Alright and very central but would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: HWSouthampton
Reviews.Content: it was alright for 1 night. couldnt check in until 3pm and no baggage storage avaiable at - very bad for a central london hotel. you could wak to Charing Cross and leave your bag ta the station though!! this was a joke. wouldnt stay for that reason again as its essential not to be carrying around luggage in central theatreland! very central though and easy to find walking distance from everything and especially Waterloo Station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, but stay at the right hotel!”
Reviews.Author: welshgirl71
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge at Covent Garden is actually two hotels, the one on the side with the car park is dirty and horrible and old, but the one on the other side of the road is much better, clean but basic and a great location. We have stayed in both before we knew that the one hotel was better than the other. Also very cheap parking for central london. If you can get a cheap deal - we stayed for Â£19 in teh sale and you stay on the right side of the road, its a steal if you don`t expect much you will be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: vanillaManchester
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights 18th - 20th october very good value for money, close to covent garden, theatres, soho, tube stations, room very clean but furniture does need updating, we stayed in a very quiet room no noise from anywhere the only complaints i do have is they only supplied 1 towel and if you like to drink lots of tea or coffee supply your own as they only supply 4 small milks and 2 tea bags and coffee other than that no complaints, all you can eat breakfast between 8am and 10am Â£7.50 very reasonable also evening meals which could be eaten in the bar area or taken to your room and a bar open untill 11.30, there is also lots sight seeing and theatre brochures in reception, a very quick booking in, would use travelodge again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, didn't find it noisy”
Reviews.Author: BillytheSealCardiff
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on Fri and Sat nights. Fior my wife's 40th. Just wanted somewhere to crash in between going to restaurants and shopping, so the location was ideal. It is very basic in terms of decor and facilities, but it provided all we needed and was clean and tidy. Staff were pleasant. If all you want is a bed it's ideal, great price too. Had read other reviews and was worried about noise. But we slept on ground floor of Drury Lane one and had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “basic, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: nad049
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the travel lodge for 1 night with work collegues, the rooms are very very basic but clean enough. Location is the best thing about this place, covent garden market is 2 mins walk. staff were not helpful the check in desk had 1 person on (he was going on a go slow!) and there were about 20 ppl behind us on the que. I was woken up at 9.30am the day I was leaving by a man coming into my room! (a member of the cleaning staff) I didn't understand this as I was leaving that day only stayed 1 night why they were coming in.

Reviews.Title: “We would not stay at this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: Travelers262
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge is well located but that's about all! We arrived to a steep flight of stairs to reach the hotel. They have nobody to assist with luggage. We checked in before 3:00PM but with no area to store luggage until the check-in time and no area to wait in. We are senior citizens and tired from the trip and in order to get a room we had to pay 10pounds(British money) even though they had empty rooms. The hotel is dingy and the bathroom had one bath towel and one small towel. We will not trust Travelodges in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge - just ok”
Reviews.Author: Bally
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Travelodge Covent Garden the same weekend as the person from the last review and also stayed at the Holborn site in a family room. Whilst you cannot deny that the location is just excellent for central London and the price is amongst the cheapest in London, you really do get what you pay for. We arrived 15 minutes before check in and quite literally had to wait the 15 mins to check in. The staff on the front desk were pleasant and we were soon given the keys to our room on the 5th floor. Our room consisted of a double bed and sofa bed, but the sofa bed had definitely seen better days and was a bit grubby. There was an excellent view of a derelict office block from the window. The room apart from the sofa bed though was very clean and are presented although basic in clean and modern way. As other reviewers have stated there is a nightclub nearby and on last Saturday evening it continued throughout the night until 8.30am in the morning. On the 5th floor it was noisey and this was with the window closed. Breakfast is busy on the weekends and we were lucky to get a table, the food was ok, simple but edible but expect to queue and it did seem chaotic at times. We opted for the late checkout as there is no luggage storage and this worked well for us. Overall this hotel is basic but central, I wont be returning due to the noise.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: gonzoDevon
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here for one night. as we were going to see Rowan Atkinson in oliver' the hotel is in a great location. but couldnt sleep all night because of the traffic.but i think this is to be expected in london the staff were very nice. and helpful our car got a small dent in while in the car park. but thats life.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book if you hope to sleep on a saturday!!”
Reviews.Author: jcwmfw
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the family room section on Holborne. Expected traffic noises on Friday night didn't disturb our sleep. However, the deserted office block opposite our room was taken over by ravers and they partied til after 8am........Loud music and voices all night!! Such a shame a the location for Covent Garden/theatres is fantastic and the rooms are fime. Take some soap (as not even a tiny bar to wash hands is supplied!!) and serious earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “A clean well priced hotel in the middle of theatreland”
Reviews.Author: Welshlearner
Reviews.Content: Traveloge have lots of offers and because of this we chose to stay in Covent Garden for under Â£50, the price can be as low as Â£39 if you book at the right time. This is a large hotel over two sites and we booked into the reception on Drury Lane at about 5pm. It was not busy and the member of staff took his time booking us in to make sure we knew about the hotel. We declined the breakfast, eat as much as you loke for under Â£8 and were given a room in the 'other building' across the road. This was a short 2 minute walk and with the first guy,s direction we found our room on the 10th floor. It was typical of a Travelodge room. Clean and empty of frills. Soap/hairdrier/ in fact any extras could be had at reception. It did have a well stocked welcome tray and extra pillows. The room was quiet and comfortable, what more could you ask for at the price in Central London. We were within a 4 minute walk to the theatres and evening resturants. No taxis or underground required We bought a tastey breakfast across the road at one of the many Italian cafes and this cost half the price of the Travelodge breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Central position - large clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mon35
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a girls weekend & found the location great, we could walk to Leicester Square for a meal & within 10 mins of either Covent Garden or Tottenham Court Road tube stops. We had modern family rooms with ample space & had all we needed, though at first the absence of shampoo & a hairdrier alarmed us. However, we were able to borrow a hairdrier from reception & most of us had brought shampoo with us. We were on the 10th floor and it was rather noisy though expected with the central postion. We did eat breakfast at the hotel which was reasonable for the price, though we did tend to eat at a busy time & not all the hot food was available all the time though it was refilled so fresh. I would recommend if you just want a hotel for a base in the centre of London, will probably visit again.

Reviews.Title: “If you are on a budget this is the best hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: bluejay82
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a family room - these are very spacious by London standards and no more expensive than a regular room. I have been in many more expensive London hotels which have been cramped in comparison. Great location! Short walk to the west end, holborn, british museum, restaurants, close to everything. Ok so it is a travelodge so do not expect very comfotable pillows, luxurious towels , any shampoo etc. I would never eat at a Travelodge either. No real storage space eg drawers, no fridge etc. No air-conditioning. If you can handle all this then you are in for a good deal. This is probably the best travelodge I have stayed in and the best budget hotel in London. Spend the extra money you save each night eating at wagamma or getting breakfast at pret a manger!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: gordonbennett
Reviews.Content: Cheap, noisy and worn out, in Central London. My room was quite large for the location and price. Bed was very soft and tired. Both pillows were very squashed and minimal. One chair at dressing table was very hard. TV was a small LCD and could not been watched easily from the bed. The spare floor space could have had accommodated an armchair but did not. Even though my room was several floors up and at the side of the hotel, the traffic and pedestrian noise was irritating. So if you have a few hours to wait the room is not the place to plan to do it. In the bathroom one of the two lights was not working with thick dust on top of the sink light fitting showing they had not tried to change the bulb. The bathroom ceiling had 2 large damp patches. There was no bottled water available and, although normally in the UK I would drink the tap water, I am not sure I would drink the water in these bathrooms. Hotel will disappoint anyone used to comfortable travel. However, probably fine for people on a tight budget such as school trips, leisure travellers with no taste/budget for style and occasional business travellers who get a daily allowance and want to save money on the room to have a good dinner out. For the avoidance of doubt, the 2 or 3 Travel Lodge hotels I have used as last resorts in the UK provinces are better than this. If you just want to be close to the West End you can almost certainly save money on this particular hotel by shopping around on the internet...but be realistic, in this price range everything is pretty bad in London. Would I use it again? Not likely, my company travel department would not dare.

Reviews.Title: “good location, but just a Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: Kaz_from_Manc
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in this hotel twice now - once in the main hotel and once in the annex. The room in the annex was refurbished, and seemed cleaner and more spacious. If I was going to stay here again, I'd ask for one of the newer rooms (although the mattresses are generally uncomfortable in most Travelodges).
